title: Director Search Engine Optimization
description:
About the job
SEO Director - Technical Focus

We're seeking an experienced SEO Director to lead our agency's search engine optimization efforts, with a particular emphasis on technical SEO. In this role, you'll drive organic growth for our clients through innovative strategies and cutting-edge technical optimizations.

Responsibilities:

Technical SEO Leadership:

- Spearhead technical SEO audits, identifying and prioritizing critical issues impacting site performance and search visibility
- Develop and implement advanced technical SEO strategies, including site architecture optimization, crawlability improvements, and indexation management
- Collaborate with development teams to review code and make cogent change requests that consider technical limitations

Strategy and Execution:

- Create comprehensive SEO roadmaps aligned with client KPIs and business objectives
- Oversee the execution of on-page and off-page SEO tactics, ensuring alignment with best practices and search engine guidelines
- Stay at the forefront of SEO trends, algorithm updates, and emerging technologies, incorporating new approaches into client strategies
- Develop and execute local SEO programs for both brick and mortar and service area type businesses

Team Management and Client Relations:

- Lead and mentor a team of SEO specialists, fostering a culture of continuous learning and innovation
- Serve as the primary point of contact for high-priority clients, communicating complex SEO concepts in clear, actionable terms
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate SEO with broader digital marketing initiatives
 - Help in the strategy development and planning for new business pitches as well as the delivery of the pitch

Requirements:

- 7+ years of SEO experience, with at least 2-3 years in a leadership role
- Deep expertise in technical SEO, including experience with JavaScript frameworks, e-commerce platforms, and various content management systems
- Strong analytical skills with proficiency in SEO tools like Google Search Console, Site Crawlers, BrightEdge, Conductor, Similarweb, Botify, etc.
- Proven track record of driving significant organic growth for clients through technical SEO optimizations
- Excellent project management abilities and experience leading cross-functional teams
- Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders

Preferred Qualifications

- Agency and in-house corporate experience preferred
- Advanced knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
- Familiarity with log file analysis and large-scale data processing
- Experience with international SEO and hreflang implementation
- Understanding of machine learning (AI) and its applications in SEO
- Experience in planning and executing business pitches/proposals

At our agency, you'll have the opportunity to work with diverse clients, leverage cutting-edge SEO tools, and lead a team of talented professionals. If you're passionate about technical SEO and ready to drive organic growth at scale, we want to hear from you.

title: SAP Hana Project Manager
description:
About the job
The Business Systems Project Manager will provide analysis, design, programming solutions, and support for SAP S4HANA business systems efficiently and economically consistent with user & business objectives. They will prioritize projects, allocate resources, and be an application specialist. In addition, they will plan and direct the installation and support of business systems SAP S4 projects involving multiple systems impacting multiple functional areas of the business. 

Required Skills:
Demonstrated project management experience and configuration & programming knowledge in SAP ECC and/or SAP S/4HANA. SAP S/4HANA experience is a plus. 
Experience with business intelligence and report writing platforms. 
Experience using 3rd Party tools/systems with SAP. 
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. 
Excellent oral and written communication skills using the English language to translate business needs into application system changes to ensure successful business processes. 

Required Work Experience:
7 or more years of experience, emphasizing business applications. 

Education Requirements:
BS in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field

title: Tech-Savvy Financial Planner
description:
About the job
Job Title: Tech-Savvy Financial Planner - Join Our Innovative Team!

Job Description:
Are you looking for a forward-thinking, technology-driven firm that offers a collaborative and growth-oriented environment? Join our dynamic financial planning team, where we serve high-net-worth clients nationwide. In this role, you will deliver tailored financial planning services to an existing book of business and have the opportunity to build your own client base within the Mountain Time Zone. We‚Äôre looking for a self-motivated, detail-focused professional passionate about financial planning and eager to grow within a supportive team.

In this role, you will:
Leverage innovative tools and technology to streamline financial planning processes and enhance client experiences.
Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, ensuring their financial goals are met through comprehensive financial planning.
Contribute to the refinement of our wealth transition strategies and planning services.
Embrace opportunities for professional development in a fast-evolving financial landscape.

Qualifications and Experience:
Experience with eMoney is a must
At least 5 years in financial advisory, including advice planning, book of business management, and client relations, with minimum of 2+ years in wealth management for high-net-worth individuals.
Proven track record in managing a client book of business with high levels of client satisfaction and loyalty.
Strong understanding of financial planning, investment strategies, and industry regulations.
Demonstrated experience applying trust and estate planning principles to enhance clients' wealth preservation.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree from an accredited institution; preferred majors include financial planning, finance, or accounting.
Preferred designations include CFP, CPA, CIMA, or EA, or equivalent experience and education.
FINRA Series 7, 63+65, or 66 license 
Familiarity with financial planning software (eMoney preferred), tax modeling (BNA Income Tax Planner preferred), and tax preparation software (CCH Access preferred).
Proficiency with Excel and data visualization tools.
Exceptional analytical skills, as well as strong written and verbal communication abilities.

Company Overview:
The AmeriFlex Group is a leading Hybrid RIA, helping clients navigate major life transitions. With headquarters in Las Vegas, NV, our team of over 200 advisors across the country manages assets exceeding $13 billion. We prioritize a planning-first approach and offer a unique hybrid platform that includes an advisor-owned RIA with a Partner Advisor ownership model. Our Broker/Dealer partner is Osaic.

Location:
Flexible - Remote or In-Person (Mountain Coast Time Zone Preferred)

Salary and Benefits:
Earn a competitive salary between $120,000 and $175,000, depending on your experience and credentials. Our comprehensive benefits package includes a 401(k), health insurance, and reimbursement for approved professional development expenses.

Application Process:
To apply, please send your resume and a compelling cover letter to Stacy Leal at stacy@theameriflexgroup.com.

Contact Information:
Stacy Leal | Phone: 702-987-9730 | AmeriFlex.com

Equal Opportunity Employer Statement:
The AmeriFlex Group is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.

title: Class C Licensed Groundwater Plant Operator
description:
About the job
We are seeking an experienced Class C Licensed Groundwater Plant Operator. The ideal candidate will be responsible for operating and maintaining equipment used in the treatment of groundwater to ensure compliance with regulatory standards.
*Duties*
- Utilize logic controllers to monitor and control groundwater treatment processes
- Operate heavy equipment for water treatment purposes
- Build, maintain, and repair water treatment systems
- Apply mechanical knowledge to troubleshoot and resolve equipment issues
- Use basic math skills to analyze data related to groundwater treatment processes
- Collect data on water quality and treatment efficiency
- Work with distributed control systems to manage groundwater treatment operations
*Skills*
- Proficiency in groundwater treatment processes
- Experience with logic controllers for monitoring and controlling systems
- Ability to operate heavy equipment effectively
- Strong mechanical knowledge for maintenance and repair tasks
- Basic math skills for data analysis
- Capability to analyze and maintain groundwater treatment systems
- Familiarity with data collection methods in groundwater treatment operations
Job Types: Full-time, Temporary
Pay: $73.00 per hour
Expected hours: 40 per week
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Day shift
Monday to Friday
Weekends as needed

Required Experience:
Plant Operator: 5 years (Required)
Wastewater treatment: 2 years (Preferred)
Groundwater: 5 years (Required)

Houston, TX (Required)

Houston, TX: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: ILI Specialist
description:
About the job
Company Description
D2 Integrity, LLC was founded in 2022 to create value for our clients by providing efficient and world class engineering, software, and consulting services. We specialize in pipeline integrity management, ILI technology, regulatory compliance, and software enabled engineering services. We strive to provide our clients an enjoyable professional environment. Our differentiator is our staff and collaborative culture. We are headquartered in Houston, TX.

Role Description
D2 Integrity, LLC is looking to grow our team with an In-line inspection (ILI) Specialist. This is a full-time position that is primarily remote work with scheduled in person meetings. The ILI Specialist will be responsible for working Integrity Engineers to perform analysis and assessments using ILI data. Principal tasks include performing calculations, data analysis, generating reports, and supporting client directly.

Responsibilities
Interpret ILI reports and signal data for various ILI technologies.
Perform calculations and data integration using ILI data for integrity assessments related various integrity threats including but not limited to:
Dent Strain and ECA using geometry ILI data
Bending strain and strain change assessments using IMU ILI data
Box matching and CGR analysis using MFL and UT ILI data.
Various other ILI related tasks associated with signal analysis.
Support Integrity Engineer implement various evaluations using API 1163, API 1176, and API 1183.
Produce reports to document results of analysis.
Maintain an understanding of various ILI technologies work and their application in integrity assessments.
Demonstrate working knowledge of regulatory requirements related to ILI.
Display strong organizational and communication skills related to status of projects, analysis performed, and results of assessments.
Delivery work and reports on-time.
Develop and maintain competency in various service offerings.
Identify learning opportunities for self-improvement. 
Identify process improvement opportunities.
Adhere to the company handbook. 

Qualifications
Current level 2/3 ILI Data Analyst certification is preferred (MFL, GEO, IMU, UT, EMAT).
BS in Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics is preferred, or equivalent experience.
Minimum of 5 years of related experience in inspection analysis or pipeline integrity management.
Experience with ILI data analysis and interpretation, including MFL, UT, and other NDE technologies.
Strong data analysis and communication skills.
Knowledge of GIS software and spatial data analysis is a plus.

Considerations: 
Sponsorship not available.
Canadian and Mexican applicants eligible as contractors.

Compensation & Benefits 
Full-Time Position
Work Remote
Competitive Salary
Quarterly Bonus
Annual Bonus
Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance (US only)
401K (US only)

title: Director of Institutional Research & Decision Support
description:
About the job
The Director of Institutional Research & Decision Support plays a crucial role at our college, leading efforts to strategically utilize data for informed decision-making. This senior position involves guiding the quality and interpretation of data, and synthesizing it to enhance processes and inform planning. In collaboration with senior leadership, the Director ensures that equitable student outcomes remain a primary focus through comprehensive research and planning. Focusing on leveraging data to create significant value for ACC and integrating principles of equity into research methodologies & data analyses ensuring fair and inclusive outcomes, the strongest candidates will lean into these characteristics:

Empathetic Communication: able to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders with grace fostering a collaborative and inclusive team environment.
Enjoys puzzles and solving problems: solving problems and extracting actionable insights from data to provide answers or solutions.
Strategic Thinker: able to think strategically about how data can be leveraged to drive innovation, gain competitive advantage, and create value for the college.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited institution OR four (4) years of experience with data analytics
‚Ä¢ Three (3) years of administrative experience with data science, institutional research, compliance reporting
‚Ä¢ Three (3) years of supervisory experience.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated proficiency in effectively managing a diverse array of functions, programs, and activities simultaneously.
‚Ä¢ Experience with integrated database management systems, data warehouses, dashboard software.
‚Ä¢ Experience with visualization tools such as Power BI and R/Python.
‚Ä¢ Strong Project Management skills.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
‚Ä¢ Experience working with SCT Banner products and IBM COGNOS reporting environment.
‚Ä¢ Experience with accreditation, assessment, program evaluation, and/or compliance reporting.
‚Ä¢ Experience in institutional research methods, practices, measurement, and qualitative methods.
‚Ä¢ Two (2) years of supervisory experience
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with research on college student persistence and success.
‚Ä¢ Project management certification (PMP).

title: Lead Associate Director - Biddable, Customer Success
description:
About the job
Chalice Custom Algorithms (chalice.ai) is the leading AI application for brands applying their own data and analytics in the real-time decisioning of ad buys. Chalice‚Äôs software automates data ingestion, predictive analytics, and deployment of custom bidding instructions in a supervised-learning environment, where advertisers can visualize and test their custom algorithms. Advertisers‚Äô algorithms can be deployed in all major DSPs, as well as Meta and YouTube.

Chalice was named ‚ÄúBest Demand Side Tech‚Äù by AdExchanger, and powered AdWeek‚Äôs ‚ÄúBest Use of Programmatic‚Äù in the 2023 Media Plan of the Year awards.

Key Responsibilities:

As a Lead Associate Director at Chalice, you will:

Build Strong Customer Relationships: Build strong, long-term relationships based on trust, proactive customer service and programmatic / biddable subject matter expertise

Drive Strategic Customer Growth: Consult with clients to ensure they are achieving their campaign goals and maximizing the value of our platform.

Act as a Leader: lead customer success initiatives with impact across the company. Establish scalable processes to build a high-performing customer success team.

Consult on Product Development: Collaborate across Solutions Architecture, Data Science and Engineering to develop products and features that best support customer adoption and growth.

Lead Technical Problem Solving: Collaborate with engineers, data scientists, and product managers to address complex technical issues. Consult with customers on troubleshooting APIs.

Advise on Company Strategic Direction and Growth: Act as a key advisor to the executive team, providing insights and recommendations based on customer feedback and market trends to inform the company's growth strategy.

Qualifications:

7+ Years Experience: Demonstrated experience in within ad tech, either in customer success, ad ops, client services or trading. Experience with data science centric and applied AI technologies is a plus.

Leadership: demonstrated leadership across functions, leading with integrity and respect, with a high bar of excellence

Strategic Thinking: Demonstrated ability to develop and execute customer success strategies. Experience in driving customer success initiatives that improve retention and customer satisfaction.

Communication: Exceptional verbal and written communication skills. Ability to present complex ideas and solutions to senior stakeholders and clients.

Customer Focus: Deep understanding of customer needs and the ability to align them with company goals. Experience in developing customer education programs and resources.

Results-Driven: Track record of meeting and exceeding customer success metrics and KPIs. Ability to drive customer value and business outcomes through strategic initiatives.

Entrepreneurial Spirit: Thrive in a dynamic startup environment, showcasing initiative, drive, and a proactive approach in all tasks. Addresses ambiguity by driving clear, cohesive, scalable solutions.

Analytical and Collaborative: Proficient in analyzing customer results, interpreting data, and collaborating effectively with tech and data science teams to optimize performance and drive strategic decisions.

Technical Proficiency: Familiarity with programmatic and ideally, social, advertising platforms and AI technologies is a plus, allowing for efficient troubleshooting and guidance.


Why Chalice?

Joining Chalice means being at the forefront of AI for advertising, working in a stimulating and dynamic environment that encourages creativity, growth, and innovation. We value diversity, collaboration, and dedication to making a meaningful impact in the advertising landscape.

Chalice is a profitable early-stage company with funding from industry insiders including Trade Desk‚Äôs TD7 Ventures and Aperiam Ventures. Chalice's clients range from Fortune 100 companies, the world's largest advertising agencies as well as up and coming brands and independent agencies across the globe.

Chalice‚Äôs philosophy:

AI is too important for brands to outsource
AI should be transparent and auditable
We strive for excellence while fostering learning and creating a supportive work environment.
We are a team of non-conformist, independent thinkers
We are committed to and driven by diversity of thought, background, and experience, and creating the psychological safety for all to thrive

To learn more about Chalice, visit our website. www.chalice.ai


Location:

Chalice is based in NYC, with a hybrid office/remote work site. This role is based in NY, with the expectation of 1-2 days a week in office.


Compensation:

This role offers a competitive base salary with a range of $120,000 ‚Äì $150,0000, depending on experience. Compensation includes equity in a fast growing early stage company.

Benefits include:
Medical
Dental/vision
401k options
Unlimited PTO
11 Company Holidays
Office wide closure between Christmas Eve and New Years

If you're ready to be part of a team that's shaping the future of advertising through custom AI solutions, reach out, and let's create something amazing together!

Chalice participates in E-Verify. Chalice will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), with information from each new employee‚Äôs Form I-9 to confirm work authorization. For more information, visit https://www.uscis.gov/e-verify.

title: Retail Operations Manager
description:
About the job
Quincy Credit Union is looking for a dedicated Retail Operations Manager to support our retail team and Chief Operating Officer in ensuring operational excellence across all retail branches. The Retail Operations Manager will be responsible for overseeing the operational processes that enable efficient, effective member service while mitigating risks. The ideal candidate will serve as a subject matter expert on retail operations and play a key role in cash management, system administration, and compliance with organizational policies and procedures. 

 Key Responsibilities: 

Develop, implement, and modify retail delivery procedures to ensure efficient member service and manage risks effectively. 
Oversee all retail activities to ensure compliance with established Credit Union policies and procedures. Conduct branch audits to manage and mitigate risks to the credit union.
 Assist members with complex transactions and sensitive issues. Provide guidance to retail staff on legal matters such as trusts, powers of attorney, and subpoenas.
Work closely with the Chief Operating Officer on sensitive risk matters, conducting investigations and offering solutions. Collaborate with the Data Analytics department to generate retail reports and performance dashboards. 
 At Quincy Credit Union, we value our employees and provide a supportive work environment with excellent benefits, including:

Majority employer-paid health and dental insurance
Employer-paid 10% contribution to 401(k) retirement plans
12 paid holidays
100% tuition reimbursement for business and finance degrees

If you're enthusiastic about working in a service-oriented role and are eager to contribute to our mission, we encourage you to apply today!

Requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree 
5+ years of experience in retail operations, preferably in a credit union or banking environment.
Strong knowledge of retail banking operations, compliance, and cash management.
Proven leadership skills with the ability to manage projects.
Excellent problem-solving and decision-making abilities.
Strong communication skills with the ability to support staff and assist members in complex situations.

Quincy Credit Union is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Product Strategist
description:
About the job
At Livefront, we help companies design and build world-class digital products that command attention and inspire joy. We‚Äôve helped household names like Target, Samsung, General Mills, and Optum create experiences that have reached millions of people, and startups like HomeSpotter and Acclaim build entirely new businesses that challenge their industries‚Äô status quo.
We‚Äôre looking for an outstanding Product Strategist to join our team. 

Who you are
It‚Äôs not just about the technology for you, but rather how novel technology can be exploited to forge new business opportunities and make peoples‚Äô everyday lives better. When you encounter a remarkable digital experience in your own life, you are incessantly curious about the systems, people, and processes that came together behind the scenes in order to make it happen. You have a keen eye for gorgeous interface design and recognize its power when paired with ambitious service design. You are able to skillfully align the right technologies to the right problems and you aren‚Äôt afraid of shrewd prioritization when it is needed to keep moving forward. You know how to take ambiguity and turn it into action. Your superpower is your ability to inspire, influence, and compel efforts across disciplines and organizational structures to reinvent existing products and create new ones. You're just as comfortable designing the strategy for a product as you are doing the heavy lifting to make it come to life. You can navigate complex and politically-charged discussions and decisions.

Why you should apply
You want to be at the center of the strategic apex of where products are planned and defined before coming to market. 
You want to work with passionate and talented people who are always looking for ways to make things better.
You desire a work environment where respect, mutual trust, and egoless collaboration are paramount.
You want colleagues who take their work seriously but not themselves, and who know how to let loose and have a good time.
You like being part of a team that has a reputation for excellence and gives back to the community by educating, mentoring, and sponsoring.
You want to work on products and accounts that have outsized impact and reach.
You believe in sweating the details, giving a damn about quality, and taking pride in going the extra mile.

What you bring to the table
At least 5-10 years of relevant experience, ideally in a consulting environment or as part of an in-house, cross-functional product team.
Experience launching and bringing new consumer-facing digital products to market at scale. 
Experience consulting enterprise clients on digital product strategies and execution. 
Strong versatility and experience with products across multiple digital platforms including iOS, Android, Web, TV, Auto, Voice, Wearables, IoT and other smart devices. 
Fluency with basic data analysis techniques: bi-variate analysis, cross tabulation, distributions. 
Familiarity with business and product management frameworks, including but not limited to: Jobs to Be Done, Hook, Kano, Design Sprint, Design Thinking, User Journey Mapping, Traction, and others.
Excellent communication skills and a strong ability to present and defend strategic choices persuasively.
Experience gathering and synthesizing both qualitative and quantitative data to uncover new insights about user behavior and business opportunity.
Mastery of modern product management best practices. 
Above-average discipline and personal organization skills.
A demonstrated hunger for personal and professional growth.
A self-evident love and care for the craft of product management.

Bonus points if you...
Write and/or speak publicly about topics related to product strategy, technology, design, and consumer behavior.
Have experience with business or product strategy consulting. 
Have experience with business development or account management. 

What to expect
When applying, please include a short note about yourself, a summary of your work experience, and a link to any writing or recorded speaking you have done about topics related to product management and/or business strategy (if applicable).
Our hiring process moves quickly and consists of several stages for candidates who capture our attention with their initial submission, sometimes including but not limited to a short preliminary phone interview, a series of video interviews, and a short take-home exercise which you'll have up to a week to complete.

Additional information
We go out of our way to evaluate all employees and job applicants equally based on merit, competence, and qualifications. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply and consider all qualified applicants.

title: Technical Project Manager
description:
About the job
About Futurety:

Futurety is a leading data analytics company dedicated to transforming data into actionable insights for our clients. Our innovative solutions empower businesses to make data-driven decisions and achieve their strategic goals. With a team of passionate experts, we provide cutting-edge data analytics services and tools to a diverse range of industries.

Due to the highly regulated nature of the data we work with, this role is onsite at our offices in Columbus, Ohio. Flexible scheduling and up to 1 day per week work from home is permitted, however the role is primarily in office. Please only apply if you are in Central Ohio or planning to relocate to Central Ohio. 

Job Description:

Futurety is seeking a dynamic and experienced Technical Project Manager to join our team. In this role, you will support project leads by overseeing the planning, execution, and delivery of complex data analytics projects, ensuring they are completed on time, and within scope. You will work closely with project leads and cross-functional teams, including data scientists, engineers, and business analysts, to deliver high-quality solutions that meet our clients' needs.

Key Responsibilities:
Develop detailed project plans, timelines, and budget estimates.
Support Account Directors and Project Leads by managing multiple data analytics projects from inception to completion.
Coordinate internal resources and third parties/vendors for the flawless execution of projects.
Plan resource availability and allocation.
Manage changes to the project scope, schedule, and costs using appropriate verification techniques.
Measure project performance using appropriate systems, tools, and techniques.
Report and escalate to management as needed.
Perform risk management to minimize project risks.
Establish and maintain relationships with clients, stakeholders, and project team members.
Conduct project post-mortems and create recommendations for future improvements.

Requirements:
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Communications, Computer Science, Engineering, Business Administration, or a related field.
Experience with cloud data warehouses (Azure, BigQuery, Snowflake, AWS)
Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, Looker, Domo)
Excellent client-facing and internal communication skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multitasking skills.
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office.

Preferred Skills:
Three to five years working experience as a project manager in the information technology sector.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think strategically.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Knowledge of Agile/Scrum methodologies.

Why Futurety?
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
Collaborative and innovative work environment.
Work on exciting projects with leading clients across various industries.
Supportive team culture that values work-life balance.

If you are passionate about managing technical projects and have a knack for data analytics, we would love to hear from you. Apply today and join our team at Futurety!

How to Apply:

Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and why you are interested in this position to careers@futurety.com.

Futurety is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating We offer competitive pay and ‚ÄúCadillac‚Äù benefits for full time employees:
Excellent health insurance
Company paid vision insurance
Company paid dental insurance
Matching 401(k)
Family friendly flex time
Pet friendly office
Profit sharing
Generous vacation and time off
A strict "life is too short" - your teammates will be as talented, smart, and humble as you are and your clients will treat you like part of their teams

Job Type:
Full-time

Schedule:
8 hour shift

Supplemental pay types:
Bonus pay
Commission pay

Ability to commute/relocate:
Columbus, OH 43220: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location:
In person

*No sponsorship available

title: Energy Engineer (Mid-Senior)
description:
About the job
Are you an engineer with experience in the energy efficiency, commercial HVAC or manufacturing fields? Do you enjoy interacting with customers and utilizing your interpersonal skills?

You‚Äôre in the right place! We are hiring a Mid-Senior Energy Engineer at Energy 350 to serve our territory in Southern Idaho.

Key Details:
Location: Remotely 75% of the time (work from home in Southern Idaho)
Travel: 25% travel to client sites around Southern Idaho
Pay: $75,000-$120,000 annually
Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability/Life Insurance, HSA, EAP, 401K with 4% match & Profit Sharing, PTO, Paid Holidays, Parental Leave, Wellness Reimbursement, First Time Homebuyers Assistance & Relocation Assistance
Schedule: Full-Time 40 hours per week; Monday-Friday

About Energy 350: The future is bright at Energy 350! We are an energy efficiency consulting firm located in Portland, OR. Energy 350 is a leader in energy efficiency programs, policy, research, evaluation, and engineering. At Energy 350, we care about our employees and prioritize a balanced work lifestyle. We look for fast learners who are highly motivated and mission driven to join us in our casual yet hard working environment where we value people for who they are and for their differences. To learn more, out our website: https://www.energy350.com/

Position Overview: The Mid-Senior Energy Engineer is responsible for working with industrial clients to identify projects to reduce energy usage, quantifying energy savings and helping determine eligible incentives for clients. This includes a lot of problem solving, collaboration and interaction with customers. This is a work-from-home position that requires boots on the ground in Southern Idaho. This engineer will work closely with two other Energy 350 engineers located in Boise.

A typical day may include:
Conducting energy efficiency studies in the commercial and industrial sectors
Retrocommissioning/building optimization
Working with commercial and industrial customers to scope and develop energy efficiency projects
Working with mechanical and controls contractors to scope commercial HVAC related energy efficiency projects and communicating utility incentive program requirements
Energy Engineering / Energy Analysis
Conducting on-site Measurement & Verification of energy savings
Writing technical reports for non-technical audiences
Working in a dynamic, challenging and collaborative environment

Qualifications:
We are looking for a technical person with excellent communication skills and the ability to actively engage various stakeholders to participate in local energy efficiency incentive programs. Ideal candidates will have many of the following skills and experience:

Advanced degrees and/or great experience preferred; bachelor‚Äôs degree required
5 or more years of experience in the energy efficiency field
Experience analyzing energy systems and quantifying annual energy savings
A high energy, self-starter with excellent organizational and multi-tasking skills
Industrial or commercial energy efficiency experience
Working knowledge of commercial and industrial mechanical systems and building science
Ability to breakdown complex data sets to conduct root analysis and present meaningful observations applying data visualization tools
Capability to work autonomously with good project & time management skills
Excellent writing, verbal communication, and presentation skills

This full-time position requires location in southern Idaho and working from a home office to serve industrial and commercial sites for local utility programs. Relocation assistance will be provided.

Energy 350 is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

We provide competitive salary, benefits, excellent room for growth, and an amazing work environment surrounded by excellent people.

To apply, submit a resume and cover letter to careers@energy350.com. In your cover letter, please answer the following questions:
¬∑ This is a work from home position that requires boots-on-the-ground in southern Idaho. If you do not live in southern Idaho, are you willing to relocate?

title: Manager, Business Intelligence and Analytics
description:
About the job
JOB TITLE: Manager, Business Intelligence and Analytics
FULL-TIME POSITION

Position Overview: This position will be responsible for creating business value through data insights and analytics for the company. This role is responsible for conducting data analysis, visualization, modeling, capacity planning, budgeting, forecasting, requirement gathering, and reporting. This role will collaborate with the leadership team and stakeholders to identify opportunities and insights to improve the performance/customer service of the business; and forecast passenger volume. The primary responsibility for this position is to maintain operational excellence of Terminal 4 operations and to achieve continuous improvements based on insights and analytics. This role reports to the Vice President, Operations.

FLSA STATUS: EXEMPT

Salary Range: $107,000 - $130,000

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

o Develop, maintain, and optimize PowerBI dashboards, analytic reports, and data visualizations by documenting user requirements for all departments.
o Ensure data integrity collected by and reported from systems such as Crowd Vision, Beonic, AeroBahn, IAuditor, Copenhagen Optimization, and JCAII by performing comprehensive User Acceptance Testing (UAT).
o Mentor Operations Supervisors and other managers on leveraging data-driven tools and making informed decisions based on data analysis.
o Manage large-scale data-related projects such as new software procurement/development, AI/ML initiatives, data warehouse creation, passenger flow systems, and other critical operational initiatives.
o Provide expert consultation to internal and external senior leaders to enhance business decision-making, performance, and customer experience.
o Perform data mining in the data lake using SQL and other tools to extract valuable insights by serving as the subject matter expert for the company's data lake, understanding where and how data is stored.
o Create internal and external plans for Terminal 4 involving quantitative, qualitative, and predictive analysis in all areas of operation. Develop and monitor passenger volume forecasts and benchmark performance internally and externally.
o Develop and maintain monthly metrics dashboards for key performance indicators (KPIs) to track and analyze business and marketing metrics, holding teams accountable to goals and objectives.
o Use multiple data sources to create and present weekly, monthly, and quarterly reports. Conduct ad hoc deep dives as required to uncover insights and opportunities.
o Collaborate with stakeholders to determine preventive maintenance or process improvement project schedules and timelines, minimizing impact on regular terminal operations.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

EDUCATION, TRAINING, AND EXPERIENCE
o Bachelor‚Äôs degree in industrial engineering, business analytics, statistics, business intelligence, or related field or experience.
o 5 years‚Äô experience performing Operations business analysis/intelligence, such as quantitative and qualitative analysis, predictive analytics, business case development, operations analysis, etc.
o Lean Six Sigma Black Belt Certification

Special Requirements
o Must be able to pass a criminal background check and obtain and maintain federally mandated security clearances required to work at an airport.
o Valid Driver‚Äôs License required
o Valid Passport with ability to obtain travel Visa / Travel Authorization as required

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES. AND OTHER WORK REQUIREMENTS

KNOWLEDGE
o Core competencies in statistics, visualization, and data mining and modeling.
o Experience and understanding of a wide variety of analytical processes, tools, and approaches.
o High level understanding of data gathering and transformation tools

SKILLS
o Expert Level PowerBI or Tableau (Inclusive of Dax Programming)
o Intermediate Level of SQL Developer (Oracle)
o Predictive Modeling/Forecasting (Time Series Analysis & Other Regression Initiatives)
o Expert Level of Microsoft Excel (VBA, PowerQuery, and Access Add ins)
o Active listening: Give full attention to what other people are saying, take time to understand the points being made, ask questions as appropriate, and not interrupt at inappropriate times.
o Time management: Manage one‚Äôs own time or the time of others.
o Coordination with others: Adjust actions in relation to others' actions.
o Judgement and decision making: Consider the relative costs and benefits of potential actions to choose the most appropriate one.

ABILITIES
o Experience structuring and delivering presentations and communications targeted to company leadership and stakeholders.
o Ability to work independently and efficiently, often without direct supervision.
o Ability to quickly learn potentially unfamiliar topics.
o Excellent verbal and communication skills.
o Aviation industry experience preferred.
o Comprehend oral information: Listen to and understand information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences.
o Speak: Communicate information and ideas in speaking so others will understand.
o Comprehend written information: Read and understand information and ideas presented in writing.
o Write: Communicate information and ideas in writing so others will understand.
o Recognize problems: Tell when something is wrong or is likely to go wrong.
o Reason to solve problems: Apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense.
o Make sense of information: Quickly make sense of, combine, and organize information into meaningful patterns.

Other Work Requirements
o INITIATIVE: Demonstrate willingness to take on job challenges
o LEADERSHIP: Demonstrate willingness to lead, take charge, and offer opinions and direction
o ADAPTABILITY/FLEXIBILITY: Be open to change (positive or negative) and to considerable variety in the workplace
o DEPENDABILITY: Demonstrate reliability, responsibility, and dependability and fulfill obligation

PHYSICAL CONDITIONS/WORK ENVIRONMENT
The Americans with Disabilities Act prohibits discrimination against a qualified individual with a disability. To be qualified for this position an individual must meet the following standards and/or be able to perform the essential functions and activities. The physical activities for this position involve: pulling, pushing, standing, sitting, stooping, walking, crouching, kneeling, and jumping. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to travel from floor to floor and will be required to travel outside between buildings in varying outdoor weather conditions. An individual in this position may be required to lift and/or move more than 15 pounds. The essential sensory and communicative activities include: feeling, speaking, hearing, smelling, and vision abilities including close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision and depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

description:

title: Cloud and Data Manager
description:
About the job
Are you looking for an exciting challenge managing a full stack system that runs one of the world's largest constellations of ocean sensors?

About us
Blue Ocean Gear is a San Francisco Bay Area-based start-up at the forefront of the growing community of mission-driven businesses building technology to empower good stewardship of the world‚Äôs oceans. Our core product is an intelligent, networked buoy system that helps fishers, scientists and other marine industries track and monitor their gear, saving them time and money, providing critical operational data and analysis, and reducing the single largest source of ocean plastics ‚Äì lost fishing gear. In the process, we are bringing IoT to the oceans, rapidly deploying one of the first high-resolution networks of ocean sensors in some of the world‚Äôs most economically productive waters. We are seeking driven problem solvers with a global mindset to join our team as we scale up our commercial products serving customers from lobster fishers to offshore renewable energy providers.

Job description
At Blue Ocean Gear, we build products for the fishing industry, climate research, and other demanding ocean applications. Our products are deployed for extended periods of time in the world‚Äôs harshest ocean environments; generating a wide range of data from fishing behavior to ocean surface conditions. We are seeking a creative, analytical mind who is excited to lead a team of 2-3 direct reports and consultants in the development and maintenance of Blue Ocean Gear‚Äôs full-stack system as well as the launch of new data products. This role will require regular in-person presence in our office in Sausalito‚Äôs working waterfront district. 

As leader of our Cloud & Data team, you will be responsible for
¬∑ Direction of and contribution to Blue Ocean Gear‚Äôs full-stack system
¬∑ Management of small but growing team of front-end, back-end, DevOps, and data science employees/consultants
¬∑ Providing customer/stakeholder/business support around data products 
¬∑ Partnering with senior management team in the development and execution of Blue Ocean Gear‚Äôs strategy 
 Necessary qualifications and experience
¬∑ Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related subject 
¬∑ 3-5 years commercial experience managing cloud and data development and operations
 Specifically:
¬∑ AWS and Google Cloud infrastructure management and architectures
¬∑ DevOps solutions and processes
¬∑ Java/Java Script development and best practices
¬∑ SQL and PostgreSQL database management
¬∑ Linux operating system configurations and management
¬∑ Network and OS security
¬∑ DNS operations and administration
¬∑ Prior experience managing distributed networks of IoT devices
¬∑ Commercial experience managing a cross-functional team

Desirable skills and experience
¬∑ Advanced degree in data science, computer science, and/or management
¬∑ Expertise in ArcGIS integration and tools
¬∑ Expertise in Python, R, and IoT systems

The ocean is a vast, inclusive, and diverse ecosystem that impacts an equally varied range of coastal communities and ocean-based industries. Our customer base ranges from large corporations to indigenous and community-based fisheries. We are actively working to build a team that reflects a similar inclusivity and strength in diversity of backgrounds, beliefs, and culture. Blue Ocean Gear is an equal opportunity employer and we encourage applicants from all cultures, races, colors, religions, sexes, national or regional origins, ages, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity, military, protected veteran status or other status protected by law.

title: Postdoctoral Researcher, Fire Process-Atmospheric Chemical Modeling
description:
About the job
The Desert Research Institute's (DRI's) Division of Atmospheric Sciences is accepting applications for a Postdoctoral Researcher interested in modeling of fire behavior and wildfire plume chemistry. We seek an individual with a strong research background in fire process and/or atmospheric chemical modeling and a passion for advancing fire science. This individual will be involved in existing and upcoming research towards understanding fire propagation and severity, fire-atmosphere interaction, fire emissions into the atmosphere, wildfire plume evolution, and pre- to post-fire changes of eco-hydrologic conditions with applications in fire and land management. The successful candidate will focus on numerical modeling, including assimilation of data from laboratory and field experiments, including from UAS payloads and Doppler lidar. This individual will design and conduct modeling simulations to explore various aspects of fire behavior and/or the complex evolution of wildfire plumes focusing on the gas-particle partitioning of organic compounds and toxicity changes during aging of the plume. While this position will be housed within DRI‚Äôs Division of Atmospheric Sciences (DAS), the successful candidate will interact and collaborate with researchers across all three of DRI‚Äôs science divisions (including Hydrologic Sciences, Atmospheric Sciences, and Earth and Ecosystem Sciences), as well as colleagues within the University of Nevada, Reno (UNR) and University of Nevada, Las Vegas (UNLV). This position is located at DRI‚Äôs Northern Nevada Science Center in Reno, NV, but candidates preferring remote locations inside the United States may be considered.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Ph.D. in atmospheric sciences, engineering, forestry, physics, mathematics, computer science, chemistry, or a related discipline from an accredited institution. 
Familiarity with physics-based fire process and/or atmospheric chemistry. 
Experience with programming and data analysis languages (e.g., Python, R, Matlab, and Fortran).
Demonstrated experience in conducting research in atmospheric, fire, or closely related science. 
Potential for initiating, planning, and carrying out research projects.
Exhibited ability to publish peer-reviewed scientific literature.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in the English language. 
Proficient in presenting research results at conferences and professional meetings.
Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with others in an interdisciplinary environment and in diverse research teams.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Familiarity with physics-based fire processes or wildfire plume chemistry modeling.
Familiarity with fire‚Äìatmosphere models (e.g., WRF-SFIRE) and/or physics-based fire models (e.g., FDS, FIRETEC, Quic-Fire).
Demonstrated expertise in using the WRF model as well as in post-processing of model results.
Familiarity in spatial scaling of physics-based fire process models.
Experience working with the Linux operating system.
Ability to collaboratively develop research proposals and participate in grant writing efforts to secure research funding.

Promotion Potential and Career Progression
Postdocs and early career faculty are provided with considerable support and mentoring to give them every opportunity to be successful in a research career. A DRI postdoctoral research position has long served as the first step to a successful research career at DRI and at other institutions. Postdoctoral researchers hired from this posting may be eligible for promotion to regular faculty (Assistant Research Professor) upon the successful completion of their postdoc. To support the postdoc in working towards this goal, the DRI division the postdoc is hired under may provide professional development support for the incumbent to begin to develop their own research program as a postdoc. DRI postdocs are eligible to serve as PIs on research grants, and the incumbent will be encouraged to collaborate with colleagues across DRI and at other institutions. Promotion from Postdoctoral Researcher to Assistant Research Professor can occur when the Postdoctoral Researcher successfully demonstrates the ability to develop and sustain their own funding. The incumbent will also have the opportunity to participate in both formal and informal early career mentoring programs provided by DRI Human Resources.

DRI faculty are supported through competitive grants and contracts with external funding agencies, and faculty therefore have access to considerable administrative support and an Institute-wide entrepreneurial approach to maintaining success in developing funding programs. DRI has been successful in using this model to create scientific breakthroughs and applied science solutions to some of the most challenging problems facing the nation and the world for over 60 years. 

DRI is a research-focused institution and teaching and advising of graduate students is not required but is possible through the Graduate Schools at UNR and UNLV.

Salary / Benefits
The minimum starting salary for this position is $65,000. DRI offers a benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, and life insurance, 6.2% retirement match, 1.25 annual leave days per month, a beginning balance of 15 sick leave days, 12 paid holidays, educational benefits, and the option to participate in a flexible spending account or health savings account. Additionally, there is no state income tax and no social security deduction. This position may be eligible for relocation assistance dependent on division funding.

Organizational Summary
For more than 60 years, the Desert Research Institute has functioned as the nonprofit, non-degree-granting environmental research arm of the Nevada System of Higher Education. Focused on basic and applied research, the Institute‚Äôs unique model blends academia with entrepreneurship to deliver a wide variety of scientific services and research-generated knowledge to its sponsors and clients.

DRI faculty are nontenured and responsible for generating their own salaries and Institute operating revenues through external funding. DRI also receives a portion of its annual operating revenues from the State of Nevada. As an autonomous organization in NSHE, DRI maintains financial and personnel policies and procedures that differ from other NSHE institutions.

The position will be based in Reno situated in northwestern Nevada at the base of the eastern Sierra Nevada Mountains, 25 minutes from Lake Tahoe. Reno boasts 300+ days of sunshine and offers unparalleled opportunities for outdoor activities ranging from mountain biking, hiking, fishing, hunting, whitewater paddling, and golfing in the summer and fall to alpine skiing, snowboarding, and cross-country skiing in the winter.

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
DRI is deeply committed to supporting a diverse and inclusive workforce and recognizes that encouraging a diverse culture strengthens problem solving skills and creativity and increases productivity. Additionally, an inclusive and diverse environment improves the workplace culture and encourages employee engagement. DRI also takes measures consistent with Title IX to ensure the safety and wellbeing of its students, faculty and staff. Additional information can be found at DRI's Diversity and Inclusion Webpage.

Application / Review Process 
Qualified individuals interested in this position must apply online.

Please upload the following documents in the specified section of your application in Workday:
A cover letter detailing your research experience and professional qualifications 
A current curriculum vitae. 
Contact information for three professional references, to be contacted at the appropriate phase of the recruitment process based on applicant permission.

Qualified individuals who meet all qualifications and requirements are encouraged to apply immediately and provide all required attachments to receive full consideration. Recruitment will close without notice when a sufficient number of applications are received, or a hiring decision has been made.

SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS FOR INTERNAL NSHE CANDIDATES
DRI employees or employees within the Nevada System of Higher Education (NSHE) MUST use the ‚ÄúBrowse Jobs‚Äù report within Workday to find and apply for jobs at DRI and other NSHE Institutions. Once you log into Workday, type "Browse Jobs" in the search box which will navigate to the internal job posting site. Locate this specific job posting by typing the job requisition number, ‚ÄúR0144602‚Äù in the search box.

For more detailed information about DRI, please visit us at www.dri.edu. For questions regarding this position or assistance with your application, please email jobs@dri.edu or call the recruiting office at 775-673-7431.

title: Director of Analytics
description:
About the job
Position Title: Director of Analytics
Department: Research & Analytics
Reports To: Chief Operating Officer (COO)
Status: Full-Time, Exempt
Work Setting: Hybrid
Manages Others: Yes
Salary range: $90,000-$120,000
Posting date: 9/3/24


General Purpose: 
The Director of Analytics is responsible for the management of analytics projects, delivering on the data-related agency work plan initiatives and coordination of analytic-related activities. The Director works closely with the COO and Director of Research to manage the breadth and depth of the work profile of the Research & Analytics Team and ensures product quality and execution aligned with internal and external deadlines. The Director oversees the development and maintenance of community health datasets with information from a wide range of sources (NYS, payers, providers and others), and makes recommendations for the continued evolution of analytic and database tools. 

The Director serves as an advisor to the COO and co-leads the operations of the Research and Analytics team. They will work closely with the Research & Analytics team to scope internal and external projects and determine resources needed to execute on those projects. 

It is Common Ground Health‚Äôs intention that employees receive training/professional development necessary to achieve the development of skills, knowledge, abilities and attitudes related to their job duties and individual development, and to the overall agency and its work plan deliverables. The Director of Analytics will demonstrate a commitment to the mission, vision and values of Common Ground Health. 

Responsibilities/Accountabilities:
 Management/Leadership 
¬∑ Establishes priorities for departmental initiatives that align with the Common Ground Health Mission, Vision and Work Plan, and adjusts priorities to meet changing demands appropriately. 
¬∑ Coaches, mentors, and supervises research and analytic staff. 
¬∑ Works with the Chief Operating Officer and Finance Director, drafts and submits budget proposals and oversees the departmental budget as approved. 
¬∑ Manages relationships with external partners who have population health data needs and/or complementary data sets.
¬∑ Coordinates with cross-agency departmental leadership to allocate support resources to projects driven by other areas appropriately.
Is a member of the agency management team and advises on the agency‚Äôs strategic planning initiatives.

Analytics Strategy and Execution
¬∑ Develops analytic strategy and deliverables in partnership with Director of Research and COO.
¬∑ Assures the quantity, timeliness, and accuracy of analytic products and services.
¬∑ Meets with internal and external stakeholders to gather work requirements; serves as a liaison
¬∑ Leads efforts to secure access to needed databases from the state, insurers, hospitals and other sources
¬∑ Manages external vendor or contract relationships established to support database administration services.
¬∑ Strategizes with the Rochester Regional Health Information Organization (RRHIO) to explore how HIE data can be used for population health improvement.

Project Management & Process Improvement
¬∑ Working with the COO, ensures projects are scoped correctly and meet budget requirements.
¬∑ Serves as a project manager for projects originating within the Department of Research & Analytics and from external stakeholders 
¬∑ Assembles and leads project teams and conducts regular project team meetings.
¬∑ Identifies opportunities to improve processes and procedures, recommends and implements changes to improve efficiency.
Competencies:
¬∑ Very strong analytical reasoning and quantitative skills.
¬∑ Ability to develop and manage work plans with deliverables, milestones, and performance measures.
¬∑ Very strong planning and organizational skills for overseeing simultaneous multi-dimensional projects.
¬∑ Expertise in defining analytic projects from general requirements and hypotheses.
¬∑ Capable of guiding and teaching others on both technical and conceptual elements of analytic work.
¬∑ Ability to creatively problem solve to more effectively and efficiently analyze data.
¬∑ Expertise analyzing health-related data such as claims, clinical records (EMR/HIE), and public health measures.
¬∑ Demonstrated commitment to health equity and anti-racism.
¬∑ Ability to communicate effectively with diverse populations (including creation and presentation of slides and reports).
¬∑ Strong interpersonal skills and poise to work directly with senior leaders, partners, staff and all stakeholders. Must have the ability to foster strong, supportive relationships with colleagues and peers.
¬∑ Demonstrated initiative and integrity.
¬∑ Flexibility to adapt to a changing environment.
¬∑ Ability to work independently and manage time efficiently.


Minimum Qualifications:
¬∑ Master‚Äôs Degree in a relevant discipline such as health administration, public health, data science or business, or bachelor‚Äôs degree with relevant experience.
¬∑ Master‚Äôs Degree in a relevant discipline such as health administration, public health, data science or business, or bachelor‚Äôs degree with relevant experience.
¬∑ Deep experience leading complex quantitative analytic projects with large data sets
¬∑ Experience managing complex projects that involve multiple departments and / or external stakeholders. 
¬∑ Strong competence with data and analytics tools such as SQL, Excel, and Tableau.
¬∑ Familiarity with both patient- and population-level health data such as claims, clinical records, and public health measures.
¬∑ At least a basic understanding of health care at the local, state, and national level. 
¬∑ Demonstrated proactive approach to leading teams.
¬∑ Experience working with diverse groups of people across all organizational levels.
¬∑ Strong written and oral communication skills.
¬∑ Experience with Microsoft office products (Word, Outlook and PowerPoint), project management software (Microsoft Project, Smartsheet), databases and data base querying tools (Access, SPSS, SQL Server etc.)
¬∑ Maintains residency in New York State with residency in the Finger Lakes region strongly preferred. 
¬∑ Experience using web-based video conferencing systems such as Zoom required.
  Physical Requirements:
¬∑ Must be able to work in a hybrid environment that requires both remote and in-person work.
¬∑ Occasional travel to local and regional meetings by vehicle. Sits for long periods. Works long hours on a computer. Uses a keyboard. Reads printed materials or from a computer monitor.
¬∑ Occasionally required to climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. Must frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.
¬∑ In support of the Americans with Disabilities Act, this job description lists only those requirements and qualifications deemed essential to the position.


DON‚ÄôT MEET EVERY SINGLE REQUIREMENT? We still encourage you to apply! Studies show that women, non-binary applicants, and people of color are less likely to apply for jobs unless they meet every single qualification. However, at Common Ground Health, our diverse backgrounds, perspectives, identities, and talents help us thrive. 


  CULTURE STATEMENT
Our Work:
We build relationships among health care and human service providers, insurers, community-based organizations, community members, families and other partners to find common ground on our area‚Äôs most pressing health challenges. Together, using health and community data, we develop strategies for better care, smarter spending and healthier people. By helping people work together to reach a solution, we improve outcomes through policy, systems and environmental change. The goal is to give every person a chance to be heard and part of the process. Through all of these activities, Common Ground Health seeks to improve population health, promote health equity and reduce health disparities in the Finger Lakes region.

Our Culture:
Our foundation at Common Ground Health is built on our relationships with one another. We are learners, listeners, engagers, advocates, coaches, mentors, conveners, and more. Our staff is the most valuable resource the organization has for advancing our mission.
  We create and maintain a physically, emotionally, and socially healthy work environment. We share our experience as a healthy and collaborative workplace as an example for others. We want our colleagues to look forward to coming to work each day to deliver the highest quality of work possible.
  Our organization and our stories are ever-changing, growing, and improving. Everyone brings a unique perspective that enhances our collective work. We will embrace these differences as part of the process to achieve high quality outcomes. We celebrate ‚Äúteachable moments‚Äù even, and especially when, they may be uncomfortable. We approach our relationships at Common Ground Health with integrity, transparency and objectivity. We value the unique contributions of our individual staff and volunteers and recognize the importance of both context and content expertise. 

Working Here:
Common Ground Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We offer competitive salaries and a wide range of benefits that include:
A flexible benefits plan that includes comprehensive medical, dental and vision insurance, a flexible spending account, and AFLAC policies
A generous time off package that includes PTO (paid time off), volunteer time off and paid agency holidays
A flexible and friendly hybrid work environment
403(b) retirement plan with an employer contribution
Professional development opportunities
Agency paid life insurance, and short & long-term disability
Employee assistance program (EAP) and discounts through my Better Benefits (mBB)

title: Asst/Assoc/Full Professor in Electrical & Computer Engineering- Trustworthy AI
description:
About the job
Job Summary:
The Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering seeks to hire a faculty member with expertise in Trustworthy AI and machine learning. Key areas of interest include, but are not limited to robustness, security, privacy, interpretability, fairness and safety in machine learning and AI from systems and/or theoretical perspectives. Outstanding candidates at all levels (Assistant, Associate, Full Professor rank) will be considered.

This position is part of the Wisconsin Research, Innovation and Scholarly Excellence (RISE)-Artificial Intelligence (AI) cluster hire initiative. While the tenure home for this position will be in the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE), the successful candidate will participate in interdisciplinary and collaborative efforts with other departments, schools and colleges.

The ECE Department's mission is to foster a diverse and inclusive community that advances the frontiers of engineering, disseminates discoveries and inventions, and prepares students to make the world a better place for all. Candidates who have specific goals and plans that are aligned with this mission and whose research and teaching interests fall within the areas described above are strongly encouraged to apply.

Responsibilities:
Teaching undergraduate and graduate courses and contributing to curriculum updates and innovations; mentoring graduate students and supervising their research; developing and directing a successful, extramurally funded research program; participating in departmental and university shared governance; and contributing to professional and public service.

Institutional Statement on Diversity:
Diversity is a source of strength, creativity, and innovation for UW-Madison. We value the contributions of each person and respect the profound ways their identity, culture, background, experience, status, abilities, and opinion enrich the university community. We commit ourselves to the pursuit of excellence in teaching, research, outreach, and diversity as inextricably linked goals.

The University of Wisconsin-Madison fulfills its public mission by creating a welcoming and inclusive community for people from every background - people who as students, faculty, and staff serve Wisconsin and the world.
Education:
Required: PhD in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or closely related field.
Qualifications:
The successful candidate will have an excellent academic record, a vision for an innovative, significant and impactful research program and the skills to implement it, and a commitment to high-quality undergraduate and graduate instruction and mentoring. Associate and Full Professor candidates must possess experience and scholarly credentials that meet the tenure standards of the UW-Madison Physical Sciences Divisional Committee and the College of Engineering.
Work Type:
Full Time: 100%
It is anticipated this position requires work be performed in-person, onsite, at a designated campus work location.

description:
