title: Signal Processing Engineer
description:
About the job
Qualifying candidate will be a self starter serving as a subject matter expert in Digital Signal Processing (DSP) and Algorithmic Development. Desired experience includes X-Midas, Python, GNU-Radio, Julia, or MATLAB development skills. Familiarity with DSP Techniques (such as Cyclo-Stationary processing, Cumulants, CAFs, Polyphase Filterbanks, etc), Radar Processing, Wireless Communications, Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning, and/or Satellite Engineering. Individual should be comfortable integrating algorithms and processing data from receiving hardware systems.

An exceptional technical background with strong mathematical and software skills to support signal processing developments that can transition quickly into mission operations is essential. Candidate must possess exceptional knowledge in DSP techniques and algorithms, strong mathematics background, ability to write fluent software.

SATSS Benefits Include:
25% Retirement Contribution ( SATSS contributes an amount equal to 25% of your salary to retirement)
40 Days of Paid Time Off per Year
Gym Reimbursement
College 529 Match
Equity
100% Company Paid Healthcare or Cash in Lieu of Coverage
Bonuses for Technical Excellence and Growth
Fully Paid Insurance (Dental, Vision, Life, Disability)
Paid for Conferences, Journals, Publications, Radio Hardware, Training, and Textbooks
Employee Owned (Options issued to our entire Team!)

Must Have, U.S. Security Clearance
TS/SCI

Must Have, Digital Signal Processing Expertise
Familiarity with processing and exploitation of signals collected on a variety of SDR platforms
Working knowledge of Radar and/or Wireless Communication Signals
Nice to have Experience includes real-world development of various Modulation Types, FECs, Packetized Bit Structure, Beamforming, PLLs, and/or Matched Filters, SAR/ISAR Image Formation, Range Doppler Processing, and related concepts.
Development of DSP algorithms for emitters operating in dynamic & complex RF environments
Self-starter comfortable with Customer interactions and high level technical direction
Ability to support Customer development needs with rapid prototyping
Dynamic environment requires ability to pivot to new technical solutions in short order to meet Customer requirements and/or mission need

Must be able to implement technical solutions in software
C/C++, Python, Julia in a Linux development environment. Basic understanding of Fortran, Java, Perl, JavaScript, XML, JSON, and other languages will aid in development
Familiarity with either X-Midas or MATLAB || OCTAVE, GNUradio, and LAPACK || LINPACK software suites are strongly desired
Previous use of code management such as git, gitlab, svn, mercurial, or other code repositories is desired with a basic understanding of cloning, branches, merges, unit testing, continuous integration, automated build and test cycle (jenkins, pipelines, etc), and automated code checkout.
Ability to make library calls across languages. Familiarity with Cython, SWIG, and other Pythonic/C wrappers with cross-compiler support is desired.
Experience writing multi-threaded software using CPUs in a Linux server environment
Comfortable with GPU and CUDA related processing capabilities
Strong grasp of Linux commands and ability to write shell scripts.

Nice to Have, knowledge of Linear Algebra, Physics, and Statistical Mathematics. 
Strong focus on matrix methods (eigen/QR decomp, components analysis), higher order derivatives (Jacobians, Hessians, and traces thereof), robust estimators, gradient descent approaches, ray tracing methodologies, finite fields, set theory, polynomials, quadratics, root finding techniques (such as Newton‚Äôs Method), etc.

Nice to Have, Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence Experience
Knowledge of the underlying mathematics for AI/ML algorithms and their application to the signal processing domain and sense making
Ability to author Kernels, Density Estimators, and advanced Clustering Algorithms
Fundamental understanding of autoencoders (variational, denoising, etc), latent spaces, components analysis, sparsity approaches, regularization approaches for ill-posed problem sets, higher dimensional spaces, adaptive filters
Familiarity with GANs (Generative Adversarial Networks)
Familiarity with Python libraries such as scikit-learn, scikit-image, numpy, scipy, mayavi, matplotlib, pandas, keras, tensorflow, caffe, nltk, statsmodels, pybrain

Education Requirements:
B.S. or higher in Electrical Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or related field.
Preference for graduate school degree with a strong track record of publications and/or presentations at community conferences

title: Director of Project Management
description:
About the job
We are the Indiana Biosciences Research Institute (IBRI). We are a leading translational research institute that advances academic and industry science through collaboration to improve patient health outcomes. Building your career at the IBRI in Indianapolis‚Äô 16 Tech Innovation District, means being part of a team of renowned scientists, creative thinkers, and innovative leaders.

Today‚Äôs research is being driven by significant advances in our abilities to study complex disease processes and propose new ways to improve patients‚Äô lives. To reflect the evolving nature of life sciences research and encourage synergies through collaboration, we‚Äôre enhancing our integrated capabilities, adding depth to how we approach patient-informed translational science and pursuing four foundational areas of scientific focus. These four areas will provide us the core talent and capability to pursue translational science in this new patient-centric framework:

Disease, Systems, Pathways ‚Äì We‚Äôre working to better understand diabetes and identify new ways to combat the disease. We‚Äôre applying this learning to other diseases that share common systems and pathways.
Molecular Innovation ‚Äì We‚Äôre developing new capabilities for molecular design and drug discovery to investigate disease processes and pursue new therapeutic approaches.
Integrated Data Sciences ‚Äì We‚Äôre pursuing advanced data sciences to create novel end-user inspired solutions that address complex analysis, simulation, and prediction across the translational sciences.
Enabling Technologies ‚Äì We‚Äôre building a rich platform of enabling technologies that give our scientists, partners, and collaborators access to the best tools to solve complex scientific problems.

The IBRI‚Äôs vision is to build a world-class organization of researchers, innovators and business professionals that catalyze activities across the Indiana (and beyond) life sciences community. To achieve that vision, we look for curious and collaborative team members who are energized by innovation, guided by integrity, and inspired by diversity.

The Opportunity:
We are seeking a Director of Project Management to build and establish a Project Management function within the IBRI. This role will have a range of responsibilities centered around scientific acumen, coordination, communication, data management, and relationship management for the portfolio of IBRI projects. These responsibilities require a combination of scientific knowledge, project management skills, and relationship management.

Key Responsibilities:

Scientific Project Management
Establishing a Project Management Function: The Director of Project Management with work with IBRI executive leadership, scientific leadership and administrative functions to establish a Project Management function to manage a portfolio of internal and collaborative projects.
Managing a Portfolio of Projects: The Director of Project Management would be responsible for working with IBRI technical leaders to manage a portfolio of projects. This could involve arranging and leading meetings, facilitating discussions, and documenting and communicating results.
Establishment of Target Data Packages (TDPs): The Director of Project Management would be responsible to work with IBRI project leaders to define the TDPs for the various stages of the drug discovery pathway (ie Target Validate, Lead and Candidate). TDPs are a comprehensive set of attributes a program must achieve along the translational and commercialization pathway.
Achieving Milestones: The Director of Project Management would be responsible for ensuring that IBRI projects are progressing according to plan and that key milestones are being achieved on schedule. This requires tracking the project's progress, identifying and addressing any issues or delays, and adjusting plans, as necessary. It also involves regularly reporting progress to IBRI executive leadership.

Operational Excellence 
Leading Project Team Meetings: The Director of Project Management would be responsible for organizing and facilitating project team meetings, which aim to integrate the work of various technical cores, and/or teams. Most importantly the Director of Project Management will be responsible for guiding the conversation and making sure the team's activities align with the project's objectives. This responsibility also requires understanding the scientific content discussed during these meetings, interpreting data, and asking relevant questions. The Director of Project Management would also need to resolve any conflicts that might arise and ensure that all team members have a chance to contribute.

Relationship Management
Contract Research Organizations (CROs): The Director may act as the primary point of contact with CROs working on behalf of the project team. This task requires excellent interpersonal skills, negotiation skills, and an understanding of contract management. The Director of Project Management may also need to monitor the CROs' performance and handle any issues that arise, ensuring that the quality of work meets the project's standards.

Job Requirements:
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in scientific discipline PLUS minimum 8+ years of scientific project management experience OR Master‚Äôs Degree in scientific discipline PLUS minimum of 4 years of scientific project management experience OR PhD in scientific discipline PLUS minimum 2 years of scientific project management experience.
Minimum of 2 years of experience working with Contract Research Organizations (CROs).
Previous experience working across matrixed organizations.
Superior organizational and business acumen skills.
Experience with non-profit organizations preferred.
Demonstrated independent judgement, good discretion, and decision-making skills.
Must possess cultural awareness, strong relationship management skills and emotional intelligence.
Extensive experience with MS Office suite, Teams, and Outlook.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Equal Employment Opportunity:
The IBRI provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

title: Senior Business System Analyst
description:
About the job

Research alternative business solutions and, where appropriate, document cost, recommend, present, and justify such alternatives.
Ability to evaluate multiple perspectives, collect evidence, ask questions, and use critical thinking skills to derive a conclusion and effectively communicate the conclusion.
Evaluate, manage, and resolve requests in the ticketing system

Experience
Must have a minimum of two years‚Äô experience in a HR business analyst role or a minimum of three years‚Äô experience in a HR functional role.
Must have two years of professional experience with dashboards and data visualization using Power BI
ERP (HR) system experience.
Continuous improvement experience.
Demonstrated Change Management experience

title: Director, Paid Social and Programmatic
description:
About the job
Our Opportunity

Little Spoon is seeking a tenured senior marketing leader to join our Growth Marketing organization. In this critical and highly visible role, you will be responsible for architecting and executing our full funnel media strategy to increase awareness + familiarity as well as engagement and consideration. As a key member of our marketing leadership team, you will collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders on our media strategy, our investment mix strategy, structured experimentation, measurement. This role will be based in our New York City headquarters or remotely from anywhere in the United States.

What You‚Äôll Do

Own development and communication of the long-term vision, goals, and roadmap for full funnel marketing efforts as established together with partners
Develop full funnel strategies across cutting edge + scalable media platforms across programmatic (DSP) + streaming video, paid social, connected TV (CTV/OTT), among others in order to drive brand and purchase lift
Partner with external vendors to ensure we‚Äôre squeezing maximum value and capability out of media platforms and driving relevance with the customer as we build and iterate our full funnel strategy
Partner with technical analytics + data science resources to build experimentation roadmap, create actionable performance analysis, establish reporting views, and distill insights from all the above that feed back into the media strategy
Partner and communicate effectively with stakeholders in Brand Marketing + Performance Marketing, reduce / attack siloing of work, and build mechanisms to drive top decile creative optimization tailored to each stage of the funnel
Ability to conceptualize and execute projects, with strong bias for action, ability to prioritize and meet deadlines, and work cross functionally amidst some TBD or vague ownership areas that have yet to be fully developed

What You‚Äôll Need

8+ years of relevant digital media experience, 4+ years people leadership
Proven track record in attracting, developing, and motivating talent. Ability to continually raise the bar and grow your personal and collective capability.
Deep knowledge of the mid-funnel including social, programmatic, online video and the ability to develop comprehensive media plans and establish incrementality based measurement solutions (vs. last touch alone) in a post-iOS14 privacy world.
A history of owning, developing, and communicating long-term vision and goals that your group owns
Ability to influence internal and external stakeholders / leadership, debate, keep priorities simple and clear and commit to a clear plan to drive the strategy forward. 

About Little Spoon:

Little Spoon is the fastest growing baby and kids food brand in the United States. On a mission to make parents‚Äô lives easier and kids healthier, we are bringing the future of kids food to the modern parent through a first-of-its-kind platform of products delivered straight to your door. Little Spoon sets your child up for a lifetime of health, from a baby‚Äôs very first bites through to their big kid years, with a portfolio of freshly-made baby food, early finger foods, toddler, big kid meals and snacks. Since launch, the company has delivered more than 50 million meals and is responsible for feeding more than 2.9% of US babies, helping to simplify the lives of hundreds of thousands of parents. Learn more at LittleSpoon.com or find us on Instagram at @LittleSpoon.

Recent accolades include:

üèÜ Inc. Best Workplaces
üöÄ Inc. 100 Fastest Growing Companies
ü´∂ Fast Company Brands That Matter
ü§© EY Entrepreneur of the Year Finalist

If you have a disability and require accommodation during our interview process, please let us know how we can help make the interview process fair to your needs.

title: Tableau Developer
description:
About the job

Provide technical leadership in areas of advanced reporting, analytics dashboards, and BI solutions development.

title: Training Coordinator
description:
About the job

Ranked one of the top 100 top RIAs by Barron‚Äôs & Forbes and headquartered in Parsippany, New Jersey with several regional offices across the country, Summit Financial LLC is a ~$10 billion independent advisory firm that has been providing comprehensive financial planning and wealth management services to high-net-worth individuals for over 40 years.

title: Senior Manager, Supply Chain Analytics
description:
About the job
Senior Manager, Supply Chain Analytics
Employment Status: Full-time, benefits eligible
Location: Nampa, ID (on-site)
Schedule: M-F, 8-5/flex according to business needs
Compensation: Salary
Who We Are
Gymreapers is a direct-to-consumer e-commerce brand creating premium lifting gear, apparel, and equipment for men and women. Our supportive lifting gear has been featured in Men‚Äôs Health, Barbend, Powerlifting Technique, and more. The Gymreapers brand has been listed twice on the Inc Magazine‚Äôs list of 5,000 fastest growing businesses: 2022 at #291 and 2021 at #521. Our CEO, Roc Pilon, recently was named Entrepreneur of the Year by Ernst and Young!
Benefits/Perks
Competitive Pay
Paid Time Off (PTO)
Company paid holiday‚Äôs
50% Employee Discount on Gymreapers.com!!
100% Employer Paid: Medical, Dental and Vision, Short-term and Long-term disability, Life insurance for both employee and spouse/dependents
Health Savings Account (HSA) employee option
Job Summary:
Gymreapers is looking to add a Supply Chain or Business analytics professional to our powerful and fast-paced team. Headquartered in Nampa, Idaho we work tirelessly to support our customers, athletes, and gym-goers on all fronts, all around the world. In this role you will build, develop and implement the supply chain and business intelligence program for Gymreapers. This role will also offer query and reporting visualization expertise, supporting the business with live data correlated to company goals and key areas. This is an exciting opportunity for anyone who enjoys creating a strategic vision, and being hands on in the execution of it. 
Typical Duties and Responsibilities:
Develop reporting, analytics and models that support business decisions through the creation of operational tools, queries, visualization, and dashboards
Develop and maintain a data warehouse ensuring data collection is inclusive of all areas of the business such as Supply Chain, Marketing, Finance, and Operations
Support in the strategy of our demand planning vision with the intent to reduce stock outs on inventory through forecasting variance reduction and inaccuracy elimination 
Be the subject matter expert around machine learning, statistical, and econometric time series techniques alongside hybrids of these to develop accurate, granular demand forecasts
Partner closely with Finance, Marketing, Sales, Procurement and Operations to develop data queries, reporting, and visualizations to assist with optimal buying decisions, and the mitigation of risks within the Supply Chain 
Delivering and supporting production code driving business-critical decision-making systems.
Required Skills and Abilities:
Bachelors or Masters in a quantitative subject (i.e. computer science, economics, operations research, statistics, etc.) or a related field such as Industrial Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, etc.
3+ years of practical experience working in data science systems (ideally in e-commerce, supply chain, or operations)
Experience delivering robust and maintainable production codebases that autonomously deliver data science models to downstream systems.
Experience in statistical/econometric time series modeling (ARIMA, Exponential Smoothing/ETS, GLMs/GAMs, Dynamic Factor Models, etc.), machine learning (XGBoost/LightGBM, RNNs, Transformers, etc.), or hybrid time series techniques (ES-RNN, N-BEATS, TFT).
Proficiency in Python, SQL, Git
Proficiency in using data visualization tools such as Tableau, or Bi-Reports
Passion for driving outsized business impact through applied science, humility, and collaboration.
Our Core Values
Grow or Die
Customer Obsession
Extreme Ownership
Nothing is Given // Everything is Earned
Be Humble
1% Better Everyday
Live with Integrity
Sacrifice
Gymreapers LLC is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national or ethnic origin, disability, as well as any other characteristic protected by federal, provincial, or local law.

title: Sr Manager / Director - Consulting Services
description:
About the job
About the Role
Marketing Attribution was founded by experienced veterans of the marketing measurement industry. We help advertisers, advertising platforms, and market research firms measure and optimize the impact of media and other marketing investments. We‚Äôre technology leaders, pioneering techniques that are now widely used across our industry including Bayesian marketing mix models (MMMs) and effective frequency-based response curves. Our consultants leverage advanced analytics, machine learning, and our cloud-based, automated modeling platform to build predictive sales models and deliver business insights that change how clients plan, advertise, and grow their business.

Responsibilities:
Lead ongoing marketing mix modeling services for a portfolio of large consumer brands
Oversee all aspects of the projects, from data acquisition to delivery and client presentation
Work with the clients to determine what data is relevant and what‚Äôs not.
Oversee modelers who will sculpt the data for ingestion into our tools, usually in Python.
Oversee the modeling process, ensuring the models are accurate, reliable, and useful 
Write the PowerPoint presentation, leveraging fairly complete templates in most cases
Meet with clients to share insights and recommendations via presentations or through our dashboards. Help clients understand where they are spending too much or too little, what worked or didn‚Äôt work, and why.
Build marketing budget optimizations and help clients maximize sales and marketing ROI.
We have clients that license our software for their own modeling. Some days we are coaching them to be great modelers too.

Requirements:
Graduate degree in analytics, data science, operations research, industrial engineering, statistics, economics, or other quantitative field
4 years marketing mix modeling experience 
Some Python skills. We‚Äôre mainly a Python shop on the analytics consulting team.
Good knowledge of regression, elastic net, or other related machine learning methods.
Ability to quickly size a data challenge and engineer the right amount of automation and sophistication against the project priorities.
Keen interest in using analytics, modeling, and problem solving to address marketing attribution challenges for a diverse set of clients and industries. The research questions start at marketing but span distribution issues, pricing strategy, supply chain analytics, etc.
Clear and confident communication.
Flexibility in what you'll be working on. We like to help each other out. So we might ask you to work on a variety of things (marketing mix models, price and promotion models, automated machine learning projects, coaching clients on their modeling projects).

Compensation
Competitive salary. Target range is $135,000 to $180,000 depending on experience.
4 weeks‚Äô vacation plus Company holidays
Equity in the company (or equivalent for foreign nationals who can‚Äôt hold equity)
Company generously pays full premium for life, disability, and health insurance
IRA plan with matching employer contribution
Exact title depends on experience
 Foreign Nationals
This is a country built by immigrants. We‚Äôre open to hiring anyone, regardless of anything except talent, skills, integrity and attitude.
 Location
Our home office is in Evanston, IL but we work primarily remotely.

title: Senior ASIC Design Engineer
description:
About the job
Cepton (Nasdaq: CPTN), a leading intelligent lidar solution provider, is seeking a seasoned Senior ASIC Design Engineer who is passionate about solving challenges to join us and support the development of Lidar products. Working closely with our Director of ASIC Engineering and partnering closely with our brilliant functional R&D teams, you will work in a dynamic, cross-functional, collaborative work environment and be responsible for designing, verifying, and validating our core products. 
 Here at Cepton, we use technology to make some difficult problems become easy and some impossible tasks become feasible. We value one's ability to learn higher than the knowledge one has acquired in the past. We like people who strive to solve a problem in new and creative ways instead of seeking conventional wisdom, we enjoy solving hard problems together. As we are at the cutting edge of technological advancement, join us if you are willing to work with like-minded people to face the challenges posed by the new era of technology together. 

What You Will Do: 
Partner closely with the functional R&D teams to develop design specification documentation for individual function blocks, RTL implementation, and system integration, and set up and maintain a verification environment. 
Be responsible for tasks including DFT, synthesis, static timing analysis, power estimation, hardware troubleshooting, silicon bring-up, and validation. 
Support new product introductions to the high-volume manufacturing process to enable automotive and non-automotive applications. 

Who You Are: 
B.S. or M.S. in Electronic/Electrical Engineering with at least three years of working experience in ASIC design. 
Has deep knowledge of one or more of the following domains: Embedded CPU subsystem and architecture; High-speed digital signal processing, computer vision, or machine learning; High-performance serial interface protocols; Low-power design methodology; mixed-signal design; FPGA prototyping. 
Strong RTL (Verilog/System Verilog/VHDL) coding skills and hands-on experience in programming languages (Perl/Tcl/Python/C). 
Has in-depth knowledge of high-speed digital design, multi-clock domain SOC, and verification; Has a good understanding of ASIC design flow from RTL to silicon. 
Familiar with industry-standard EDA tools, advanced silicon processes, and technology nodes for high speed and low power consumption. 
Has strong analytical skills and problem-solving ability and is able to provide technical leadership as needed. 
A good and reliable team player with strong communication skills. Self-motivated, continually striving for excellence, and can thrive under pressure. 

What We Will Offer: 
Opportunities to work with strong industry leaders and opportunities to relocate to Silicon Valley. 
Competitive compensation package, including stock. 
Comprehensive employee benefits program, including medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and more. 
Paid time off and paid holidays.
Bonus program eligibility. 
401k, FSA, or HSA.

Location: 
Cepton Headquarters ‚Äì San Jose, CA.
Some local on-site visits to key customers.
Travel to regional customer sites and support trade shows and conferences if needed.

Cepton is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. 
The pay range for this role is $150,000 to $180,000. Actual compensation packages are based on several factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, depth of experience, certifications, and specific work location. This may be different in other locations due to differences in the cost of labor. The total compensation package for this position may also include an annual performance bonus, stock, benefits and/or other applicable incentive compensation plans. 

Cepton Technologies is an Equal Opportunity Employer
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to race, ethnicity, gender, veteran status, or on the basis of disability or any other federal, state, or local protected class.

About Cepton Technologies (www.cepton.com):
Cepton (Nasdaq: CPTN) is a Silicon Valley innovator of lidar-based solutions for automotive (ADAS/AV), smart cities, smart spaces, and smart industrial applications. With its patented Micro Motion Technology (MMT¬Æ), Cepton aims to take lidar mainstream and achieve its vision of safe and autonomous transportation for everyone.
 Founded in 2016 and led by industry veterans with decades of collective experience across a wide range of advanced lidar and imaging technologies, Cepton is focused on the mass-market commercialization of high-performance, high-quality lidar solutions. Cepton is headquartered in San Jose, CA, and has a center of excellence facility in Troy, MI to provide local support to the OEM and Tier 1-studded Metro Detroit area.

title: Associate or Full Professor, Disability Health & Quality of Life
description:
About the job
The Department of Community and Population Health, College of Health (COH), invites applications for an Associate or Full Professor with a specialization in impacting the health and quality of life of persons with disabilities, with an anticipated start date of July 2025. This appointment includes the possibility of tenure on hire for qualified candidates.

Candidates must have an earned doctorate in a field related to health, disabilities, technology and/or data science by the date of employment. Candidates should have a research focus in one of the following areas: Community Living and Participation, Health and Functioning, Employment, Technology for Access and Function, Disability Statistics and Demographics Research, and Disability Regulations and Policy Research. The ideal candidate would be working at the intersection of disability and one or more of the above mentioned emphasis areas. This search is part of a planned multi-year cluster hire at Lehigh University to meet our strategic emphasis on positively impacting health, quality of life, and employment for people with disabilities.

The individual hired will be expected to teach introductory courses in community and population health, or in biostatistics and data science, as well as upper-level courses in their area of expertise at the undergraduate and graduate level; engage in scholarly activities; and participate in departmental, college, and university service. This includes mentoring students at the undergraduate and graduate levels, mentoring junior faculty members, assisting with curriculum design, and contributing to the growth of the College of Health. The appointed faculty member will have the opportunity for interdisciplinary collaboration with colleagues throughout Lehigh University, including faculty creating assistive technologies and with Lehigh University partners, such as Good Shepherd Rehabilitation.

The Department of Community and Population Health at Lehigh University is committed to fostering positive change in the communities where we live and work by promoting health equity. The mission of the COH, the newest of five colleges at Lehigh University, is to understand, preserve, and improve the health and well-being of domestic and global populations and communities with community-focused and data-driven research and education in three primary areas: population health, community health, and health innovation and technology. Our strategic plan identifies as a goal, improving health outcomes for marginalized communities in the Lehigh Valley. The COH is collaborating with the Colleges of Education and Engineering to build a research team of scholars with expertise in promoting disability independence from multiple disciplinary angles.

Review of applications will begin on October 7 and will continue until the position is filled. Applicants should submit their materials at academicjobsonline.org/ajo/jobs/28384. Candidates should submit the following materials:
Cover letter
Curriculum vitae
Research statement that describes past scholarly contributions and future research directions
Teaching statement that describes instructional philosophy and courses that the candidate would want to teach or develop
A statement on contributions to diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) that describes knowledge, prior DEI experience, and the candidate‚Äôs future plans for enhancing community and culture at Lehigh 
Names and contact information for three references (letters of recommendation will be requested for finalists only)

Any inquiries regarding this search should be directed to Prof. Vinod Namboodiri, Chair of the search committee, at incoh@lehigh.edu.

title: Senior Engineering Manager
description:
About the job
Role Overview:
We are seeking a visionary and strategic Senior Engineering Manager to lead our dynamic engineering team, which is the driving force behind Dune Security‚Äôs groundbreaking solutions. In this pivotal role, you will be responsible for shaping the technical direction of the company, driving innovation, and ensuring that our engineering practices and infrastructure can scale to meet the demands of a rapidly growing customer base. You will oversee the development and maintenance of robust, scalable systems that underpin our AI-powered platform, ensuring that we stay ahead of the curve in the fast-evolving cybersecurity landscape. This is a unique opportunity to make a significant impact on the future of cybersecurity by leading the development of cutting-edge solutions that protect organizations worldwide.

What You‚Äôll Do:
Technical Leadership: Define and execute the engineering strategy in alignment with Dune Security‚Äôs overall vision and business goals. Lead the development of innovative technologies that provide a competitive edge in the cybersecurity market.

Team Building and Management: Build, mentor, and lead a high-performing engineering team. Foster a culture of collaboration, innovation, and excellence, ensuring the team is motivated and aligned with the company‚Äôs objectives.

Scalable Architecture: Oversee the design and implementation of scalable, reliable, and secure systems that support our AI-powered solutions. Ensure our technology stack is robust, adaptable, and capable of handling the demands of a growing enterprise.

Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with product management, design, and other departments to ensure that engineering efforts are aligned with business priorities and that products are delivered on time and to specification.

Process Optimization: Implement and refine engineering processes, tools, and methodologies that enhance productivity, code quality, and delivery speed. Ensure adherence to best practices in software development, DevOps, and quality assurance.

Innovation and R&D: Drive research and development initiatives to explore new technologies, tools, and methodologies that can advance Dune Security‚Äôs mission. Stay ahead of industry trends and ensure the company remains a leader in cybersecurity innovation.

Budget Management: Manage the engineering budget effectively, ensuring that resources are allocated appropriately and that the team has the tools and infrastructure needed to succeed.

Stakeholder Communication: Communicate technical decisions, challenges, and strategies to the executive team, investors, and other stakeholders. Provide clear and regular updates on the progress and direction of engineering projects.

What You‚Äôll Bring:
Experience: 8+ years of engineering experience, with at least 4 years in a senior leadership role (e.g., Senior Engineering Manager, Engineering Manager, Head of Engineering, or CTO) at a high-growth startup or technology company.

Technical Expertise: You bring deep experience in developing web-based platforms and SaaS solutions for enterprise clients, with a strong focus on cloud architecture, platforms, microservices, distributed architecture, and scalable systems‚Äîskills that are essential for success in this role. A security-first mindset is crucial, as we require someone who can integrate security practices into every stage of the development lifecycle, embodying a true DevSecOps approach. Our tech stack leverages a range of AWS services, including EC2 for scalable compute capacity, Lambda for serverless computing, API Gateway for managing APIs, DocumentDB for document database services, and S3 & CloudFront for storage and content delivery. We also utilize SageMaker for machine learning, Kafka for real-time data streaming, Route 53 for DNS services, and Secrets Manager for secure access management. Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and Go is essential, alongside experience with DevOps tools like Docker and GitLab to support efficient and secure development and deployment processes.

Frontend Expertise: Familiarity with frontend technologies, particularly in building and leading teams that utilize React, Material UI, and other modern frontend frameworks. A strong understanding of frontend performance optimization, cross-browser compatibility, and responsive design is essential.

Data Visualization Experience: Experience in integrating and optimizing data visualization components within frontend applications, using libraries such as Recharts or D3.js.

Leadership Skills: Proven track record of building and leading high-performing engineering teams. Strong people management skills with the ability to inspire and motivate a diverse team.

Strategic Vision: Ability to think strategically and translate business goals into a comprehensive technical strategy. Experience in driving innovation and leading complex projects from concept to completion.

Collaboration: Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively across departments and with senior leadership.

Educational Background: A bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field is preferred. A master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science is a plus.

Adaptability: Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities. A hands-on approach with a willingness to dive into technical details when necessary.

Career Path:
While this role is a senior position, there are ample opportunities for growth as Dune Security scales. As Senior Engineering Manager, you'll be positioned to evolve into additional leadership roles or take on additional responsibilities as the company grows. We are committed to investing in our leaders, offering continuous opportunities for professional development, and ensuring that your career evolves in parallel with the company‚Äôs success.

About Dune Security:
Dune Security is a pioneering cybersecurity SaaS company reducing the attack surface for enterprises by introducing the world‚Äôs first AI-Powered Employee Risk Management solution. By leveraging AI, we quantify individual risk through analyzing user behavior, context, learning patterns, and third-party data. This allows us to tailor cybersecurity measures to each individual, transforming vulnerabilities into strengths. Dune Security is poised to reshape cybersecurity, enabling organizations to proactively manage risks and empowering CISOs to safeguard their companies.

At Dune Security, you‚Äôll have the freedom to think creatively, dream big, and use your full range of skills to contribute to our rapid growth. We‚Äôre still in an exciting early stage where your work can have a significant impact on the company‚Äôs direction and success. We value world-class talent and foster a culture of innovation, inclusion, and growth.

Dune Security is proudly backed by world-class venture capital firms, including SignalFire, Craft Ventures, Ensemble VC, Firestreak, and Alumni Ventures.

Compensation:
We offer a highly competitive compensation package that includes:
Base Salary: A minimum starting salary of $155,000, with the potential for a higher amount based on experience and qualifications.

Equity: Significant equity compensation, allowing you to have a meaningful stake in the company‚Äôs future success.

Benefits & Perks: Comprehensive benefits including health insurance, retirement plans, generous PTO, and additional perks designed to support your overall well-being and work-life balance.

Additional Details:
Location: NYC. Candidates must reside within a commutable distance of our Soho, Manhattan office.
Hours: Full time.

Apply Today:
Joining Dune Security means embracing a unique opportunity to shape the future of cybersecurity. If you're passionate about innovation and ready to take on significant responsibility, we encourage you to apply.

If your experience is close to what we‚Äôre looking for but doesn‚Äôt fulfill all the requirements, we encourage you to apply. We are on a mission to build a special company, and to achieve our goal, we are focused on hiring individuals with diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences.

Note: Dune Security is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

title: Associate
description:
About the job
ROLE SUMMARY

In this role, you will participate in all aspects of the firm‚Äôs engagements, including assisting with bankruptcy-related financial and legal analysis, litigation, developing complex financial models, providing valuations, evaluating strategic alternatives and quantifying damages. You will work closely with all team members on a variety of engagements representing clients such as debtors, CROs, chapter 7, 11 and liquidating/litigation trustees, creditors, creditors‚Äô committees and plan administrators in cases spanning a range of industries.

ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Technical Skills (must successfully complete modeling or other technical skills testing prescribed by the Company)
Analytics: evaluation of first-day motions, 13-week cash flow analyses, liquidity forecasting, constructing recovery waterfalls, lender update presentations, vendor analyses, SOALs / SOFA/s / MORs, KEIP & KERP analyses, liquidation, wind-down and claims analyses and three statement models
Financial Modeling: creating detailed 3-statement financial models, ad hoc analytics and company valuations
Client Focus: assisting with the preparation of pitch books and providing thoughtful research and analysis for potential clients
Communication: working directly with senior personnel at Province and our clients to develop comprehensive solutions to complex financial challenges across multiple industries. Ability to recognize underlying issues and condense large amounts of financial and legal information into logical, thoughtful and concise solutions and/or presentations
QUALIFICATIONS / IDEAL CANDIDATE
Academic/Work:
1 to 3 years work experience in corporate restructuring, investment banking, private equity, finance, financial consulting, or relevant corporate positions with a financial or accounting focus.
Strong academic record from a reputable undergraduate/graduate program
Pursuit of a CPA, CFA, or other financial designations will be viewed favorably
Technical:
Advanced PowerPoint and Excel capabilities
Excellent writing and verbal communication skills
Proficient with financial/data analytics
Familiarity with the US Bankruptcy code is a plus
Behaviors:
Planning and Prioritization: must be able to work independently and effectively multitask in a highly detailed environment, having a good sense of what is important to accomplish the goal
Communication Skills: ability to condense large amounts of financial and legal information into logical, thoughtful and concise solutions, presentations and well-written reports
Action-Oriented: eager and responsive at all times, seizing the opportunity when presented with it.
Trust: exceptional maturity and the corresponding ability to interact with lenders, lawyers, senior executives and middle managers, presenting the candid truth in a helpful manner
Personal Learning: ability to successfully work in a small and collaborative team environment, committing to and actively working on improving skills, seeking feedback and adjusting accordingly
OUR BENEFITS

Our benefits include, but are not limited to:
Excellent salary and bonus plans
Competitive benefits package
Company 401K plan
Company profit-sharing plan

AFFIRMATIVE ACTION/EEO STATEMENT:

Our firm provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment in accordance with applicable federal, state, or local laws.
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:

This job description outlines the primary responsibilities of the position. It does not encompass all duties that may be required in this role. The employee may be expected to perform additional job-related tasks and responsibilities as instructed by management within the boundaries of applicable law. Management reserves the right to add, revise, or delete information in this job description. Reasonable accommodation will be provided to qualified individuals with disabilities as required by law. This document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise, other than an "at-will" employment relationship.

title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst
description:
About the job
Job Summary:
We are thrilled to announce the grand opening of our Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) company in Boulder! This exciting addition to the community marks the beginning of an exceptional journey in center-based therapy. We are on the lookout for passionate and qualified Board-Certified Behavior Analysts (BCBAs) to join our dynamic team and contribute to our clinic‚Äôs rapid growth.

As a BCBA at our agency, you will have the unique opportunity to collaborate with top-tier clinical leadership, gaining invaluable insights and guidance from industry experts. We are committed to fostering a supportive and collaborative work environment where our team can thrive and reach their full potential. We offer flexible schedules and prioritize a healthy work-life balance, ensuring our employees feel empowered and appreciated.

At ACP, we believe that when our employees are supported and inspired, they deliver their best work, making a profound and meaningful impact on the lives of those we serve. Join us in this exciting venture and be a part of something truly special in Boulder!

If you are a dedicated and compassionate BCBA looking to make a meaningful difference in the lives of individuals with autism and their families, we invite you to join our team at ACP. Together, we can empower individuals to reach their full potential and lead fulfilling lives.

Relocation assistance

title: Senior Manager of Supply and Demand Planning
description:
About the job
Senior Manager of Supply & Demand Planning
Employment Status: Full-time, benefits eligible

Who We Are
Gymreapers is a direct-to-consumer e-commerce brand creating premium lifting gear, apparel, and equipment for men and women. Our supportive lifting gear has been featured in Men‚Äôs Health, Barbend, Powerlifting Technique, and more. Job Summary:
We are looking for a talented and driven seasoned Demand Planner and Inventory Specialist to become a key player in our dynamic team. This role is essential for maintaining optimal inventory levels, fulfilling customer demand, and driving our growth across Amazon (FBA), business to business (Retail & Wholesale operations) and direct-to-consumer (DTC) channels. The ideal candidate will have a strategic mindset and excel in executing comprehensive e-commerce forecasting, demand planning, and buying strategy.
  Responsibilities:
Develop and maintain accurate demand forecasts for all product lines using historical data, market trends, and sales insights.
Collaborate with sales, marketing, and product development teams to incorporate promotional plans and new product launches into demand forecasts.
Integrate e-commerce forecasting with overall business strategy to ensure a unified demand approach.
Monitor and manage inventory levels across Amazon and DTC channels to prevent stockouts and overstock situations.
Implement inventory optimization strategies to balance customer service levels and inventory costs.
Align inventory management tactics with merchandising and buying strategies to support overall business goals.
Analyze sales data, inventory reports, and market trends to identify patterns and opportunities for improvement.
Generate and present reports on inventory performance, forecast accuracy, and key performance indicators (KPIs).
Work closely with suppliers, logistics partners, and internal teams to ensure timely and efficient product replenishment.
Resolve supply chain disruptions and address any issues related to product availability.
Develop and implement strategies to improve demand planning and inventory management processes.
Participate in cross-functional projects aimed at enhancing overall business performance.
Ensure alignment of e-commerce forecasting with broader inventory strategies.
Provide analytical and strategic support to retail demand planning and inventory management teams.
Collaborate with retail teams to ensure consistent and effective inventory management across all channels.
Foster strong communication channels with key stakeholders to align inventory strategies with business goals.
Collaborate with the marketing team to align inventory plans with promotional activities and sales events.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain Management, business administration, operations management, or data science related fields
4+ years of experience in demand planning and inventory management, preferably within the designer and luxury goods industry.
Apics Certifications or Lean Certifications are a plus (Planning and Inventory Management ~CPMI, Certified Supply Chain Professional ~ CSCP, Six Sigma Black Belt CSSBB) 
Proficiency in demand forecasting tools, inventory management software, and ERP systems.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets and make data-driven decisions.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and external partners.
Proven strategic thinker with the ability to develop and implement effective inventory management strategies.
Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Experience with Amazon Seller Central, retail supply chain management, and direct-to-consumer logistics is a plus.
Strong leadership skills, with the ability to motivate and inspire teams to achieve excellence.

title: Unmanned Aircraft Software Lead
description:
About the job
Zone 5 Technologies (Zone 5) is a leading UAS, and technology development company founded in 2011 and headquartered in San Luis Obispo, CA. We specialize in creating and testing innovative unmanned aircraft systems (UAS) designed for challenging government applications. Our expertise spans the entire development process, from concept to production, with a focus on air-launched effects, next-gen munitions, counter-UAS systems, and tactical interceptors. At Zone 5, we are committed to driving advancements in technology with our vertically integrated approach.

Join our team at Zone 5 Technologies as the Software Lead at the company, where innovation and cutting-edge technology drive us to pioneer advancements in Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS). Based in the vibrant city of San Luis Obispo, California, we're seeking talented individuals to join our growing team and contribute to our development and advancement for groups 1 to 4 Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS).

Position Summary:
The Unmanned Aircraft Software Lead will oversee the development, integration, and maintenance of software systems for unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs). This role involves leading a team of software engineers, collaborating with cross-functional teams (hardware, systems, and flight operations), and ensuring that all software complies with safety, performance, and regulatory requirements. The candidate will be responsible for the entire software development lifecycle, from requirements gathering through design, implementation, and validation.

Key Responsibilities:
Team Leadership: Lead, mentor, and manage a team of software engineers focused on UAV flight control, communication, mission planning, and data processing software.
Software Architecture & Design: Design and implement software architecture for UAV systems, ensuring scalability, reliability, and performance.
Development and Integration: Lead the development of flight control, mission management, and payload management software, integrating with hardware, sensor, and communication systems.
Testing and Validation: Develop and oversee unit tests, simulation tests, hardware-in-the-loop (HITL) testing, and field flight testing to ensure software performance and safety.
Compliance & Standards: Ensure the software meets regulatory standards such as DO-178C (for airborne systems) and other UAV-related certifications.
Collaboration: Work closely with hardware engineers, systems engineers, and flight operations teams to ensure seamless integration of software with UAV platforms.
Innovation: Stay updated with emerging technologies in UAV software and contribute to the innovation and evolution of the company‚Äôs UAV products.
Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive software documentation, including design documents, testing plans, and user manuals.

Required Qualifications:
Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field (Master's preferred).

Experience:
Minimum of 5 years in software development, with at least 2 years in a leadership role.
Prior experience with UAV or aerospace software systems is strongly preferred.

Skills:
Expertise in a wide variety of programming languages such as C, C++, C#, Python, Matlab, Simulink.
Knowledge of flight control systems, real-time operating systems (RTOS), and communication protocols (e.g. Stanag4586, Arinc825, MAVLink).
Comprehensive background in networking systems and protocols (UDP, TCP, DNS, DHCP).
Experience with software development tools such as Git, GitHub, and issue tracking systems (e.g., JIRA).
Familiarity with safety-critical systems and relevant standards (DO-178C, ARP4754, etc.).
Strong problem-solving, leadership, and communication skills.

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with machine learning, computer vision, or autonomous systems.
Knowledge of satellite or long-range communication systems for UAVs.
Strong DevSecOps background in securing military systems.
CI/CD experience with implementing automated testing and deployment pipelines.
AWS EC2, ECR, S3, Lambda experience.

Benefits:
Competitive salary
Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance fully paid for by the company.
401K plan with company match
4 weeks paid time off.
12 paid holidays
Opportunities for professional development and advancement.
Access to cutting-edge UAV technology and training.
Work in a dynamic and growing industry with exciting career prospects.

Why Join Zone 5 Technologies?
Innovative Environment: Work on cutting-edge technology that is shaping the future of defense and aerospace.
Collaborative Culture: Join a team of passionate professionals dedicated to pushing the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible.
Career Growth: Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.

If you are passionate about unmanned aircraft technology and want to be a part of a dynamic and growing company, we would love to hear from you. Apply today and join the Zone 5 Technologies team!

In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire.

title: Senior Regulatory Affairs Specialist
description:
About the job
SUMMARY
The Senior Regulatory Affairs Specialist is responsible for managing, coordinating, and executing internal regulatory processes, including technical documentation for EU MDR compliance, along with other emerging markets. 

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES
This is not an all-inclusive list of duties and responsibilities. Projects/duties may be modified/changed/added/deleted as needed.
  Manage company efforts in global market expansion, identifying various global regulatory requirements, developing internal technical documentation, and supporting responses to various global regulatory agencies.
Contributes to writing and editing technical documents
Researches, analyzes, integrates, and organizes background information from diverse sources for regulatory submissions.
Understands and applies regulatory requirements and their impacts for submissions and pre-and post-market compliance including Post Market Surveillance, Clinical Evaluation Reviews, Post Market Clinical Feedback, and Periodic Safety Update strategies.
Explains information clearly with the right level of detail for the audience, and works to understand a situation, potential risks, and develop possible solutions; brings team members to consensus around topics within the field.
Recognizes when additional support from senior levels within RA is needed to ensure sound decisions are made and risks are minimized.
Utilizes technical expertise and judgment to solve problems. Leverages technical skills and analytical thinking to solve problems. May use multiple internal sources outside of own team to arrive at decisions.
 SUPPLEMENTAL RESPONSIBILITIES
Completes any tasks and/or projects assigned by supervisor
Other duties as assigned
 SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY
None
 QUALIFICATIONS
Education:
Bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college
 Experience:
Minimum of 8 years‚Äô experience working in medical devices
Prior experience in medical device regulatory affairs and global submissions
 Specific Characteristics:
Strong communication skills in English (both written and oral)
Strong initiative ability to communication, project management, and organizational skills
Ability to work independently in a changing environment.
Has ability to prioritize information for data analysis and recognize when additional information and support is needed.
Team-oriented and responsive to internal and external customer needs.
Ability to understand technical documentation and execute associated procedures
 DEMANDS
Time and availability
Must be able to work a minimum of 40 hours each week from 8 am-5 pm, or some variation thereof
Must be able to work extended hours and overtime on normal workdays and/or weekends as needed and demanded by job duties
 Travel
Must have transportation to and from headquarters
 Physical: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by a typical office employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Frequently required to hear and talk
Use of hands for keyboard usage
Frequent sitting, standing and walking
Occasional reaching with hands and arms, stooping, kneeling, lifting, and/or moving up to 30lbs
 Environment
Must be able to work in a moderately loud work environment

DISCLAIMERS
AAP/EEO Statement-
North American Rescue, LLC provides equal employment opportunities to all individuals regardless of their race, color, creed, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law. Further, the company takes affirmative action to ensure that applicants are employed, and employees are treated during employment without regard to any of these characteristics. Discrimination of any type will not be tolerated.

title: Manager, CRM
description:
About the job
We are seeking a Manager, CRM & Lifecycle Marketing for one of our Fortune 500 CPG clients. 
 About our client 
The Clorox Company (NYSE: CLX) is a leading multinational manufacturer and marketer of consumer and professional products with approximately 8,700 employees worldwide and fiscal year 2017 sales of $6 billion. Clorox markets some of the most trusted and recognized consumer brand names, including its namesake bleach and cleaning products; Pine-fSol¬Æ cleaners; Liquid Plumr¬Æ clog removers; Poett¬Æ home care products; Fresh Step¬Æ cat litter; Glad¬Æ bags, wraps and containers; Kingsford¬Æ charcoal; Hidden Valley¬Æ dressings and sauces; Brita¬Æ water-filtration products; Burt's Bees¬Æ natural personal care products; RenewLife¬Æ digestive health products; and Rainbow Light¬Æ, Natural Vitality¬Æ, Neocell¬Æ and Stop Aging Now¬Æ dietary supplements. The company also markets brands for professional services, including Clorox Healthcare¬Æ and Clorox Commercial Solutions¬Æ. More than 80 percent of the company's sales are generated from brands that hold the No. 1 or No. 2 market share positions in their categories. 
 Job Description  
The Manager, CRM & Lifecycle Marketing will be tasked with maximizing performance from our owned consumer messaging platforms, including email, SMS, and loyalty. In this role, you will be designing a lifecycle strategy and playbook to introduce this capability to the enterprise, developing brand-specific best-in-class journeys that drive engagement and monetization across the customer‚Äôs lifecycle. You will be accountable for delivering results and supporting the team to plan and optimize consumer journeys. 
 This individual will be responsible for effectively leading the team to plan, implement and report on lifecycle and CRM initiatives across multiple brands. To be successful in the role, you will need to be a natural collaborator cross-functionally, clear communicator to provide coaching to the team and willing to be hands-on in execution. You will lead our team‚Äôs point of view for applying and testing new personalization and segmentation capabilities, working closely with colleagues across all DTC functions and with Omni, Brand Engagement, TLS, and Electro teams. 
 Key Responsibilities 
Lead the thinking and develop the roadmap to support CRM strategy, personalization and testing to drive engagement and loyalty across the owned consumer journey. 

Partner with Studio Leads and brand engagement/omni teams to understand short and long-term goals to concept email and SMS journeys to effectively engage and retain the opted-in database while reactivating lapsed consumers. 

Act as player-coach with a team of CRM marketers and operators to own end-to-end development of lifecycle campaigns - from planning and execution to optimization and measurement - that increase user engagement, retention, and LTV across brands. 

Collaborate with Electro, Brand Engagement and KCD team members to continuously optimize processes and synergize workflows. 

Own CRM and Lifecycle marketing vendor relationships, responsible for contract negotiation, invoicing and aligning with broader Consumer Experience Transformation team on choices. 

Be a constant resource for BU and other functional team members who are seeking to better understand the impact of lifecycle marketing for their business and consumer goals. 

Lead, develop and inspire CRM team members/agencies. 

Set and manage best practices around segmentation, welcome and win-back series, triggers, and testing framework and pursue forums to share out these learnings quarterly. 

Design strong measurement and attribution approach with data science/analytics to optimize spend and creative across channels. 

Champion marketing analytics, data architecture, and data hygiene best practices that best support lifecycle marketing initiatives & reporting. 

Define, design, and implement a loyalty strategy in partnership with cross-functional partners to evaluate vendors and select a Loyalty platform to service interested brands. 
 Qualifications 
Minimum 7-10 years of experience in retention marketing, CRM, or lifecycle automation in a multi-brand environment 

Experience in DTC/e-commerce consumer marketing 

Experience in people and team management 

Experience with CPG brands a plus 

Experience working with in-house and outsourced product, brands, data, and creative teams. 

Demonstrated success optimizing for engagement and LTV. 

Strong collaborator‚Äîability to influence across multiple teams and personalities to drive towards common goal. 

Clear communicator ‚Äì demonstrated expertise in driving clarity and alignment within team and with cross-functional partners and senior leadership. Excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills. 

Demonstrated cross-functional leadership with strong ability to build, grow, and maintain key internal partnerships. 

Flexibility and agility to adapt to changing and evolving business objectives. 

Ability to work across multiple brands and quickly pivot as needed. 

Strong analytical skills with ability to tell a compelling story. 

Eagerness to contribute to the team‚Äôs culture of curiosity and shared problem-solving. 

Willingness to seek out answers, explore out of the box solutions, and track down resources. Strong problem-solving skills, especially when dealing with ambiguity. 

Candidate will ideally be in Durham, NC or San Francisco/Oakland, CA but open to remote based on candidate location. 
 We are committed to fair and equitable pay and are transparent with current and future teammates about our full hour pay ranges for this position. 
 The expected hourly pay range for this position is $70-$75 per hour.

title: Vice President Finance
description:

description:
About the job
Director of Revenue Operations

By improving commercial processes, facilitating data-driven decision making, and taking on administrative tasks previously owned by the sales force, the RevOps team directly impacts and improve Meyer Lab‚Äôs efficiency.

title: Alzheimer's Post Doctoral Fellowship
description:
About the job
We are the Indiana Biosciences Research Institute (IBRI). We are a leading translational research institute that advances academic and industry science through collaboration to improve patient health outcomes. Building your career at the IBRI in Indianapolis‚Äô 16Tech Innovation District, means being part of a team of renowned scientists, creative thinkers, and innovative leaders.

Today‚Äôs research is being driven by significant advances in our abilities to study complex disease processes and propose new ways to improve patients‚Äô lives. To reflect the evolving nature of life sciences research and encourage synergies through collaboration, we are enhancing our integrated capabilities, adding depth to how we approach patient-informed translational science and pursuing four foundational areas of scientific focus. These four areas will provide us the core talent and capability to pursue translational science in this new patient-centric framework: 

Disease, Systems, Pathways ‚Äì We are working to better understand diabetes and identify new ways to combat the disease. We are applying this learning to other diseases that share common systems and pathways.
Molecular Innovation ‚Äì We are developing new capabilities for molecular design and drug discovery to investigate disease processes and pursue new therapeutic approaches.
Integrated Data Sciences ‚Äì We are pursuing advanced data sciences to create novel end-user inspired solutions that address complex analysis, simulation, and prediction across the translational sciences.
Enabling Technologies ‚Äì We are building a rich platform of enabling technologies that give our scientists, partners, and collaborators access to the best tools to solve complex scientific problems.

The IBRI‚Äôs vision is to build a world-class organization of researchers, innovators and business professionals that catalyze activities across the Indiana (and beyond) life sciences community. To achieve that vision, we look for curious and collaborative team members who are energized by innovation, guided by integrity, and inspired by diversity.

The Opportunity:
The Indiana Biosciences Research Institute (IBRI) is hiring a postdoctoral researcher in the interdisciplinary research space of Alzheimer‚Äôs disease, immunology and pharmacology. This position is funded through IBRI‚Äôs partnership with TREAT-AD, The ideal candidate will be joining the IBRI‚Äôs cellular pharmacology team to advance research exploring new therapeutic approaches for Alzheimer‚Äôs disease. This is a unique opportunity to work in a unique scientific environment with both academic and industry colleagues. This position will report to Dr. Louis Stancato and Dr. Joshua Kulas.

Responsibilities:
This role will be primarily laboratory based responsible for developing and testing assays, and cell culture models to evaluate candidate molecules for their biological effects.
Manage an independent research project to yield one or more published manuscripts and conference presentations.
Writing and finalizing reports (Target Enablement Packages) on emerging therapeutic targets in Alzheimer‚Äôs disease.
Attending meetings with the TREAT-AD teams and working collaboratively with the TREAT-AD consortium to evaluate and propose drug targets.

Qualifications:
Ph.D. in a relevant field such as neuroscience, pharmacology, immunology, cell biology, or biochemistry by the start date of the postdoctoral fellowship.
Excellent organizational and project management skills.
Proven experience with data analysis and interpretation skills as well as the ability to effectively present and communicate scientific information.
Prior research experience in neuroscience or immunology is valued.

Preferred Qualifications:
Extensive experience with mammalian cell culture or cell lines, pharmacology experiments and standard laboratory assays such as qPCR, western blot, and cell or tissue imaging is preferred.
Experience working with iPSC cultures or flow cytometry is a plus.
Experience with RNA sequencing experiments or cell line editing is a plus.
Experience working with microglia or immune cells is highly desirable. Experience working with rodents or rodent models of neurodegeneration is a plus.
Experience with grant writing is valued.

Equal Employment Opportunity:
The IBRI provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status.

title: Officer, Product Reporting and Operations
description:
About the job
About Calvert Impact
Calvert Impact is a global nonprofit investment firm that helps investors and financial professionals invest in solutions that people and the planet need. During its 25-year history, Calvert Impact has mobilized over $4 billion to grow local community and green finance organizations through its flagship Community Investment Note‚Ñ¢ and structuring services. Calvert Impact uses its unique position to bring the capital markets and communities closer together. More at calvertimpact.org.
 Job Description
The Strategy team at Calvert Impact has developed two new products that enable us to bring the capital markets closer to the communities we serve ‚Äì one focused on addressing the urgency of climate change (the Cut Carbon Note) and another focused on reducing credit gaps for under-banked small businesses across the U.S. (Access Small Business Program).
 The team is seeking an Officer to assist with servicing, reporting, and other operational functions supporting Cut Carbon and Access. The role requires someone who is skilled at data management and analysis, has superb organizational and project management skills, and thrives in a fast-paced environment. This position will report to the Director of the Access Small Business Program and will work across the organization, coordinating closely with members of the Accounting, Loan Administration, and Impact Measurement and Management teams. 
 Key Responsibilities
 Key responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
  Provide operational support to the firm‚Äôs Access program, including contribution to key processes such as loan purchase and repayment cycles
Design, prepare and distribute reporting to key Access stakeholders, including warehouse lender, state agencies, US Treasury, auditors and other partners
Coordinate with Cut Carbon asset servicer and trustee to prepare and disseminate semi-annual distribution date reports
Collaborate with internal and external partners to issue new series of Cut Carbon Notes
Contribute to ongoing financial modeling and projections for Access and Cut Carbon programs
Provide analysis related to asset, lender and program performance, trends and forecasts
Work with the Impact Measurement and Management team to collect, manage, and analyze portfolio impact data, both quantitative and qualitative
Support the development of IMM frameworks and systems for new products
Be a positive contributor to our high-performing, self-starting, mission-driven culture
Assist in grant reporting and compliance
Assist to ensure a clean and timely year end audit on multiple entities, including compilation of requested materials, preparation of reports, and responding to audit questions raised
Engage with colleagues on the team and across the organization on special projects as needed
  Qualifications
The ideal candidate:
Is passionate about the mission and work of Calvert Impact and our commitment to justice, equity, diversity, and inclusion
Is proficient in Excel, bonus if the candidate is familiar with relational databases and/or data visualization tools (e.g., Airtable, Power BI, Salesforce)
Is fluent in English and is an effective and respectful communicator (both oral and written) and listener
Can work effectively both as part of a team and independently
Is open to different perspectives and learning new methods of analysis
Is skilled at prioritizing competing demands and working across teams with different priorities
Is intellectually curious, combined with a good sense of humor and high integrity
Has a positive, ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù attitude focused on implementing solutions
Minimum of three years of financial services experience, with lending, capital asset finance, and/or debt fund accounting experience strongly preferred
Has an undergraduate degree in Finance, Accounting or a related field, bonus if the candidate has taken any impact investing, economic development, and/or impact measurement courses
Is authorized to work in the United States

title: Tenure-Track Professor, Digital Population Health (Associate or Full)
description:
About the job
The Department of Community and Population Health, College of Health (COH), invites applications for a tenure-track Associate or Full Professor of Digital Population Health with a specialization in mHealth, health IT, wearables, VR/AR, telehealth, telemedicine, clinical decision support, data-driven health policy, personalized wellness, and assistive technologies for disability independence, with an anticipated start date of July 2025. This appointment includes the possibility of tenure on hire for qualified candidates.

Candidates must have an earned doctorate in biostatistics, engineering, public or population health, computer or computational science, mathematics, linguistics, social/behavioral sciences (like psychology, sociology, anthropology, demography, or political science), or a closely related field by the date of employment. Candidates must conduct research that advances population health through digital technologies.

The individual hired will be expected to teach introductory courses in health information technology and/or health data science, as well as upper-level courses in their area of expertise at the undergraduate and graduate level, engage in scholarly activities, and participate in departmental, college, and university service, including mentoring students at the undergraduate and graduate levels; mentoring junior faculty members; assisting with curriculum design; and contributing to the growth of the College of Health. The appointed faculty member will have the opportunity for interdisciplinary collaboration with colleagues throughout Lehigh University, including faculty creating assistive technologies and with Lehigh University partners.

The Department of Community and Population Health at Lehigh University is committed to fostering positive change in the communities where we live and work by promoting health equity. The mission of the COH, the newest of five colleges at Lehigh University, is to understand, preserve, and improve the health and well-being of domestic and global populations and communities with community-focused and data-driven research and education in three primary areas: population health, community health, and health innovation and technology. Our strategic plan identifies as a goal, improving health outcomes for marginalized communities in the Lehigh Valley. The COH is collaborating with the Colleges of Education and Engineering to build a research team of scholars with expertise in promoting disability independence from multiple disciplinary angles.

Review of applications will begin on October 7 and will continue until the position is filled. Applicants should submit their materials at academicjobsonline.org/ajo/jobs/28361. Candidates should submit the following materials:
Cover letter
Curriculum vitae
Research statement that describes past scholarly contributions and future research directions
Teaching statement that describes instructional philosophy and courses that the candidate would want to teach or develop
A statement on contributions to diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) that describes knowledge, prior DEI experience, and the candidate‚Äôs future plans for enhancing community and culture at Lehigh
Names and contact information for three references (letters of recommendation will be requested for finalists only)

Any inquiries regarding this search should be directed to Prof. Bilal Khan, Chair of the search committee, at incoh@lehigh.edu.

title: Business Development Specialist Bilingual Chinese or Spanish
description:
About the job
Company Description
Founded in 2014, HXE has firmly established itself in the MICE industry with a fundamental mission‚Äîto connect customers and providers with precision and efficiency through innovative technology. Annually, more than 50,000 reservations are managed through HXE, with an estimated budget exceeding $1.9 billion USD. HXE has received two rounds of investment from IDG and DCM. With a presence in over 300 cities and partnerships with leading hotel brands like Marriott, Hilton, and IHG, we ensure our clients experience precision, efficiency, and innovation in every event.
