title: Project Analyst
description:
About the job
Project Planning Analyst
Excellent opportunity to build on your career with a global company who is a leader in their industry! Our client is seeking a high-achieving candidate to join our creative and dynamic organization. You must be exceptionally organized and have excellent communication skills in this role. 

You will be working on multiple mini projects that are in part of an initiative for the company to keep all facilities pristine. This role is a mix of data entry, inventory management, data analysis, customer management, and process improvement.

RESPONSIBILITIES: 
You will be involved in understanding pain points of the stores to see what materials are needed. You will communicate these changes to internal departments to build and maintain store level trackers and order for the changes. Some of the responsibilities include:
Gathering and collecting information from field store partners for project creation
Auditing project readiness in MLX system (internal, web-based)
Working as a liaison between the field and cross functional partners to meet all toll gates
Calculating how many items need to be ordered
Placing labor, outbound, and direct to store orders
Monitor inventory depletion and adjust orders as necessary
Place re-orders for missing, damaged or additional required materials
Provide process improvement suggestions for the projects

This is a 6-12 month contract opportunity, with potential to extend or convert to direct hire in the Atlanta area! The team is working a hybrid schedule; Mon-Thursday in the office in Smyrna/Vinings and Friday WFH. Enjoy a casual dress code, dynamic and high-energy team members, and the ability to execute business skills.

REQUIRED SKILLS:
2+ years of professional work experience in a Project Management, Project Analyst, Project Coordinator or Supply Chain/logistics role
Intermediate Excel skills - ability to do IF, AND, SUMIF, VLOOKUP - currently doing weekly in current position
Experience executing/juggling multiple projects/inventory
Process Improvement experience (can provide examples)
Experience running a project from start to finish (full lifecycle)
Experience interacting with cross-functional partners
Detail oriented 
Bachelor's Degree (Business, Industrial Engineering, Supply Chain, Logistics Operations, Process Improvement, or similar field) 

Must be authorized to work in the U.S./Sponsorships are not available.

title: Recruiter
description:
About the job
Greater Phoenix Chamber Foundation
The Greater Phoenix Chamber Foundation (the Foundation) convenes and catalyzes business, education, and community to enhance college and career readiness, develop a stronger workforce, and build healthier communities throughout Arizona. The Foundation, a 501c3 nonprofit organization, leads the charitable and education initiatives of the Greater Phoenix Chamber under the four pillars of education, workforce development, wellness, and research. Through stronger alignment between education, business, and community, the Foundation prepares individuals for college and career and serves as an intermediary to convey workforce needs and champion scalable workforce solutions. In addition, the Foundation makes Arizona and the Greater Phoenix region known as destinations for healthy talent and healthy communities through workplace wellness efforts and publishes data-driven research to inform policymakers, business leaders, and the general public.
 Greater Phoenix Chamber
The Greater Phoenix Chamber (Chamber) is the leading business organization for the Greater Phoenix region. We catalyze regional prosperity with forward-thinking public policy, intentional economic growth, and diverse, prepared talent. We accomplish this by building a policy environment where businesses thrive, serving as a resource and voice for AZ economic data and policy, and developing and attracting a skilled, talented, diverse workforce to meet the demands of growth industries.

Skills for America‚Äôs Future 
In May 2023, the Greater Phoenix Chamber Foundation launched Connect to Work AZ, a regional jobs-first hiring initiative based on the Skills for America‚Äôs Future model. Skills for America‚Äôs Future is committed to increasing economic mobility for under and unemployed individuals by connecting them to quality jobs through deep partnerships and an understanding of the unique human capital needs of their network of engaged employers. This approach drives systemic change and innovation and can be seen through both the employers‚Äô skilled and diverse workforce, and the economic mobility provided to the job seekers who are no longer unemployed/unemployed.

Who are we looking for today?
We are interested in hiring people who have a passion for Phoenix and a desire to make the Greater Phoenix region a great place to live, work, and play. Ideal candidates will bring a passion for working to improve lives, expand economic prosperity, and foster collective action and impact with industry-sector leadership and community and education partners.

Primary Responsibilities 
We are looking for a Recruiter who will be responsible for recruiting talent to meet the evolving needs of our hiring partners as well as the Chamber and Foundation‚Äôs internal hiring needs. The Recruiter reports to the Director of Workforce Innovation.

Position Objectives:
We are seeking a self-motivated, hands-on, full-time Recruiter with a minimum of 1-2 years of work experience in a recruiting/staffing function. 

Ideally, the candidate will also have experience sourcing candidates from community-based organizations

This position is a member of the Workforce Team within the Foundation. 

The Recruiter will:
Source, recruit, screen, interview and assess high volumes of candidates for exempt and nonexempt roles to exceed the Connect to Work AZ client‚Äôs needs.

Be responsible for implementing staffing and recruiting processes, strategies, and solutions.

Develop strong relationships within the community and partner with hiring managers and business leaders.

Maintain accurate candidate records and ensure ATS is accurate.

Track and report key metrics designed to measure and predict staffing activity, including but not limited to candidate recruitment status, submit-to-hire ratios, placements, employment verification, and retention.

Perform regular follow-ups with the respective candidates to ensure the timeliness of the recruiting process.

Proactively seek new avenues to attract candidates.

Possess excellent consultative skills and proven experience in all recruiting methods, including passive sourcing.

Develop strong partnerships with community-based organizations that can refer candidates from target populations to job opportunities.
 Candidate qualifications: 
The Foundation is looking for candidates with the following knowledge, skills, and abilities desirable for job success:

1 ‚Äì 2 years of recent high-volume, fast-paced staffing/recruitment experience

Recruitment experience in healthcare/finance/banking is a plus.

Knowledge of recruiting software is a plus but not required.

Excellent interpersonal skills, communication skills, and team-based project experience.

Detail-oriented with a sense of urgency.

Must possess excellent judgment to prioritize work, handle multiple projects at once, and meet objectives.

Must have proven experience supporting a high volume of requisitions.

A clear understanding of the end-to-end recruitment lifecycle processes and best practices.

Must have experience in mapping and sourcing resumes from all sources, including job boards.

Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite and in-depth knowledge of data mining internet research, and internet recruiting.

Must be able to travel to meetings or events regularly; reliable transportation is necessary.

Experience sourcing candidates from education and community-based organizations is a plus, but not required.

Must pass a background check, fingerprint clearance, and a drug test.

Location/Remote Working Expectations:
Staff members are expected to be in-person at the Chamber offices 1-2 days per week and can generally work remotely the remaining 3-4 days. In-person meetings and events are required from time to time in addition to the in-office days, to best meet the needs of the organization and clients.

Application Information: 
Qualified candidates should apply through the LinkedIn posting. Should you have any questions, please feel free to reach us at hr@phoenixchamber.com.

NO PHONE CALLS, PLEASE. GPCF is an equal opportunity employer. No person will be discriminated against because of race, religion, sex, color, age, national origin, disability, or any other legally protected class.

title: Marketing Consultant for IT, AI focused services
description:
About the job

Location: US (Remote working, Part time)
Compensation: Profit-Sharing Basis + Performance-Based Incentives
About Us:
At OrcaLex Technologies, we are innovators in AI and Generative AI-powered software development services. Our expertise includes Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), fine-tuning Large Language Models (LLMs), and developing multimodal LLM solutions. We also excel in vision applications leveraging Machine Learning (ML), YOLO, OpenCV, and multimodal LLMs for industries such as pharmaceuticals, semiconductors, automation, robotics, defense technology, and core engineering sectors (mechanical, embedded, signal processing, control systems, drones, missiles).
We are looking for a Senior Marketing Consultant for our IT Services focused on AI and Generative AI, who can engage with top-level executives, particularly CXOs of client companies, to drive business growth. The role involves a profit-sharing arrangement, with the potential for significant earnings based on performance.
Key Responsibilities:
Drive business development by targeting CXOs, founders, and decision-makers of client companies.
Promote our AI-powered IT services solutions, focusing on RAG, multimodal LLMs, and vision applications, to core engineering industries.
Hunt for new prospective clients globally, focusing on sectors such as pharma, semiconductors, defense, automation, and robotics.
Identify and open high-value deals by interacting directly with client CEOs and founders. Our technical team will assist in closing orders.
Prepare and deliver tailored presentations, offers, and proposals to meet the specific needs of each prospective client.
Collaborate with internal teams to ensure alignment with client requirements and deliverables.
Criteria
Proven experience as a Senior Marketing Consultant or similar role, with a track record of hunting/closing large, high-value deals.
Ability to engage with and influence CXOs, founders, and senior executives.
Experience in targeting / acquiring clients in industries like pharma, semiconductors, defense, and engineering.
Ability to work independently, with a focus on results and profitability.
What We Offer:
Profit-sharing model with significant earnings potential based on performance.
Opportunity to work with cutting-edge AI and engineering technologies.
Contact: praveen@orcalex.ai

title: JITTC-N DIADS/SAM Systems Administrator - 20569
description:
About the job
Requisition Number: 20569

Required Travel: 0 - 10%

Employment Type: Full Time/Salaried/Exempt

Anticipated Salary Range: $63,809.00 - $95,000.00

Security Clearance: TS/SCI

Level of Experience: Mid

This opportunity resides with Live, Virtual, Constructive Solutions, a business group within HII‚Äôs Mission Technologies division. As a trusted partner to our military customers, we design, develop and operate systems that bring together service members from across the globe to help you train like you fight, because we understand that preparation requires full coordination‚Äînot readiness in piece parts.

Meet HII‚Äôs Mission Technologies Division

Our team of more than 7,000 professionals worldwide delivers all-domain expertise and advanced technologies in service of mission partners across the globe. Mission Technologies is leading the next evolution of national defense ‚Äì the data evolution - by accelerating a breadth of national security solutions for government and commercial customers. Our capabilities range from C5ISR, AI and Big Data, cyber operations and synthetic training environments to fleet sustainment, environmental remediation and the largest family of unmanned underwater vehicles in every class. Find the role that‚Äôs right for you. Apply today. We look forward to meeting you.

To learn more about Mission Technologies, click here for a short video: https://vimeo.com/732533072

Job Description

Mission Technologies, a Division of HII, is seeking a Red Forces IADS/SAM Operator as a member of the Modeling, Simulation, and Training team at the Joint Integrated Test and Training Center ‚Äì Nellis (JITTC-N), Nellis, AFB, NV. The individual‚Äôs primary responsibility the accurate representation and operation of threat SAMs and IADS. Coordinated SAM engagements at the requisite levels ‚Äî single SAM, Battery, or SABOC ‚Äî to drive mission test and training objectives. Requires communication and coordination with Red Czar, Control Room Coordinator, and White Force Coordinator during execution/operation.

What You Will Do

Operating consoles to provide realistic representation of SAMS and IADS. Duties will include, but are not limited to:

Orchestrate and operate constructive representation of red forces for test and training missions. 
Support the development and coordination JITTC-N training by providing IADS/SAM subject matter expertise during the planning and execution of training.
Provide feedback and assist in the creation and modification of mission-planning materials to ensure participants achieve maximum training.
Report issues related to stimulation software applications and provide basic trouble shooting support.

Essential Job Responsibilities

Maintains smooth operation of multi-user computer systems, including coordination with network administrators. Duties may include setting up administrator and service accounts, maintaining system documentation, tuning system performance, installing system wide software and allocate mass storage space. Interacts with users and evaluates vendor products. Makes recommendations to purchase hardware and software, coordinates installation and provides backup recovery. Develops and monitors policies and standards for allocation related to the use of computing resources.

Minimum Qualifications

3 years relevant experience with Bachelors in related field; 1 year relevant experience with Masters in related field; or High School Diploma or equivalent and 7 years relevant experience.
Understanding of Air Force terminology to implement/emulate realistic red forces for test and training.
Work Environment: Position is not eligible for remote work; on-site support is required. Must be capable of working morning and evening shifts to accommodate flexible schedule training operations.
Clearance: DoD Top Secret security clearance with SCI eligibility.

Preferred Requirements

Fundamental understanding of military surface to air missile systems.
Experience with Digital Integrated Air Defense System (DIADS) Software.
Military experience with aviation and combat systems.
Advanced aircraft simulator experience and scenario development.
Highly desired ‚Äì Experience with Joint Simulation Environment (JSE) and familiarity with its software components (NGTS, WSCE, DIADS, EAAGLES, GRID, Shot Log, ART, and SCE).

Physical Requirements

Adequate visual acuity and manual dexterity for meeting the requirements of the Systems Analyst discipline.

HII is more than a job - it‚Äôs an opportunity to build a new future. We offer competitive benefits such as best-in-class medical, dental and vision plan choices; wellness resources; employee assistance programs; Savings Plan Options (401(k)); financial planning tools, life insurance; employee discounts; paid holidays and paid time off; tuition reimbursement; as well as early childhood and post-secondary education scholarships.

HII is more than a job - it‚Äôs an opportunity to build a new future. We offer competitive benefits such as best-in-class medical, dental and vision plan choices; wellness resources; employee assistance programs; Savings Plan Options (401(k)); financial planning tools, life insurance; employee discounts; paid holidays and paid time off; tuition reimbursement; as well as early childhood and post-secondary education scholarships. Bonus/other non-recurrent compensation is occasionally offered for qualified positions, and if applicable to this role will be addressed by the recruiter at the screening phase of application.

Why HII

We build the world‚Äôs most powerful, survivable naval ships and defense technology solutions that safeguard our seas, sky, land, space and cyber. Our diverse workforce includes skilled tradespeople; artificial intelligence, machine learning (AI/ML) experts; engineers; technologists; scientists; logistics experts; and business administration professionals.

Recognized as one of America‚Äôs top large company employers, we are a values and ethics driven organization that puts people‚Äôs safety and well-being first. Regardless of your role or where you serve, at HII, you‚Äôll find a supportive and welcoming environment, competitive benefits, and valuable educational and training programs for continual career growth at every stage of your career.

Together we are working to ensure a future where everyone can be free and thrive.

Today‚Äôs challenges are bigger than ever, and the nation needs the best of us. It‚Äôs why we‚Äôre focused on hiring, developing and nurturing our diversity. We believe that diversity among our workforce strengthens the organization, stimulates creativity, promotes the exchange of ideas and enriches the work lives of all our employees.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, physical or mental disability, age, or veteran status or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.

Do You Need Assistance?

Reasonable accommodations are considered on a case-by-case basis. Please note that only those inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this email address. Additionally, you may also call 1-844-849-8463 for assistance. Press #3 for HII Mission Technologies.

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
About the job
About Spectora
Spectora is the leading SaaS home inspection platform, with a 7-year track record of helping home inspectors build successful businesses through our world-class inspection software. Our flagship product is an all-in-one business solution that helps inspectors conduct and share inspections, manage and automate their operations, and market their business.

We‚Äôre proud to say Spectora is the market leader in the home inspection space, an achievement possible because of our fanatical focus on our customers, product, and team. We go head-to-head with bigger competitors with deeper pockets every day and are winning.

And we win because of our people.

Our culture is driven by our scrappy, hilarious, and relationship-focused team, who bring IQ and EQ to the table. We push ourselves and each other to grow in our careers and as people and are focused on being the best versions of ourselves every day. Spectora is a genuinely exceptional place to work (if we do say so ourselves).

Want to hear about our culture directly from the team? ‚è≠ https://youtu.be/ticzqdTGAlo

About the Position
We are seeking our first Business Intelligence Engineer to drive data-informed decision making across Spectora to fuel our growth in a focused way. As we further solidify our market-leading position in the home inspection industry, meaningful business insights will be crucial in making the right decisions. 

Our Business Intelligence Engineer will take on a new role within our Finance & Operations team as we unlock valuable insights about how our customers and business have operated. You‚Äôll report directly to the Head of Finance & Operations and have a unique opportunity to shape this role from the ground up, creating your own processes and methodologies. You‚Äôll often work directly with our CEO and other leaders to transform raw data into actionable insights that drive our product development, customer success, and growth strategies. 

As a BI Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and optimizing our data pipeline, enabling our teams to make informed, data-driven decisions. You will be an expert in creating scalable data solutions using Ruby/Rails, Postgres, Snowflake, and Domo and/or Holistics. Your role will be critical in transforming raw data into business insights through ETL processes, data modeling, and creating robust reports and dashboards.

Core Responsibilities

Data Integration and Management:
Quickly develop a deep understanding of our platform database and infrastructure
Design and implement ETL processes to integrate data from various sources into Snowflake.
Develop and manage Snowflake data models, ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and efficiency.
Familiar with backend technologies, especially Ruby on Rails, to integrate data solutions with our application and automate data-related workflows.
Able to maintain and expand our data warehouse (Snowflake) to ensure it supports current and future analytics needs.
Optimize data loading, transformation, and retrieval processes for performance.
Reporting and Visualization:
Create and maintain interactive and visually appealing dashboards and reports in visualization tools (ie: Holistics, Domo).
Translate complex data sets into actionable insights through effective data visualization techniques.
Customize and enhance visualization applications to meet specific business needs and objectives.
Data Analysis:
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their data needs and requirements.
Perform ad-hoc data analysis and provide actionable recommendations based on findings.
Develop and maintain key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to track business performance.
Collaboration and Communication:
Work closely with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and deliver BI solutions that support business goals.
Communicate technical concepts and findings to non-technical stakeholders in a clear and understandable manner.
Provide training and support to end-users on our BI tools, data analysis best practices and overall data literacy
Identify opportunities for data-driven improvements in our product, systems, processes and operations and take action on collaborating with other teams to implement them
Quality Assurance:
Ensure data integrity and accuracy by implementing robust data validation and testing procedures.
Monitor and troubleshoot BI systems and applications to resolve issues promptly.
Stay updated with industry trends and best practices to continually improve BI processes and tools.

Who You Are
You‚Äôre a self-starter who thrives in ambiguity and gets excited by the prospect of building our business intelligence function from the ground up
You‚Äôre great at data analysis, advanced SQL querying, schema design and enabling teams to make data-driven decisions
Experience with BI tools Domo and/or Holistics
Familiar with Ruby and Ruby on Rails with demonstrated experience building and integrating data solutions.
You have a combination of technical expertise in data engineering and business acumen
You have a solutions-oriented mindset and don‚Äôt require a perfect set of circumstances before taking action- Spectora is in the messy middle
You‚Äôre gifted in understanding data requirements to turn complex data into actionable data insights
You have 5+ years of relevant experience in Business Intelligence, Data Engineering, or a similar role, preferably spent in SaaS companies with large databases. You‚Äôll need to have enough experience to setup systems and processes independently
You‚Äôre a great communicator. Spectora has a strong culture built on connection, optimism, hard work, and loving what we do. To be effective in your role, you‚Äôll need to value similar things and influence through excellent communication
You have a strong sense of pride and ownership in your work. We do, and so do our inspectors

We encourage you to apply even if you don‚Äôt meet every bullet point. We are people, not checklists, and we hire as such!

Pay & Benefits
Job Type: Full-Time
OTE: $85,000-110,000 per year (US Only)
Total Rewards:
Insurance: Medical, dental, and vision, employer paid life insurance, employer paid short & long term disability
Paid Time Off: Unlimited vacation and sick time, plus paid parental leave
Retirement: 401k and matching
Remote work: employees receive a home office reimbursement 

How to Apply:
Want to go the extra mile or make your resume stand out? Email jobs@spectora.com with your CV and a personalized note or video on why you'd be a great fit. Show us who you really are. We want to get to know YOU!

Spectora strives to create an inclusive environment where everyone is set up for success and looks forward to coming into work everyday. As an equal opportunity employer, we prohibit discrimination in our hiring process and strongly encourage women, people of color, LGBTQ+ individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, and veterans to apply.

title: Database Administrator/Architect (TS/SCI required)
description:
About the job
Job Description:

Type of Requisition:

Regular

Top Secret SCI + Polygraph

Suitability:

None

Data Science

Database Management Systems (DBMS), Microsoft SQL Server, Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS)

10 + years of related experience

Yes

Job Description:

Database Administrator/Architect ‚Äì TS/SCI required

Fort Meade, MD

Transform technology into opportunity as a Database Administrator/Architect with GDIT. A career in enterprise IT means connecting and enhancing the systems that matter most. At GDIT you‚Äôll be at the forefront of innovation and play a meaningful part in improving how agencies operate.

At GDIT, people are our differentiator. As a Database Administrator/Architect you will help ensure today is safe and tomorrow is smarter. Our work depends on Database Administrator/Architect joining our team to support the US Army Intelligence and Security Command (INSCOM).

HOW A DATABASE ADMINISTRATOR/ARCHITECT WILL MAKE AN IMPACT

Data architects focus on how information moves across the system from one application to another.
Demonstrated expertise in requirements engineering, software architecture, software testing, and software deployment including understanding how the software interacts with the technical architecture.
Data architects allow a company to easily publish and share their data with others in the industry, data architects design database systems.
By creating the system according to industry standards, they also help a business accurately report information to the necessary bureaus.
Additionally, they design with growth in mind, allowing for future modifications to the database as the company develops.
Participates in the design, creation, and maintenance of computerized databases.
Responsible for the quality control and auditing of databases to ensure accurate and appropriate use of data.
Works with management to develop database strategies to support organization requirements. Consults with and advises users on access to various databases.
Works directly with users to resolve data conflicts and inappropriate data usage. Directs the maintenance and use of the corporate data dictionary.
Performs MS SQL Server and other DBMS database and application server administration.
Administers, maintains, develops and implements policies and procedures for ensuring the security, availability and integrity of the Database Management System (DBMS).
Creates and updates SSPs, CKLs and other documentation for the accreditation of the DBMS on classified networks.
Completes performance analysis, tuning, and index maintenance. Adjusts advanced settings of Microsoft SQL Server and other DBMS to optimize functionality.
Builds new Microsoft SQL Server Instances within on-premise architecture collaborating with other teams (Storage, Domain, Systems) to implement industry best practices.
Automates routine administration tasks and updates continuity documents.
Implements and manages High Availability and Disaster Recovery features for MS SQL Server.
Performs database and software life-cycle activities to ensure highest level of system performance, availability and compliance with organization requirements.
Verifies and develops database backup, storage, and replication schemes across the enterprise meeting the organization‚Äôs recovery time objective and point time objective.

WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL NEED TO SUCCEED - REQUIRED:

Clearance Level: TS/SCI
Certification:
DoD 8570.01-M IAT Level II/8140 Computing Environment (CE) Certification as determined by the Program Manager is required prior to support on contract
Education: BS Degree with 12 years of experience or MS Degree with 10 years of experience
Preferred Skillset:
Coordinate database architecture changes with Database Engineer (DBE)s. Direct the installation of database management systems, databases, tables and views. Direct the administration and use of current and emerging database tools, strategies and technologies
Create database structures and interfaces to meet customers‚Äô requirements; develop, administers, maintains, and implements policies and procedures for ensuring the security and integrity of the database and performs database and software life-cycle activities to ensure highest level of system performance and availability and compliance with business requirements
Experience installing, configuring, securing, updating, and maintaining SQL Server Enterprise 2022 database software.
Experience using SQL Server Management Studio
Experience implementing SQL Server Backup, Integrity check, and Index Optimizers such as those from ola.hallengren.com
Ability to evaluate and resolve Security Technical Implementation Guides (STIGs), document findings, plan mitigations, and
resolve to completion.
Ability to address security vulnerabilities discovered in weekly Assured Compliance Assessment Solution (ACAS) scans.
 Location: On Customer Site in Ft. Meade, MD
Additional:
Candidates must be willing and able to attain a CI Polygraph for certain positions as determined by the contract
Position may require lifting of objects (i.e. IT Hardware), reaching/bending/kneeling (i.e. plug in cables) and other moderately strenuous activity
Travel may be required to support the mission
WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL NEED TO SUCCEED - DESIRED:

Certification:
Desired Computing Environment Certification for Candidates to be considered:
SQL Server Management Studio
SQL Server Enterprise 2022
GDIT IS YOUR PLACE:

401K with company match
Comprehensive health and wellness packages
Internal mobility team dedicated to helping you own your career
Professional growth opportunities including paid education and certifications
Cutting-edge technology you can learn from
Rest and recharge with paid vacation and holidays

title: Data Analyst
description:
About the job
GSA Management Inc (InSite Property Group) is a leading institutional developer and owner of real estate self-storage assets nationwide. We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our Asset Management team.

Objective: 
The Data Analyst will develop advanced analytics to enhance our understanding of asset and market performance across our portfolio and target markets. 

Responsibilities:
Evaluate and gather data on markets, social trends, economic factors, and competitors from both external (paid sources, public databases) and internal company sources.
Perform Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) to identify patterns, anomalies, and insights that support strategic decision-making.
Assist in maintaining data pipelines, data warehousing, and extraction.
Formulate and test hypotheses using statistical methods to validate assumptions and inform business strategies.
Develop and update predictive models to forecast market dynamics and asset performance.
Assist in the design, maintenance, and optimization of data pipelines and data warehousing solutions.
Create interactive dashboards and visualizations using tools like Tableau to present insights to executives and stakeholders.
Integrate insights using tools like Tableau for executive and stakeholder reporting.
Enhance data collection methods and processing techniques to improve data accuracy, integrity, and usability.
Work with different teams to make sure your analysis supports business goals and strategy.
Work closely with teams across operations, finance, and revenue management to ensure analytical initiatives align with business objectives.

Other Functions: 
Must be able to work extended hours and weekends as needed
Other duties as assigned

Skills and Experience:
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, or a related field. A master‚Äôs degree is a plus.
Proficiency in Python, SQL, Pandas and other relevant machine learning libraries.
Experience with business intelligence tools such as Tableau.
Experience in geospatial analysis ArcGIS is a plus. 
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Minimum 3 years of experience working with data in a professional setting.

Physical Requirements:
Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer
¬∑ Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times

Salary Range:
$90,000 - $130,000 per year

title: Data Governance Analyst
description:
About the job
Our client is a leader in the healthcare industry and is looking to add another analyst to their data governance team. This individual will work closely with their data engineering teams to better understand the various nuances of healthcare data. We are looking for a professional, local to California, with high-level data governance experience and a strong personality that can help navigate approaching business conversations.

Your Work

In this role, you will:
Take ownership, plan and lead subject area information modeling to support Enterprise Information Model. Create and maintain Conceptual and Logical/Canonical models with attribution.
Lead facilitation sessions with business Subject Matter Experts for clarity of definitions in the business taxonomy. Provide input into Business Term definitions in partnership with data stewards and subject matter experts.
Maintain, grow, and modify as needed an enterprise-wide data governance framework, with a focus on improvement of data quality and trust through modifications to organization behavior, policies and standards, governance metrics, processes, and related tools
Use models and business taxonomy to promote data literacy to benefit stakeholders across IT developers, analytics creators and business consumers.
Create and maintain data governance policies, playbook(s), processes, and procedures for guiding various data management processes, including the adoption of data security and privacy, data quality practices, and data dissemination activities
Responsible for defining data quality checks and data reconciliation rules in partnership with technical data asset owners and data engineers to ensure data integrity is maintained during transit and at rest
Engage with stakeholders across the organization to identify data quality needs, draft requirements, assist in the development of data quality checks, track, monitor, and report of the overall health of data in the organization
Perform impact analysis of regulatory, business, corrective action plans, and system changes on the Enterprise Data Governance program, respective data domains, and relevant data governance policies and procedures within the context of enterprise data
Assist with preparation of material for regular core team and key governance forums (e.g., Enterprise Data Governance Steering Committee, Data Steward Council) to review progress and initiatives with key constituents.

Your Knowledge and Experience
Requires a bachelor's degree or equivalent experience and 7+ years of prior relevant experience
Experience with data governance, master data management, and data quality processes and procedures and writing policies and 5+ years in business analysis or data analysis
Ability to understand internal and external drivers for changes to data governance policies
Possesses advanced knowledge and experience large-scale data architecture, master data management, data quality and data reconciliation efforts and similar projects or programs of significant complexity
Proficient on querying and extracting data from repositories such as Netezza, Oracle, SQL Server, etc
Ability to communicate and articulate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner
Proven collaborator with strong interpersonal skills, works collaboratively within the team and outside the team
Excellent presentation, written, and verbal communication skills which bring clarity and precision at all levels within the organization
Excellent problem-solving and critical-thinking skills to recognize and comprehend complex issues, policies, regulatory requirements, and industry information affecting the business environment
Experience in healthcare is a plus

title: Project Manager Bilingual Chinese or Spanish
description:
About the job
Company Description
Founded in 2014, HXE has firmly established itself in the MICE industry with a fundamental mission‚Äîto connect customers and providers with precision and efficiency through innovative technology. Annually, more than 50,000 reservations are managed through HXE, with an estimated budget exceeding $1.9 billion USD. HXE has received two rounds of investment from IDG and DCM. With a presence in over 300 cities and partnerships with leading hotel brands like Marriott, Hilton, and IHG, we ensure our clients experience precision, efficiency, and innovation in every event. We are expanding our operations in the U.S. and seeking an experienced Event/Conference Planner to join our team in Las Vegas.
Role Overview:
We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Project Manager to join our team in Las Vegas, NV. In this full-time, on-site role, you will be responsible for managing projects from conception to completion, ensuring seamless coordination between clients, vendors, and internal teams. You will play a pivotal role in executing business strategies, overseeing event and product development projects, and ensuring successful delivery.
Key Responsibilities:
Lead and manage projects from planning through execution, ensuring they are completed on time and within scope.
Develop detailed project plans, including timelines, milestones, and deliverables, while managing project resources effectively.
Serve as the primary liaison between clients, vendors, partners, and internal teams, facilitating communication and managing expectations.
Track project progress, provide status updates, and ensure all project documentation is maintained in internal project management systems.
Coordinate and book event meeting and conference spaces, overseeing all logistics and registration processes.
Negotiate and manage contracts with vendors and venues, ensuring favorable terms and accuracy.
Analyze and synthesize feedback from stakeholders to identify common pain points and trends, translating these into actionable insights.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including the development team, to ensure alignment and successful execution of project goals.
Monitor industry trends and competitor activities to stay ahead of market demands and opportunities for innovation in our SaaS products.
Address and resolve project issues promptly, maintaining a high level of customer service and satisfaction.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Hospitality Management, Event Management, Communications, Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field is preferred.
Strong analytical and strategic thinking skills with an ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and project management tools.
Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work independently and take ownership of projects.
Preferred Qualifications:
Bilingual in Mandarin-English or Spanish-English.
Experience in the hospitality, event planning, travel, or expo industry is preferred.
Proven experience in project management, with a track record of successfully managing complex projects.
What We Offer:
Competitive salary and benefits package.
An opportunity to work with a global team in a fast-growing company in the U.S.
Career growth and professional development in the MICE and SaaS industries.
For highly qualified candidates, we offer H1B Visa sponsorship as part of our commitment to attracting top talent from around the world.

title: Proposal Manager
description:
About the job
Who We Are
Aditi is a leading consultancy that connects talent, teams, and technology solutions to help our clients accelerate their digital journey. We create unique experiences that rely on borderless talent, technology, and customized solutions under your direction or ours.
Visit us at www.aditiconsulitng.com to learn more.
Who You Are
The Proposal Manager will be responsible for managing the end-to-end proposal development process for technology consulting services bids. This role requires a strategic thinker with excellent project management skills, attention to detail, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. The Proposal Manager will ensure that all proposals are compliant, compelling, and tailored to meet the specific needs of our clients.

The Work
Lead the proposal development process from initial RFP/RFI analysis to final submission.
Create RFP outlines, including page allocation, based on weight of evaluation criteria.
Collaborate with sales, technical, delivery, financial and subject matter experts to gather necessary information and develop proposal content. Ensure win strategy, compliance, and customer understanding are in the final proposal documents.
Develop and maintain proposal templates and reusable content, ensuring consistency and compliance with company standards.
Write, edit, and format proposal content to create clear, concise, and persuasive documents. Interface with Solution Directors, Account Leads, and Solution Architects to ensure consistency, concurrency, and accuracy of messages throughout the proposal.
Manage proposal schedules, deadlines, and deliverables to ensure timely submission.
Conduct quality reviews of proposals to ensure accuracy, completeness, and alignment with client requirements.
Coordinate and facilitate proposal review meetings and debriefs.
Maintain a repository of proposal content and best practices for future use.
Stay updated on industry trends and competitive landscape to enhance proposal strategies.

Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Communications, or a related field.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in proposal management or technical writing, preferably in the technology consulting industry.
Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple proposals simultaneously.
Experience leading proposals valued at more than $5 million for a single award
Excellent writing, editing, and proofreading skills.
Experience with video, graphics and data visualization content.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and proposal management software.
Strong analytical and research skills.
Ability to work independently and as a team leader.
Exceptional attention to detail and organizational skills.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills.

Preferred Qualifications:
APMP certification or equivalent.
Knowledge of common technology consulting services and solutions.

What's in it for you?
You will be part of a diverse, vibrant, global Aditi community; teams pushing the boundaries of new business capabilities and emerging technologies and services, sharing their experiences and lessons learned with each other. You'll have the chance to thrive in an environment where your ideas are valued and your voice matters.
At Aditi, you will be able to work on meaningful and innovative projects, powered by the latest technologies and industry best practices. We will continually invest in your learning and growth. You'll be immersed in the design and implementation of human-centric solutions to help solve complex challenges with some of the world's largest companies.
Alongside our suite of traditional benefits including health coverage, disability insurance, paid family leave, we've extended our benefits and perks to meet our employees evolving needs:
Unlimited earning potential, including a competitive base salary and uncapped commission structure.
Employee-first mentality that supports a remote and hybrid workforce and empowers daily flexibility.
Open Paid Time Off
Summer Flex Leave
Paid Volunteer Days
Annual Wellness Stipend
Aditi Academy ‚Äì Curated Learning & Development programs to help our staff level up, including digital on-demand and live courses, mentorship, and skill development paths.
Annual Incentive Trip for top performers across the company, and additional quarterly rewards and recognition programs.

Are you ready to join us?
Aditi is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Production Planner
description:

At Quick Quack Car Wash, where we're not just washing cars, we're changing the way people think about car washes! Our team is dedicated to delivering exceptional service with lightning-fast efficiency and top-notch quality. As part of our team, you'll join a dynamic environment where every day brings new challenges and opportunities for growth. Job Title: Production Planner/Scheduler
Quick Quack Car Wash is seeking a self-motivated and eager individual to work in a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment. They will act as a liaison between supply chain and manufacturing operations to coordinate and communicate order requirements through the required processes. title: Data Scientist Innovation Engineer 16660
description:

Job Title: Data Scientist Innovation Engineer 16660
 Location: Juno Beach, FL / Relocation Package (Negotiable)

Employees in this role have responsibility for interpreting, organizing, executing, and coordinating assignments. title: Postdoc Positions on Reinforcement Learning for Turbulence
description:
About the job
Multiple Postdoctoral Fellow Positions Available Immediately

Discovery of Reduced Models of Transition Dynamics
in Turbulence by Reinforcement Learning

The research groups of Fabrizio Bisetti (U Texas at Austin), Mirko Gamba (U Michigan Ann Arbor), Prof. Petros Koumoutsakos (Harvard U), and Charles Meneveau & Greg Eyink (Johns Hopkins U) have multiple postdoctoral fellow positions available as part of a project sponsored by DARPA‚Äôs Automated Prediction Aided by Quantized Simulators (APAQuS) program. The project‚Äôs objective is to demonstrate a novel approach that discovers stochastic sub-grid scale models for large-eddy simulation of meta-stable state transitions in a classical-fluid turbulent flow, using a newly proposed scientific multi-agent reinforcement learning framework. The project combines machine learning, large-eddy simulation, and table-top experiments.

The postdoctoral fellow positions are available starting immediately. The appointments are yearly and renewable based on performance and availability of funding. The salary depends on the sponsoring institution and the applicant‚Äôs qualifications and experience. Applicants who are legally permitted to work in the United States at the time of their application will have a strengthened application.

Positions are available in the following areas:

Dynamic programming and reinforcement learning for fluid mechanics
Modeling and simulation of isothermal turbulence with large-eddy simulation
Closures and models for large-eddy simulation
Numerical methods for Computational Fluid Dynamics
Experiments in isothermal turbulence and laser-based diagnostics
Theory and application of statistical mechanics of systems far from equilibrium

In addition to carrying out research towards the project‚Äôs objectives, the postdoctoral fellow will be assisting with graduate student supervision and reporting activities.

The project is fast paced and highly collaborative, offering exceptional professional growth opportunities and featuring the option for stays at partnering institutions to carry out joint research.

Interested candidates should contact PIs at their institutional email addresses for more information. Applications should include CV, two sample publications or manuscripts, and a brief cover letter with career and research highlights. Include the keyword [DARPA APAQuS] in the subject line.

A PDF of this announcement is available at https://sites.utexas.edu/flow/files/2024/09/2024.09.03.Postdoc_APAQuS.pdf

title: Senior Threat Analyst
description:
About the job
Our client, a large government systems integrator located in Fort Huachuca, AZ, is looking to hire a Top Secret cleared Senior Threat Analyst to work onsite in a 12-month contract. The senior analyst will be responsible for supporting the defense of Army networks. The consultant will be designing, implementing, and administering network security for UNIX, Windows, Cisco, and Juniper technologies.

This role performs assessments of systems and networks within the network environment or enclave and identifies where those systems/networks deviate from acceptable configurations, enclave policy, or local policy. This role also measures effectiveness of defense-in-depth architecture against known vulnerabilities. The consultant will be performing technical (evaluation of technology) and nontechnical (evaluation of people and operations) risk and vulnerability assessments of relevant technology focus areas (e.g., local computing environment, network and infrastructure, enclave boundary, supporting infrastructure, and applications).

The consultant will be responsible for analyzing the organization‚Äôs cyber defense policies and configurations and evaluating compliance with regulations and organizational directives. The consultant will be maintaining a deployable cyber defense audit toolkit (e.g., specialized cyber defense software and hardware) to support cyber defense audit missions.

Required Skills

MA/MS OR- BA/BS in Information Technology, Cybersecurity, Data Science, Information Systems, or Computer Science 
10+ years experience in similar roles 
Must have active Top Secret clearance 
Proven experience and ability to leverage CND analysis toolsets to detect and respond to IT security incidents. 
Must maintain knowledge of applicable cyber defense policies, regulations, and compliance documents specifically related to cyber defense auditing. 
Experience preparing audit reports that identify technical and procedural findings and provide recommended remediation strategies/solutions. 
Experience designing, implementing, and administering network security for UNIX, Windows, Cisco, and Juniper technologies 
Experience performing TCP-IP protocol implementation across designated Army networks 
Ability to lead security event monitoring, to include proactive and iterative log and packet analysis and anomaly detection 
Must meet DoD 8140 DCWF 541 requirements (B.S., CISA, CISM, GCIH, or GSNA) 
The following certifications:
GCFA: GIAC Certified Forensic Analyst 
An IAT II certification (CCNA-Security, CND, CySA+, GICSP, GSEC, Security+ CE, or SSCP) is required 
Knowledge of network security architecture concepts including topology, protocols, components, and principles (e.g., application of defense-in-depth). 
Knowledge of how traffic flows across the network (e.g., Transmission Control Protocol [TCP] and Internet Protocol [IP], Open System Interconnection Model [OSI], Information Technology Infrastructure Library, current version [ITIL]). 
Knowledge of application vulnerabilities. 
Knowledge of system and application security threats and vulnerabilities (e.g., buffer overflow, mobile code, cross-site scripting, Procedural Language/Structured Query Language [PL/SQL] and injections, race conditions, covert channel, replay, return-oriented attacks, malicious code). 
Knowledge of what constitutes a network attack and a network attack‚Äôs relationship to both threats and vulnerabilities. 
Knowledge of penetration testing principles, tools, and techniques 
Desired Skills 

First-hand knowledge of the mission and operational requirements of the U.S. Army. 
A demonstrated understanding of U.S. Army IT operational and technical requirements, and an advanced understanding of U.S. Army IT applications and network systems. 
One or more of the following certifications:
CCE: Rocheston Certified Cybersecurity Engineer 
CFR: CyberSec First Responder 
CySA+: CompTIA Cybersecurity Analyst plus 
GCFA: GIAC Certified Forensic Analyst 
GCFE: GIAC Certified Forensic Examiner 
PenTest+: CompTIA Penetration Tester plus 
ITIL v3 Foundations (or higher) certification, or able to achieve this certification w/in 90 days of contract start or hire date

title: Tenure-Track Professor, Disability Health & Quality of Life (Assistant, Associate, or Full)
description:
About the job
The Department of Community and Population Health, College of Health, (COH) invites applications for a tenure-track Assistant, Associate, or Full Professor with a specialization in impacting the health and quality of life of persons with disabilities, with an anticipated start date of July 2025.

Candidates must have an earned doctorate in a field related to health, disabilities, technology and/or data science by the date of employment. Candidates should have a research focus in one of the following areas: Community Living and Participation, Health and Functioning, Employment, Technology for Access and Function, Disability Statistics and Demographics Research, and Disability Regulations and Policy Research. The ideal candidate would be working at the intersection of disability and one or more of the above mentioned emphasis areas. This search is part of a planned multi-year cluster hire at Lehigh University to meet our strategic emphasis on positively impacting health, quality of life, and employment for people with disabilities.

The individual hired will be expected to teach introductory courses in community and population health, or in biostatistics and data science, as well as upper-level courses in their area of expertise at the undergraduate and graduate level; engage in scholarly activities; and participate in departmental, college, and university service. This includes mentoring students at the undergraduate and graduate levels, mentoring junior faculty members, assisting with curriculum design, and contributing to the growth of the College of Health. The appointed faculty member will have the opportunity for interdisciplinary collaboration with colleagues throughout Lehigh University, including faculty creating assistive technologies and with Lehigh University partners, such as Good Shepherd Rehabilitation.

The Department of Community and Population Health at Lehigh University is committed to fostering positive change in the communities where we live and work by promoting health equity. The mission of the COH, the newest of five colleges at Lehigh University, is to understand, preserve, and improve the health and well-being of domestic and global populations and communities with community-focused and data-driven research and education in three primary areas: population health, community health, and health innovation and technology. Our strategic plan identifies as a goal, improving health outcomes for marginalized communities in the Lehigh Valley. The COH is collaborating with the Colleges of Education and Engineering to build a research team of scholars with expertise in promoting disability independence from multiple disciplinary angles.

Review of applications will begin on October 7 and will continue until the position is filled. Applicants should submit their materials at academicjobsonline.org/ajo/jobs/28385. Candidates should submit the following materials:
Cover letter
Curriculum vitae
Research statement that describes past scholarly contributions and future research directions
Teaching statement that describes instructional philosophy and courses that the candidate would want to teach or develop
A statement on contributions to diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) that describes knowledge, prior DEI experience, and the candidate‚Äôs future plans for enhancing community and culture at Lehigh 
Three letters of recommendation

Any inquiries regarding this search should be directed to Prof. Vinod Namboodiri, Chair of the search committee, at incoh@lehigh.edu.

title: Scientist / Senior Scientist, In Vivo Cancer Biology
description:
About the job
Scientist / Senior Scientist, In Vivo Cancer Biology
Full-time position
Competitive compensation (Salary, Benefits & Options)
180 Varick Street, New York, and 430 E 29th Street, New York

Waypoint Bio is a venture-backed biotech startup building the next generation of cell therapies for solid tumors and autoimmune diseases. Traditional cell therapy development faces a trade-off between in vitro approaches that are fast but inaccurate, and in vivo approaches that are accurate but slow and expensive. Using our proprietary platform combining spatial biology, pooled screening, in silico protein engineering, and machine learning, we can obtain both depth and breadth when screening cell therapy candidates ‚Äì speed without compromising on in vivo accuracy. Our team is highly collaborative, interdisciplinary, and shares the mission of developing novel immune cell therapies to benefit patients' lives.


Position Summary:
We are seeking a highly-motivated, creative scientist who thrives in a fast-paced and collaborative environment. The ideal candidate will have extensive expertise designing and using cutting-edge in vivo mouse models to test the efficacy & safety of cancer immunotherapies. They will also have deep technical knowledge of the immune system, the tumor microenvironment, and the design of novel immunotherapies. In this position, you will design and implement in vivo assays to assess the anti-tumor activity of CAR-T cells, develop novel immunocompetent and xenograft in vivo cancer models, and apply Waypoint‚Äôs multiplexed imaging platform to perform pooled in vivo screens of cell therapies. You will work collaboratively with computational and wet-lab scientists on every step of the pre-clinical therapeutic development process, from the initial design and screening of cell therapy constructs, subsequent ranking & filtering, and further optimization to obtain finalized therapeutic candidates. 



Duties and Responsibilities
Develop novel, clinically-relevant mouse models of solid tumors, including both xenograft and immunocompetent models.
Compare existing CDX, PDX & immunocompetent mouse models to identify those that best mimic human disease.
Perform all steps of in vivo mouse studies to assess CAR T efficacy and safety (including injections and surgeries for tumor implantation, tumor growth measurements, and harvesting organs for subsequent ex vivo analysis)
Perform in vivo mouse studies with Waypoint‚Äôs high throughput CAR-T screening platform.
Learn how to apply Waypoint‚Äôs proprietary multiplexed imaging & pooled screening technologies to mouse tissues.
Actively engage in prioritizing key milestones and developing appropriate timelines.
Provide conceptual input on in vivo experimental design and interpretation in a team setting.
Keep detailed scientific records in an electronic lab notebook and actively contribute towards the organization of the lab.


Required Qualifications
Ph.D. in Immunology, Cancer Biology, Molecular Biology, Cell Biology, Genetics, or a related field. Alternatively, Bachelor‚Äôs degree or Master‚Äôs degree with 6 years or 4 years of relevant experience, respectively.
4+ years of academic or industry experience working on mouse models of solid tumors.
Expertise in evaluating cancer therapies in mouse models, especially cell therapies (e.g. CAR-T, CAR-NK, TCR-T) or antibody therapies.
Technical expertise in mouse injection methods (IV, SubQ, IP), subcutaneous tumor implantation and measurements, organ harvesting, animal phenotyping, and adherence to IACUC protocols.
Knowledge of the interplay between the immune system and the tumor microenvironment.
An excellent scientific track record with published papers or recent experience in the fields of cancer biology or immunotherapy.
Superb organizational abilities and precise scientific record keeping in electronic lab notebooks.


Preferred Qualifications
Hands-on experience with both orthotopic and subcutaneous cancer models.
Experience or knowledge of in vitro cancer models (e.g. engineered cell lines, co-culture systems, or cancer organoids).Ability to culture and genetically engineer primary immune cells in vitro.Experience with Regulatory T cells and in vivo studies of autoimmune or inflammatory indications.Experience with multiplexed imaging technologies, confocal microscopy, or immunohistochemistry.


Send CV and cover letter to apply:
jobs@waypointbio.com

Experience with configuration, troubleshooting, and installation of Motorola P2P and Rajant Radios (2.4Ghz & 5Ghz variants)
Cisco Networking Fundamentals Certification (CCNA)
Experience working as a Cross-Functional Team Member
Experience in reviewing and conducting data analysis on deployed/fielded Major End Items (MEI) and developing solutions for field implementation
Experience in reviewing/redlining Network Data Packages (NDP)

Salary Range: $104,900 - $157,300

The above salary range represents a general guideline; however, Northrop Grumman considers a number of factors when determining base salary offers such as the scope and responsibilities of the position and the candidate's experience, education, skills and current market conditions.

Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.

The application period for the job is estimated to be 20 days from the job posting date. However, this timeline may be shortened or extended depending on business needs and the availability of qualified candidates.

Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. title: Quality Engineer
description:

title: Business Continuity Specialist
description:
About the job
Business Continuity Specialist ‚Äì BC Testing and MVO SME
Contract - Hybrid (3 days onsite in NYC)
$30-40hr w2

Summary Description
Member of the BCM team to support the Global BC program, reporting to the Americas Head of BC.

Business Impact Analysis (‚ÄúBIA‚Äù)
Desired Skill set ‚Äì
Adequate knowledge and experience in implementing business impact analysis (BIA) including understanding of terminologies and methodology.
Initiate review, update and harmonization of the BIA, opportunity to work with BC Team members across the regions
Maintain recovery requirements and business impacts of a business disruption
Offer feedback and recommendations on challenges to the effective implementation of the BIA

Minimum viable operations (MVO) 
Desired Skill set ‚Äì
Adequate knowledge on the concepts of minimum viable operation and preferably adequate understanding of investment banking products and services.
Support this global initiative/program and provide recommendations on how to tie the initiative back to the Global BC program. There will be overlap opportunities with implementing operational resilience related regulations in the U.S. or internationally.
Periodic review, testing and update of the MVO procedures with the business.

Business Continuity (BC)
Desired Skill set ‚Äì
Use of Fusion Software for planning, continued maturity and enrichment of contents and input
Assist in coordinating the annual BCP review or when there is any material change and QA the process prior to BU sign-off.
Assist in the management of all aspects of the BC program, including monitoring of BC key indicators, management of recovery technologies such as Cap Markets BC machines, and other remote technologies

Testing of Business Continuity program
Desired Skill set ‚Äì
Assist in administering BC testing in compliance with internal policies and regulatory requirements and documenting the results and correcting gaps.
Ability to effectively plan, coordinate and administer/implement different type of business continuity testing (e.g., tabletop, simulated or capability testing) that efficiently make use of the BU participants‚Äô time and are relevant to improve the firm‚Äôs business continuity and resilience posture.
Ability to make justifiable recommendations to improve business continuity testing regimen for the firm with the vision to improve resilience during an actual disruption.
Ability to incorporate other aspects of recovery such as risks on technology, third party services etc, in testing to validate effectiveness of business continuity strategies and arrangements.

Incident Monitoring and Travel Risk
Desired Skill set ‚Äì
Support in monitoring news & alerts for incidents that may affect our client's offices and travellers and escalate the issue as necessary
Has adequate experience in using tools for mass notification, risk intelligence and traveller tracking.
On-call and available (24x7) during ongoing incidents that could significantly disrupt business operations, and coordinate in real time with members of the BC Team and impacted business units.

Familiar with Global BC regulation requirements
Review the global database in Fusion to ensure the Firm remains within compliance

Ensure that Business Continuity Plans in the region incorporate any changes to the business operations and recovery requirements

As required 
Business continuity
Understanding and awareness of regulatory requirements, best practices, internal policies and procedures
Operational Resilience 
Awareness/familiarity in the upcoming CFTC Operational Resilience Framework and other U.S. regulations.
Experience in supporting the implementation of other resilience framework such as BS65000, FCA (UK) ORF and BaFIN DORA etc.
Education and Awareness 
Support the AVP, BC Specialist in coordinating testing, education and awareness and increasing firm wide BC awareness
Incident & Crisis Management 
Participation of business impacting events, Communications, 24/7 availability
Call Notifications Tests
Assist in administering the semi-annual emergency notification system testing
Audits
Assist in responding to audit queries, both from a BC perspective and coordinating responses from individual BUs
Facilities 
Back up to the AVP, BC Specialist in preparing quarterly UPS/Gen Set Report for updating.
Availability
Being contactable 24/7 globally on point to manage unexpected business impacting events
Monitoring of environmental impacts across the globe and multiple potential impacts on our static assets.

Assists the AVP, BC Specialist in data analysis and preparing reports particularly on testing and training as well as review of BC-related documentation. Perform other administrative duties and assist with special projects as assigned.

title: Campus Leader
description:
About the job
1 year or more of work experience in Micro-Mobility a plus.

CA Driver's license with clean driving record
1 year of Micro Mobility Experience a plus

Primary Responsibility:

Operational Management

title: Program Manager
description:
About the job
(ID: 2024-6372)

Axle is a bioscience and information technology company that offers advancements in translational research, biomedical informatics, and data science applications to research centers and healthcare organizations around the globe. With experts in biomedical science, software engineering, and program management, we focus on developing and applying research tools and techniques to empower decision-making and accelerate research discoveries. We work with premier research organizations and facilities including multiple institutes at the National Institutes of Health (NIH) and other public and private organizations. 


 
Benefits We Offer:


100% Medical, Dental & Vision Coverage for Employees

Educational Benefits for Career Growth

Paid Time Off (Including Holidays)

Employee Referral Bonus

401K Matching

Flexible Spending Accounts:

Healthcare (FSA)

Parking Reimbursement Account (PRK)

Dependent Care Assistant Program (DCAP)

Transportation Reimbursement Account (TRN)






 
The Program Manager is responsible for the performance of the work in support of our contract at the NIH. The PM is responsible for the overall management of contractor personnel and all contractual issues and is the primary interface between the Government and the contractor team. The PM has full authority to act for the contractor team on all contract matters relating to daily operation of the contract. The PM is responsible for the overall management of contractor employees and all contractual issues. PM have ongoing knowledge of daily activities within each work section. The PM establishes workload requirements to align employees to fulfill the task assignments. 

 
Responsibilities:


The Program Manager will be responsible for ensuring the Task Order team completes their work on time and within budget, as well as guiding the teams as needed.

Serves as the task order level manager authorized to interface with the Government Contracting Officer (CO), the task order level Contracting Officer Representative (COR), government management personnel, and customer agency representatives. Provide overall direction and guidance for all aspects of the program.

Serves as liaison with customer to establish relationships for Business Development growth.

Ensures that Contractor tasks are completed within the deadlines, tasking guidance from the Government is clear and unambiguous, contract personnel are qualified to perform the tasks, and potential personnel problems are pre-empted.

Responsible for contract management and financial reporting, and for ensuring problem resolution and user satisfaction.

Ensure conformance with NIH policies and procedures

Responsible for formulating and enforcing work standards, assigning contractor schedules, reviewing work discrepancies, supervising contractor personnel, and communicating policies, purposes, and goals of the organization to subordinates.

Manage and coordinate contractor staff to fulfill the objectives defined in the Statement of Work through all phases of the project.

Shall be responsible for the overall contract performance.

Responsible for identifying any potential program risks and for identifying them to the Government as soon as they are recognized.


 
Qualifications:


Education: Bachelor‚Äôs Degree

Years of Experience: 10 years of relevant experience in managing programs and teams

Demonstrated ability to manage a portfolio of projects

Experience in identifying and mitigating program risks

Able to manage staff and program cost, schedule, and performance

Well versed with Government contract mechanisms. Thorough working knowledge of the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR), and other supplements.

Proven ability to interpret and negotiate large Government solicitation and contracts.


 
Additional Qualifications:


Contract management of program from cradle to grave. Substantial knowledge of federal and other customer contracting regulations, policies, and practices with requisite skills to provide accurate interpretation and implementation advice to leadership and staff.

Expertise in the management and control of funds and resources using complex reporting mechanisms

Demonstrated capability in managing multi-task contracts and/or subcontracts of various types and complexity

Proven track record of developing a Business Development Pipeline

Sales history mixed with Project Management skills preferred

Proven skill with Customer Relationship Management and growing an existing account

Work with the Business Development team on acquiring new Task Orders

Will assist with creating Technical and Business Proposals as well



Proven experience with growing a business and growing a customer base

Responsible for ensuring Deliverables are done correctly and delivered on time

Work with Leadership to identify new avenues to grow with NIH

Work with Subcontractors to ensure their team members maintain business standards

Interview and onboard potential new hires. Maintain high employee retention

Lead quarterly reviews on progress for Leadership

Prepare PowerPoint decks for Contract/Task Order Kick-Offs as needed.

Experience managing programs and large task orders with the federal government required ‚Äì experience with the NIH a plus





The diversity of Axle‚Äôs employees is a tremendous asset. We are firmly committed to providing equal opportunity in all aspects of employment and will not tolerate any illegal discrimination or harassment-based age, race, gender, religion, national origin, disability, marital status, covered veteran status, sexual orientation, status with respect to public assistance, and other characteristics protected under state, federal, or local law and to deter those who aid, abet, or induce discrimination or coerce others to discriminate.

Accessibility: If you need an accommodation as part of the employment process, please contact careers@axleinfo.com

Disclaimer:The above is meant to illustrate the general nature of work and level of effort being performed by individual‚Äôs assigned to this position or job. This is not restricted as a complete list of all skills, responsibilities, duties, and/or assignments required. Individuals may be required to perform duties outside of their position, job or responsibilities as needed.

title: Plant Controller
description:
About the job
Primary Objective
As the primary finance and accounting leader at the site, this role involves providing analysis, management reporting, planning, and accounting support to our growing global business. The ability to work independently is crucial. Prepare balance sheets and profit and loss statements, and other financial reports. Complete balance sheet reconciliations. Responsibilities also include budgeting and forecasting, financial month end close process, monthly results commentary, creating and preparing financial analysis, product costing analysis, track and communicate capital expenditure projects, excess and obsolete inventory review, ad hoc reporting, and assisting site departments and other site controllers. Special projects as assigned by the Division and VP of Finance. 

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Complete and process monthly journal entries 
Balance sheet reconciliations 
Weekly expense reporting / forecasting 
Financial month end close process 
Monthly forecasting and trend analysis 
Annual budgeting and Rolling Forecast 
Concur administrator for site personnel
Manage out of pocket reimbursements 
Monthly Concur Accrual and Expense postings 
Manage and reconcile monthly intercompany accounting 
Month end cash closing
Other duties include: project management, costing, scrap tracking, capital expenditure tracking, continuous improvement projects, sales and use tax filing, forecasting (weekly and monthly), budget, and external & internal audit support

Qualifications
Bachelor‚Äôs degree (accounting major) with major coursework in business, finance accounting, and at least 5 years accounting/financial analysis experience within a manufacturing company. 
Must be highly computer literate with data mining and ERP systems, have strong communication, interpersonal, organizational, time management and analytical skills. Requires deadline driven, high-energy individual, able to work autonomously and lead as key contributor on teams. 
The individual will be expected to be familiar with standard concepts, practices, and procedures within the accounting and finance field, including cost accounting. 
Rely on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. 
Be able to perform a variety of tasks and work under general supervision. A certain degree of creativity and latitude is required. 
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, problem solving skills, strong interpersonal skills are a must, as well as willingness to accept and task ownership of new responsibilities in a fast growing environment. 
Additional requirements include a working knowledge of MS Excel, Word, and Outlook, and the ability to multi-task with moderate supervision. Experience with Cognos products would be plus, but not required.
