title: Manufacturing Data Acquisition Specialist
description:
About the job
The Innovation and Development Division (IDD) drives the innovation strategy for the Hubs and Operations, and contributes to the Group's transformation. It is responsible for imagining, developing and incubating new solutions until they are brought to market, particularly when it comes to offers with a high technological content (including digital and IT). IDD gathers more than 3,000 employees from 70 nationalities at 60 sites.

The Global Markets & Technologies (GM&T) World Business Unit delivers technological solutions (molecules, equipment and services) to support the new markets of energy transition, maritime logistics and scientific exploration, in order to accelerate Air Liquide sustainable growth. To support the energy transition, GM&T brings environmentally friendly solutions to the clean energy market with hydrogen energy and Bio-Natural Gas for vehicles, refrigerated transport using nitrogen, but also the treatment and injection of Biogas into the energy grid as a local power source.

The Manufacturing Data Acquisition Specialist will report to GM&T Americas Manufacturing Site Director with functional and scope directions taken from D&IT Transformation Director. The mission will be to support the implementation of process improvement initiatives through data solutions and analytics based on Automation/Scada/Historian systems: The Manufacturing Data Specialist is a multi-skilled automation engineer with technical vision and drive, liaison with manufacturing management, operations and engineering stories needs, accepting stories into delivery increments and complete tasks to deliver the work. Candidate serves as the Automation/Historian data processing & analytics champion for the GM&T Americas Manufacturing organization, as well as subject matter expert for HMI and SCADA configurations management.

Responsibilities

Deliver reliable, scalable data management (acquisition, integration, transformation) and analytics based on Automation and PLC‚Äôs systems, for all purposes : Process Compliance, Production Performance, Engineering improvements, etc, ‚Ä¶
Work with Process Engineers and Production teams to bring in well production data, and any field automation into Manufacturing Rockwell SCADA and Historian systems for alarm historization/trending, and display
In coordination with Process Controls teams, manage and execute data system upgrades, configuration of new tags, and building process data visualization screens; lead and execute efforts to upgrade HMI operator interfaces as required to support Process Controls, Automation, MES, and SPC initiatives 
Support shop floor Manufacturing Execution System (MES) implementation


Requirements

Bachelor‚Äôs Engineering or related degree from an ABET accredited institution.
3+ years experience in Data Analytics based on industrial data.
Proficient in Source Data Analysis, profiling, integration, modeling applied to Automation & Historian systems like Rockwell
Must be highly proficient in data extraction from FactoryTalk View SE, Client/Server Distributed Applications
Knowledge of SCADA and Automation controls. Background in working with PLC s and related HMI hardware and their related software (Allen-Bradley, Modicon, GE)
Proficiency with any of the following applications : Oracle, SQL, VB Script, and/or PowerShell associated with the extraction, transformation, and/or loading of data (i.e. query design)
Excellent English communication (oral and written) and interpersonal skills
Excellent analytical capabilities, with ability to collect and correlate information and data
Critical thinking and problem solving skills, demonstrate decisiveness and action
Self-starter and ability to evolve easily, foster collaboration and consistency across multiple teams
Highly efficient written skills (documenting standards, process and procedure guides, runbooks)
US Citizen or Green Card Holder - The candidate must have valid unrestricted employment authorization in the U.S. and must not require any type of visa sponsorship now or in the future.


Preferred

A Plus Rockwell Plant PAx experience
Background in Wonderware, Ifix, Ignition
Knowledge of IT applications, Oracle, Experience with MRP/ERP systems
Knowledge of telemetry/iOT solutions
Experience with Manufacturing or Hard Goods
Power BI
Programming FactoryTalk Batch


Benefits Information

Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, 401(k) match, Flexible Spending Accounts, EAP, Education Assistance, Parental Leave, Paid time off, and Holidays. 
For more information you can go to Air Liquide Benefit Offerings


Our Differences make our Performance

At Air Liquide, we are committed to build a diverse and inclusive workplace that embraces the diversity of our employees, our customers, patients, community stakeholders and cultures across the world.

We welcome and consider applications from all qualified applicants, regardless of their background. We strongly believe a diverse organization opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to innovate by living our fundamentals, acting for our success and creating an engaging environment in a changing world.

title: Senior Manager, Data Science
description:
About the job
Job Title: Senior Manager, Data Science

Location: Remote

About The Company

We are a leading company in the food & beverage industry, focused on delivering exceptional services and solutions to our clients. With a strong commitment to innovation, inclusivity, and professional development, we pride ourselves on fostering a dynamic work environment where individuals can grow both personally and professionally. Our team values collaboration, excellence, and integrity, making it a great place to work for driven and talented individuals.

Job Summary

We are looking for a Senior Manager, Data Science to join our Enterprise Analytics Team. The ideal candidate will be an experienced data scientist with a background in predictive modeling and team leadership. This role involves the development of domain-specific predictive models and coaching a team of data scientists to deliver actionable business insights.

Key Responsibilities

Lead predictive analytics portfolio development: Own the technical development of predictive models in key business areas such as pricing, supply chain, and merchandising.
Collaborate with senior leadership: Work with Sr. Directors and Directors to define business opportunities and ensure the proper application of analytical techniques to achieve objectives.
Implement data science models: Utilize Python, Tableau, and open-source libraries to build and deploy models and visualizations that drive business results.

Drive innovation and industry leadership: Continuously research best practices in analytics and represent the company at industry events.

Experience: At least 4+ years of experience in analytics, management consulting, or corporate settings; experience with SQL/NoSQL, Python, and advanced statistical modeling techniques.
Skills: Strong programming skills, experience with machine learning, Bayesian statistics, and data visualization tools like Tableau.
Certifications: No mandatory certifications but relevant credentials in data science and machine learning are preferred.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience in CPG, Retail, or Foodservice industries.
Experience with Agile Software Development.
Strong communication and strategic thinking skills.

Benefits

Work-Life Balance: Flexible hours, remote work options, and PTO.
Professional Development: Opportunities for training, mentorship, and attending industry events.
Additional Perks: Collaborative team environment, company events, and opportunities to lead industry innovations.

title: Data Analyst
description:
About the job
Spot Pet Insurance is the fastest growing pet insurance company in North America. Our commitment to an exceptional end-to-end customer experience and our data-driven approach have quickly established us as a leading pet insurance provider. We're dedicated to providing pet parents with peace of mind by offering accessible and comprehensive coverage so their furry companions can lead happier, healthier lives. To demonstrate this, we recently joined forces with MrBeast to find homes for 100 homeless pets and committed to giving each of them pet insurance for life! Along the way, we‚Äôve created a company culture that allows our employees to thrive, with perks like daily free meals, a pet-friendly office, and ridiculously fun company events every quarter. Our dedication to fostering a positive and rewarding work environment for our team has even earned us a Great Place to Work certification.

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our dynamic team! The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users. Google Analytics
GCP

Python Programming
R Studio

Nice to haves:
Experience in analytics & visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI

Benefit package

Dental, and visions benefits
Life insurance
Unlimited PTO

401k with Company match
Annual performance-based bonus

title: Data Analyst
description:

title: Data & AI Lead
description:
About the job
Job Description: Data and AI ‚Äì Manager
Location: USA 
Position Summary:
We are seeking a highly experienced AI Lead to spearhead the development, implementation, and management of AI frameworks within our healthcare organization. This role demands a minimum of 12+ years of experience in technology, with a strong emphasis on AI, and data management. Additionally, the candidate must have prior experience in leading an AI Center of Excellence (CoE) and be capable of building a new AI team from the ground up.
The AI Lead will be responsible to build AI solutions that are ethically sound, compliant with regulations, and aligned with our strategic objectives. This role requires a visionary leader who can drive AI innovation while maintaining a strong focus on governance, risk management, and team development.
Key Responsibilities:
AI Strategy and Implementation:
Develop, implement, and manage a comprehensive AI framework that aligns with industry best practices and healthcare regulatory requirements.
Lead the strategic planning and execution of AI policies, ensuring they support the organization‚Äôs business objectives, ethical standards, and regulatory compliance.
Building and Leading AI Team:
Establish and lead AI teams/pods, focused on driving excellence in AI strategy, governance, and deployment across the organization.
Recruit, mentor, and manage a multidisciplinary AI team, building the team from the ground up.
Foster a collaborative and innovative environment within the CoE, promoting best practices in AI development and deployment.
Training and Development:
Design and deliver training programs for the newly formed AI team, ensuring they are well-versed in AI governance, ethical AI practices, and regulatory compliance.
Stakeholder Engagement and Cross-Functional Collaboration:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, legal, compliance, IT, and business units, to ensure alignment on AI governance practices.
Act as a liaison between the AI CoE and other departments, facilitating communication and collaboration on AI projects.
AI Policy Development:
Draft, review, and update policies related to the use, development, and deployment of AI technologies within the organization.
Stay informed of emerging trends and regulatory developments in AI governance and update organizational policies accordingly.
AI Development, Performance Monitoring and Continuous Improvement:
Ensure AI solutions follow desired regulations and are scalable.
Implement systems for continuous monitoring and evaluation of AI performance, ensuring models function as intended and produce reliable outcomes.
Lead initiatives for AI model validation, testing, and ongoing maintenance, integrating feedback from the CoE.
Data Management and Security:
Oversee data processes related to AI, ensuring data quality, security, and privacy.
Collaborate with data management teams to establish protocols for data usage, storage, and access in AI projects.
Qualifications:
Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field. A Master‚Äôs degree or AI/ML certified.
Experience:
Minimum of 10+ years of experience in technology, data architecture, AI/ML, or a related field.
Proven experience in leading AI processes or similar roles within a healthcare, pharmaceutical, or life sciences company.
Strong background in building and managing teams, with a focus on training and development.

Excellent analytical skills including trend analysis and data modeling.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
About the job
TDI Technologies, Inc. is seeking candidates for a Sr. Data Scientist position. The position‚Äôs main responsibility will be to gather, format, and analyze information from Navy Hull, Mechanical, and Electrical (HM&E) systems. The position will require knowledge of machine learning methods and modeling development and training. Candidates should be comfortable working within an engineering team, designing new software solutions, and interfacing with customers.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Develop code and test modeling approaches for shipboard systems using real and simulated shipboard sensor and status data from control systems.
2. Incorporate algorithms and model designs into software solutions and pipelines that solve our customer‚Äôs data analytics challenges.
3. Prototype and demonstrate TDI Technologies‚Äô data science capabilities to prospective customers.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:
1. Master‚Äôs Degree in a statistical, mathematical, computer science, or engineering discipline from an accredited college or university OR
2. In lieu of a Master‚Äôs, Candidates may possess a Bachelor of Science Degree in an engineering discipline from an accredited university along with 7 or more years of experience in an engineering, software development, and data science role

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS:
1. Successful applicants must either have an active government security clearance or the ability to receive approval upon position acceptance.
2. Must have a valid US passport OR the ability to obtain one upon position acceptance.

SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
Essential Skills:
1. Software development in Python
2. Experience with machine learning and/or artificial intelligence frameworks such as scikit-learn, Pandas, and NumPy
3. Experience with at least one of the following problem types: Time-series classification, regression analysis, optimization, clustering
4. Software development and operation within Linux and Windows based systems
5. Experience using version control tools such as SubVersion or Git
6. Strong technical writing skills and attention to detail for documentation
7. Willingness to convey technical problems and solutions to a variety of team members

Additional Preferred Skills:
1. Five (5) years of experience in identifying trends and problems through complex big data analysis.
2. Leading efforts to combine analysis from multiple data sources using a variety of techniques, ranging from simple data aggregation via statistical analysis to complex data mining independently.
3. Experience architecting scalable process solutions prepared with big data, data driven Machine Learning tools such as TensorFlow, scikit-learn, Pandas, and NumPy, Natural Language Processing, and implementing data models and developing data sources to support organizational solutions.
4. Working knowledge of fundamental concepts, practices, and procedures of naval shipboard Hull, Mechanical, and Electrical systems preferred.
5. Experience with development and deployment of Docker containers
6. Experience with orchestration using Kubernetes
7. Experience with DevOps tools and practices
8. Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS)
9. Experience with rotating machinery, industrial automation and controls, or vibrations analysis

Travel:
This position may require up to approximately 5-10% travel.
Location: Philadelphia, PA. This position will allow for some remote work but will also require attendance to in-person meetings at the Philadelphia Navy Yard offices as well as at government development and lab facilities.
Equal Employment Opportunity Policy:
TDI Technologies, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type.
This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layout, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Job Description

Korn Ferry is a global organizational consulting firm. We help clients synchronize strategy and talent to drive superior performance. We work with organizations to design their structures, roles, and responsibilities. We help them hire the right people to bring their strategy to life. And we advise them on how to reward, develop, and motivate their people.

Our 10,000 colleagues serve clients in more than 50 countries. We offer five core solutions:

Organizational Strategy
Assessment and Succession
Talent Acquisition
Leadership Development
Total Rewards

The Research Analyst position marks the entry point for a uniquely powerful career development track ‚Äì one that can truly lead anywhere. As one of us, you will have endless opportunities to innovate, make an impact, and work with the best. You will also have plenty of freedom to chart your own course, as you grow and develop with our business.

Talent Matters At Our Company. So, We Have Created a Colleague-centric Culture Where Everyone Can Make An Impact ‚Äì On Our Business, On Our Clients' Businesses, And On Their Own Careers. Some Of The Things That Make Our Culture Special

Creativity ‚Äì We look to one another to generate innovative solutions, not only for our clients but also for ourselves.

Collaboration ‚Äì We work in an open environment with a borderless mentality, sharing the expertise of our team members around the world.

Performance ‚Äì We are committed to exceeding client expectations, so high performance levels are a given.

Inclusivity ‚Äì We encourage everyone to contribute to the success of the business; there is no role at that is insignificant.

Integrity ‚Äì We believe that how you go about business is as important as business results.

Agility ‚Äì We work in a fast-moving, dynamic industry where change is the only constant and flexibility is key to our success.

Key Responsibilities

The primary focus of the Research Analyst is supporting the practice in preparing for business development meetings and delivering on executive search projects. Typical job focus includes:

Preparing company overviews for account teams
Researching companies and developing target lists
Identifying potential candidates from a variety of online and proprietary tools
Calling companies to determine organization structure

A successful Research Analyst career path typically includes opportunities for promotion to Associate, which has extensive client contact and business development expectations. Career paths for successful candidates may also include a more senior Research position (e.g. ‚ÄúKnowledge Manager‚Äù) for a sector or COE cluster.

Additional Responsibilities For a Research Analyst May Include

Searcher‚Ñ¢ Data Quality Management and Entry: Consistently inputting and updating highly confidential candidate records in our proprietary Client Resource Management (CRM).

Business Development Support: Actively participating in designing the search and business development strategy with the Partner and Consultant; pro-active involvement as a valued team contributor throughout the search process from pitch to candidate development.

Candidate ID: Providing research in support of candidate identification and business development activities of the practice. Develops appropriate candidate ‚Äútarget‚Äù lists for Senior Associates using the phone, print materials and a wide range of online information resources.

Internal/External Call Participation: Attending and/or listening in on kick-off meetings, suggesting possible targets, and attending client briefings/meetings when possible; Attending or listening in on all applicable sector and practice meetings/calls.

Focus on Client and Candidate Service: Developing a full understanding of the search and the research needs of internal clients; Developing confidence and trust of both internal and external clients.

Market Intelligence: Teaming up on ‚Äúproprietary‚Äù market intelligence projects in a Research Analyst sector and/or COE industry concentration; Proactively identifying and tracking organizational, industry, and/or functional trends and reporting findings.

YEAR ONE CRITICAL SUCCESS FACTORS

Learn the researcher role and become an effective member of the search team.

Master ability to identify relevant candidate backgrounds from a variety of sources including:

Searcher Express‚Ñ¢ (proprietary candidate database)
LinkedIn, Capital IQ, BoardEx, Pitchbook, ZoomInfo, etc.
Industry associations and trade publications

Manage time effectively to simultaneously balance research requests from multiple search teams. Actively engage with colleagues of all levels to create a culture of transparency, collaboration, respect, execution, and professionalism.

Professional Experience/Qualifications

Intelligence and Intellectual Curiosity: Must be genuinely interested in learning about people, business and industry characteristics/needs. Need the ability to quickly learn industry fundamentals and understand criteria for success. Importantly, they must have a high "EQ" (Emotional [Maturity] Quotient). Need sufficient conceptual skills to understand broad industry concepts and analytical skills to ‚Äúdrill down‚Äù to determine depth of experience.

High Energy Level: Must work on multiple assignments simultaneously, adhering to best practice guidelines. Must be willing to work hours required to complete the assignment. ‚ÄúStreet Smarts‚Äù The ability to quickly discern the criteria most important for candidate success in a particular search and think in a non-linear fashion so as to work smarter and creatively; Listen to and process candidate information in such a way as to determine likely fit with the opportunity and quickly ‚Äúclose‚Äù the conversation to specific next steps or additional source or candidate identification.

Contribution to Resources: Adds to and updates Searcher. Conducts a thorough evaluation of the outcome of research provided on a search and ensures that results are recorded in Searcher. Actively contributes to the practice knowledge system as well as to practice and research meetings.

Entrepreneurial Spirit: Works with minimal direction; is a self-starter but at the same time knows when to, and is comfortable with asking for direction when necessary. Provides meaningful feedback and when appropriate offers value-added suggestions for approaching the search in a different way. Provides research support in business development efforts.

Efficiency and Need for Closure: Work with multiple managers and prioritize task effectively. The ability to understand to complete searches quickly and at the highest quality standards, while making a profit consistent with the value delivered.

Persistence and Thoroughness: Ability to work in a fast-paced and unstructured work environment, able to assertively navigate organizational structures, but with sensitivity and finesse. Associates must reliably complete necessary paperwork and follow procedures effectively, especially those involving protecting key assets, such as proprietary databases.

Outstanding Communication Skills: Although outstanding telephone skills are especially essential, Associates need excellent overall communications skills, as well. They must demonstrate excellent verbal skills on the telephone, written skills in drafting specifications and references as well as other required documents, and presentation skills in client situations.

Discretion: Must project an understanding and appreciation for the strict confidentiality of client and candidate information and protect it as appropriate.

Poise and Professional Presence: Although in-person client contact is not the primary focus of this position, the Research Analyst will interface frequently with very senior stakeholders, and must project a professional image.

Positive Cultural Influence: Although our culture is independent and entrepreneurial, a team orientation is becoming increasingly important. At a minimum, the Associate must interface well with other office associates, but ideally will become a valued and important part of building a positive culture, raising other associates' job satisfaction levels, and increasing office productivity and retention rates.

LEADERSHIP CHARACTERISTICS

Getting Organized: Is well-organized, resourceful, and focused; effective and efficient at marshalling multiple resources to get things done; lays out tasks in sufficient detail to mark the trail; gets things done with less and in less time; can work on multiple tasks at once without losing track of any; foresees obstacles and plans around them.

Focusing on Action and Outcomes: Attacks everything with drive and energy with an eye on the bottom line; unafraid to initiate action before all the facts are known; drives to finish everything he/she starts.

Communicating Effectively: Writes and presents effectively; adjusts to fit the audience and the message; gets a message across with precision, clarity, brevity, and a relentless desire to re-read / proofread.

Managing Up: Is ambitious and is comfortable marketing himself/herself to higher management; knows how to relate effectively to top management, and can advocate for him/herself

Relating Skills: Warm, friendly, and interpersonally agile; easy to approach and talk to; relates well to all kinds of people; makes a pleasant first impression and builds solid relationships.

Managing Diverse Relationships: Relates well to a wide variety of diverse styles, types, and classes; open to differences; effective up, down, sideways, inside, and outside; builds diverse networks; quick to find common ground; treats differences fairly and equitably; treats everyone as a preferred customer.

Demonstrating Personal Flexibility: Open to lifelong, continuous personal improvement; aware of self and impact on others; responsive to feedback; is very flexible; can act in ways that seem contradictory and is adaptable to demand characteristics of different situations.

EDUCATION

An undergraduate degree from a well-regarded institution is required. Familiarity with Microsoft Office Products and databases (such as Bloomberg, Factiva, Lexis-Nexis) are a plus.

Salary Range

$60,000.00 - $75,000.00

Salary range represents the compensation Korn Ferry expects to pay to a candidate with the requirements for the job posted. Korn Ferry offers competitive compensation and benefits commensurate with experience.

Korn Ferry Benefits

The Korn Ferry Cares Wellbeing Platform offers Employees health benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, Short Term Disability, Basic Life and Accidental Death & Dismemberment), Critical Illness, Accident Injury, Hospital Indemnity, and Legal Insurance. Employees are eligible to enroll in Korn Ferry's Tax Deferred Savings plan 401(k). Employee Stock Purchase Program is available to all permanent employees who work 20 hours or more after 6 months of service. 

Employees are eligible to receive a total of 15 days vacation annually plus paid time off for 16 company holidays. Full time eligible employees will accrue sick time commencing on the first date of employment at the rate of 3.33 hours per pay period for an annualized maximum of 80 hours.

Internal Mobility at Korn Ferry

If you currently work for Korn Ferry or one of our affiliates, you must be eligible to apply for a different position within Korn Ferry to use the Careers Site. If you accept such a position, your benefits programs and Human Resources policies may change. Please consult with your HR contact for the new position concerning application eligibility, including any immigration/visa needs, benefit programs, and HR policies applicable to that position.

Korn Ferry is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative 

Action Employer - Minority/Female/Disability/ Veteran

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

title: Lead Data Engineer
description:
About the job
About the Role: 

Immediate need for a talented Data Engineer to support organization's Global digital transformation by designing, implementing, and optimizing our database architecture and data structures within our Salesforce and SAP ecosystem. The ideal candidate will have a solid understanding of database architecture and data integration processes and will be responsible for ensuring that our data structures and warehouses are aligned to support global reporting needs. This position will be collaborating with various business and technical stakeholders like developers, architects, and analysts to deliver high quality data solutions that support our organizations growth and operational efficiency. A key component of this role will be to map, build, test, and maintain database pipeline architectures between Salesforce and SAP.

Minimum Qualifications

Strong understanding of relational database concepts.
Working knowledge of Salesforce Data/Object model.
Some familiarity with cloud base database solutions like Salesforce Data cloud, AWS, Azure, Google, SAP DWC/DataSphere.
Some familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau, SAC, Power BI.
Ability to work closely with data analysts, and other stakeholders to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
Experience in designing, building, and optimizing ETL/ELT data pipelines to process large datasets.
Understanding of best practices for data modeling, including star schemas, snowflake schemas, and data normalization techniques.
Strong documentation skills for pipeline design and data flow diagrams.
Experience with Salesforce integrations, ETL processes and data migration projects.
Fundamental DevOps Practices, including knowledge of unit testing, CI/CD, and repository management.
Some understanding of CAN-SPAM and GDPR and other data privacy regulations.

title: ETL Developer
description:
About the job
Position Details:
Job Title: ETL Developer
Location: Plano, TX
Duration: Long Term

Job Description / Key Responsibilities:
Architect and develop end-to-end scalable data applications and automated data pipelines using Informatica Cloud (IICS), SQL, and Python.
Collaborate with product managers and scrum masters to create user stories and ensure on-time sprint deliverables.
Lead a team of data engineers, providing guidance on technical solutions, identifying benefits and risks, and offering well-informed recommendations.
Design and implement enterprise data warehouse solutions using RDBMS, Snowflake, S3 Data Lake, AWS cloud, and CI/CD tools such as Jenkins.
Build, optimize, and schedule ETL workflows for automated data integration and transformation.
Implement and enhance automated data solutions for data security, auditing, and change management processes.
Promote software engineering best practices including agile methodologies, coding standards, code reviews, and testing.
Mentor and guide technologists, fostering a collaborative and innovative engineering culture.

Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in computer science, Engineering, or related technology field; or equivalent work experience with 12 years of technology experience.
7+ years of experience in Data Engineering, leading the development of automated data pipelines and scalable data applications.
7+ years of experience with Informatica Cloud (IICS), data profiling, and data quality tools.
7+ years of experience in enterprise data warehouse platforms and databases such as RDBMS, Snowflake, AWS cloud technologies, and Jenkins CI/CD.
5+ years of experience implementing Snowflake lakehouse solutions, including SQL/Python-based ETL processes.
5+ years of experience mentoring junior engineers and leading technical teams.
4+ years of experience with software engineering best practices including agile, code management, and testing.
AWS, Informatica, or Snowflake certifications are preferred.
Experience with Dataiku is a plus.

Preferred Certifications:
AWS Certified Solutions Architect, Informatica Cloud Certification, or Snowflake Certification.

If Interested with the opportunity, please send your resume to ravi@dctekinc.com

title: Data Scientist - Senior
description:
About the job
Established in 2021, Independence Pet Holdings is a corporate holding company that manages a diverse and broad portfolio of modern pet health brands and services, including insurance, pet education, lost recovery services, and more throughout North America.

We believe pet insurance is more than a financial product and build solutions to simplify the pet parenting journey and help improve the well-being of pets. As a leading authority in the pet category, we operate with a full stack of resources, capital, and services to support pet parents. Our multi-brand and omni-channel approach include our own insurance carrier, insurance brands and partner brands.

Independence American Insurance Company (IAIC), a subsidiary of IPH, has over 50 years of underwriting experience and a history of innovation in the pet insurance industry. IAIC has built a reputation as a trusted and dependable partner. We are a pet-focused underwriter with deep insurance industry experience, offering a product with proven consumer appeal.

Job Summary

Independence American Insurance Company (IAIC) is seeking a Senior Data Scientist to advance the predictive modeling and visualization capabilities of the actuarial department for a leading pet insurer. In this role, you will apply best practices to prepare and manage datasets; develop predictive models for rating, conversion, and retention purposes, and create data visualizations in platforms such as Power BI and Radar. IAIC is seeking a highly self-motivated candidate to lead our data and visualization initiatives.

Job Location: Remote work is not available in AK, MT, HI (US)

Main Responsibilities

Design and implement data pipelines for collecting, processing, and integrating structured and unstructured data from multiple sources, including internal databases and external data providers.
Perform root cause analysis and utilize complex SQL queries to investigate data issues such as data inconsistencies, missing data, and errors. Collaborate with data engineers, data analysts, and other stakeholders as needed.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by conducting data audits and creating reconciliation processes.
Conduct exploratory data analysis to understand the relationship between data elements and insurance processes such as pricing, conversion, and retention. 
Develop rating plans using predictive models to optimize risk segmentation across a portfolio of products while balancing strengths and weaknesses of each model to the subject product.
Use advanced statistical techniques to identify key drivers of sales and retention and create/maintain models to forecast expected results.
Create and maintain dashboard visualizations in Power BI and Radar to monitor key metrics such as rate levels, risk segmentation, and retention.
Collaborate with actuarial, underwriting, and other stakeholders across the organization to accomplish goals and objectives.
Communicate findings and recommendations to technical and non-technical audiences through reports, presentations, and visualizations.
Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data science and actuarial science to drive continuous improvement and innovation.
Establish best practices across the data science workflow, including but not limited to data preparation, modeling, and documentation.
Serve as the data science subject matter expert and enrich predictive modeling knowledge and functional capabilities across the actuarial department.

Qualifications

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Science, or a related field with relevant work experience. Otherwise, Master‚Äôs degree or higher preferred.
5+ years of experience in a data science role, preferable in the insurance industry (P&C or A&H).
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL, with experience in data manipulation and statistical analysis.
Experience with SQL Server and Snowflake. Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and tools.
Experience with WTW‚Äôs Radar suite, including Radar Base and Emblem.
Strong oral and written communication skills.
Ability to work efficiently on multiple projects with strong prioritization skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a cross-functional team in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent problem-solving skills, critical thinking abilities, and attention to detail.

#carrier

All of our jobs come with great benefits including healthcare, parental leave and opportunities for career advancements. Some offerings are dependent upon the location of where you work and can include the following:

Comprehensive full medical, dental and vision Insurance
Basic Life Insurance at no cost to the employee
Company paid short-term and long-term disability
12 weeks of 100% paid Parental Leave
Health Savings Account (HSA)
Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
Retirement savings plan
Personal Paid Time Off
Paid holidays and company-wide Wellness Day off
Paid time off to volunteer at nonprofit organizations
Pet friendly office environment
Commuter Benefits
Group Pet Insurance
On the job training and skills development
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
About the job
Are you passionate about developing cutting-edge AI solutions? Do you have extensive experience in designing, coding, testing, and deploying scalable and reliable software systems? You might be the perfect fit for our Machine Learning Engineer job opportunity!

TackleAI is a Chicagoland software company established to create logical solutions to business challenges. Our diverse team of developers and data scientists combine powerful machine learning with computer vision and proprietary neural networks to turn unstructured documents into intelligible and immediately accessible data.

We are looking for a Mid to Senior Level Machine Learning Software Engineer to join our AI startup. You will be part of a dynamic and talented team that is passionate about creating innovative solutions for our customers. You will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge technologies and projects that have a positive impact. As a Machine Learning Software Engineer, you will:
Design and implement machine learning pipelines and frameworks using Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch or other tools
Research and apply state-of-the-art machine learning techniques to solve real-world problems
Evaluate and optimize the performance and scalability of machine learning models and systems
Build end-to-end machine learning pipelines, including data ingestion, preprocessing, feature engineering, model training, validation, and deployment.
Conduct experiments and perform statistical analysis to evaluate model performance and identify areas for improvement
Document and communicate your work and results to stakeholders and peers
Test, debug, and monitor the performance and reliability of the AI systems and applications

To be successful in this role, you should have:
Bachelor's Degree or higher in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field
At least 4 years of professional experience in machine learning, data science, or software engineering
Proficiency in Python and one or more machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, or Keras
Knowledge of machine learning concepts and methods such as supervised learning, unsupervised learning, deep learning, natural language processing, computer vision or reinforcement learning
Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud
Experience in using agile methodologies such as Scrum or Kanban
Excellent communication, leadership, and problem-solving skills

Nice to have:
Master‚Äôs Degree in a Computer or Engineering related field.
Exposure to .NET technologies such as ASP .Net core.
Experience with other languages such as Python, Rust, and C++, and C#
DevOps experience, Working knowledge of Docker, Kubernetes

As a Machine Learning Software Engineer at our AI startup, you will also enjoy:
Utilizing the newest and latest tools & technologies
A competitive salary and variable compensation package
Flexible, hybrid work schedule
Health insurance coverage through Blue Cross Blue Shield
Vision, Dental, Life, STD, and LTD coverage offerings available
11 paid holidays
160 hours Paid Time Off annually
401(k) ‚Äì Roth, Traditional, or both
Diversity focused, inclusive and safe environment
Collaborative and supportive work environment
The chance to learn from and grow with industry experts.

If you are interested in joining our AI startup and working on exciting projects that make a difference, please send your resume and portfolio to Kyle Weber at kyle@tackleai.com. We look forward to hearing from you!

MENTAL/PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers. This individual will frequently interact with internal stakeholders as well as customers.

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY POLICY:
TackleAI is an equal opportunity employer. In accordance with anti-discrimination law, it is the purpose of this policy to effectuate these principles and mandates. TackleAI prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type and affords equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. TackleAI conforms to the spirit as well as to the letter of all applicable laws and regulations.

ACCESSIBILITY ACCOMMODATION STATEMENT:
TackleAI is committed to providing qualified individuals with disabilities reasonable accommodations to perform the essential functions of their jobs. Additionally, if you (or another applicant of whom you are aware) require assistance accessing or reading this job posting or otherwise seek assistance in the application process, please contact careers@tackleai.com

title: Data Scientist
description:
About the job
We are a Boston-based epidemiology and biomedical research organization. We are actively engaged in several clinical trials, pharmacoepidemiology, chronic disease epidemiology, genetic epidemiology, biostatistical and genomics research. Our research team oversees study data related activities and Quality improvement activities to improve the way translational research is conducted and clinical care is delivered. The multi-disciplinary center consists of a highly talented group of biomedical researchers, clinicians, epidemiologists, biostatisticians, data analysts/programmers, project coordinators, and informatics team with academic affiliations to Harvard Medical School and Boston University. We are looking for candidates with a service-oriented mentality, high sense of ownership of the assigned tasks and ability to solve problems presented by data.


Project Background:
 Our research group has a full-time Data Scientist opening for individuals who love working with data and want to use their data science skills to help researchers conduct high-impact research that expands our understanding of human health and improves healthcare outcomes for Veterans. You will work with a strong, collegial, diverse, and talented team of computer scientists, statisticians, and clinicians at BVARI, the VA Boston Healthcare System, Harvard Medical School, and the Boston University School of Medicine.

Why should a data scientist work at a VA-associated research institute? The VA has the largest integrated medical records database in the United States, with comprehensive clinical information on over 22 million patients (2 trillion+ rows, 22,000+ columns of data), including large amounts of both structured and unstructured data. The VA also has large databases of genomic and imaging data. Working with our group offers the opportunity to execute high-impact projects with large-scale real-world healthcare data that is unavailable at most other institutions.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Use advanced data analysis methods (from machine learning, artificial intelligence, applied statistics, etc.) to assist in building predictive models of healthcare outcomes from the largest integrated medical records database in the United States.
Extract, clean, and validate data in preparation for analysis, starting from raw data in a large relational database.
Carry out exploratory analysis and data visualization and summarize analysis results.
Collaborate with a range of researchers, including clinicians, computer scientists and statisticians to design and execute analyses.
Assist in developing improved data science methodology in relation to healthcare data.
Assist in publishing papers on our findings, systems, and methodology.

Qualifications and Entrance Requirements:
Proficiency in programming with R and/or Python to carry out data analysis in large and complex datasets.
Experience working with relational databases using SQL or willingness to learn.
Ability to move projects forward independently with moderate support.
Ability to work effectively in multi-disciplinary teams.
Passion for advancing healthcare research through creative use of data.
Strong communication and collaborative research skills required.
Experience using version control and reproducible research (git, knitr, etc.) is preferred.
Experience with electronic medical record data or clinical databases preferred.

Please note we are unable to provide work authorization and/or visa sponsorship. 

Work Environment
This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, and filing cabinets. The employee must be a resident of Massachusetts upon start date.

Physical Demands
The physical demands described in this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee frequently is required to stand; walk; use hands; and reach with hands and arms. This position requires the ability to occasionally lift office products and supplies, up to 20 pounds.

Selective Service
If you are male application born after December 31, 1959, you must certify that you have registered with the Selective Service System or are exempt from having to do so under the Selective Service Law.

Position Type/Expected Hours of Work
This is a full-time exempt position, and hours of work and days are Monday through Friday, 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m.

Travel 
No travel is expected for this position.

Work Authorization/Security Clearance
An employee in this position must complete all appropriate background checks at the time of hire and periodic reappointment.

Other Duties
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

About BVARI
We are a highly supportive environment, where culture comes first, and we reward our employees with outstanding benefits and perks, including highly competitive benefits, flexible work arrangements, generous time off with annual cash-out options, retirement matching, and deeply discounted MBTA commuter passes to those who spend the preponderance of their time commuting to the office.

Equal Opportunity Employer 
Boston VA Research Institute, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, transfer, leaves of absences, compensation and training.

title: Data Analytics Specialist
description:
About the job
Title: Insights & Analytics Specialist
Location: Charlotte, NC
Reporting Structure: Reports to the Director of Account Management
About WorldWide HealthStaff Solutions:
WorldWide HealthStaff Solutions Ltd. is a recognized global leader in the international healthcare recruitment industry. We predominantly recruit international healthcare professionals from around the world to work in the United States. We are vital to hospitals and medical centers around the country. In addition, we significantly impact the lives of the healthcare professions we work with. With office locations in North Carolina, Idaho, the Philippines and Dubai, the company is growing rapidly and expanding at all locations. This position is located in Charlotte, North Carolina.

The position reports to the Director of Account Management. Within the organization, the position has primary working relationships with Account Management, Marketing, New Business Development, Recruiting, Operations, IT, and our team in the Philippines. Externally, the position would work with our agency and consulting partners.

Manage and analyze client data, competitive activity, and market/macro trends--across multiple sources, including secondary data and research.
Support monthly client reporting.
Report and make recommendations, providing explanations on findings that inform on business performance.
Lead the articulation of actionable insights based on the data, driving both short-term and long-term strategies
Conduct ad hoc analyses for key internal clients, as requested
Understand the Brand strategy and recommend tactics to drive the strategy based on actionable insights from multiple data sources.
Leverage dynamic data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, and Google Sheets/ Excel for impactful storytelling
Collaborate with and gather input from cross-functional partners to help identify and explain key insights and trends. Act as a strategic analytics advisor to the organization

Qualifications:
Bachelors degree in Computer Science or Analytics is preferred
2yrs experience in data analytics role
Strong verbal and written communication skills, as demonstrable in oral presentations, succinct PowerPoint stories and layout, as well as structured syntheses and recommendations
Demonstrate strong analytical skills and creative problem solving skills, turning insights into action
Demonstrate advanced use of Microsoft Excel/ Google Sheets
Ability to work independently and with cross-functional teams

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
About the job
Stable company has an immediate need for a Senior Data Scientist on a direct hire basis. In this role, you will be a key person within the org working 100% hands-on, and strong senior-level data science skills are needed. You will work closely with the business and have a keen ability to communicate with non-technical users. You will take ownership of designing, dev, and deployment of analytics projects. A passionate data person is needed! This is a top company offering competitive base salaries, bonuses, hybrid work from home, 401K matching, full medical benefits, and more. This is a great chance to join an awesome team and have a large impact in a growing industry!

Requirements:
**Must be a US Citizen and live in Metro Atlanta, Georgia**
*4+ years of experience within data science, advanced analytics.
*Expertise with Python, R and other languages.
*Statistical modeling experience; strong experience with putting models to production and the build/deployment of machine learning models.
*Bachelor‚Äôs Degree from a top school.
*Excellent communication and leadership skills.
Plus:
*GenAI experience.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
About the job
Sr Data Engineer

title: Data Analyst
description:
About the job
Job Title: Data Analyst
Location: Remote Fulltime

Job Description
We are seeking a Data Analyst with experience in translating business requirements into technical data specifications, manipulating large datasets and supporting Data engineering teams with various data initiatives. title: Data Analyst
description:
About the job
Data Analyst/Power BI Specialist
Fortune 50 Healthcare 
 Brooksource 
Remote 


Role Overview: Join our Enterprise Architecture Team at a Fortune 50 Healthcare client to enhance our data-driven decision-making through comprehensive reporting. This role is crucial for developing and maintaining Power BI and Lean IX reports that focus on capabilities, technologies, governance, end-of-life (EOL) considerations, and the broader aspects of Enterprise Architecture. You will ensure data accuracy, integrate APIs, and provide actionable insights that support strategic initiatives and organizational goals.


Required Qualifications:
Proficiency in Power BI, with experience in building and managing reports.
Experience with PowerApps is a plus.
Experience using ADO for managing Epics, Features, and Stories.
Strong skills in data management and analysis, including experience with complex data sets and root cause analysis.
Proficiency in accessing APIs for data exchange and conducting Postman API testing.
Experience with Microsoft Excel, including formulas, pivots, charts, and graphs.
Experience with Lean IX reporting is highly preferred, though not required.
Proficiency in data mining and predictive modeling techniques.
Ability to train end users on new reports and dashboards.
Experience in generating reports from single or multiple systems.

Preferred Qualifications:
Advanced degree in a quantitative discipline such as Mathematics, Economics, Finance, Statistics, Computer Science, or Engineering.
More than 2 years of experience with SQL, SAS, or other data systems.
In-depth experience with data mining and predictive modeling techniques.

Day-to-Day Responsibilities:
Power BI and Lean IX Reporting: Develop, enhance, and manage reports using Power BI and Lean IX. Create and refine reports focusing on capabilities, technologies, governance, EOL, and Enterprise Architecture aspects. Address reporting needs, manage backlogs, and support organizational goals.
Data Management and Analysis: Collect, store, and manage data related to Enterprise Architecture. Ensure data accuracy and quality while performing in-depth analysis of complex data sets to provide actionable insights.
API Integration: Implement and manage API integrations for data exchange, including conducting Postman testing to maintain data accuracy and consistency.
Training & Support: Educate users on report functionalities, assist in system-related decisions, and collaborate with Enterprise Architects and stakeholders to ensure the relevance and effectiveness of reports. Enhance data visibility and support strategic initiatives.

title: Data Scientist
description:
About the job
SRS Distribution, a wholly owned subsidiary of The Home Depot, currently operates under a family of distinct local brands encompassing more than 760 locations across 47 states. For more information, visit www.srsdistribution.com.

Location:

This is a hybrid position. Our corporate office is located 7440 S. Hwy 121 McKinney, TX 75070 

What you‚Äôll Do:

This role will be responsible for importing data, designing experiments, and developing various advanced analytics solutions to inform decision-making regarding customer treatment at SRS Distribution. The right person for the role is a data scientist who thoroughly enjoys defining and solving mathematical problems to address business questions. The ideal candidate is excited about delivering state-of-the-art and practical data science solutions in the construction industry.

Requirements We Look For: 

Define the Scope of the Work (20%)

Work with product owners of different verticals, branch offices, and the senior leadership to fully understand the background, purpose, and the goals of each project.
Work with IT and the database team to understand the data infrastructure to support each project.
Define the additional resources needed to support each project.
Define the big and small milestones for each project.
Define the metrics used to evaluate the success and failure of each project.

Responsible for descriptive and inferential statistical analyses (40%)

Drive novel insights from large and complex data sets by developing and applying cutting-edge data wrangling and analytics capabilities.
Run descriptive statistical analysis to reveal the trend and pattern of customer data.
Build, validate and implement predictive models to address key scientific and business questions in partnership with the business owners.
Work with other stakeholders to design pilots, experiments, or surveys to derive insights for solving business problems.

Dashboard reporting (20%)

Build key metrics to track customer segmentation performances.
Work with data engineering team by delivering accurate and consistent data that meet the reporting needs.
Create actual reports that can provide deep insights for audience to track our business performances.

Interpret and present results (20%)

Interpret complex statistical results in an easy-to-understand language
Convert statistical results into actionable business plans.
Present analytics or modeling results to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Qualities that Stir our Souls (and make you stand out):

Minimum a bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field such as mathematics, statistics, data science, physics, computer science, or engineering, etc. A master‚Äôs degree or a Ph.D. is preferred.
Minimum 5+ years of experience in a data analytics or data science role.
Strong expertise in SQL and Python (or R).
Working knowledge of data visualization or reporting tools such as Tableau, Google Data Studio, Power BI, or QLIK.
Experience in building statistical and machine learning models independently in a business setting.
Experience in solving customer-level business problems.
Strong verbal and written communications skills both to technical and non-technical audiences
Ability to prioritize and meet timelines in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong logical thinking skills
Other responsibilities and projects as assigned. 
Working knowledge of Snowflake, AWS cloud services, and Google Cloud Platform APIs
Experience with solving business problems in the construction industry

SRS Perks & Benefits: 

Weekly Pay 
Day One 401(k) Plan participation with Generous Company Match 
Generous Paid Time Off, Holidays, Birthday, and Floating Holidays‚Ä¶. and more 
Paid Parental Leave 
Medical, Dental and Vision Benefits 
Employee Referral Bonus Program

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
About the job
Let‚Äôs face it, a company whose mission is human transformation better have some fresh thinking about the employer/employee relationship. 

We do. We can‚Äôt cram it all in here, but you‚Äôll start noticing it from the first interview.

Even our candidate experience is different. And when you get an offer from us (and accept it), you get way more than a paycheck. You get a personal BetterUp Coach, a development plan, a trained and coached manager, the most amazing team you‚Äôve ever met (yes, each with their own personal BetterUp Coach), and most importantly, work that matters.

This makes for a remarkably focused and fulfilling work experience. Frankly, it‚Äôs not for everyone. But for people with fire in their belly, it‚Äôs a game-changing, career-defining, soul-lifting move.

Join us and we promise you the most intense and fulfilling years of your career, doing life-changing work in a fun, inventive, soulful culture. 

If that sounds exciting‚Äîand the job description below feels like a fit‚Äîwe really should start talking.

We are looking for an experienced Senior Data Scientist to help us align the transformational capabilities of BetterUp‚Äôs platform with our customers' end goals. This is a unique opportunity to produce innovative applied research that quantifies the tangible business value we create for our customers.

If you are passionate about developing scalable analytics solutions to real-world customer challenges, enjoy the rigor and creativity of applied research, and thrive in a fast-paced startup environment where you get to build the future, come help us redesign how we show our value to the world!

What You‚Äôll Do

Partner with our customers and internal account teams to secure, clean, analyze, and present on data demonstrating BetterUp‚Äôs impact and value to customers‚Äô strategic priorities and bottom line
Design and execute applied research studies using historical data: identify comparison groups, select relevant metrics, and align measurement time points for accurate analysis.
Apply advanced statistical modeling (e.g., multiple and logistic regression, chi square testing, propensity score matching) to understand how coaching drives impact and creates value
Produce client-ready deliverables and present findings back to customers in a simple and easy to understand way
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., Product) to incorporate key findings from Value Management into product strategy 
Partner closely with data engineering and analytics engineering to design new Value Analytics data models, metrics, and reproducible analysis 
Play an integral role in helping define the analytics function and the future of data at BetterUp
Report to the Director of Product and Customer Analytics; provided embedded, full-service support to the Partner Insights & Value Strategy function

If you have some or all of the following, please apply:

5+ years in professional analytics roles using SQL, advanced Sheets / Excel, Business Intelligence visualization/dashboarding [Looker preferred], and coding/programming [R (Posit) strongly preferred]
Interest and domain knowledge of organizational psychology, development, and/or change [Masters in Industrial Organizational psychology or other related disciplines preferred]
Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills applying statistical and predictive modeling concepts and classification techniques [Experience conducting analyses with pre-post and quasi-experimental designs strongly preferred]
Exceptional written and oral communication skills, with the ability to translate complex results into clear strategic recommendations to non-technical audiences
Exceptional visualization and data storytelling skills, with the ability to translate complex data into compelling, intuitive visualizations and crisp insights
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment, and to work effectively with people at all levels in an organization
A self-starter that can jump right in and quickly add value, with a demonstrated ability to think like an owner and make effective prioritization decisions in a dynamic environment

Benefits

At BetterUp, we are committed to living out our mission every day and that starts with providing benefits that allow our employees to care for themselves, support their families, and give back to their community.

Access to BetterUp coaching; one for you and one for a friend or family member 
A competitive compensation plan with opportunity for advancement
Medical, dental and vision insurance
Flexible paid time off
Per year: 
All federal/statutory holidays observed
4 BetterUp Inner Work days (https://www.betterup.co/inner-work)
5 Volunteer Days to give back
Learning and Development stipend
Company wide Summer & Winter breaks 
Year-round charitable contribution of your choice on behalf of BetterUp
401(k) self contribution
We are dedicated to building diverse teams that fuel an authentic workplace and sense of belonging for each and every employee. We know applying for a job can be intimidating, please don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out ‚Äî we encourage everyone interested in joining us to apply.

BetterUp Inc. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, genetics, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status. In addition to federal law requirements, BetterUp Inc. complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

At BetterUp, we compensate our employees fairly for their work. Base salary is determined by job-related experience, education/training, residence location, as well as market indicators. The range below is representative of base salary only and does not include equity, sales bonus plans (when applicable) and benefits. This range may be modified in the future.

The base salary range for this role is $162,000 ‚Äì $280,000.

If you live in New York, the base salary range for this role is:

$187,000 ‚Äì $280,000: New York City

$162,000 ‚Äì $243,000: Albany, Buffalo, Rochester, Nassau, Newburgh, Syracuse

Protecting your privacy and treating your personal information with care is very important to us, and central to the entire BetterUp family. By submitting your application, you acknowledge that your personal information will be processed in accordance with our Applicant Privacy Notice. If you have any questions about the privacy of your personal information or your rights with regards to your personal information, please reach out to support@betterup.co

title: Data Architect
description:
About the job
Who We Are:
Integrated Medical Systems, Inc. (IMS), founded in 1994, is one of the nation's top distributors within the alternate site market. We strive to continually exceed expectations by cultivating valued partnerships and delivering on our commitment to always put our customers first. We offer flexible rental and purchase options for a vast line of disposable and rental products specific to infusion, respiratory, enteral feeding, oncology, and cleanroom.

People at IMS are innovative, dedicated, and experienced to enhance our customer‚Äôs experience from start to finish. By joining us, not only will you be working alongside industry experts and thought leaders, but also with a company recognized for its dedication to employee growth and well-being.

What We‚Äôre Looking For:
IMS is seeking an experienced Data Architect who has expertise in business intelligence, data analytics, information management, and data-driven decision support systems, data modeling, strategy, design, development and implementation of large-scale analytics projects in the cloud. In this role, you will be responsible for constructing data pipelines, managing and optimizing data warehouses, building analytics and predictive modeling to drive business operations and product decisions. The ideal candidate will have a firm grasp of emerging technologies, platforms, and applications and an ability to customize them to help our business become more secure and efficient. You will be creating the blueprint and roadmap of a cloud-based system, based on the requirements and goals of the client or organization. You will have an immediate impact on the day-to-day efficiency of IT BI operations and an ongoing impact on growth.

How You‚Äôll Make an Impact:
‚óè Develop data infrastructure strategies, including the overall enterprise data management framework, data security, and compliance
‚óè Develop and implement technical efforts to design, build, and deploy hybrid applications, including large-scale data processing, computationally intensive statistical modeling, and advanced analytics
‚óè Develop and execute a strategy for digital transformation
‚óè Translating business requirements into technical specifications, including data streams, integrations, transformations, databases, and data warehouses
‚óè Work closely with IT security to monitor the company‚Äôs cloud privacy
‚óè Respond to technical issues in a professional and timely manner
‚óè Identify the top cloud architecture solutions to successfully meet the needs of the company
‚óè Lead our organization through cloud adoption and establish best practices for BI/Analytics
‚óè Vet cloud providers and third-party services
‚óè Educate teams on the implementation of new cloud-based initiatives, providing associated training and documentation when necessary
‚óè Primarily focus on leveraging Grow BI to create a single-source of truth for data

What You Bring to the Table:

Required Skills:
‚óè Proven work experience as a Data Architect/Analyst or similar role
‚óè Positive attitude and a strong commitment to delivering quality work
‚óè Excellent knowledge of cloud computing technologies and current computing trends
‚óè Effective communication skills (written and verbal) to properly articulate complicated
cloud reports to management and other IT development partners

Preferred Skills:
‚óè Bachelor‚Äôs degree (or equivalent) in computer science, information technology, or mathematics
‚óè Knowledge of web services, API, REST, and RPC
‚óè AWS or Azure certification

title: Senior Researcher
description:
About the job
SHRM‚ÄØis a member-driven catalyst‚ÄØfor creating better workplaces where‚ÄØpeople and businesses‚ÄØthrive together.‚ÄØAs the‚ÄØtrusted authority on all things work, SHRM is the foremost expert, researcher, advocate, and thought‚ÄØleader on issues‚ÄØand innovations‚ÄØimpacting today‚Äôs evolving workplaces.‚ÄØ‚ÄØWith nearly‚ÄØ340,000‚ÄØmembers in‚ÄØ180‚ÄØcountries, SHRM touches the lives of more than‚ÄØ362‚ÄØmillion workers and their families globally.

SUMMARY

The Sr. Researcher will generate actionable insights for HR executives, HR professionals, and policymakers. The position is focused on researching all things work, worker and workplace and may include topics such as human resources, workplace economic impacts, inclusion and diversity, and related government policies.

Responsibilities:

 Design and execute research studies from start to finish, including defining objectives, generating hypotheses, developing research plans, designing and programming surveys, analyzing results, summarizing findings, and creating final deliverables. 
 Use industry best practices and familiarity with the organization's mission to inspire ideas and content. 
 Communicate and collaborate internally and externally to support the goals of the thought leadership team, its partners, and the organization. 
 Produce well-researched content in compelling and creative ways for print and online publications and presentations. 
 Coach and mentor junior staff. 
 Perform other duties as assigned. .

Education & Experience Requirements

Required

 Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business, economics, political science, psychology or other social science field; or equivalent relevant experience. 

Experience

 5+ years of professional experience in survey research, project management, and data analysis. 

Certifications Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

Required

 Proficiency with statistical software package (e.g., SPSS, R) including cross tabs, frequencies, correlations, and regressions. 
 Experience with programming on survey design platforms (e.g., Survey Monkey, Qualtrics, etc.). 
 Basic understanding of how to use generative AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT, Microsoft Copilot, etc.). 
 Ability to consolidate data findings into concise, actionable, and easy-to-understand charts and/or presentations. 
 Ability to work independently. 
 Ability to work on multiple projects with different objectives simultaneously. 
 Experience leading projects with junior staff. 
 Proven time management skills, including prioritizing, scheduling, and adapting as necessary. 
 Strong oral and written communication skills. 

Preferred:

 Master‚Äôs in business, economics, political science, psychology or other social science field. 

Additional Notes

 Physical Requirements 

 Must be able to perform essential duties satisfactorily with reasonable accommodations. 
 Work is generally done sitting, talking, hearing and typing. Visual acuity to use a keyboard, prepare and analyze data and figures; transcribing, viewing a computer terminal; extensive reading. 

 Work environment 

Work is regularly performed in a professional office environment and routinely uses standard office equipment.

The hiring range for this position is $88,000 to $123,000 per year. This range is an estimate and the actual salary may vary based on the candidate's experience, skills, and qualifications. SHRM offers a competitive and comprehensive total rewards package. The benefits for this position include professional growth and development, health, dental, vision, well-being, health savings, flexible spending, retirement, open leave, and annual discretionary bonus and incentives.

title: Data Science Intern- Insurance
description:
About the job
Are you a current student seeking a valuable internship opportunity in the realm of Data Science?

Do you enjoy being part of a team that works with a diverse range of products /technology?

About The Business

LexisNexis¬Æ Risk Solutions provides customers with solutions and decision tools that combine public and industry-specific content with advanced technology and analytics to assist them in evaluating and predicting risk and enhancing operational efficiency. We use the power of data and advanced analytics to help our customers make better, timelier decisions. By bringing clarity to information, we ultimately help make communities safer, insurance rates more accurate, commerce more transparent, business decisions easier and processes more efficient. You can learn more about LexisNexis Risk at the link below, https://risk.lexisnexis.com/

About Our Team

LexisNexis Risk Solutions provides data and analytics for risk management and decision-making. We aim to enable customers to make informed decisions using our innovative solutions. This internship will support the Auto Underwriting Analytics team in applying Data Science methods for analyzing data pertaining to our Underwriting suite of products.

About The Role

The Data Science Internship Program provides exposure to the Scoring and Modeling organization of LexisNexis‚Äô Insurance Division. Successful candidates will learn particular aspects of our business while working on data-science-related assignments and projects. Potential areas for assignment include but are not limited to auto claims, fraud, life, home, commercial, and telematics.

The program runs from May 19, 2025, to July 25, 2025, and is open to master's students. This internship is based in Alpharetta, GA, with no relocation assistance provided.

Responsibilities

Conducting analysis and creating performance reports in support of existing and new product development, and/or customer sales.
Developing analytic models, writing analysis code, and working with internal or external stakeholders to validate the accuracy of results.
Following established best practices in statistical work and analyzing plans by executing appropriate statistical and modeling techniques.
Assembling, merging, and parsing large amounts of data to detect meaningful patterns and trends.
Providing support for client inquiries regarding score calculations or other analytical outputs.
Participating in targeted training designed to enhance technical skills and develop core competencies.
Documenting and communicating analytical work and results clearly.

Requirements

Be a currently enrolled student working on a Master‚Äôs in a Scientific, Mathematical, or Computer field. Qualified applicants must be graduating between December 2025 and May 2026. 
Possess foundational knowledge of natural language processing, machine learning, and information retrieval.
Display familiarity with data manipulation languages and showcase a basic grasp of data modeling principles.
Be a natural problem solver, able to collaborate with your team to resolve issues.
Demonstrate excellent problem-solving skills and ability to think critically.
Possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Learn more about the LexisNexis Risk team and how we work here
