title: Lead Data Scientist
description:
About the job
About the Company: 
One of our clients is a large Integrated Delivery System who is developing value-based models of reimbursement and care delivery. This initiative is focused on Population Health, ACO, and direct to Employer models. To support these strategies, we are hiring a Lead Data Scientist to join a team comprised of talented analysts and data scientists that are passionate about developing a true system of care that creates value for our customers and patients.

About the Role: 
You will design and implement data-driven insights to enable value-based contracts and commercial offerings. You will support the contract lifecycle from initial development and planning, through pre-sale and implementation, to reconciliation. During planning phase: analyze variance to identify opportunities and risks; develop pro-forma scenario models of contracts and terms; create reports to guide negotiations with prospects. During implementation: forecast performance results and support client-specific areas of interest. During reconciliation: measure performance of our products across financial, patient satisfaction, and quality outcomes. Apply performance evaluation that fulfills contract terms and, when appropriate, the demands of rigorous outcomes research methodology. Work with departmental staff to identify requirements for reporting and / or business intelligence tools. Identify necessary data and methodologies; collect, integrate, analyze and interpret data. Leverage advanced statistical analysis methods to create insightful recommendations and conclusions that you effectively communicate to your stakeholders. Identify and address expected and unforeseen data complexities to mitigate their impact on the analytic outcome and associated business decisions. Clearly communicate data issues to the recipients and work to improve data quality where possible within the analytical models you create. Feed data quality issues back to IT to assist in our quest for high quality data. Develop and present reports, analyses and findings to senior management and others as scheduled or requested. You will engage with the Managed Care Contracting and Commercialization teams and interface with key leaders in our care management and clinical service lines. Act as liaison/analyst for internal stakeholders, understand their needs and translate them into reporting and analytic solutions.

Responsibilities: 
Design and implement data-driven insights to enable value-based contracts and commercial offerings.
Support the contract lifecycle from initial development and planning, through pre-sale and implementation, to reconciliation.
Analyze variance to identify opportunities and risks during the planning phase.
Develop pro-forma scenario models of contracts and terms.
Create reports to guide negotiations with prospects.
Forecast performance results and support client-specific areas of interest during implementation.
Measure performance of products across financial, patient satisfaction, and quality outcomes during reconciliation.
Identify requirements for reporting and / or business intelligence tools.
Collect, integrate, analyze and interpret data.
Create insightful recommendations and conclusions using advanced statistical analysis methods.
Address data complexities to mitigate their impact on business decisions.
Communicate data issues and work to improve data quality.
Present reports, analyses, and findings to senior management and others.
Engage with Managed Care Contracting and Commercialization teams.
Act as liaison/analyst for internal stakeholders and translate their needs into solutions.

 Qualifications: 
Minimum of BA/BS degree in a relevant field of study; Master‚Äôs degree preferred.
At least five (5) years of analytics development experience for a health provider, health plan or accountable care organization.
Experience working in a health plan and/or Health Delivery System focused on medical economics.
Experience working in healthcare provider analytics related to managed care contracting, population management, clinical or financial decision support.
Strong data mining skills using tools like SQL, R, Python, SAS, etc.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to perform complex analysis and make recommendations based on statistical inferences.
Experience with a wide variety of analytical or statistical methods.
Strong working knowledge of Business Intelligence products (Tableau, SAS, MicroStrategy, etc.).
Excellent oral and writing skills; ability to communicate effectively with varying audiences.
Demonstrated ability to articulate goals, plan and implement processes to achieve those goals, recognize and assess the implications of confounding variables, and meet deadlines.
Advanced interpersonal skills required to service internal and external clients effectively.
Self-motivated with a demonstrated ability to work independently and to exercise independent judgment in developing complex techniques or programs in a dynamic environment.

 Pay range and compensation package: 
Salary $150,000 to $170,000
This is a 40-hour work week and is FULLY REMOTE.

Equal Opportunity Statement: 
Include a statement on commitment to diversity and inclusivity.

title: Research Analyst
description:
About the job
Location: Remote (US-based) 
Type: W2, Part-time, Flexible Hours 
 About the Role: 
 As a Research Analyst, you will play a key role in improving the quality of search engine results, ensuring users find the most relevant and useful information. Your work will directly impact the development of AI algorithms, making search engines smarter and more intuitive. You won‚Äôt need to be a data expert, but your insights will help refine search accuracy, contributing to a seamless online experience. 
 This role is ideal for individuals who are curious about how search engines work and enjoy analyzing data to improve user experience. It requires a balance of attention to detail, strong analytical skills, and a passion for quality. 
 Key Responsibilities: 
- Analyze search result performance and provide insights on relevance and quality. 
- Evaluate and rate the effectiveness of search engine results to ensure they meet user expectations. 
- Offer feedback and recommendations to improve algorithm performance. 
- Conduct quality assurance to ensure search engine results are optimized. 
- Report on trends and areas for improvement in search functionality. 
 Qualifications & Skills: 
- Native-level proficiency in American English, with an understanding of American culture and online trends. 
- Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret and evaluate data. 
- Excellent attention to detail and problem-solving abilities. 
- Reliable internet connection and a comfortable home office setup. 
 Ideal Candidate: 
- Experience in AI, search engine evaluation, or data analysis is a plus, but not essential. 
- Familiarity with online search engines and digital trends. 
- Enjoys providing feedback and improving digital tools. 
- Background in search engine optimization or data analysis is beneficial. 
- Seeks a flexible, remote job that can easily fit around other commitments. 
 Benefits: 
- Flexible working hours that fit your schedule (10-29 hours per week). 
- Work remotely from anywhere in the America. 
- Opportunity to gain experience in the growing field of AI and search engine technology. 
- Enhance your analytical, quality, and research skills. 
- Join a supportive and dynamic team. 
 How to Apply: 
If you're excited to contribute to this innovative project and improve search engines, apply now! We look forward to hearing from you. 
 Currently hiring in Arizona, Florida, Georgia, Illinois (but NOT Chicago), Maine, Minnesota, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Texas, Virginia, Wisconsin. 
Applicants must be of at least 18 years of age to apply.

title: Data Engineer
description:
About the job
Location: Remote (EST Hours)

Are you passionate about challenging the limits of data science and revolutionizing market research through synthetic data? We're looking for a highly skilled Data Engineer to join our client's innovative team. In this pivotal role, you will collaborate with data scientists to design, develop, and optimize scalable data pipelines to support cutting-edge synthetic data initiatives.

We are working with a global enterprise team of researchers who go beyond precise measurement to offer a deeper understanding of society, markets, and people. They combine advanced science, cutting-edge technology, and deep expertise to deliver meaningful, impactful results.

Key Responsibilities:
Build and maintain scalable data pipelines using technologies such as Apache Spark, Kafka, SQL, and NoSQL databases.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure efficient and reliable data processing and storage.
Optimize and improve data infrastructure, ensuring performance, reliability, and data quality.
Utilize cloud platforms (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) to leverage cloud-based data storage and processing solutions.
Deploy and manage data infrastructure using containerization and orchestration tools like Docker and Kubernetes.
Work closely with data scientists on synthetic data generation, AI/ML model deployment, and similar projects.
Implement privacy-preserving technologies and ethical considerations in data processes.

What We're Looking For:
Proven experience in data engineering, with expertise in Apache Spark, Kafka, SQL, and NoSQL.
Proficiency in Python, Java, or Scala, with experience in ETL frameworks and data orchestration tools.
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms and cloud-based data storage.
Familiarity with Docker, Kubernetes, and cloud deployment practices.
Commitment to data quality, with an ability to identify inefficiencies and proactively implement improvements.
Familiarity with synthetic data generation, AI/ML, and privacy-preserving technologies.
Strong communication skills to articulate complex concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Passion for innovation in data science, with a desire to push the limits of synthetic data solutions.

Why Join?
Be at the forefront of synthetic data innovations, shaping the future of market research.
Work in a collaborative environment with a talented team of data engineers, analysts, and scientists.
Flexible working options with opportunities for personal growth and career advancement.

title: Arity - Data Science Intern - Arity
description:
About the job
At Allstate, great things happen when our people work together to protect families and their belongings from life‚Äôs uncertainties. And for more than 90 years our innovative drive has kept us a step ahead of our customers‚Äô evolving needs. From advocating for seat belts, air bags and graduated driving laws, to being an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, and, more recently, device and identity protection.

Job Description

Founded by The Allstate Corporation in 2016, Arity is a data and analytics company focused on improving transportation. We collect and analyze enormous amounts of data, using predictive analytics to build solutions with a single goal in mind: to make transportation smarter, safer and more useful for everyone. At the heart of that mission are the people that work here‚Äîthe dreamers, doers and difference-makers that call this place home. As part of that team, your work will showcase both your intelligence and your creativity as you tackle real problems and put your talents towards transforming transportation. That‚Äôs because at Arity, we believe work and life shouldn‚Äôt be at odds with one another. After all, we know that your unique qualities give you a unique perspective. We don‚Äôt just want you to see yourself here. We want you to be yourself here.

 

The Analytics Team

At Arity, our Data Science team is at the core of helping us transform mobility. We not only know how to analyze and find meaning within billions of miles of driving data collected from smartphones, onboard devices and third parties; we are passionate about how it affects the end-users of our products. On our team people get the opportunity to build scalable distributed data pipelines, develop and deploy an array of machine learning algorithms, and create eye-opening data visualizations. We find top talent from various quantitative disciplines to collaborate with product owners, software engineers, and experience designers in development teams to create innovative products to make transportation smarter, safer, and more useful for everyone.

Where good people build rewarding careers.

This Summer 2025 internship is for students currently enrolled in a graduate degree program. This‚ÄØrole is responsible‚ÄØfor the use and development of data science/geospatial projects and proof of concept business solutions for users in Analytics and Data Science. This person partners with Data Scientists and Data‚ÄØEngineers to provide tactical‚ÄØsolutions in one of the several product segments including insurance, geospatial enrichment, core telematics, and advertising. This is a highly dynamic position that requires a great degree of flexibility, analytic‚ÄØagility and the ability to rapidly adapt to changing business requirements/needs, new technologies and data sources. This role requires close integration and partnership with the business and Data Science team and requires business acumen in order to output the best technical solutions. 

Job Description

Uses best practices, with limited coaching, to develop‚ÄØmachine learning and geospatial techniques to build models that address business needs 
Utilizes effective project planning techniques to break down basic and occasionally moderately complex projects into tasks and ensure deadlines are kept 
Uses and learns a wide variety of tools and languages to achieve results (e.g., Python, Spark, SQL) 
Collaborates with the team in order to improve the effectiveness of business decisions through the use of data and machine learning/predictive modeling 
Innovates on projects by using predictive modeling techniques, deep learning techniques or tools 
Executes on modeling/machine learning projects effectively 
Reviews and evaluates on appropriateness of techniques, given current modeling practices, to senior leadership 

Job Qualifications

Target Start date: May/June 2025 
Currently pursuing a master or PhD degree (strongly preferred) in a quantitative field (e.g. mathematics, statistics, computer or physical science) 
Ability to solve problems, think critically, and communicate clearly 
Knowledge of statistical modeling, machine learning, mathematical optimization, and/or data mining from graduate level course work 
Proven capability of executing end-to-end analytics projects from capstone projects, research projects, or past intern experience 
Demonstrated fluency with Python or R programming 
Experience with Spark or AWS computing services such as EMR, Glue, Sagemaker or data warehouse service like BigQuery is a plus 
Understanding of algorithmic scaling and complexity is a plus 
Compensation offered for this role is between $20 and $42 an hour and is based on experience and qualifications.

Skills

Customer Centricity, Digital Literacy, Inclusive Leadership, Learning Agility, Results-Oriented

Compensation

The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation.

Joining our team isn‚Äôt just a job ‚Äî it‚Äôs an opportunity. One that takes your skills and pushes them to the next level. One that encourages you to challenge the status quo. And one where you can impact the future for the greater good.

You‚Äôll do all this in a flexible environment that embraces connection and belonging. And with the recognition of several inclusivity and diversity awards, we‚Äôve proven that Allstate empowers everyone to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live.

Good Hands. Greater Together.

title: Data Analyst
description:
About the job
Role Overview 
As a Data Analyst within Customer Identity Shared Services, you will be instrumental in driving improvements to customer identity management systems, ensuring secure and efficient customer experiences. Utilizing data analytics and a hypothesis-driven test-and-learn approach, your focus will be on optimizing identity verification processes, enhancing customer authentication journeys, and supporting the overall framework of shared services in customer identity management. 
Working within cross-functional teams, you will create valuable insights into the effectiveness of current identity strategies, identify key opportunities for enhancement, and develop business cases and testing plans to execute on those opportunities. 
You will expand your competencies in customer identity management technologies, grow your business and industry acumen, and demonstrate your ability to manage complex projects across their lifecycle. Additionally, you will contribute innovative solutions to identity management challenges, helping to refine and push the boundaries of our shared services in this domain. 
Key Responsibilities 
Data Analysis & Strategy Design: Extract, analyze, and interpret customer identity data from multiple systems to design, recommend, and execute strategies for customer identity shared services. Utilize tools such as SQL, Heap, Python, Snowflake and R to develop, test, and optimize customer segmentation schemes and authentication strategies. 
Model Development: Apply traditional regression models and machine learning algorithms to understand the drivers of customer behavior in relation to identity management, estimating the impact of different strategies on security and customer experience. 
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with IT, security, and product teams to ensure that customer identity shared services align with broader business goals and customer needs. 
Insight Communication: Effectively summarize and present data-driven insights and results to senior management and stakeholders to inform decision-making and drive strategic initiatives. 
Quality Control & Process Improvement: Implement quality control processes to ensure data accuracy and integrity. Continually enhance existing identity management processes and reporting through automation, quality control measures, and insightful presentations. 
 Requirements 
Educational Background: Bachelor‚Äôs degree (Graduate degree preferred) in a quantitative discipline such as Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field and 5+ years of relevant analytical experience. 
Technical Skills: Strong proficiency in SQL, Python, and Excel; experience with customer identity management platform such as OKTA, multiple types of relational databases, BI tools, and/or additional programming languages is a plus. 
Experience: 4-5 years of experience in a complex, data-driven problem-solving environment 
Problem-Solving: Demonstrated ability to apply a highly analytical approach to complex problems, with a focus on identity management and customer experience. 
Industry Knowledge: Experience in identity management, cybersecurity, or consumer finance industries is preferred.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
About the job
CenterPoint Energy and its predecessor companies have been in business for more than 150 years. 

Our Vision: Our vision is to become the most admired utility in the United States through the execution of our long-term growth strategy. We have an unwavering commitment to safely and reliably deliver electricity and natural gas to millions of people.

Our Commitment: CenterPoint Energy is committed to creating an inclusive work environment where business results are achieved through the skills, abilities and talents of our diverse workforce.

At CenterPoint Energy, individuals are respected for their contributions toward our company objectives. We strive for an inclusive work environment across all levels that is reflective of the available workforce in the communities we serve.

Job Summary

As a Senior Data Engineer, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining data pipelines that support analytical analysis. You will partner with various business clients, data scientists, and data analysts to ensure that the company has access to the data it needs to make informed decisions.

Essential Functions

Develop, construct, test and maintain data acquisition pipelines for large volumes of structed and unstructured data. This includes batch and real-time processing.
Build large and complex datasets based on business requirements.
Construct ‚Äòbig data‚Äô pipeline architecture.
Identifies opportunities for data acquisition via working with stakeholders and business clients.
Leverages a variety of tools such as Python, SAP Data Services, DataFlow, DataStream, Google Cloud Functions, Spark, Google Cloud Run, SAP SLT, Google Pub Sub, and etc. to integrate systems and data pipelines.
Recommends ways to improve data quality, reliability, and efficiency.
Develop JSON messaging structure for integrating with various applications.
Drive a data engineering strategy focused on delivering data in near real-time using serverless technologies.
Develop data architecture to optimize performance for dashboards and digital applications.
Lead the integration track of various strategic projects.
Leverage DevOps and CI/CD practices to ensure the reliability and scalability of data pipelines.


Education Description

Requires a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering or STEM field from an accredited college or university.

Experience

Requires 5+ years of experience in a data engineering role.
Strong SQL background working with a variety of data sources.
Expertise using languages such as Python, Java, or Spark.
Experience leveraging messaging queue technologies such as Kafka and Pub/Sub.
Expertise transforming streaming data using technologies such as DataFlow, DataStream, Spark streaming, or DataBricks.
Expertise developing resilient and scalable data models.
Expertise developing pipelines for unstructured data.
Expertise in native cloud back-end technologies such as BigQuery, DataFlow, Pub/Sub, Cloud Functions, Cloud Run.
Expertise with cloud-based data platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.
Experience with AI and ML ops.
Experience with AI and machine learning.
Experience with DevOps and deploying and maintaining CI CD pipelines.


Physical Requirements

Able to communicate either written and verbal communications either in person or through technical equipment such as telephone. 
Able to demonstrate and apply the manual dexterity to operate a personal computer and common office equipment. 
Able to sit, stand or walk for long periods of time. 
Able to exert up to 10 pounds of force occasionally, and/or a minimal amount of force frequently to lift, carry, push, pull, or otherwise move objects. 


Working Conditions

Required to participate in CenterPoint Energy's Emergency Operation Plan (EOP). 


We want you to know

Being a part of the CenterPoint Energy team is more than a career alone. It's an opportunity to make a positive impact. You will be an integral part of enabling everyday life and the pursuit of possibilities for the customers we serve and the communities we share. The vital services we provide are at the core of making our world work, and by sharing your energy with us, we'll create a better tomorrow together.

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

CenterPoint Energy is committed to creating an inclusive work environment where business results are achieved through the skills, abilities and talents of our diverse workforce.

At CenterPoint Energy, individuals are respected for their contributions toward our company objectives. We strive for an inclusive work environment across all levels that is reflective of the available workforce in the communities we serve.

What We Bring To You

Competitive pay
Paid training
Benefits eligibility begins on your first day
Transit subsidies
Flexible work schedule, paid holidays and paid time off
Access to discounts at fitness clubs and an on-site wellness center at our headquarters in Houston
Professional growth and development programs including tuition reimbursement
401(k) Savings Plan featuring a company match dollar-for-dollar up to 6% and a company contribution of 3% regardless of your contribution

Posting End Date: 10/11/2024

title: VP Data Analytics
description:
About the job
Rush Street Interactive (NYSE: RSI) is a market leader in online casino and sports betting, currently operating real-money gaming with our brands: BetRivers.com, PlaySugarHouse.com, and RushBet.co. We‚Äôre building bridges between online, social and land-based gaming businesses to create amazing, integrated experiences that keep players in the game.

Rush Street Interactive is seeking a dynamic and experienced Vice President of Data Analytics to lead our data initiatives in the rapidly growing sectors of online real-money gaming, online casinos, and sportsbooks. This role demands a strategic thinker who can drive data-driven decisions, enhance business intelligence capabilities, and support the company‚Äôs growth through innovative analytics solutions and teams.

What You Will Do

Leadership and Strategy:

Provide strategic direction for the data analytics function, aligning and influencing the company‚Äôs overall objectives. 
Develop and implement a comprehensive data strategy that supports business growth and operational efficiency by evaluating and identifying the areas for product teams to focus on that will drive the biggest impact to business KPIs. 
Lead, mentor, and manage a team of data scientists, analysts, and engineers. 

Data Management And Analysis

Oversee the collection, storage, and processing of large data sets from various sources, ensuring data integrity, accuracy, and scalable data insights. 
Develop and maintain advanced analytics models, including predictive modeling, customer segmentation, customer LTV, financial projections, and marketing mix analysis. 
Utilize data visualization tools to create and present actionable insights to senior management and stakeholders. 

Innovation And Improvement

Identify opportunities to leverage machine learning and AI to enhance data analytics capabilities. 
Stay abreast of industry trends and emerging technologies to continuously improve data analytics practices. 
Implement automation tools and techniques to streamline data processing and analysis. 

Collaboration And Communication

Partner with key stakeholders across marketing, product, operations, engineering, finance, compliance, and other departments to drive data-informed decision-making. 
Communicate complex data insights in a clear and actionable manner to non-technical audiences. 
Support cross-functional projects by providing data-driven insights and recommendations. 

All About You

Minimum of 10-12 years of experience in data analytics, data science, or business intelligence roles, with at least 5 years in a leadership position. 
Proven track record of managing large data sets and delivering impactful business insights. 
Experience in the consumer technology, mobile gaming, online casino, or sportsbook industry is highly desirable. 
Proficiency in advanced analytics techniques such as multivariate regression analysis, predictive modeling, and ROI measurement. 
Expertise in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL. 
Expertise with A/B testing tools. 
Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar. 
Strong leadership and team management abilities. 
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. 
Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. 

Qualifications

Bachelors, Master‚Äôs, or Ph.D. degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, or another quantitative field. 
Experience working in technology, consulting, or finance. 
Proven track record of leadership in business intelligence, analytics, or related roles, with at least 7 years of experience in a leadership role. 
Strong experience leveraging data to drive revenue growth and user engagement. 
Expertise in data analysis tools and platforms, such as Looker, Tableau, Power BI, or similar technologies. 
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations for stakeholders. 
Demonstrated ability to lead and inspire a diverse team, fostering a culture of creativity, collaboration, and accountability. 

As a rapidly growing company in an emerging industry, you‚Äôll have a huge impact on our product and our company. We like proactive team members and strive to have a company of self-disciplined professionals who enjoy collaboration, having fun, and of course, achieving together what others believe to be improbable. We are dedicated to treating everyone with respect and to support your professional and personal growth.

Rush Street Interactive is an equal opportunity employer and committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, sexual identity, and expression, marital status, family status, lifestyle, age, culture, religion, military, and veteran status, citizenship, or disability.

Be at the forefront of this ground-breaking industry! Apply now!

title: Manager, Data Science
description:
About the job
About Annalect

Annalect is the Data & Technology arm of Omnicom Media Group

Annalect‚Äôs 2,000+ innovators leverage data and technology to help clients across Omnicom build relationships that matter ‚Äî whether that means fostering consumers‚Äô trust in brands, building new experiences, or delivering advanced analytics where it‚Äôs most needed. Annalect is the driving force behind Omni, Omnicom‚Äôs unique open operating system, which works hand-in-hand with clients‚Äô and partners‚Äô data and tools, to orchestrate better marketing outcomes.

Annalect‚Äôs unique approach to data and technology ‚Äì one that relies on transparency, neutrality, and interoperability ‚Äì allows us to deliver purpose-built and scalable solutions that make data actionable. Our advanced teams of product leaders, data scientists, consultants, and engineers enable us to meet the business goals of our internal and external clients.

Team Overview

We are a team of engaged data-curious professionals who continuously seek new and improved ways to learn from our extensive data assets. We share ideas, code, outcomes, and credit for our collective efforts. We're looking for explorative, independent data scientists to grow with us as we tackle ever-changing challenges.

Position Overview

As a member of the Annalect Data Science team, you will work with client team strategists and media buyers to build insightful solutions that shape the strategic direction of your client‚Äôs marketing plans through data-driven insights. You will work with the rest of the data science team to build new utilities, improve existing solutions and explore a wide variety of datasets.

Key Responsibilities

Lead exploration and experimentation with a large number of datasets to draw insights and search for client specific as well as general solutions
Work with and combine data from multiple event-based media sources (ad servers, DSPs and tag management solutions) and user-based files (client customer data, panel data, 3rd party datasets) warehoused on multiple platforms (AWS Redshift, AWS Athena, and Google Cloud Platform)
Uncovering audience insights for clients:
Guiding non-technical stakeholders in choosing the right analysis to answer open-ended questions
Independently formulating and executing an analytics plan; iteratively building on client feedback to get to a satisfactory answer
Translating quantitative results back into actionable insights and interesting storytelling
Hands-on machine learning and statistical modeling
Build and maintain tools to process, visualize and analyze data
Deploy scalable solutions to cloud-based infrastructure
Assist with audience segmentation and machine learning via our proprietary marketing and insights platform
Develop data insights across a variety of client products
Evaluate new data and tools; quickly learning to navigate new platforms; extract, transform, and load data from various partner cloud storage solutions
Document and sharing knowledge with a wide variety of Annalect and Omnicom teams

Required Skills And Qualifications

5 to 10 years of relevant experience
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, engineering, information management, social sciences or business/marketing related fields. Advanced quantitative degree or intensive bootcamp experience is preferred.
Must have hands-on expertise in Python, SQL proficiency preferred as well
Experience with cloud computing such as AWS or Google Cloud Platform and others
Experience leading and directing data scientist efforts
Experience managing data scientists, preferably in a media environment

Perks of working at Annalect

Culture! We have an incredibly fun, collaborative environment that encourages engagement and work/life balance
Generous PTO that includes vacation days, personal days, a fantastic Summer Friday program and extended time off around the holiday season.
As part of Omnicom, we have the backing and resources of a global billion-dollar company, but also have the flexibility and pace of a ‚Äústartup‚Äù - we move fast, break things, and innovate.

This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on relevant experience, other job-related qualifications/skills, and geographic location (to account for comparative cost of living). The Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, benefits include: health insurance, vision insurance, dental insurance, 401(k), Healthcare Flexible Spending Account, Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account, vacation days, sick days, personal days, paid parental leave, paid medical leave, and STD/LTD insurance benefits.

Compensation Range

$101,500‚Äî$145,000 USD

Annalect, a division of Omnicom Media Group is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.

Review Our Recruitment Privacy Notice

title: Product Manager - Data & Analytics
description:
About the job
GoHealth Intro: As a leading health insurance marketplace, Go Health‚Äôs mission is to improve access to healthcare in America. For customers, enrolling in a health insurance plan is confusing and difficult, and seemingly small differences between plans can lead to significant out-of-pocket costs or lack of access to critical medicines and even providers. We use our technology, data science, agents, and expertise to cut through the confusion and get customers enrolled in a plan with the right coverage and benefits.

Why Apply: GoHealth has established a culture where our employees feel empowered, engaged and inspired. We are looking for builders who will contribute to the long-term health of the company. We also understand that you may not check every box in our requirements list, most applicants don‚Äôt! In fact, frequently cited statistics show that women and underrepresented groups apply to jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. GoHealth encourages you to break that statistic and to apply today!

About The Role

As a Product Manager within GoHealth‚Äôs Product Management team, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our AI, data and analytics capabilities. This is a newly formed team focused on addressing critical business challenges through robust data and analytics foundation capabilities, including a unified data & AI platform, data & AI governance with master data management practices, and customer 360. The key objectives are to improve how organization runs, grows and optimizes the business while delivering personalized shopping experiences for Medicare consumers.

In this role, you will manage AI Ready Data capabilities for both predictive and generative AI model building. For predictive AI, you will design a solution to perform data analysis, feature engineering, feature discovery, partitioning, sampling strategies, and more. For generative AI, you will work on defining the strategies for accessing unstructured multi-model data, and document and text processing such as vectorization and knowledge graph building. You will draw from your extensive knowledge and experience in both data preparation for model building, integrating and deploying it to production pipelines and workflow experience endpoints at scale.

What You Will Do

Dive deep into complex challenges faced by our external (Medicare consumers and Health Plans) and internal (Business leaders, Data Science, ML engineering, Product experience & design) stakeholders.
Gather Voice of Customer and translate it into valuable insights to define and prioritize roadmap.
Lead technical discussions and be a thought leader to identify the appropriate AI model for business outcome metrics, make sound decisions and influence business direction through data-driven analysis.
Work with data scientists, ML engineers, analysts, and software developers to guide the development of the models and deployment to endpoints.
Conduct regular product reviews to measure the product success; monitor and track model and product performance against these metrics.
Contribute to the overall product strategy by establishing scalable AI & data foundation.

What We Are Looking For

4+ years hands-on experience or working knowledge in Data Prep and Machine Learning or Generative AI product development and deployment to experience workflows
Strong data acumen, statistical analysis and problem-solving ability to track key performance indicators (KPIs), and make data-driven decisions to optimize AI products
Understanding the fundamentals of machine learning, deep learning, and data science, including practical applications and limitations
Familiarity with programming languages such as Python, SQL, and JavaScript, as well as AI frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, and understanding of cloud-based infrastructure
Proficiency in sourcing, understanding, and validating data, ensuring it is relevant and ethically procured
Exceptional ability to translate AI & data product strategy into executable and prioritized roadmap, considering cross-functional dependencies.
Creative execution with ability to manage several initiatives in different stages of product lifecycle.
A systems thinker, effective written and verbal communicator, and the ability to influence stakeholders at various levels of organization.

If you are passionate about driving innovation in AI, data and analytics and are excited about leading transformative projects in dynamic healthcare technology environment, we encourage you to apply for this role. Join us in shaping the future of data-driven decision-making at GoHealth.

Location: Hybrid/On-site

Benefits‚ÄØ&‚ÄØPerks

Open vacation policy because work life balance is important 
401k program with company match 
Employee Stock Purchase Program
Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance benefits 
Paid maternity and paternity leave
Professional growth opportunities 
Generous employee referral bonuses
Employee Resource Groups
Work from Home Stipend 
Tax-free commuter benefits
GoHealth is an Equal Opportunity Employer 

GoHealth Privacy Policy

title: Data Analytics Senior Manager
description:
About the job
Position: Data Analytics Senior Manager
Location: Remote
Hours: Normal M-F, 8-5
Duration: Perm
Salary: $120k-$150k
Interview Process: one and done virtual
 
Must Haves:
Must have a strong accounting background coming from one of the Big 4 accounting firms (PwC, KPMG, Deloitte, EY)
ETL Automation: Alteryx
Visualization: Tableau / MSFT PowerBI
Code-Based: Python (R acceptable but not preferred)
Data Query: SQL (T-SQL) / (mySQL acceptable but not preferred)
Relational Data: Understanding of Database syntax (Table Structure, Joins, Filters)
Analytics background and experience, preferably in a client service environment
Solid communication, teaming, presentation and project management skills
Ability to research and generate ad-hoc solutions to problems
Strong Excel skills ‚Äì Using formulas (VLOOKUP, SUMIF, IF statements, INDEX/MATCH etc.)

1) Must have: The candidate should have strong soft skills and general areas of technical competence, as this is the backbone of the candidate‚Äôs day to day work in the Business Transformation group.
2) ‚ÄòMajor‚Äô concentration: At least one technical skill that the user is Certified in and has been using on a consistent basis for 2+ years; Considers themselves near ‚Äòfluent‚Äô or ‚Äòsuper-user‚Äô.
3) ‚ÄòMinor‚Äô concentrations: At least 2+ technical skills that the individual has at the very least.
 
Day to Day: 
Our client is seeking a data driven team member to join the Data and Analytics team in Business Transformation as a Senior Manager. As a member of the team, you will be collaborating with clients by creating, developing, designing, and implementing processes and tools that will change how our clients use their most powerful resource ‚Äì data. The Data and Analytics team helps clients define data strategies, build automation processes, and develop visualizations + predictive analytics tools to deliver impactful solutions and help our clients achieve business objectives using a data driven approach.
 You will be responsible for managing various client projects, communicating business objectives to cross-functional stakeholders and providing input on both business process operations and data analytics tool specifications. You will be expected to work independently yet collaboratively with key stakeholders across a client‚Äôs organization to oversee projects and drive transformation. Additional responsibilities include tasks specific to scope development, budget creation and monitoring, as well as development of internal tools and templates to help drive team development.
 An effective team member can incorporate a strong CPA/Finance background in building client solutions to address client‚Äôs business needs using data analytics tools. The team is tool agnostic in building a customized solution for our clients and uses various tools such as Python or Alteryx for data business process automation and PowerBI or Tableau for dashboarding. Effective communication and organizational skills will be imperative to your success in this role. Requisite working knowledge gained through professional working experience on data analytics projects is foundational to successfully initiate, plan, execute, monitor, control, and close projects.
 
 Roles and Responsibilities:

¬∑ Hands-on experience translating data and analytics into actionable insights with ability to create reports and present observations to clients in a clear and concise manner.
¬∑ Able to design and execute the transformation and analysis of large structured and unstructured / quantitative and qualitative datasets.
¬∑ Strong problem-solving skills with ability to work independently, owning and driving projects from requirements through execution by implementing various data analytics solutions.
¬∑ Work closely with stakeholders to understand their business needs, developing and maintaining strong internal and client relationships to manage cross-functional projects/initiatives.
¬∑ Senior Manager-level candidates must have project management experience in cross-functional engagements including accounting/finance, FP&A, modeling, and/or tech implementation.
¬∑ Must be able to effectively communicate complex, technical topics to a novice, non-technical audience with a passion for collaboration, learning new technologies, and client success.
¬∑ Ability to manage individual and supporting staff workflows and task responsibilities.

Skills and Competencies:

¬∑ Alteryx
¬∑ Power Automate
¬∑ PowerBI
¬∑ Tableau
¬∑ Data Architecture
¬∑ Data Modeling / Analytics
¬∑ Strong Excel skills
¬∑ Finance/Accounting background
¬∑ Data Science
¬∑ Data Visualization
¬∑ Solution Architecture
¬∑ Workflow Automation
¬∑ Programming (e.g., SQL, Java, Python, R)
¬∑ RDMS (relational database management systems)
¬∑ Exposure to data platforms (e.g., Snowflake, Databricks)
¬∑ Data Engineering

title: Data Scientist
description:

title: Data Scientist
description:
About the job
Job Description: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Data Scientist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Natural Language Processing (NLP), Machine Learning (ML), and Deep Learning (DL) technologies. You will be responsible for building data classifiers, extracting meaningful insights from large data sets, and applying your expertise in AI/ML to solve specific problems.

Key Responsibilities:
Apply data mining techniques to extract valuable insights from large datasets.
Perform statistical analysis and build high-quality prediction systems integrated with products.
Develop and maintain ETL pipelines for ingesting and conforming data for further analysis using tools such as AWS Glue and Pentaho.
Automate the classification of text using machine learning techniques.
Utilize cloud-based data science tools such as AWS Bedrock, SageMaker, QuickSight, and Azure OpenAI Studio.
Build automated data classification systems.
Work with various database architectures and structures, including SQL, NoSQL, and vector databases.

Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and R.
Experience with cloud-based data science tools (AWS Bedrock, SageMaker, QuickSight; Azure OpenAI Studio, etc.).
Strong background in building automated data classification systems.
Familiarity with database architectures and structures, including SQL, NoSQL, and vector databases.
Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field.
A minimum of 5 years of related experience.

Preferred Skills and Expertise:
Experience building text classifiers that label unstructured text into predefined categories using techniques such as Relevance Vector Machines, decision trees, linear regression, Na√Øve Bayes classifiers, Named Entity Recognition, and related supervised learning techniques.
Custom software development for Machine Learning in Python using common libraries such as NumPy, Scikit-learn, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Pandas, and SQLAlchemy.
Experience with automated and manual text data annotation using tools such as SageMaker Ground Truth, Prodi.gy, SuperAnnotate, Doccano, and custom software solutions.
Expertise in building Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) pipelines for machine learning using custom Python code and enterprise ETL tools such as Pentaho, AWS Glue, Hadoop, and Apache Airflow.
Extensive knowledge of the agencies, programs, and overall organization of the U.S. federal government.

title: Senior Applied Data Scientist
description:
About the job
dunnhumby is the global leader in Customer Data Science, empowering businesses everywhere to compete and thrive in the modern data-driven economy. We always put the Customer First.

Our mission: to enable businesses to grow and reimagine themselves by becoming advocates and champions for their Customers. With deep heritage and expertise in retail ‚Äì one of the world‚Äôs most competitive markets, with a deluge of multi-dimensional data ‚Äì dunnhumby today enables businesses all over the world, across industries, to be Customer First.

dunnhumby employs nearly 2,500 experts in offices throughout Europe, Asia, Africa, and the Americas working for transformative, iconic brands such as Tesco, Coca-Cola, Meijer, Procter & Gamble and Metro.

We‚Äôre looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our Applied Data Science (ADS) team. It‚Äôs a chance to apply your expertise to distil complex problems into compelling insight to deliver effective and impactful solutions for clients. You‚Äôll investigate, develop, implement and deploy a range of solutions for our retailer and CPG clients. The role will involve collaborating with various cross-functional teams (e.g. Account management, Data Engineering, Product Management).

What We Expect From You

Degree in a quantitative subject such as Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, or a related discipline.
Programming skills (Hadoop, Spark, SQL, Python)
Prototyping in data visualization tools 
Analytical Consulting expertise & strong communication skills
Bias to action- Balance between experimentation and application to make progress
Strong knowledge of Statistical modelling & Causal Inference techniques
Quality Assurance and Testing

What You Can Expect From Us

We won‚Äôt just meet your expectations. We‚Äôll defy them. So you‚Äôll enjoy the comprehensive rewards package you‚Äôd expect from a leading technology company. But also, a degree of personal flexibility you might not expect. Plus, thoughtful perks, like flexible working hours and your birthday off.

You‚Äôll also benefit from an investment in cutting-edge technology that reflects our global ambition. But with a nimble, small-business feel that gives you the freedom to play, experiment and learn.

And we don‚Äôt just talk about diversity and inclusion. We live it every day ‚Äì with thriving networks including dh Gender Equality Network, dh Proud, dh Family, dh One and dh Thrive as the living proof. We want everyone to have the opportunity to shine and perform at your best throughout our recruitment process. Please let us know how we can make this process work best for you. For an informal and confidential chat please contact stephanie.winson@dunnhumby.com to discuss how we can meet your needs.

Our approach to Flexible Working 

At dunnhumby, we value and respect difference and are committed to building an inclusive culture by creating an environment where you can balance a successful career with your commitments and interests outside of work.

We believe that you will do your best at work if you have a work / life balance. Some roles lend themselves to flexible options more than others, so if this is important to you please raise this with your recruiter, as we are open to discussing agile working opportunities during the hiring process.

For further information about how we collect and use your personal information please see our Privacy Notice which can be found (here)

title: Data Science Manager - NLP / LLMs
description:
About the job
Data Science Manager - NLP / LLMs

The business develop a cutting-edge customer intelligence tool that empowers major brands, such as Disney and Est√©e Lauder, to deeply understand the preferences and trends within their customer base. Their platform leverages advanced Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Large Language Models (LLMs) to transform unstructured text data into actionable insights, driving strategic decisions for global brands.

The ideal candidate is currently working as a Manager, Principal Data Scientist, or Lead Data Scientist and brings a proven track record of managing small, high-performing teams (4-8 members, for example) in a startup environment. A strong background in NLP is imperative, and applicants must have experience working with Large Language Models. This role is pivotal to shaping the future of the business' customer intelligence platform, driving innovation, and ensuring the delivery of world-class solutions that meet the needs of their customers.

Key Responsibilities:

Team Leadership: Lead, mentor, and manage a small team of data scientists, providing guidance on project priorities, technical approaches, and professional development.
Project Management: Oversee the end-to-end lifecycle of data science projects, from ideation and research to deployment and monitoring, ensuring timely delivery and alignment with business objectives.

title: Business Data Officer
description:
About the job
Job Description

The Business Data Officer will develop and implement data analytics capabilities for the Commercial banking team from scratch. This role involves collaborating with senior leaders throughout the Commercial Bank.

Reporting directly to the Chief Data Officer, the Business Data Officer will oversee and manage resources and participate in the Data Strategy Executive Committee.

The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of commercial banking, with the ability to identify strategic opportunities and guide resources to enhance key data capabilities.

In this role, the Business Data Officer will set, plan, and manage the objectives and roadmap for the commercial data team. They will provide strategic direction and work closely with the Commercial CIO and CFO.

Key Accountabilities

Commercial Data Roadmap & Management Reporting:

Possesses a deep understanding of both business and data strategies. 
Works closely with the Commercial CFO and CIO to develop and sustain the data roadmap. 
Strategizes and oversees the implementation of a data consumption layer (semantic) in the modern data warehouse to facilitate ease of use and self-service. 
Manages and supervises data projects within the designated business line. 
Collaborates with the Chief Data Architect to review and approve proposed architectures for data assets in specific business areas. 
Provides periodic updates to the executive leadership team regarding the data roadmap. 
Understands the processes for collecting, managing, and storing commercial data across the organization. 
Builds and maintains trust, serving as an advisor on leveraging data to enhance performance and shape business-wide strategies. 
Delivers management reporting. 

Commercial Data Governance & Controls

Has a comprehensive understanding of the commercial data landscape and collaborates to define business ownership. 
Plays a highly collaborative role in overseeing data governance. 
Provides executive leadership with updates on data risks and issues. 
Establishes and enforces data controls within their business line. 
Offers thought leadership on Data Policies, Standards, and Procedures. 
Monitors and ensures adherence to established policies and standards. 
Acts as the Information Owner for strategic data platforms, ensuring their resilience, security, access, and data flow. 
Contributes to data privacy policies and ensures compliance with data protection regulations. 

Commercial Data Team Management

Oversees projects related to data management, analytics, and governance. 
Responsible for growing, leading, motivating, and managing the commercial data team. 
Develops and maintains a communication plan for engaging with partners, team members, and senior leadership. 
Focuses on actively coaching and advancing the careers of data team members. 
Advises senior leadership on fostering a data-driven culture across the organization. 
Collaborates closely with the technology department to create an environment that ensures data and information are accessible with proper access controls. 

Qualifications And Education Requirements

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field. 
Over 10 years of experience in a senior data management role. 
At least 5 years of experience in building and maintaining data governance frameworks. 
At least 5 years of experience in developing and implementing data lifecycle policies and standards. 
At least 5 years of experience in the banking and finance sector. 
Over 5 years of experience in managing and leading teams. 
Proficiency in PowerBI, SQL, and/or SAS. 
Knowledge of industry best practices in Data Architecture, Analytics/Reporting, and Governance. 
Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills, particularly with executive leadership. 
Proven ability to drive and lead cultural change initiatives. 
Exceptional project management skills. 
Results-oriented with creativity and analytical thinking, and comfortable in a collaborative environment. 
Experience working with senior leadership and executives. 
Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet tight deadlines. 

Key Competencies for Position

Strategic Vision ‚Äì Develop and apply a strategic mindset to drive initiatives forward. 
Effective Communication ‚Äì Communicate openly and effectively with stakeholders at all levels. 
Decision-Making and Problem Solving ‚Äì Pursue a deeper understanding of issues and take decisive action to resolve them. 

Key Measures Of Success/Key Deliverables

Active Engagement ‚Äì Take a hands-on approach in building analytics solutions with the team. 
Guidance and Best Practices ‚Äì Provide best practices and control guidance to ensure effective approaches. 
Alignment with Strategy ‚Äì Prioritize and coordinate work with the senior team to ensure delivery plans are aligned with ONB's business strategy. 

**We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, ethnic origin, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.**

title: Staff Data Architect/DBA
description:
About the job
Conexess Group is aiding a national client in their search for a Staff Data Architect/DBA.

The Opportunity

As a Data Architect, you'll play a pivotal role in driving technical excellence with our dynamic teams. Collaborating closely with product, design, architects, and engineers, you'll lead the design, implementation and ongoing management of our data resources and cutting-edge solutions. Your contributions will be instrumental in the advancement of our platform, ensuring its scalability, reliability, and innovation. This position offers an exciting opportunity for a data professional that is passionate about technical innovation and using data to help our company grow.

Responsibilities:

 Data Modeling: Understand current data utilization, methods and models in order to architect a new data model that supports current product capabilities including reporting and future data analysis. 
 Governance: Develop and enforce data governance policies and best practices to ensure data integrity and compliance. 
 Collaboration: Work closely with product owners, designers, architects and platform engineers to define scope and drive the implementation of new features from conception to release. 
 Continuous Improvement: Regularly evaluate and enhance the data architecture to adapt to evolving business needs. 
 Leadership: Provide leadership and strategic direction for data-related projects and initiatives. 
 Quality Assurance: Ensure data quality, integrity, and consistency across all data systems and processes. 
 Audits & Assessments: Conduct regular assessments and audits of the data architecture and related processes to ensure compliance and efficiency. 
 Hands-on Administration: Responsible for ensuring data sources are being backed up and restorable. Ensure monitoring is in place and analyze metrics on a regular basis to guarantee up-time, recognize anomalous activity, and forecast possible issues by observing changes in resource utilization patterns. 
 Hands-on Assistance: Work with engineers to develop stored procedures, troubleshoot existing ORM performance issues, and aid in the retrieval of data for troubleshooting. Assist in platform deployments to ensure that database upgrades run smoothly and ensure that data is being populated as expected. 
 Database Design and Performance Tuning: Familiar with AWS RDS and Serverless SQL clusters. Will be responsible for building views, access patterns, and stored procedures for performant and secure data access by the application later. 
 Disaster Recovery: Responsible for data fix and realtime database rollback plan to manage data corruption. Responsible for maintaining backup and restore strategy for the databases. 
 Cost Management: responsible for maintaining and extending cost control automation for the data sources. 
 Quicksights Visualizations: Quicksights is used for both internal and external reporting, which will require updates and maintenance. 

Qualifications:

 Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field. 
 5-7+ years of proven experience as a Data Architect/DBA in an AWS environment. 
 Extensive experience in data modeling, database design, data governance, and data warehousing. 
 Experience in managing and optimizing databases with MySQL, DynamoDB, ElasticSearch, Athena, and Postgres. 
 Strong knowledge of AWS cloud platform including services such as RDS, Redshift, S3 and Quicksight. 
 Proficient in performance tuning, query optimization, database backup and recovery procedures. 
 Proven leadership and communication skills. 
 Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail. 

Personal Qualities:

 Leadership Experience: Demonstrating effective leadership and mentorship, fostering innovation, and driving successful outcomes through collaborative decision-making. 
 Communication Excellence: Excelling in keeping peers and stakeholders informed, particularly during critical customer-impacting scenarios. Demonstrating the ability to convey complex technical concepts clearly and succinctly. 
 Agile Affinity: Seamlessly incorporating Agile/Scrum methodologies into project workflows, fostering adaptability and efficiency within the team. 
 Problem Solving: Exhibiting an unparalleled knack for tackling intricate, ambiguous challenges head-on. 
 Detail-Oriented: Exceptionally meticulous and attentive to every detail. 

Benefits

Our benefits package is designed to reward contribution and loyalty and to attract the kind of talented individuals who have their pick of employers. We offer a highly competitive package comprising:

 Competitive Base Salary: Compensation aligns with experience and special expertise. 
 Stock Options: Options vest over a 4-year period, with 25% vesting each year, offering a long-term incentive for your contribution to the company's growth. 
 Core Benefits: Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and matching 401K plans. Personalization options are available. 

Work Authorization

Applicants must be authorized to work for ANY employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa at this time.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
About the job
Senior Data Scientist

On-site Location: Washington, DC

Home office: Arlington, VA

Clearance Required: TS/SCI

People Centered. Data Driven

Elder Research Inc. is a Data Science consulting firm specialized in providing analytic solutions

to clients in Commercial and Government industries. Providing analytic solutions to hundreds of

companies across numerous industries, our team enjoys a great variety in the type of work they

do and exposure to a wide range of techniques and tools

We are trusted advisors to our clients, building lasting relationships and partnering as preferred

analytics providers. We use a variety of programming languages and tools to create analytic

solutions, often fitting within our clients‚Äô environment and needs.

Join our team and find great opportunities to hone your analytic skills, work on complex

problems with amazing teammates, and gain valuable analytics consulting experience.

Summary of Position

As a Data Scientist, you will work directly with Department of Homeland Security managers,

product owners, and technical staff to understand business needs, develop technical plans, and

deliver data-driven analytical solutions that solve client problems. You will primarily create and

deploy predictive models from a wide variety of data sources and types using the latest

mathematical and statistical methods.

Required Degree And Experience

Bachelor Degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., statistics, mathematics, operations research, engineering or computer science) + 7 years of experience.
Masters Degree + 5 years of experience
PhD + 2 years of experience

Essential Functions

Exploration, cleaning, and wrangling to understand available data
Meetings and discussions with clients and co-workers to refine understanding of the business problem at hand
Trying different predictive modeling approaches to identify the best fit for a given set of business understanding, available data, and project timeline
Writing re-usable code in R, Python, Java, Scala, SQL, or other languages, and working to refine it through code review and discussion
Applying statistics to understand the significance of different attributes
Preparing presentations, writing reports, and working to communicate technical results to clients with varying levels of analytic sophistication
Ability to work independently in a collaborative, dynamic, cross-functional environment

Required Skills

Proficiency with unsupervised, semi-supervised, and supervised learning algorithms and technologies.
Proficient with one of more of the following programming languages (Java, C++, Python, R)
Proficient with SQL; strong understanding of relational databases
Demonstrated experience applying data science methods to real-world problems.
Knowledge and experience in data wrangling, advanced statistical data analysis and modeling
Capable of communicating complex models and concepts in non-technical language
Comfortable learning new things and working outside of your comfort zone
Proficient in data science lifecycle methodologies such as CRISP-DM and TDSP

Desired Skills

Domain expertise: insider threat, intelligence data sources (HUMINT, SIGINT, IMINT, and OSINT)
Experience working with some of the following technologies: AWS, Azure, Solr, NoSQL databases (MongoDB, DynamoDB, Redis, HBase, Cassandra, Accumulo, Neo4j, etc.), Caffe/TensorFlow/Keras/etc, Hadoop, Spark, Pig

About Elder Research, Inc.

Elder Research is a growing consulting firm specializing in data (analytics, data science, AI and

machine learning), and related strategy and training. Our organization has over 25 years of

experience and 100+ practitioners that have partnered with hundreds of organizations to

achieve significant value through innovative applications of data, analytics, and people-

centered processes.

 We are tackling hard problems, big and small, where off-the-shelf solutions don‚Äôt work

or don‚Äôt exist. To achieve success, we value humble, hardworking teammates with the

ability to be flexible, think critically and experiment.

At Elder Research, you‚Äôll be part of a fun, friendly, and supportive community where we need

each other to succeed, your point of view matters, and asking questions with a beginner‚Äôs

mindset is applauded. In keeping with our entrepreneurial spirit, we want candidates that are

self-motivated with an innate curiosity and strong team work ethic. We are constantly learning

and offer teammates free access to a wide range of learning opportunities including Elder‚Äôs

own platform statistics.com and technical mentors or sponsors. Broadening and deepening

your technical and consulting skills both on the job and off is something we are passionate

About, And We Pay You To Do It.

To achieve success on defense, intelligence, and security work we frequently bring together the

expertise of decision-makers, analysts, agents, investigators, and even behavioral scientists. Our

team enjoys great variety in the type of work they do and exposure to a wide range of analytic

techniques and tools.

Elder Research, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive

consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation,

gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated

against on the basis of disability.

About Us

Scientific Research Corporation is an advanced information technology and engineering company that provides innovative products and services to government and private industry, as well as independent institutions. At the core of our capabilities is a seasoned team of highly skilled engineers and scientists with multidisciplinary backgrounds. This team is challenged daily to provide cutting edge technology solutions to our clients.

Scientific Research Corporation offers a competitive salary, an extensive benefits package and a work environment that encourages excellence. For positions requiring a security clearance, selected applicants will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

DIVERSITY & INCLUSION

We strongly believe in the abundance of differences among individuals. We value different points of view and appreciate diverse perspectives. We truly believe this is what makes our organization inclusive and more responsive to the needs of our diverse customers.

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

Scientific Research Corporation is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer that does not discriminate in employment.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

Scientific Research Corporation endeavors to make www.scires.com accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact srchr@scires.com for assistance. This contact information is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

title: Data Scientist
description:
About the job
Your Responsibilities

Lockton Dunning Benefits is currently seeking a Data Scientist who will be responsible for developing, maintaining, and supporting the data science solutions for the company. This includes the collection, aggregation, and analysis of data from multiple sources to provide insights, reporting, interactive visualization for functional management and decision making. In addition, you will contribute to the culture and processes that support a high functioning team and the organization more broadly.

Evaluating large and complex data sets for the purpose of correlative and causal pattern discovery, trend driver analysis, predictive modeling, and financial forecasting
Developing programming solutions to address unique situational needs, calling upon a diverse array of analytics methods and programming languages
Build dashboards and exhibits that monitor key metrics and derive insights for a wide range of audiences
Collaborate closely with and provide analytical guidance to Lockton consulting teams: strategic, clinical, pharmacy, account service, etc. 
Responsible for accurate and thorough documentation of product/components
Requirement clarification, design, and implementation for software product/solution releases
Contribute to continuous improvement of software development best practices in the areas of coding tools, languages and APIs, agile software design and development processes
Designs and implements new, unit tested, software; maintains and enhances existing software
Create/Design Database structures
Develop, integrate, test and deliver high quality, robust solutions in a time bound manner as per the requirements
Execute and deliver as per project plans
Work with peers and leaders within the Data Science practice, as well as other Lockton associates and Lockton clients for smooth implementation and testing of the application at client location if required
Contribute to the creation of re-usable tools and libraries
Document, track, and monitor bugs, problems, and issues to ensure timely resolution
Provide insight and assistance to the data and analytics staff 

Qualifications

2+ years of relevant data analytics programming and/or insurance company experience, and an understanding of risk and insurance
Experience developing Machine Learning models and Predictive Analytics algorithms
Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs in data science, computer science, operations research, statistics, actuarial mathematics, applied mathematics, or a related quantitative field
Ability to manage/maintain large data sets and process through various software, applications, and programming languages: Excel, PowerBI, PowerQuery, SQL, R, Python, SAS, etc. 
Ability to communicate complex analytical concepts and visualize results and analysis verbally and through software such as PowerPoint
Strong organizational skills, along with excellent planning, analysis, and problem-solving capabilities
Proven ability to work in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment and multi-task effectively 
Excellent organizational, mathematics, and data skills
Intellectual curiosity, and drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques
Proven critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Attention to detail
Willingness to take initiative and propose solutions and next steps without explicit direction
Big Data/Real Time Analytics experience & Data warehouse/Data mining experience

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
About the job
We are
At Synechron, we believe in the power of digital to transform businesses for the better. Our global consulting firm combines creativity and innovative technology to deliver industry-leading digital solutions. Synechron‚Äôs progressive technologies and optimization strategies span end-to-end Artificial Intelligence, Consulting, Digital, Cloud & DevOps, Data, and Software Engineering, servicing an array of noteworthy financial services and technology firms. Through research and development initiatives in our FinLabs we develop solutions for modernization, from Artificial Intelligence and Blockchain to Data Science models, Digital Underwriting, mobile-first applications and more. Over the last 20+ years, our company has been honored with multiple employer awards, recognizing our commitment to our talented teams. With top clients to boast about, Synechron has a global workforce of 14,000+, and has 55 offices in 20 countries within key global markets.

Job Title: Business Analyst with KYC
Job Locations: Irving TX

Our challenge
We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Business Analyst having knowledge on KYC analysis to join our team. The Business Analyst will be responsible for analyzing business processes, identifying areas for improvement, and developing strategies to enhance efficiency and productivity.

The Role
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their needs and gather detailed business requirements.
Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform business decisions.
keeping records of transactions to ensure that all legal requirements are met and that the correct data is recorded.
Complete KYC on boarding for new and pre-exiting customer (KYC Refresh) by reviewing client documentation, vendor databases, and data entered into proprietary
Examine transaction records for precision and agreement with other system records
Propose and design technical and process solutions that meet business needs and objectives.
Work with IT and other departments to implement solutions and ensure they align with business goals.
Communicate findings, recommendations, and project updates to stakeholders and executives.
Create detailed documentation of business requirements, processes, and solutions.
Participate in testing and validating new systems and processes to meet business requirements.
Identify opportunities for process improvements and contribute to ongoing optimization efforts.

Requirements:
You are:
Perform the required KYC screening on new clients by documenting and corroborating the information obtained on the client as required
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
Experience with business process modelling and documentation tools.
Knowledge of project management methodologies and tools.

It would be great if you also had:
Certification CFCI or relevant

We can offer you:
¬∑ A highly competitive compensation and benefits package
¬∑ A multinational organization with 55 offices in 20 countries and the possibility to work abroad
¬∑ Laptop and a mobile phone
¬∑ 10 days of paid annual leave (plus sick leave and national holidays)
¬∑ A comprehensive insurance plan including: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and long-/short-term disability (plans vary by region)
¬∑ Retirement savings plans
¬∑ A higher education certification policy
¬∑ Extensive training opportunities, focused on skills, substantive knowledge, and personal development
¬∑ On-demand Udemy for Business for all Synechron employees with free access to more than 5000 curated courses
¬∑ Coaching opportunities with experienced colleagues from our Financial Innovation Labs (FinLabs) and Center of Excellences (CoE) groups
¬∑ Cutting edge projects at the world‚Äôs leading tier-one banks, financial institutions and insurance firms
¬∑ A flat and approachable organization
¬∑ A truly diverse, fun-loving and global work culture

SYNECHRON‚ÄôS DIVERSITY & INCLUSION STATEMENT
Diversity & Inclusion are fundamental to our culture, and Synechron is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. Our Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) initiative ‚ÄòSynclusive‚Äô is committed to fostering an inclusive culture ‚Äì promoting equality, diversity and an environment that is respectful to all. We strongly believe that a diverse workforce helps build stronger, successful businesses as a global company. We encourage applicants from across diverse backgrounds, race, ethnicities, religion, age, marital status, gender, sexual orientations, or disabilities to apply. We empower our global workforce by offering flexible workplace arrangements, mentoring, internal mobility, learning and development programs, and more.
All employment decisions at Synechron are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to the applicant‚Äôs gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
