title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
About the job
GoHealth Intro

GoHealth is a leading health insurance marketplace and Medicare-focused digital health company. Through the efficient, multi-tiered guidance of our highly specialized licensed insurance agents, GoHealth meets Medicare consumers where they are in their enrollment journeys and empowers them to choose the plan and carrier best suited for their healthcare needs. Our extensive industry expertise, including the use of data science and machine learning with key investments in proprietary technology, helps consumers cut through the confusion and enroll confidently.

Why Apply

As an industry leader in the Medicare marketplace, we are compelled to not only embrace change but to actively be the change to adapt to our consumers complex needs. We believe in hiring risk-takers, innovators, and collaborators within our industry to create individualized, simplified healthcare solutions for our beneficiaries.

Our #TeamGoHealth employees are at the core of our collective success; that's why we are committed to discovering the best in-class talent and ensuring that each team member receives the development tools and support they need to flourish in their professional endeavors.

We also understand that you may not check every box in our requirements list -- most applicants don‚Äôt! In fact, frequently cited statistics show that women and underrepresented groups apply to jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. GoHealth encourages you to break that statistic and to apply today!

About The Role

GoHealth is looking for a Senior Data Engineer who will design, develop and maintain data sourcing, ingestion, and transformation solutions that will be used in reporting & analytics, data science, and other consuming applications. The Senior Data Engineer will also collaborate on building and maintenance of a world class data and analytics platform.

What You Will Do

Design and lead development of data ingestion and transformation pipelines in Databricks
Design, develop and maintain automation pipelines for CI/CD, infrastructure as code, observability and alerting, and all other aspects of a world-class Databricks platform
Initiate documentation, knowledge-sharing, and creating of operating procedures
Mentor junior developers and help them achieve more advanced skills

What We Are Looking For

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science or equivalent experience
5+ years of experience in the design and development of data pipelines, data marts, and data warehouses.
1+ years of experience writing Databricks spark jobs and/or DLT pipelines
Excellent analytical and problem-solving ability with strong attentions to detail and accuracy
Excellent understanding of data warehousing concepts and dimensional data modeling
Excellent written and oral communications skills, with the ability to articulate complex processes to individuals of varying technical abilities
Excellent Python skills with experience with other languages
Experience in Microsoft SQL Server and SSIS

Location: Hybrid/On-site

Benefits And Perks

Open vacation policy because work life balance is important
401k program with company match
Employee Stock Purchase Program
Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance benefits
Paid maternity and paternity leave
Professional growth opportunities
Generous employee referral bonuses
Employee Resource Groups
Work from Home Stipend

GoHealth Privacy Policy

title: Senior Information Technology Business Analyst
description:
About the job
Good afternoon, may you be interested in discussing these roles? If so, please give me a call at your earliest convenience. 973-658-3155

No 3rd Party Agencies please

CONTRACT: 6 Months +
  Title: IT Business Analyst
 Compensation: up to $60/ hr. depending on experience
 Location: This is a hybrid position in Piscataway, NJ, with potential for up to 2 days remote.
 Length of Contract: 6 months +
Requires On-Site Interview 
  Job Description: 
Our client is a technical professional organization dedicated to advancing technology for the benefit of humanity, and they publish a third of the world‚Äôs technical literature in electrical engineering, computer science and electronics and is a leading developer of international standards that underpin many of today's telecommunications, information technology and power generation products and services.

They are looking for a technical Business Analyst to support their efforts on software development initiatives. The Business Analyst will be a key facilitator that works closely with business program and product managers, and the IT teams to deliver technology solutions that add business value.

This role acts as the bridge between project stakeholders and IT teams, is accountable for both the business requirements and functional specifications and is responsible for driving necessary business communication.

As an integral team member of the IT BRM and PMO team, the Business Analyst leads both the effort of defining software requirements and ensuring those requirements are accurately developed.

The incumbent is also responsible for forging strong relationships with business relationship managers and ensuring alignment with IT solutions, our client's infrastructure, and processes with industry best practices.

Responsibilities:
Interfacing with internal and external stakeholders to determine business, functional and technology requirements that support organizational business goals, documenting those requirements, and working with Product Owners, Developers, Project Managers, and QA Analysts to deliver business technology solutions including:
Translate business needs into solutions that interoperate, create efficiencies, provide the highest level of customer experience and drive improved utilization of self-service/automation by internal and/or external users.
Analysis and recommendation of innovative solutions to improve efficiency and quality of process, increase productivity, availability and performance to aide in long term strategic and operational goals.
Documentation of requirements, test case oversight and change management procedures from a business owner perspective for existing mission critical systems & applications ensuring change meets (or exceeds) business objectives.
Collaborate with the Product Owner, Stakeholders and Delivery Team(s) to gather functional and non-functional requirements.
Facilitate sessions with all relevant stakeholders to drive clarity and agreement on requirements
Oversight of the design of applications and the mapping of functional business requirements into technical requirements/agile stories.
Transition of services and oversight of application migration when appropriate, including documentation, communication, and approvals with all relevant units and business owners
Responsible for the overall planning, execution and success of assigned projects.
Incorporation of architecture and security requirements.

Required Qualifications:
Strong business analysis, and project management skills ( Ideally 5 + years of BA experience )
Strong experience in gathering and defining requirements, analyzing/mapping business processes, supporting the design, development, implementation, and maintenance of solutions, services, products, and applications.
Good understanding of Enterprise Architecture ( There may be multiple applications, but the software application tech stack will typically include Java, Java Script, AWS, Power BI for data visualization, and there may be some AI related initiatives as well. )
Good knowledge of business information technology best practices and a strong understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle
Strong analytical skills and proven track record of utilizing team-based approach to quickly and accurately resolve system/solution issues.
Strong understanding of system development, IT and business process and their inter-relationship.
Capability to motivate others within a non-direct reporting structure to execute change
Strong communication and writing skills on a business and technical level.
Strong skills in documentation for business and technology user audiences.

Preferred Qualifications:
PMI Professional in Business Analysis (PMI-PBA)

Education & Certifications:
Bachelor's degree in related field or equivalent experience.

Equal Opportunity Statement:
RCM is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Pay Transparency:
RCM believes in transparency and fairness in compensation. We are committed to providing our employees with competitive salaries that reflect their skills, experience, and contributions to our organization. As part of our commitment to pay transparency, we want to provide you with as much information as possible about our compensation practices.

Disclaimer:
This job posting is intended to describe the general nature and the level of the work to be performed. It is not intended to include every job duty and responsibility specific to the position. RCM reserves the right to amend and change responsibilities to meet business and organizational needs as necessary.

About RCM:
RCM is a leading provider of Business, IT, and Engineering Services to over 1,000 clients in the commercial marketplace including . RCM partners with clients to define, implement and manage a broad range of technologies across multiple platforms, systems, and networks. Our broad geographic presence ensures that a proven and reliable tactical and strategic capability is available and deployable virtually everywhere in North America.

Pennsauken, NJ 08109

title: VP of Data Integration and Analytics
description:
About the job
At DUAL North America, our core values dictate how we live and work. We are a group with independence and people at its heart and we are a home for talent with a unique culture: the biggest small company in the world.

The focus on being a People First business has always been at the very heart of the Group; Our vision was to create an independent business with a unique culture and one that would survive and thrive as a business controlled by the people working for it. And finding the most talented and entrepreneurial people to join the Group has been and will continue to be key.

Title: VP of Data Integration and Analytics
Division: Information Technology
Reports to: CIO or CTO
Travel:10-15%
Work Environment: Hybrid/Remote
Salary: $200,000 base

About the role: 
DUAL North America is seeking a Vice President of Integration and Analytics. We are a forward-thinking leader in the insurance industry, with a commitment to achieving our ambitious business goals by leveraging innovative data strategies. We are seeking a strategic and experienced leader to transform data into actionable information to ensure we meet our long-term goals.

Position Overview: 
The Vice President of Integration and Analytics will be a key driver in shaping and executing DUAL North America's data and integration strategies. This senior leader will oversee the development and implementation of a robust data fabric that standardizes data and analytics practices, enhances business insight, and improves the efficiency of cross-functional resource deployment. The role encompasses overseeing data systems architecture, managing both data in motion (real-time data processing) and data at rest (data storage and management), and integrating these systems seamlessly within our dynamic ecosystem.

Essential Functions:
Develop and execute an enterprise operating model that standardizes data and analytics practices, aligning with DUAL North America‚Äôs 2030 ambitions.
Prioritize and drive data initiatives that unlock business insights and create value, in collaboration with key business functions.
Oversee the architecture and implementation of data systems managing both data in motion (real-time data processing and streaming) and data at rest (data storage and management).
Ensure that data infrastructure is robust, scalable, and integrates seamlessly across the organization‚Äôs evolving ecosystem.
Manage the end-to-end lifecycle of data, including collection, transformation, aggregation, storage, and governance.
Develop strategies for data warehousing, archival, and retrieval that support advanced analytics and business intelligence.
Design and implement a specialized data foundation that supports cutting-edge business analytics and AI models.
Drive initiatives that leverage advanced analytics to generate actionable insights and support strategic decision-making.

Job Requirements (education, experience, skills): 
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field; Master‚Äôs degree or MBA preferred.
Extensive experience (10+ years) in data integration, analytics, and management, with a proven track record in senior leadership roles.
Expertise in managing data in motion (real-time data processing) and data at rest (data storage and management), with proficiency in tools like Azure Data Factory, Microsoft Fabric or Informatica Data Management Cloud.
Proven experience with enterprise reporting tools such as Power BI, Cognos, or Tableau, including the development of dashboards and data visualizations.
Utilize AI programming skills in Python, R, or similar languages to develop and deploy machine learning models and advanced analytics solutions.
Excellent leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills.
Ability to translate data insights into actionable business strategies and drive organizational change.
If you do not meet all the qualifications for this role, we still encourage you to apply, as we are always looking for diverse talent to join our growing team.


What we offer:
A career that you define. Yes, we offer all the usual rewards and benefits - including medical, dental, vision, a wide variety of wellbeing offers, competitive salary, unlimited PTO, 401k with company match, paid volunteer days and more.
We provide an environment where new ideas are encouraged and celebrated, where people who want to have a real hand in our success thrive. We want people who want to make a difference - not just in the workplace, but in the industry and in the wider community.

EEO Statement:
We consider our people our chief competitive advantage and as such we treat colleagues, candidates, clients, and business partners with equality, fairness, and respect. DUAL North America provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training. DUAL will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.

title: Global Data Science & Analytics Business Relationship Manager ‚Äì Medica Devices (on-site)
description:
About the job
Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic medicines. Our 114,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.

Working at Abbott

At Abbott, You Can Do Work That Matters, Grow, And Learn, Care For Yourself And Family, Be Your True Self And Live a Full Life. You‚Äôll Also Have Access To

Career development with an international company where you can grow the career you dream of.
Free medical coverage for employees* via the Health Investment Plan (HIP) PPO
An excellent retirement savings plan with high employer contribution
Tuition reimbursement, the Freedom 2 Save student debt program and FreeU education benefit - an affordable and convenient path to getting a bachelor‚Äôs degree.
A company recognized as a great place to work in dozens of countries around the world and named one of the most admired companies in the world by Fortune.
A company that is recognized as one of the best big companies to work for as well as a best place to work for diversity, working mothers, female executives, and scientists.

For years, Abbott‚Äôs medical device businesses have offered technologies that are faster, more effective, and less invasive. Whether it‚Äôs glucose monitoring system, innovative therapies for treating heart disease, or products that help people with chronic pain or movement disorders, our medical device technologies are designed to help people live their lives better and healthier. Every day, our technologies help more than 10,000 people have healthier hearts, improve quality of life for thousands of people living with chronic pain and movement disorders, and liberate more than 500,000 people with diabetes from routine Ô¨Ångersticks.

The Opportunity 

We are recruiting a Business Relationship Manager to join the Global Data Science & Analytics (GDSA) team within Abbott Medical Devices. This role will support the development and implementation of various data science projects executed by the GDSA team in Mumbai, India.

The GDSA team is a group of data scientists and engineers who deliver data science solutions to internal stakeholders. This team uses machine learning, artificial intelligence, statistical modeling, data mining, and visualization techniques to provide analytics solutions to a wide range of challenging projects related to Abbott‚Äôs life-saving medical technologies. We leverage a wide variety of healthcare data, including health insurance claims, internal Abbott device data, and Electronic Health Records (EHR).

The primary function of this role is to direct data science projects conducted by GDSA. The Business Relationship Manager must understand business needs (e.g., Marketing, Commercial/Sales, Clinical) and work with the scientists/engineers to design and execute projects to meet those needs.

This position will work on-site at one of our locations in St. Paul, MN, Maple Grove, MN or Plano, TX.

What You‚Äôll Work On

Develop, plan, coordinate and direct data science projects (of medium complexity) across multiple locations that are of major scope and importance. Manage multiple, often concurrent projects and meet expectations.
Understand medical device business needs/perspective (e.g., Marketing, Commercial/Sales, Clinical) and articulate these needs to other stakeholders (e.g., data scientists, IT). Assure that data science projects effectively address businesses‚Äô long and short-term business goals.
Communicate data science results to internal and external audiences, including senior management. Prepare and present written and oral reports. Adjust presentation style and content to suit the audience.
Interact well with diverse groups and maintain strong working relationships with internal and external collaborators. Listen to and understand others‚Äô points of view and articulate tactfully and respectfully one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô perspectives orally, in writing, and in presentations.
Interface with senior management on significant matters, often requiring the coordination of activity across organizational units.

Required Qualifications

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in business or technical discipline OR an equivalent combination of education or work experience. 
Proven working experience in product development, project management and/or business process implementation.
Cross-functional collaboration and alignment
Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multitasking skills
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office
Process-oriented thinking, focused on continuous improvement and lessons learned; have demonstrated the ability to define and implement complex and interdependent business processes. 

Preferred Qualifications

Master‚Äôs degree
5 years‚Äô experience in medical devices or health care analytics, including experience with a global company.
Innovative thinker with analytical problem-solving skills. Experience working in data science/analytics, particularly with insurance claims data a plus.
Experience prioritizing and managing project initiatives across multiple functions and/or business units.
Experience working in a broader enterprise/cross division business unit model preferred. Ability to work in a highly matrixed and geographically diverse business model.
Strong storytelling and communication skills and the ability to effectively communicate at multiple levels in the organization. Adept at data visualization: understanding the best ways to communicate data results and use data to tell a story. 
Ability to work effectively within a team in a fast-paced changing environment -- multi-tasks, prioritizes and meets deadlines in timely manner. Strong project management, team skills, and influential management.
Knowledge of medical claims billing/coding a plus.
Adept at handling multiple assignments in a timely manner and meeting assigned deadlines.

Apply Now

 Participants who complete a short wellness assessment qualify for FREE coverage in our HIP PPO medical plan. Free coverage applies in the next calendar year.

Learn more about our health and wellness benefits, which provide the security to help you and your family live full lives: www.abbottbenefits.com

Follow your career aspirations to Abbott for diverse opportunities with a company that can help you build your future and live your best life. Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to employee diversity.

Connect with us at www.abbott.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Abbott and on Twitter @AbbottNews.

The base pay for this position is $72,700.00 ‚Äì $145,300.00. In specific locations, the pay range may vary from the range posted.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
About the job
This position is 50% AI development and modeling and 50% Testing.

The position is a hybrid position with three days onsite and two days offsite.

The interview process will be a phone interview and then a face-to-face interview on site.

The candidate should have at least three years of experience with their most recent development experience doing AI development, open-source modeling and validation and testing.

A previous background of doing Java and Python development before AI would be nice to see. The candidate also needs to have experience in a REST API environment. 

Our Ideal Candidate:

You are a self-motivated professional who demonstrates the ability to quickly grasp new technologies, products, and use cases.

You can come up proper test strategy with the features cross micro services.

You are bright and intellectually curious; deal with concepts and complexity comfortably; are capable, adaptable and agile.

The team crosses continents, and as such, communication in all forms is essential to success in this role.

You will be expected to demonstrate an excellent working knowledge of Java Programming, developing test applications or automating using JUnit/TestNG/Selenium. The ideal candidate will have had experience in QA and has a good handle on scripting and SQL.

As our Senior SDET, you will be responsible for below mentioned Day-to-day Duties. In the role of Senior SDET you must be able to work and adapt in a fluid, fast-paced environment.

Working as the Senior SDET you must have strong technical, communication, collaboration, and leadership skills

Day-to-day Duties? Here's What You'll Be Doing

‚Ä¢ Participate in product functional reviews, test specifications, documentation review of Clients Cloud product, one of the fastest growing integration products

‚Ä¢ Develop test plans and test cases specifically designed for AI applications, including machine learning models and data-driven processes.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate effectively with peer engineers and architects to solve complex problems spanning their respective areas to deliver end-to-end quality in our technology and customer experience

‚Ä¢ Design, develop and maintain test cases in JUnit/TestNG/Selenium

‚Ä¢ Execute test cases and analyze and report test results to product teams

‚Ä¢ Participate actively in functional, system and regression testing activities

‚Ä¢ Work closely with the development team to analyze, debug and resolve any issues

‚Ä¢ Provision the environment in AWS/Azure and deploy the product with validation

‚Ä¢ Design and develop test plans; test cases based upon functional and design specifications

‚Ä¢ Influence development managers to insure appropriate levels of quality on owned technologies

‚Ä¢ Influence and communicate effectively with non-technical audiences including senior product and business management

‚Ä¢ Estimate and perform risk analysis for large features

Your Qualification

‚Ä¢ Experience in developing test cases by using Junit/TestNG/Selenium is a must.

‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of AI concepts, algorithms, and machine learning models

‚Ä¢ Backend automation with tools such Eclipse, Maven (projects management), Java, REST-based framework

‚Ä¢ Knowledge in testing Micro Service architecture in Sizing, resiliency, rolling deployment/upgrade.

‚Ä¢ Testing experience with web-based applications and relational databases

‚Ä¢ Strong working knowledge in Unix/Windows environments

‚Ä¢ Strong knowledge in RDBMS and experience writing SQL scripts.

‚Ä¢ Excellent problem solving, analytical skills and technical troubleshooting skills.

‚Ä¢ Clarity and precision in verbal and written communication

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with software development life cycles and agile programming methodologies.

‚Ä¢ Excellent problem solving, analytical and technical troubleshooting skills.

‚Ä¢ Must have a strong knowledge of QA processes and methodologies.

‚Ä¢ Must be self-starter with good communication & presentation skills in a fast-paced environment with multi-tasking capabilities.

Key Essentials

‚Ä¢ BS/MS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or similar technical degree; advanced degree a plus

‚Ä¢ 5+ years of experience in testing or development using Java or C++

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
About the job
Description

Introduction

Do you want to join an organization that invests in you as a Business Intelligence Analyst? At Parallon, you come first. HCA Healthcare has committed up to $300 million in programs to support our incredible team members over the course of three years.

Benefits

Parallon, offers a total rewards package that supports the health, life, career and retirement of our colleagues. The available plans and programs include:

Comprehensive medical coverage that covers many common services at no cost or for a low copay. Plans include prescription drug and behavioral health coverage as well as free telemedicine services and free AirMed medical transportation. 
Additional options for dental and vision benefits, life and disability coverage, flexible spending accounts, supplemental health protection plans (accident, critical illness, hospital indemnity), auto and home insurance, identity theft protection, legal counseling, long-term care coverage, moving assistance, pet insurance and more. 
Free counseling services and resources for emotional, physical and financial wellbeing
401(k) Plan with a 100% match on 3% to 9% of pay (based on years of service)
Employee Stock Purchase Plan with 10% off HCA Healthcare stock
Family support through fertility and family building benefits with Progyny and adoption assistance. 
Referral services for child, elder and pet care, home and auto repair, event planning and more
Consumer discounts through Abenity and Consumer Discounts
Retirement readiness, rollover assistance services and preferred banking partnerships
Education assistance (tuition, student loan, certification support, dependent scholarships)
Colleague recognition program
Time Away From Work Program (paid time off, paid family leave, long- and short-term disability coverage and leaves of absence)
Employee Health Assistance Fund that offers free employee-only coverage to full-time and part-time colleagues based on income. 

Learn More About Employee Benefits

Note: Eligibility for benefits may vary by location.

You contribute to our success. Every role has an impact on our patients‚Äô lives and you have the opportunity to make a difference. We are looking for a dedicated Business Intelligence Analyst like you to be a part of our team.

Job Summary And Qualifications

The Business Intelligence Analyst provides operational and financial analysis to PSC operational units and senior leadership. As a part of the Financial Reporting team, this person will be responsible to move, integrate, and transform data into business insights.

In this role you will:

Work closely with Database Administrators, Architecture, and Operational leadership teams 
Working knowledge of SQL programming to perform queries related to report and dashboard creation
Analyze business needs to produce valuable insights 
Prepare on-demand analytics and ad-hoc reports

title: Data Engineer/ Modeler
description:
About the job
We‚Äôre living and working in the midst of a digital revolution, and the demand for optimized technology practices has never been more critical for businesses. At Entech, it‚Äôs our mission to help companies navigate the changing environment and accelerate digital realization through the power of solutions, services, and product platforms. With comprehensive end-to-end offerings, we advise, engineer, and manage, ensuring our clients proactively drive toward success in this ever-evolving digital landscape.

Our team is growing, and we‚Äôre searching for a Data Engineer/ Modeler who is a creative problem-solver with their fingertips on the latest industry practices to help our clients achieve digital realization. You‚Äôll join a group of industry veterans and digital natives, blending the power of tried-and-true methods with cutting-edge technologies. We prioritize authentic partnerships in a collaborative environment, and we‚Äôre excited to welcome a Data Engineer/ Modeler who is eager to bring their expertise to our team.

Responsibilities
Create Logical, conceptual, and Physical data models for database or data warehouses.
Ensure compliance with industry standards and best practices in data modeling.
Analyze and troubleshoot any issues related to data structure and provide solutions.
Work closely with database administrators, developers, data architects, business analysts and other stakeholders.
Manage and document data models, relationship, attributes, and dependencies for future reference.

Qualifications:
8+ years of experience in Data Engineering & Data Modeling.
Skillset - Data Engineering:
The position is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining scalable ETL data pipelines on the AWS platform. This role involves extracting data from various sources, transforming into usable data formats, and loading into data lake or data warehouse like redshift for analysts and reporting while leveraging the AWS services like Glue, Lambda, S3, Redshift. This role requires skillset of cloud computing, DevOps using Github/Bitbucket/Bamboo, SQL, and python to deploy the solutions into production.
Skillset - Data Modeling:
The skillset required for this role is familiarity with modeling techniques on start schema, snowflake schema, OLAP cubes modeling for data warehouse designs. This role also requires strong knowledge on database concepts using any popular database like DB2, Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL

Company Benefits
Health, Dental, Vision, 401(k), 25 days of Paid Time Off (PTO)
Additionally
Entech is an equal-opportunity employer.
This is an On-site Hybrid work schedule based out of our Malvern, PA Office
No Third-party candidates will be accepted, this is strictly a direct employment opportunity with Entech.

title: Data Science Graduate Intern
description:
About the job
Ecolab is seeking a Data Science Intern to work on the cutting edge of decision science and analytics to identify solutions to some of the most challenging problems facing our most precious resources. This is a position for a graduate student intern. This position will entail a variety of data analytics work in building out predictive models and algorithms for various types of applications in both business settings, as well as in R&D, digital solutions and product development areas. You‚Äôll work side-by-side with industry recognized leaders in the areas of water safety and conservation, expected to innovate quickly and apply novel, data driven solutions to real-world challenges.

It‚Äôs time your talents took off ‚Äì join our team and challenge yourself to create innovative data analytics solutions for real-world problems!

What‚Äôs In It For You

10‚Äì12-week paid summer internship for you to grow both professionally and personally 
The opportunity to take on some of the world‚Äôs most meaningful challenges, helping customers achieve clean water, safe food, and healthy environments 
The ability to make an impact and shape your career with a company that is passionate about growth 
The support of an organization that believes it is vital to include and engage diverse people, perspectives, and ideas to achieve our best 
Apply what you learn in the classroom to meaningful projects that have genuine business impact 
Grow your professional network through one-on-one meetings with Ecolab leaders, professional development workshops, and peer get togethers 
Finish your internship with a realistic job preview of what a ‚Äúday in the life‚Äù of an Ecolab associate looks like 
Be considered for a full-time job offer (to start upon graduation) at the end of a successful internship with us. 

What You Will Do

Work closely with data scientists and analysts to design and develop data mining and machine learning algorithms to solve real problems. 
Participate in engagement and discovery sessions between data scientists to identify problems/gaps as well as innovation opportunities that can be solved or enabled by data analytics and modeling. 
Implement and test models in a POC (proof of concept) scale to operationalize the outcomes of the predictive modeling and validate the results in the real-world. 
Be encouraged and expected to innovate and be creative in your data analysis, problem solving and presentation of solutions. 

Position Details 

Position is located in Naperville, IL 
Internship start date is June 2, 2025 

Minimum Qualifications

Pursuing a Master‚Äôs Degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, or related technical field 
Expected graduation date of December 2025 or Spring 2026 

Preferred Qualifications

Training and/or experience in data analytics/science areas, such as time series analysis, forecasting, classification, and regression analysis 
Experience with data analytics tools such as Python and R 
Experience writing queries with SQL 
Experience using source control 
Exposure to or experience with database management technologies in the data analytics context 
Effective oral communication skills, organizational skills and attention to detail 
Demonstrated initiative and ability to work independently and as a member of a multi-disciplinary team while handling multiple tasks or projects 

EX:OUT CR1

Benefits

Ecolab strives to provide comprehensive and market-competitive benefits to meet the needs of our associates and their families. Click here to see our benefits.

If you are viewing this posting on a site other than our Ecolab Career website, view our benefits at jobs.ecolab.com/working-here.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Ecolab, we believe the best teams are diverse and inclusive, and we are on a journey to create a workplace where every associate can grow and achieve their best. We are committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants. We recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement on the basis of individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, we will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, disability, or status as a covered veteran.

In addition, we are committed to furthering the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) through Affirmative Action (AA). Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, disabled and covered veteran individuals at all levels of the workforce. Ecolab is a place where you can grow your career, own your future and impact what matters.

title: Database Research Scientist
description:
About the job
Join the leader in entertainment innovation and help us design the future. At Dolby, science meets art, and high tech means more than computer code. As a member of the Dolby team, you‚Äôll see and hear the results of your work everywhere, from movie theaters to smartphones. We continue to revolutionize how people create, deliver, and enjoy entertainment worldwide. To do that, we need the absolute best talent. We‚Äôre big enough to give you all the resources you need, and small enough so you can make a real difference and earn recognition for your work. We offer a collegial culture, challenging projects, and excellent compensation and benefits, not to mention a Flex Work approach that is truly flexible to support where, when, and how you do your best work.

Dolby.io is a new developer platform by Dolby Labs that puts decades of Dolby sight and sound technology into the hands of developers to deliver quality in real-time streaming, communications, and media processing solutions ‚Äî at scale. The platform includes a powerful suite of self-service APIs, SDKs, and sample apps that enable developers to easily deploy real-time streaming services with sub-second latency, integrate audio/video chat functionality into their apps, and add media processing capabilities into existing workflows to enhance the quality of audio and video files. With its accessibility, ease of use, and best-in-class audio innovation, Dolby.io is powering the future of immersive, interactive, and social online experiences that rival real world experiences.

Join the leader in entertainment innovation and help us design the future. This role offers impactful, project-based work experience in a collaborative, creative environment where you work side by side with industry leaders. Amplify your insatiable curiosity by implementing real-world solutions that revolutionize how people communicate and how entertainment is created, delivered, and enjoyed worldwide. We offer a collegial culture, challenging projects, and excellent compensation and benefits.

At Dolby, we‚Äôre changing the way the world experiences sight and sound. We enable people to experience music and movies; videos and pictures in all its intended grandeur and make life & work more meaningful and immersive. We give technology to the world‚Äôs content creators, owners, and distributors; manufacturers of TV, Mobile, and PC; and social and media platforms; so that they can truly delight their customers. We're the ones behind the astounding sound and sight experiences in the movie theaters and in your living room; on your mobile phones and on the internet.

Advanced Technology Group

ATG is the research and technology arm of Dolby Labs. It has multiple competencies that innovate technologies in audio, video, AR/VR, gaming, music, and movies. Many areas of expertise related to computer science and electrical engineering, such as AI/ML, computer vision, image processing, algorithms, digital signal processing, audio engineering, data science & analytics, distributed systems, cloud, edge & mobile computing, natural language processing, knowledge engineering and management, social network analysis, computer graphics, image & signal compression, computer networking, IoT are highly relevant to our research.

What You‚Äôll Do

Sight and Sound play a large role in our day-to-day experiences. We believe data can play a huge role in making the experiences personalized and resilient. Data is critical to synthesizing experiences that are otherwise unimaginable.

We‚Äôre looking for talented database systems and big data management researchers who are excited to advance the state of the art in technologies of interest to Dolby as well as the human society at large. Research in the areas of

data platforms, data science and analytics at Dolby Laboratories focuses on all aspects of large-scale cloud and edge data platforms and services, and novel ways to accelerate discovering insight from data.

We are interested in a variety of topics including big data management, self-service data cleaning and transformation at scale, data quality, search and discovery of structured data, information extraction, time-series and heterogenous data analytics, metadata management, applied AI, machine learning and data mining, data visualization, natural language processing and big data systems including systems‚Äô concerns such as: resource management, storage, caching, query processing, query optimization, security, and privacy.

Key Responsibilities:

Investigate heterogenous data management techniques and polystore systems, including the application of AI & machine learning techniques to foundational data management problems including data quality, data profiling, data integration and schema matching.
Develop tools and frameworks to enable scalable development of machine learning models and data science algorithms across heterogenous data domains, including tabular, time series, text, audio and video.
Create distributed data processing architectures that leverage ‚Äúcompute at the edge‚Äù to enable novel use cases and applications such as predictive routing, data-driven experiences, and adaptive environments.
Work with ATG researchers to understand data-related opportunities in peer researchers‚Äô domains such as applied AI and machine learning in Audio / Video domains.

What You Need To Succeed

Competencies

Technical depth: Necessary technical knowledge to create new SW architecture needed for real time just in time processing for audio/video algorithms running on distributed fashion between cloud and edge devices. Basic knowledge on Audio/Video streaming formats.
Explore new technologies: Openness to learn new areas and innovate in the new areas.
Invent & Innovate: Develop short and long-term technologies, algorithms and software tools that will help make Dolby a world leader in enhancing the sight and sound associated with digital content consumption. Then influence and collaborate with BG partners put the technology into production.
Work with a sense of Urgency: Responds aggressively to changing trends and new technologies and creates new algorithms to capitalize on them. Takes appropriate risks to be ahead of the competition and the market.
Collaborate: Collaborate with and influence peers in developing industry-leading technologies. Work with external trendsetters and technology drivers in academia and in partner enterprises.

Desired Background

PhD in Computer Science, or similar fields
Background in relational databases, big data systems, and data analytic systems
Expertise in data management, data cleaning, distributed systems, database storage engines, query processing and query optimization, and applied data science
Knowledge of statistics and machine learning
Proficiency in data structures and algorithms
Familiar with git and project management tools, such as JIRA 
Excellent problem-solving and partnership skills
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Relevant publications in data mining / database conferences (e.g., SIGMOD, VLDB, ICDCS, IEEE BigData, ICDE, KDD, WSDM, ICDM, WEB)
Bonus: Experience with Databricks / Spark in addition to using multiple Cloud services‚Äô data products and services
Bonus: Experience with Databricks / Spark in addition to using multiple Cloud services‚Äô data products and services
Bonus: Experience with AI models and cloud-based software development of AI models.

The Atlanta Area base salary range for this full-time position is $129,700- $,158,500, which can vary if outside this location, plus bonus, benefits, and some roles may also include equity. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, competencies, experience, market demands, internal parity, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range and perks and benefits for your location during the hiring process.

Dolby will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of San Francisco Police Code, Article 49, and Administrative Code, Article 12

Equal Employment Opportunity:

Dolby is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Our success depends on the combined skills and talents of all our employees. We are committed to making employment decisions without regard to race, religious creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, marital status, family status, medical condition, disability, military service, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions or any other classification protected by federal, state, and local laws and ordinances.

Experience with the Microsoft Azure technology stack or similar technologies in competing platforms.
Practical knowledge of data analytics and visualization tools to aid in data-driven decision making and reporting.

 Certifications & Licenses 
Professional certification in Agile and SCRUM methodologies (e.g., Certified ScrumMaster (CSM), SAFe Agilist).
Certifications in Python and SQL programming (e.g., Microsoft Certified: Python Programming Specialist, Oracle SQL Certification).

Big Data certifications (e.g., Cloudera Certified Professional (CCP): Data Engineer, Databricks Certified Professional Data Scientist).

title: Senior Analyst
description:

title: Asset Servicing Digital & Data Intern
description:
About the job
About Northern Trust

Northern Trust, a Fortune 500 company, is a globally recognized, award-winning financial institution that has been in continuous operation since 1889.

Northern Trust is proud to provide innovative financial services and guidance to the world‚Äôs most successful individuals, families, and institutions by remaining true to our enduring principles of service, expertise, and integrity. With more than 130 years of financial experience and over 22,000 partners, we serve the world‚Äôs most sophisticated clients using leading technology and exceptional service.

Please note: Each applicant has the opportunity to apply to a maximum of 3 job postings per recruitment season in North America. Please do not create multiple email addresses to apply to additional opportunities.

Posting Close Date: October 11, 2024 11:59pm Central, unless the class is filled before that date. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. We strongly encourage you to submit your application as early as possible as programs will close once positions are filled.

Who You Are

 You are pursuing a bachelor‚Äôs degree at an accredited college/university with an expected graduate date of December 2025 through Summer 2026
 You have a minimum GPA of 3.0

 You have some knowledge of Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Programming, Analytics, AI Applications and Technologies, Cloud Computing and/or Data Platforms, usually acquired through coursework or prior related experience, and are curious to learn more
 You have proven analytical, quantitative, and problem-solving skills through course work, projects, and/ or previous internship experience
 You have demonstrated leadership and teamwork through projects and/or extracurricular involvement

Federal law requires that employees be legally authorized to work in the United States. Applicants for employment must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship for employment authorization

What You‚Äôll Do

As an intern at Northern Trust you will have the opportunity to spend ten weeks working on meaningful projects, developing relevant skills to jump start your career while joining our inclusive and relational culture. You will work directly with your team on day-to-day tasks with weekly program events to work on new skills, network with senior leaders and socialize as an intern community. A recruiter will work with you to determine the best team placement given your interests, skill set and relevant experience.

The Program

 Ten weeks
 Located in Chicago, IL

Program Opportunities

 Lunch & Learns with Leaders
 Professional development workshops
 Social events
 Intern Case Challenge Project
 Volunteer event
 Mentorship and networking opportunities

Sample Projects

 Data Analysis & Visualization: analysis of large datasets to extract meaningful insights.
 Machine Learning Models: building and deploying machine learning models.
 Natural Language Processing (NLP): working with text data, such as sentiment analysis, text classification, or building chatbots.
 Cloud Computing: working with cloud platforms (e.g. Azure, AWS) to manage and analyze large datasets. This could include setting up data pipelines, using cloud-based machine learning services, or working with big data technologies (e.g. Hadoop, Spark).
 Complete, compile and present a high quality summary of findings and recommendations for review in a concise and professional manner
 Run, create and analyze reports
 Support Asset Servicing teams in various projects

Sample Career Paths

 Asset Servicing Analyst
 Asset Servicing Digital & Data Analyst

Working With Us

As a Northern Trust partner, greater achievements await. You will be part of a flexible and collaborative work culture in an organization where financial strength and stability is an asset that emboldens us to explore new ideas.

Movement within the organization is encouraged, senior leaders are accessible, and you can take pride in working for a company committed to assisting the communities we serve! Join a workplace with a greater purpose.

We‚Äôd love to learn more about how your interests and experience could be a fit with one of the world‚Äôs most admired and sustainable companies! Build your career with us and apply today. #MadeForGreater

Reasonable accommodation

Northern Trust is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please email our HR Service Center at MyHRHelp@ntrs.com.

We hope you‚Äôre excited about the role and the opportunity to work with us. We value an inclusive workplace and understand flexibility means different things to different people.

Apply today and talk to us about your flexible working requirements and together we can achieve greater.

title: Senior Data Engineer (Commodities Trading) - Up to $170k base (plus bonus)
description:
About the job
Interested in joining a technically driven Commodities trading fund?

You're going to be working on a tight-knit data engineering team, side-by-side with world class traders and data scientists in the front office. It's a position that'll have you assisting on everything data-related, from data architecture design to on-going data management, you'll have your work cut out for you.

They're recognized globally as a top commodities trading firm, largely focused on data science and have been ramping up their presence generative AI space. They bring in 100's of billions of rows of data that the Data Engineers model/architect for the Data Science team to build Machine Learning models using time series data.

To give you a better idea, they recently completed a project that tracked cargo vessel's raw data shipping locations (330 million records) in a specific regions to help Data Science build a Supply & Demand Machine Learning model.

Upon joining, you'd jump right into a data migration project where you'd be loading on-prem Oracle into Snowflake data warehouses. You'll create data ingestion pipelines using lots of Python and SQL, work extensively with ETL frameworks to write pipelines to load millions of records, and build dashboards with business intelligence tools like Power BI and Tableau. Additionally, bonus points if you have any experience with machine learning or artificial intelligence since you'll gain more exposure with those technologies as you progress in the role.

Given the cross-collaborative nature of the position, you'll need to be comfortable working on-site 3x per week in their Houston office. It'll give you significant exposure to their Risk and commercial investing teams globally.

Looking for a fast-paced, front office, fundamentally data focused role? Apply today.

title: Business Analyst/Product Owner
description:

title: Data Management / Governance Analyst
description:

title: Machine Learning and Control Algorithms Researcher
description:
About the job
Eaton‚Äôs CTO Corporate Technology Office division is currently seeking a Machine Learning and Control Algorithms Researcher.

The expected annual salary range for this role is $112500.0 - $165000.0 a year.

Please note the salary information shown above is a general guideline only. Salaries are based upon candidate skills, experience, and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations.

What You‚Äôll Do

Job summary

This is a unique opportunity to make a significant contribution to a transformational project developing artificial intelligence/machine learning (AI/ML) aided model-based systems engineering methods. The ultimate goal is to design innovative power electronics solutions for transportation electrification applications through the development of advanced computing methods. The incumbent will join a world-class research team including internal and external partners to deliver on research and commercialization projects jointly funded by Eaton and government research agencies.

Job Responsibilities

Eaton‚Äôs Corporate Technology Office (CTO) Division is currently seeking a Power Electronics/Machine Learning Researcher. This position is based at our Southfield, MI, facility on a hybrid schedule. Relocation assistance will be provided. Position Overview: This is a unique opportunity to make a significant contribution to a transformational project developing artificial intelligence/machine learning (AI/ML) aided model-based systems engineering methods. The ultimate goal is to design innovative power electronics solutions for transportation electrification applications through the development of advanced computing methods. The incumbent will join a world-class research team including internal and external partners to deliver on research and commercialization projects jointly funded by Eaton and government research agencies. Making what matters work at Eaton takes the passion of every employee around the world. We create an environment where creativity, invention and discovery become reality, each and every day. It‚Äôs where bold, bright professionals like you can reach your full potential‚Äîand where you can help us reach ours. In this function you will: -

 Plans and executes research activities in AI/ML aided power electronics design and tool development including coordination of the activities of internal and external research partners.
 Remain current on relevant scientific and industry trends and state-of-the-art techniques
 Apply state-of-the-art Optimal controls, optimization algorithms and development/application of Large Language Models
 Be knowledgeable in the fundamental concepts and principles of power electronics
 Interface with external and internal partners/stakeholders on collaborative programs.
 Presents research findings and recommendations to internal stakeholders to inform technology strategy, aid deployment of capabilities and support investment decisions
 Research and implement appropriate ML algorithms and tools
 Develop machine learning applications per requirements- Contribute towards new proposals to external funding agencies
 This Hybrid role must report on-site 3 days a week at either Southfield, Michigan .. or .. Menomonee Falls, Wisconsin. If needed, relocation assistance (within US only) is available for a qualified candidate currently residing in the USA. 


Qualifications

Required (Basic) Qualifications: 

 PhD in Electrical Engineering .
 3 -5 years of hands-on experience with the state-of-the-art optimization algorithms and tools, and knowledge of Transformers (learning modules) and their applications in Large Language Models .
 Solid foundation in Linear Algebra.
 Excellent Python coding skills including extensive hands-on experience using open-source end-to-end machine learning workflows.
 Must be authorized to work in the United States without company sponsorship now or in the future - This position requires use of information or access to hardware which is subject to the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). All applicants must be U.S. persons within the meaning of ITAR. ITAR defines a U.S. person as a U.S. Citizen, U.S. Permanent Resident (i.e. 'Green Card Holder'), Political Asylee, or Refugee.


Preferred Qualifications

 PhD in Electrical Engineering with a focus on application of optimal controls, Optimization algorithms and/or Machine learning
 Knowledge of simulation using tools such as Matlab, Simulink, PLECS, LTSPICE etc.
 Sound understanding of Machine and Deep Learning concepts. (Supervised, Semi-supervised, Unsupervised, Reinforcement Learning)
 Knowledge in Transformer Models and its applications, e.g. LLMs
 Demonstrated experience in training and deploying ML and DL models using various frameworks like pytorch, pytorch lightning, Keras, tensorflow, numpy, pandas, scikit learn etc. (selection of algorithms, hyperparameter tuning, on-prem/cloud-based training etc.)
 Prior work experience in industry in the application of optimal controls, optimization, and ML/DL
 Experience in deployment of ML/AI models on resource constrained edge devices
 Ability to function well in a fast-paced research environment, set priorities to accomplish multiple tasks within deadlines, and adapt to changing needs.


We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

Eaton believes in second chance employment. Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction history will be considered regardless of their arrest or conviction history, consistent with the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance, the California Fair Chance Act and other local laws.

You do not need to disclose your conviction history or participate in a background check until a conditional job offer is made to you. To request a disability-related reasonable accommodation to assist you in your job search, application, or interview process, please call us at 1-800-836-6345 to discuss your specific need. Only accommodation requests will be accepted by this phone number.

We know that good benefit programs are important to employees and their families. title: 2025 Data Management & Stewardship Summer Internship
description:
About the job
PURPOSE

The Intern Analyst will conduct data analysis required to optimize vendor, customer, item, and other master data processes including those related to converting master data to other systems. The Intern Analyst will be responsible for gathering and validating all necessary data. As such, the Intern Analyst will need to foster relationships throughout the organization to gather data and an understanding of what the data means to the business.

This role will be a participant in transformation initiatives related to MDM and Data Governance at Builders FirstSource.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

Utilizes tools and processes to support the creation and maintenance of consistent, standardized, and accurate master data.
Checks data content and quality by monitoring results and taking corrective action.
Acts as a liaison to domain data stewards to maintain necessary data stewardship responsibilities and procedures.
Collaborates with teammates on design and structural changes necessary to satisfy master data requirements.
Maintains existing enterprise data governance policies and procedures.
Tracks adherence to key MDM and data governance metrics/SLAs.
Assists with the maintenance of golden records across domains.
Learn business processes and partner with business process owners/SME‚Äôs, IT, and data stewardship teams.

Supervisory Responsibilities

This job has no supervisory responsibilities.

Minimum Requirements

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. 

Must be perusing bachelor‚Äôs degree in data Analytics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, Business Information Technology, Management Information Systems or related discipline from four-year college.
Prefer GPA of 3.0 or higher. 

Preferred Experience

Hands on experience with SAP MDG master data management, data quality and data governance.
Experience with analytics tools such as MicroStrategy, Tableau is a plus.
Azure Cloud experience is a plus.
Experience with Manufacturing and & Distribution industry is a plus.

Technical Skills Preferred

Databases: Informix, SQL Server, Oracle, S4 HANA
Working experience with Python and SQL
Collaboration Tools: MS Office, JIRA, SharePoint, MS Teams
DAMA Certification

WORK ENVIRONMENT / PHYSICAL ACTIVITY

title: Software Engineer (Business Intelligence)
description:
About the job
As a Business Intelligence Software Engineer, you will leverage your expertise in enterprise applications and development to analyze, program, and implement best practices in Data Sourcing (ETL), Report Building, and Data Governance. Your role will encompass the analysis, development, testing, deployment, and post-deployment support of ETL processes and PowerBI solutions for the Enterprise Applications & Data team. You will collaborate closely with Product Owners to interpret business requirements, design effective ETL solutions, and ensure the reliability and performance of data pipelines.

Key Responsibilities
Requirements Analysis: Interpret business requirements and apply technical expertise to implement solutions effectively using your knowledge of enterprise applications.
Master Data Management: Apply principles of master data management to ensure data consistency and accuracy.
ETL Process Design and Maintenance: Design, develop, and maintain ETL processes utilizing SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) for both on-premises and hybrid environments. Optimize SSIS packages for data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) from diverse sources to target databases.
Error Handling and Monitoring: Implement error handling, logging, and auditing mechanisms to monitor and resolve issues with SSIS packages, ensuring data quality and integrity.
Data Integration: Design and execute data integration and orchestration workflows using Azure Data Factory (ADF) for cloud-based solutions. Perform performance tuning and optimization of ETL processes to meet scalability and performance requirements.
Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for ETL processes, data mappings, technical specifications, and best practices to support future maintenance and reference.
PowerBI Development: Develop and enhance PowerBI functionalities to integrate and optimize enterprise applications, data, and reporting solutions. Design and create PowerBI data models and dashboards, adhering to best practices.
Collaboration and Support: Work with Data Engineers to acquire, clean, and transform data for reporting. Conduct data analysis, profiling, and pattern recognition to resolve discrepancies. Support QA and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) for PowerBI solutions.
Agile Participation: Engage in agile team practices including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, backlog grooming, and retrospectives.
Industry Awareness: Stay informed about industry best practices, tools, and technologies related to ETL, data integration, and cloud-based solutions.
Requirements
Experience: Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in business intelligence or data engineering roles.
Skills: Strong interpersonal and team-building abilities. Demonstrated problem-solving and decision-making skills with excellent written and verbal communication.
Commitment: Proven dedication to operational excellence, with a track record of delivering projects within scope, on time, and on budget.
Preferred Experience: Familiarity with QAD or SAP ERP systems, experience with Azure or AWS Cloud platforms, and Power BI Certification.
Education
Degree: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Computer Science, or a related field, or equivalent professional experience.
Certifications: Any Cloud Database Certification is advantageous.
Location
Tallassee, Alabama or Duluth, Georgia (some travel between locations may be required).
Physical Requirements
Sedentary work involving exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally, and/or a negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull, or otherwise move objects.
Working Conditions
Generally favorable working conditions typical of office environments, for more than 70% of the time.

title: Master Data Specialist
description:
About the job
Job Description

Kenvue is currently recruiting for-

 Master Data Specialist 

This position reports into the Senior Manager, Site Materials Planner and will be located at Fort Washington, PA.

Who We Are

At Kenvue , we realize the extraordinary power of everyday care. Built on over a century of heritage and rooted in science, we‚Äôre the house of iconic brands - including Neutrogena, Aveeno, Tylenol, Listerine, Johnson‚Äôs and BAND-AID¬Æ Brand Adhesive Bandages that you already know and love. Science is our passion; care is our talent. Our global team is made up of ~ 22,000 diverse and brilliant people, passionate about insights, innovation and committed to delivering the best products to our customers. With expertise and empathy, being a Kenvuer means having the power to impact the life of millions of people every day. We put people first, care fiercely, earn trust with science and solve with courage ‚Äì and have brilliant opportunities waiting for you! Join us in shaping our future‚Äìand yours. For more information, click here .

 Role reports to-  Senior Manager, Site Materials Planner

 Location-  Fort Washington, PA

 Travel %-  10%

 Pay  - $73,000 - $117,300

What You Will Do

Coordinates/executes the creation and change of specifications for products manufactured in the plant, for packaging materials or raw materials used by the plant and for all other basic data needed in the manufacturing plants (Vendors, BOMs, routings, bar codes, pallet structure, etc). Manages, develops and implements work processes related to the activity and interfaces with the plant functions to ensure accurate information supply. Aligns with Regional master data governance to ensure compliance to regional standards.

Responsibilities-

 Provides accurate and complete supply planning parameters for system maintenance 
 Reviews lead-times and MOQs with key stakeholders and recommend changes to the regional planning manager 
 Gather the information from the requestors to create a new product specification (Regional Franchise, Regional or local Marketing, Packaging Development, Regional or Local QA, Regional NPI,‚Ä¶) 
 Coordinate/execute the change of specifications for all other basic data needed in the manufacturing plants (Vendors, BOMs, routings, etc) 
 Coordinate the gathering of required input data with the functions in the plant (eg. Production Planning, QA, Packaging, Engineering,...) and take the responsibility for complete and correct data inputs in regional material master systems and local plant systems 
 Align with Regional master data governance to ensure compliance to regional standards and regulatory specifications 
 Ensure participation in new product launch meetings to ensure data requirements are fulfilled 
 Responsible for BOM data governance 
 Plant Power User for Master Data 
 Annual planning 
 Change Control for Disco/Deactivate (site process owner) 
 Change Control for Materials/Components (site process owner) 
 Applies an understanding of the interdependencies between all planning-related parameters with an End to End perspective to facilitate and drive regular data reviews 
 Understanding of change control process and systems 
 Understanding of master data inter-dependencies and cause/effect on supply plan output and ERP function 
 Demonstrates an understanding of the implications of incorrect master data on the outcomes of the production planning process 
 Proposes master data solutions within the existing system design to meet changing business requirements 

Required Qualifications

 4 years of relevant experience with a Bachelor‚Äôs degree or 12 total years of experience. 
 SAP Experience is required 
 Ability to work out of Fort Washington, PA 

What‚Äôs In It For You

 Competitive Total Rewards Package* 
 Paid Company Holidays, Paid Vacation, Volunteer Time & More! 
 Learning & Development Opportunities 
 Employee Resource Groups 
Note- Total Rewards at Kenvue include salary, bonus (if applicable) and benefits. Your Talent Access Partner will be able to share more about our total rewards offerings and the specific salary range for the relevant location(s) during the recruitment & hiring process.
