title: Remote Senior Business Analyst
description:
About the job
Company Overview

Req ID: 296492

NTT DATA strives to hire exceptional, innovative and passionate individuals who want to grow with us. If you want to be part of an inclusive, adaptable, and forward-thinking organization, apply now.

We are currently seeking a Remote Senior Business Analyst to join our team in or around Plano, Texas (US-TX), United States (US).

Job Description

This is a Remote Senior Business Analyst opportunity, in the United States, on the Analytics Enablement Consulting team, at NTT DATA for candidates who are authorized to work in the United States without restriction.

The NTT DATA Senior Business Analyst on the Analytics Enablement Consulting team is a leader who is responsible for managing and overseeing the intake of AI and GenAI projects, ensuring they align with organizational governance policies and regulatory standards. This role requires excellent communication skills because it involves close collaboration with cross-functional teams to prioritize projects, communicate with stakeholders, and ensure compliance. The analyst will also work with business units to develop and complete business cases, providing strong analytical support to justify and evaluate the impact of proposed GenAI initiatives. The analyst must have experience with AI / GenAI projects.

Key Responsibilities

Stakeholder Communication

Act as the primary liaison between business units, AI/GenAI teams, and governance bodies.

Facilitate communication and understanding of the governance process among stakeholders, ensuring transparency and adherence to guidelines.

Prepare and present detailed reports and recommendations to senior leadership and governance committees.

Analytical Skills

Use strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and provide actionable insights.

Demonstrate proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques, including experience with AI-driven analytics platforms.

Technical Responsibilities

Demonstrate expertise using AI/Client platforms, data governance tools, and project management software.

Basic Qualifications

5+ years of experience in business analysis

1+ years of experience working In-depth knowledge of AI and GenAI technologies, including their applications, risks, and ethical considerations.

1+ years of experience in managing or supporting AI/Client projects

Bachelor‚Äôs degree

Open to travel up to 25%

Preferred Skills

Knowledge of governance practice

Healthcare industry experience

#CDLAP #Healthcareconsulting #BusinessAnalyst

Where required by law, NTT DATA provides a reasonable range of compensation for specific roles. The starting pay range for this remote role is ***-135,000. This range reflects the minimum and maximum target compensation for the position across all US locations. Actual compensation will depend on a number of factors, including the candidate‚Äôs actual work location, relevant experience, technical skills, and other qualifications. This position may also be eligible for incentive compensation based on individual and/or company performance.

This position is eligible for company benefits including medical, dental, and vision insurance with an employer contribution, flexible spending or health savings account, life and AD&D insurance, short and long term disability coverage, paid time off, employee assistance, participation in a 401k program with company match, and additional voluntary or legally-required benefits.

About NTT DATA

NTT DATA is a $30+ billion trusted global innovator of business and technology services. We serve 75% of the Fortune Global 100 and are committed to helping clients innovate, optimize and transform for long-term success. As a Global Top Employer, we have diverse experts in more than 50 countries and a robust partner ecosystem of established and start-up companies. Our services include business and technology consulting, data and artificial intelligence, industry solutions, as well as the development, implementation and management of applications, infrastructure and connectivity. title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
About the job
Sr. Data Engineer
Brooksource
Fortune 50 Health Insurance Client
Remote

Overview: We are seeking a skilled Senior Developer with expertise in Snowflake to support our client's ongoing data warehouse migration and development efforts. This role is critical as they transition from their old SQL Server infrastructure to a modern Snowflake-based architecture. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of data engineering and analytics platforms, preferably in a healthcare setting, and will be able to get up to speed quickly to make an immediate impact.

Key Responsibilities:
Collaborate with internal teams to architect, build, and optimize data marts in Snowflake.
Assist in the migration from SQL Server to Snowflake, ensuring minimal disruption and maximum efficiency.
Work closely with Snowflake to support code development, refactoring, and enhancement during the migration.
Design and implement scalable data models that meet business needs, especially in the context of B2B data sharing.
Support the long-term goal of fully transitioning to Snowflake while maintaining some legacy systems (e.g., on-prem SQL Server).
Collaborate with the Managed Services team for testing and validation of data pipelines.
Provide guidance and hands-on support to internal teams undergoing Snowflake training.
Utilize Power BI, SQL, and Python for data visualization, querying, and data manipulation.
Required Skills and Experience:
Snowflake Expertise: Proven experience in designing, developing, and optimizing Snowflake environments, with strong knowledge of Snowflake‚Äôs B2B data models.
SQL Server Knowledge: Deep understanding of SQL Server, particularly in the context of migration to Snowflake.
Data Modeling: Extensive experience with data modeling in a data warehousing environment.
Power BI: Proficiency in Power BI for data visualization and reporting.
SQL & Python: Strong skills in SQL and Python for data querying and manipulation.
Healthcare Data: Experience with data engineering and analytics platforms in the healthcare sector, particularly home health, is a plus.
Preferred Qualifications:
Familiarity with Homecare Homebase EMR or similar legacy systems.
Experience navigating complex, regulated environments and managing the associated red tape.
Ability to work independently and collaborate with cross-functional teams.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to ‚Äúget their hands dirty‚Äù quickly.

title: Data Scientist
description:
About the job
Apex Systems is looking to hire a Data Scientist in Austin, Texas. If interested please send your resume to Jacqueline at jglade@apexsystems.com

Position: Data Scientist
Location: Austin, Texas or Dallas, TX
Duration: Contract to hire
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS / PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Other duties may be assigned. A teammate in this position must have the ability to:
Lead, research, strategize, design, implement, document and communicate Data Science initiatives end-to-end, from incubation to deployment.
Build and enhance machine learning, statistical and causal models for product search, ranking and recommendation that support various business goals
Facilitate the delivery of enterprise wide, production grade, and accurate data science products by establishing and standardizing tooling and process frameworks for standard methodologies
Investigate the design and performance of models and fine tune as necessary
Work closely with product and engineering managers to develop and deploy solutions with cross-functional support
Educate our business and engineering partners across the organization on data science concepts (e.g., statistics, machine learning)
Identify gaps in existing data, create data product specs, and work with Engineering teams to implement enhanced data tracking
Partner with Analytics team members and other functions to share insights and best practices, ensuring consistency of data-driven decision-making throughout the org
Effectively communicating your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management

 MINIMUM SKILLS AND QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:
MS or PhD in statistics, mathematics, analytics, computer science or another quantitative field AND 3+ years of experience as a data scientist in Logistics or Retail
Or, 8+ years of experience as a data scientist in eCommerce or Logistics
Hands-on experience in building ranking and recommendation models in production environments
Experience applying descriptive statistics, machine learning, predictive modeling, and visualization techniques to solve challenging business problems
Expert knowledge in: 
Statistical and machine learning techniques
Data Science libraries in a programming or scripting language Model deployment
Machine learning workflows
Proficient in:
Python + related ML libraries and frameworks (Ex: PyTorch)
Proficient in SQL and working with large datasets. 
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) and model development and deployment technologies (e.g., Databricks). 
Excellent communication and presentation skills (to both technical and business audiences)
Exceptional leadership and communication skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams, present findings to senior teams, and drive a data-driven culture within the organization.

title: Senior Data Architect
description:
About the job
PerkSpot is searching for a Senior Data Architect to join our Engineering Team!

Founded in 2006, we are on a Mission to Save Our Members Money by providing exclusive access to the best discounts available - anywhere. We ensure employees see offers curated to their interests, allowing them to save on electronics, home goods, meal delivery, mortgages, travel, and all the other little‚Äîand big‚Äîthings that will make life a bit easier.

The Senior Data Architect is an individual contributor role who will be responsible for designing and managing the data architecture and infrastructure that supports our online platforms, mobile applications, and other data-related services. This hands-on role requires extensive experience in configuration and monitoring of the daily database maintenance plan, creating scalable and efficient data models, ensuring data quality, and integrating various data sources to enhance business intelligence and decision-making processes. The ideal candidate will have proven success in data architecture, a deep understanding of big data needs, and a strong ability to translate business requirements into robust technical solutions.

What you‚Äôll accomplish: 

SQL Database Administration
Review and monitor the daily maintenance plan
Administer daily and hourly backups
Review indexing and other configurations that promote high performance and availability
Data Architecture Design
Develop and implement data architecture strategies that support the platform‚Äôs goals and objectives.
Design and maintain scalable, high-performance data models and schemas that support transaction processing, customer interactions, and business analytics.
Data Integration and Management
Oversee the integration of diverse data sources including transactional systems and third-party services.
Ensure seamless data flow and consistency across various systems and platforms.
Data Quality and Governance
Implement data governance practices to ensure data accuracy, integrity, and security.
Establish and enforce data quality standards and protocols.
Analytics and Reporting
Collaborate with analysts and business stakeholders to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights.
Design and implement reporting solutions that provide meaningful business intelligence.
Technical Leadership
Provide technical leadership and guidance to other engineers.
Stay abreast of emerging technologies and trends in data architecture.
Performance Optimization
Monitor and optimize the performance of data systems to ensure high availability and reliability.
Troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues and performance bottlenecks.
Collaboration and Communication
Work closely with cross-functional teams including IT, development, marketing, and operations to align data architecture with business objectives.
Communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders effectively.

What we‚Äôre looking for:
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
10-12 years of experience in data architecture, with a significant portion in a web environment.
Proficiency in data modeling tools and techniques.
Strong experience with SQL and NoSQL databases.
Familiarity with data warehousing solutions, big data technologies, and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
Knowledge of ETL processes, data integration tools, and APIs.
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work with large datasets to derive actionable insights.
Proven experience in leading data architecture projects and mentoring technical teams.
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical stakeholders.

About PerkSpot:
PerkSpot is the trusted employee discount platform that provides meaningful, personalized savings on the things that matter most. Our approach is simple, inspiring others to love where they work by offering the steepest, most intentional discounts on over 1,000 reputable brands. From local deals to big-name nationwide offerings, our 98% retention rate speaks for itself.

We are an established company with a strong foundation, growing consistently and steady. What does that mean for you? The opportunity to hit the ground running and see the impact of your work! As a leader in the industry, we‚Äôre committed to doing more - developing better products, reaching more employers, and getting more members engaged with our platform. Our passion is to make every place a great place to work, starting with our own.

Your first few months as a PerkSpotter:
Providing value doesn‚Äôt have to wait, from day one we are open to your big ideas. In your first few months, you will..

Meet the team! We think our people are pretty great so we want to ensure you‚Äôre introduced to all of the right team members to help you succeed. You‚Äôll spend quite a bit of time with our VP of Engineering, the eCommerce and Engineering teams!
Get to know PerkSpot! Immerse yourself in the business, engage with internal stakeholders, and participate in monthly company-wide All Hands meetings.
Sharpen your skills! You will become very familiar with the technology and tools that we use; AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, SQL, just to name a few.
See your impact! This is a high-impact role directly responsible for designing and managing PerkSpot‚Äôs data and infrastructure!
Participate in company-wide events! Whether it‚Äôs office miniature golf or a raffle gameshow, company culture is at the forefront of our business.

The perks and benefits:
With a name like PerkSpot, it‚Äôs no secret that employee perks are kind of our thing. Below are a few of the many perks and benefits we offer to our people.

*Comprehensive medical, dental, vision insurance effective on your first day of employment, and *100% employer-funded short-term & long-term disability insurance
*Generous Paid-Time Off and fully-paid parental leave
*401(k) with company match and free financial consulting from Mariner Financial
*WFH flexibility and home-office set-up stipend
*On-site gym access, bring your pet to work!
*Access to our exclusive perks & discounts

How to apply:
All applications will be kept strictly confidential. Feel free submit a resume and cover letter telling us how you stack up to the qualifications, plus any other information you feel would be relevant to PerkSpot. Don‚Äôt be afraid to show your spark and personality!

All positions require a full background screening.

PerkSpot is not able to provide any immigration sponsorship at this time.

Offering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture is a priority at PerkSpot. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

title: Senior Data Consultant
description:
About the job
A key client of mine is one of the largest consulting firms globally, they have over 40,000 employees worldwide and over $2B in revenue. They have seen year-on-year growth and are continuing to perform right now with their revenue seeing annual growth of 12%.

We hold a retained search for a Senior Big Data expert who is required to build out a Global Data Centre of Excellence, and work across their Fortune 500 client portfolio to support in digital transformation.

This is a huge opportunity to be a part of a growing practice with great benefits including a performance bonus that can be overachieved every year.

Responsibilities:
Design data analytics solutions by utilising the big data technology stack
Create and present solution architecture documents with deep technical details
Work closely with business in identifying solution requirements and key case studies/scenarios for future solutions
Conduct solution architecture review/audit, calculate and present ROI
Lead implementation of the solutions from establishing project requirements and goals to solution "go-live"
Participate in the full cycle of pre-sale activities: direct communications with customers, RFP processing, the development of proposals for implementation and design of the solution, presentation for proposed solution architecture to the customer and participation in technical meetings with customer representatives
Create and follow a personal education plan in the technology stack and solution architecture
Maintain a strong understanding of industry trends and best practices
Get involved in engaging new clients to further drive business in the big data space

Must Haves:
Strong ‚Äòhands-on‚Äô experience as a Big Data Architect with a solid design/development background with Java, Scala, or Python
Experience delivering data analytics projects and architecture guidelines
Experience in big data solutions on-premises and on the cloud (Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud)
Production project experience in at least one of the big data technologies
Batch processing: Hadoop and MapReduce/Spark/Hive
NoSQL databases: Cassandra/HBase/Accumulo/Kudu
Knowledge of Agile development methodology, Scrum in particular
Experience in direct customer communications and pre-selling business-consulting engagements to clients within large enterprise environments
Experience working within a consulting business and pre-sales experience would be highly attractive

Please Note - Unfortunately, my client is unable to offer H1B sponsorship.

title: Senior Automation Engineer
description:
About the job
A leading contract manufacturer for Medical Devices is in immediate need of a Sr. Automation Engineer for a 3-6 month project that will be based fully onsite in either Scottsdale or Phoenix.

Top Requirements:
BS degree minimum in Engineering.
Experience managing multiple capital equipment projects within FDA-regulated industry.
Subject Matter Expert (SME) of high-volume automated manufacturing equipment/systems.
Proficient in data analytics, Six Sigma, and lean manufacturing principles to drive projects (preferably proficient in Minitab).
Proficient in technical writing with experience developing and executing documents such as URS, engineering studies, validation protocols, work instructions, etc. (ideally has experience with ISPE GAMP 5 standards).
Responsibilities:
Champion new capital equipment projects (high-volume automated manufacturing cells/lines over $1M).
Develop User Requirements Spec (URS), Equipment Spec (ES), and consolidate all relevant information to acquire competitive bids from multiple machine builders.
Project management through equipment design and build, process development, validation, and commercialization.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
About the job
Title: Sr. Data Engineer/Architect
Location: United States - Remote (Must be willing to work CST/EST hours)
Full-Time Direct Hire W2
Salary: $140K - $150K Base

Position Overview
We are seeking an experienced Senior Data Engineer/Architect, supporting the backend of consumer-facing applications for our client's mobile and web platforms. This role focuses on delivering and optimizing data solutions using Azure SQL, CosmosDB, and Databricks. You will work closely with the engineering team to enhance the transactional data systems that power our client's resident app and property sites.

This role supports the transactional side of our client‚Äôs mobile app, specifically the backend for customer-facing applications, not traditional data warehousing. You will work with the enterprise data team, focusing on consumer-related data from Databricks.

Key Responsibilities
Data Development & Testing: Design, develop, and unit test database code using T-SQL, stored procedures, and views.
Database Structure & Design: Create, maintain, and optimize database structures to support business needs.
Data Ingestion & Processing: Own and maintain data ingestion and output for the Microsoft Customer Insights platform via Databricks.
Azure Data Pipeline Management: Create, deploy, and maintain Azure Data Factory (ADF) pipelines in line with best practices.
Performance Monitoring & Optimization: Monitor and enhance database performance, ensuring reliability and scalability in production environments.
Collaboration & Support: Work closely with application developers and data analysts to support complex data ingestion needs.
Code Reviews & Thought Leadership: Participate in code reviews and bring innovative ideas to optimize data solutions.
Data Preparation: Prepare data for predictive and prescriptive modeling, combining raw data from external sources.

Required Qualifications
Experience:
Data engineering experience with a focus on backend systems for customer-facing products.
Experience with CosmosDB.
Hands-on experience with Databricks.
Azure Data Factory.
Technical Skills:
Strong proficiency in Azure SQL, CosmosDB, and DataBricks.
Experience building data pipelines using SQL and No-SQL databases.
Knowledge of Azure Data Lakes Gen 2, Synapse, and Power BI.
Hands-on experience with ETL pipelines, real-time pipelines preferred.
Familiarity with Python, parallel processing frameworks like Spark, and MapReduce is a plus.
Agile Experience:
Familiarity with Agile software development processes.
Additional Skills:
Experience in code refactoring, CI/CD, and scalable data applications.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

Preferred Qualifications
Certifications:
Databricks certification is a plus.
Azure certification preferred but not required.
Additional Experience:
Familiarity with D365 Customer Insights and Dataverse.
Advanced degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field preferred.

Education:
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Management Information Systems, or equivalent experience required.
Advanced degree preferred.

title: Manager-Data Science
description:
About the job
You Lead the Way. We‚Äôve Got Your Back.

With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Here, you‚Äôll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that‚Äôs unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally.

At American Express, you‚Äôll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact‚Äîevery colleague has the opportunity to share in the company‚Äôs success. Together, we‚Äôll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world‚Äôs best customer experience every day. And we‚Äôll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.

Join Team Amex and let's lead the way together.

Advanced AI Capabilities & Smarketing Team is part of the Analytics, Investment & Marketing Enablement Team (AIM) within GCS organization of American Express. AIM group is responsible for driving Commercial Customer acquisitions, engagement & retention globally by evolving our card & beyond-card products, targeting customers over online and offline channels through delivering world-class Analytics, Insights and Data Products.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

Demonstrated ability to work independently and across a matrix organization partnering with cross-functional teams and external vendors to deliver solutions at top speed

Ph.D. degree preferred

Depending on factors such as business unit requirements, the nature of the position, cost and applicable laws, American Express may provide visa sponsorship for certain positions.

We back our colleagues and their loved ones with benefits and programs that support their holistic well-being. That means we prioritize their physical, financial, and mental health through each stage of life. Benefits include:

American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.

We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. title: ETL Developer
description:
About the job
About us

ConglomerateIT is a certified and a pioneer in providing premium end-to-end Global Workforce Solutions and IT Services to diverse clients across various domains. Visit us at http://www.conglomerateit.com


ConglomerateIT's mission is to establish global cross culture human connections that further the careers of our employees and strengthen the businesses of our clients. We are driven to use the power of global network to connect business with the right people without bias. We provide Global Workforce Solutions with affability.

Role: ETL Snowflake Developer
Location: Hybrid (Frisco TX)
Work Authorization: USC, GC, H4-EAD, H1-B Transfer & GC-EAD

Job Description:

We are seeking an experienced Sr. ETL Developer with expertise in designing and developing scalable data applications and pipelines. title: General Resume Submissions
description:
About the job
We are always looking for the ‚Äúbest and brightest‚Äù talent to join our family. At Jam City you will have the freedom to work and play with a team of entrepreneurs who aren‚Äôt afraid to get things done!

Perks & Benefits

Employee Stock Options

Unlimited Paid Time Off, Paid Sick Days & Holidays

100% Employee Covered Medical, Dental, Vision Plan Base Plans (PPO & HMO)

Life Insurance, 401k, Flexible Spending Accounts, Commuter Benefits & More

Catered Lunches & Well-stocked Kitchens

Food Truck Fridays

Yoga & Wellness Activities

Happy Hours

Company Retreats

Pet Friendly

Don't see anything on our Job Boards that fits your experience right now but still want to apply? Please submit your resume here! 

Company Description

Jam City is a global leader in mobile entertainment, providing social gaming experiences for millions of players around the world. Jam City was founded in 2010 by MySpace cofounders Chris DeWolfe and Aber Whitcomb, and former 20th Century Fox executive Josh Yguado. Jam City is the creative powerhouse behind some of the highest grossing and most enduring social gaming franchises for mobile, including Cookie Jam (Facebook ‚ÄúGame of the Year‚Äù winner) and Panda Pop. Jam City is the go-to studio for Hollywood, having developed immersive, narrative rich mobile games for iconic entertainment brands including Harry Potter, Family Guy, Marvel Avengers and Futurama. Jam City has 500 employees across studios in Los Angeles (HQ), San Francisco, San Diego and Buenos Aires. The Jam City team is known for its creative excellence and technological innovation in key areas including storytelling, data science and audience intelligence.

Check Out Life As a Jam Citizen

 Company news and events on our LinkedIn
 Company Blog
 Employee Feedback on our Comparably page
 Find videos on our teams and games on our Youtube

OUR COMMITMENT TO EQUITY, DIVERSITY, & INCLUSION

We believe in creating games that unite people across the world and that showcase our commitment to providing an environment that is both inclusive and diverse for our players and employees. We strive to create a workforce that is reflective of our global player community as we know that we are stronger and better when we play together. To help promote an inclusive culture, we celebrate the visible and invisible diversity of our Jam Citizens through initiatives including Employee Resource Groups, cultural events, trainings, speaker series, and more.

Jam City is an equal opportunity employer. We enthusiastically accept our responsibility to make employment decisions without regard to race, age, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, ancestry, religion, ethnicity, marital, or domestic partnerships status, disability, genetic information (including the refusal to submit to genetic testing), predisposing genetic characteristics, military status, veteran status, domestic violence victim status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expressions, or any other classification protected by federal, state, and local laws. Our management is committed to following this policy with respect to hiring, placement, promotion, transfer, demotion, layoff, termination, recruiting, pay, and other forms of compensation, training, and general treatment during employment.

About Jam City

Jam City is an award-winning mobile entertainment company providing unique and deeply engaging games that appeal to a broad, global audience. The company is the creative powerhouse behind some of the highest-grossing games, generating over $4 billion in aggregate lifetime bookings and nearly 1.5 billion downloads for hundreds of millions of players around the world. In addition to conceiving and developing the hugely popular Cookie Jam and Panda Pop franchises, the company is a partner for some of the biggest global IP holders, having developed immersive, narrative-rich mobile games around iconic entertainment brands from NBCUniversal, Disney, and Warner Bros. Games. The company‚Äôs popular RPG game Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery has generated over $500 million in bookings and 135 million installs since launch, Cookie Jam has generated over $1 billion in aggregate lifetime bookings, and Jurassic World Alive continues to be one of the top-grossing geo-location-based, AR mobile games in the market. Jam City has studios and talent located in Los Angeles (HQ), Burbank, Cedar Falls, Las Vegas, San Diego, San Francisco, and, internationally, in Berlin, Buenos Aires, Montevideo, Montreal, and Toronto. For more information, please visit www.jamcity.com .

title: AI Researcher / Engineer
description:
About the job
Moonwalk Biosciences is developing a therapeutics discovery and development platform for precise and controlled epigenetic engineering of cellular states. We aim to deeply profile the epigenetic states that underlie complex disease and develop novel therapeutics that treat and reverse them through precise control of cellular states.

Position
Moonwalk Biosciences is recruiting an AI Researcher / Engineer. As a key member of our R&D team, you will help build the Moonwalk Platform for controlled cellular reprogramming. You will develop and test AI models that can provide insight into epigenetic control of cellular functions, and predict the consequences of epigenetic edits.

Responsibilities
Work with the R&D team to build large-scale AI foundation models of DNA sequence and epigenetic state
Build training and validation datasets from a combination of public data and internally generated data
Help design wet lab experiments to generate the most effective model training data, potentially using an active learning approach
Apply AI models to advance Moonwalk‚Äôs therapeutic development programs

Required Qualifications
5+ years of experience working in AI / ML
Proficiency with one or more AI frameworks such as PyTorch or Tensorflow
Proven track record of high-caliber scientific work, e.g., demonstrated through publications in peer-reviewed scientific journals
Ability to excel in a team-first, supportive work environment, and clearly articulate ideas, problems, and solutions

Preferred Skills and Experience
Experience working at the intersection of biology and AI / ML
PhD in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Computational Biology or related field

Salary
Engineer I: The expected annual pay range for this position is $102,000 ‚Äì $138,000.
Engineer II: The expected annual pay range for this position is $121,000 ‚Äì $164,000.
Senior Engineer: The expected annual pay range for this position is $147,000 ‚Äì $199,000.
Staff Engineer: The expected annual pay range for this position is $170,000 ‚Äì $230,000.
Principal Engineer: The expected annual pay range for this position is $199,000 ‚Äì $270,000.
Exact compensation and title may vary based on skills and years of experience.

About Moonwalk Biosciences:
Moonwalk Biosciences is pioneering a new class of precision epigenetic medicines. Its novel platform technology provides a complete view of the epigenome in health and disease, with the most advanced AI prediction of epigenetic targets, and the broadest set of epigenetic engineering tools. Moonwalk was co-founded by Alex Aravanis, M.D., Ph.D., former CTO of Illumina, world-renowned scientist Feng Zhang, Ph.D. of the Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard, and a distinguished set of industry leaders and company builders. It has raised $57 million led by Alpha Wave Ventures, and joined by other leading life sciences investors ARCH Venture Partners, Future Ventures, GV, Khosla Ventures and YK Bioventures.

title: Technical Program Manager III
description:

title: Lead / Staff MLOps Engineer
description:

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
About the job
About the Team:
Our team develops and maintains recommendation and personalization algorithms. As a member of this team you will collaborate across Engineering, Product, and Data teams to apply machine learning methods to meet strategic product personalization goals, explore innovative, cutting edge techniques that can be applied to recommendations, and constantly seek ways to optimize operational processes.
This is an Individual Contributor role in content recommendations. You will be expected to lead recommendation and personalization algorithm research, development, and optimization for product areas, and to coordinate requirements and manage stakeholder expectations with Product, Engineering, and Editorial teams. You will be expected to help meet KPIs for product areas and to set and meet deadlines for external and internally facing tools, such as offline evaluation tools for pre-production algorithms. As an IC, you will also be responsible for helping to set the roadmap for algorithmic work ‚Äî not only for how to approach product requests for new recommendation features, but for helping to drive larger company objectives in the areas of personalization and content recommendation.

About the Role:
Algorithm Development and Maintenance: Utilize cutting edge machine learning methods to develop algorithms for personalization, recommendation, and other predictive systems; maintain algorithms deployed to production and be the point person in explaining methodologies to technical and non-technical teams
Feature Engineering and Optimization: Develop and maintain ETL pipelines using orchestration tools such as Airflow and Jenkins; deploy scalable streaming and batch data pipelines to support petabyte scale datasets
Development Best Practices: Maintain existing and establish new algorithm development, testing, and deployment standards
Collaborate with product and business stakeholders: Identify and define new personalization opportunities and work with other data teams to improve how we do data collection, experimentation and analysis

Required Qualifications:
7+ years of analytical and/or data engineering experience
7+ years of experience developing machine learning models and performing data analysis with Python or R
5+ years writing production-level, scalable code (e.g. Python, Scala)
5+ years of experience developing algorithms for deployment to production systems
In-depth understanding of modern machine learning (e.g. deep learning methods), models, and their mathematical underpinnings
Experience deploying and maintaining pipelines (AWS, Docker, Airflow) and in engineering big-data solutions using technologies like Databricks, S3, and Spark
Ability to gauge the complexity of machine learning problems and a willingness to execute simple approaches for quick, effective solutions as appropriate
Strong written and verbal communication skills

Additional Preferred Qualifications:
MS or PhD in statistics, math, computer science, or related quantitative field
Production experience with developing content recommendation algorithms at scale
Experience building and deploying full stack ML pipelines: data extraction, data mining, model training, feature development, testing, and deployment
Familiar with metadata management, data lineage, and principles of data governance
Experience loading and querying cloud-hosted databases such as Snowflake
Building streaming data pipelines using Kafka, Spark, or Flink

title: Internal Audit-Dallas-Associate-Data Analytics
description:
About the job
Job Description

Internal Audit - Embedded Data Analytics, Associate

The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments, and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world. We commit people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Our people are our greatest asset ‚Äì we say it often and with good reason. It is only with the determination and dedication of our people that we can serve our clients, generate long-term value for our shareholders and contribute to the broader public. We take pride in supporting each colleague both professionally and personally. From collaborative workspaces and ergonomic services to wellbeing and resilience offerings, we offer our people the flexibility and support they need to reach their goals in and outside the office

INTERNAL AUDIT

In Internal Audit, we ensure that Goldman Sachs maintains effective controls by assessing the reliability of financial reports, monitoring the firm‚Äôs compliance with laws and regulations, and advising management on developing smart control solutions. Our group has unique insight on the financial industry and its products and operations. We‚Äôre looking for detail-oriented team players who have an interest in financial markets and want to gain insight into the firm‚Äôs operations and control processes.

What We Look For

Goldman Sachs Internal Auditors demonstrate strong risk and control mindsets, analytical, exercise professional skepticism and are able to challenge and discuss effectively with management on risks and control measures. We look for individuals who enjoy learning about audit, businesses and functions, have innovative and creative mindsets to adopt analytical techniques to enhance audit techniques, building relationships and are able to evolve and thrive in teamwork and in a fast-paced global environment.

YOUR IMPACT

As The Third Line Of Defense, Internal Audit‚Äôs Mission Is To Independently Assess The Firm‚Äôs Internal Control Structure, Including The Firm‚Äôs Governance Processes And Controls, And Risk Management And Capital And Anti-financial Crime Frameworks, Raise Awareness Of Control Risk And Monitor The Implementation Of Management‚Äôs Control Measures. In Doing So, Internal Audit

 Communicates and reports on the effectiveness of the firm‚Äôs governance, risk management and controls that mitigate current and evolving risk
 Raise awareness of control risk
 Assesses the firm‚Äôs control culture and conduct risks
 Monitors management‚Äôs implementation of control measures

Goldman Sachs Internal Audit comprises individuals from diverse backgrounds including chartered accountants, developers, risk management professionals, cybersecurity professionals, and data scientists. We are organized into global teams comprising business and technology auditors to cover all the firm‚Äôs businesses and functions, including securities, investment banking, consumer and investment management, risk management, finance, cyber-security and technology risk, and engineering.

Responsibilities

Execute on DA strategy developed by IA management within the context of audit responsibilities, such as risk assessment, audit planning, creation of reusable tools and providing innovative solutions to complex problems
Partner with audit teams to help identify risks associated with businesses and facilitate strategic data sourcing and develop innovative solutions to increase efficiency and effectiveness of audit testing
Build production ready analytical tools to automate repeatable and reusable processes within IA
Build and manage relationships and communications with Audit team members

Skills And Relevant Experience

3-6 years of experience with a minimum of Bachelor‚Äôs in Computer Science, Math, or Statistics
Experience with RDBMS/ SQL
Proficiency in programming languages, such as Python, Java, or C++
Knowledge of basic statistics, including descriptive statistics, data distribution models,
Time Series Analysis, correlation, and regression, and its application to data
Strong team player with excellent communication skills (written and oral). Ability to communicate what is relevant and important in a clear and concise manner and ability to handle multiple tasks
Strong contributing member of Data Science team and help build analytical capabilities for Internal Audit Division
Driven and motivated and constantly taking initiative to improve performance
Experience with advanced data analytics tools and techniques
Familiarity with text analytics and NLP using python
Familiarity with machine learning algorithms and exposure to supervised and unsupervised learning - Linear/Logistic Regression, SVM, Random Forest and Boosting,
Clustering and Patterns Recognition techniques
Experience with analytical/ statistical programs such as SAS, SPSS, and R
Experience with visualization tools (Spotfire, Qlikview or Tableau) is a plus
Creativity/Innovation, i.e., ability to create new ways to improve current processes and develop practical solutions that add value to department

About Goldman Sachs

At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.

We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers.

We‚Äôre committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html

¬© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2021. All rights reserved.

Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

title: Scientist I
description:
About the job
Immediate need for a talented Scientist I. This is a 12+ months contract opportunity with long-term potential and is located in Framingham, MA (Onsite). Please review the job description below and contact me ASAP if you are interested.

Job ID: 24-42683

Develop, characterize, and test an integrated and automated cell culture process platform and associated process strategies through the integration of sensing technology, data analytics and automation.
Investigate, design, and independently execute research activities using the aforementioned process platform to improve cell culture process performance (productivity and/or product quality), optimize platform workflows and deepen scientific understanding of cell culture production systems.

Lead efforts for industrialization and technology transfer of proposed automated cell culture process platform and associated process strategies within.
Responsible for planning, executing, documenting, and interpreting experimental work and results with appropriate supervision and documentation.
Author high quality scientific and operational documentation and deliver scientific presentations.

Key Skills; Mammalian cell culture, process development, Upstream, Bioreactors

Hands on experience/coursework/knowledge in mammalian cell culture process development:
Experience with mammalian cell cultures (Experience with CHO cells, HEK cells, HeLa cells, CAR-T cells or T-cells, etc), therapeutic molecule production (enzymes, monoclonal antibodies, viral vectors, vaccines or cell therapy) and/or upstream process development (batch, fed-batch or perfusion cultures)
Coursework/knowledge and preferably past hands-on experience in bioreactor operation (bench scale and/or pilot scale stirred tank bioreactors or wave bioreactors) 3+ years of relevant experience

Experience with sensor technology (spectroscopy, electrochemical, chromatographic or other), PAT applications (process monitoring or process control), etc.
Hands on experience/coursework/knowledge in Data Analytics:
Potential experience with Statistical, Machine Learning or Deep Learning for regression in predictive models.
Master‚Äôs degree (2-4 years) or PhD degree (0-2 years) in Biotechnology, (Bio)Chemical engineering, Biology, Biochemistry, or a related field.
Relevant knowledge, coursework and/or hands-on experience in mammalian cell culture process development (e.g., cell biology and biochemistry, cell culture engineering, recombinant protein production, bioreactor engineering, protein product characterization, sterility and aseptic techniques, technology transfer, etc.).
Strong motivation, curiosity, attention to detail, multitasking ability and active problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
Ability to work both independently and in a team-oriented environment with strong project management and communication skills (oral/written).
Relevant knowledge, coursework and/or hands-on experience in Process Analytical Technology (PAT), its applications (process monitoring, control, and supervision) and/or in-line/on-line sensing technology (e.g. Spectroscopy, Optical, Enzymatic, Chromatographic sensors, etc.)
Knowledge, coursework and/or hands-on experience in process data analytics (multivariate, time series and/or signal processing through statistical/machine learning methods).

Our client is a leading Healthcare Industry, and we are currently interviewing to fill this and other similar contract positions. If you are interested in this position, please apply online for immediate consideration.

title: Credit Strategy Data Scientist ** Hybrid role **
description:

Our client, provides automated, cloud-based software for financial operations, seeks an accomplished Credit Strategy Data Scientist.

*** Candidate must be authorized to work in USA without requiring sponsorship ***

****************************************************************

*** Location: Draper, UT 84020 / San Jose, CA 95002

Looking for a talented, enthusiastic, and dedicated person to join the Credit Risk Strategy team.

title: Data Analyst
description:
About the job
Position: Business Data Analyst (FAN Site Deployment)
Location: Hybrid - Rosemead, CA 91770

POSITION SUMMARY
The FAN Site Deployment Data Analyst will be part of the Field Area Network (FAN) group within the Information Technology Grid Services organization at our utility company. This role supports the telecom and construction teams in project management, technical planning, and data analytics, with a focus on FAN Radio Access Network (RAN) site planning, construction, and equipment installation.

The successful candidate will have telecom experience, preferably with companies like Verizon or T-Mobile, and will be proficient in data analytics, reporting, and business analysis. This individual will gather data from various sources to generate insightful reports and analytics that drive decision-making.

Position Overview:
Support the project manager and team in planning and deploying FAN Radio Access Network (RAN) sites, including construction and equipment installation.
Gather, track, and report on business requirements for site deployment projects, ensuring all stakeholder needs are met.
Provide documentation, RAID (Risks, Assumptions, Issues, Dependencies) management, and project administration support.
Update project plans and provide status reporting to management, supporting project tracking and reporting needs.
Conduct data intake from multiple sources to perform business analysis, offering solutions and alternatives to business problems.
Develop and map business processes related to FAN RAN site deployment.
Manage and store project artifacts for the deployment team.
Work with stakeholders to ensure project results meet requirements, design, and implementation goals.
Perform problem analysis, providing resolution and mitigation strategies as necessary.
Act as a key resource to management, customers, and clients on specific project-related issues.
Support the deployment team by developing, managing, and maintaining project artifacts and documentation.

Responsibilities/Job Duties:
Leads the gathering and identification of business and system requirements for migration and integration into the Field Area Network.
Coordinates with Stakeholders to ensure results meet requirements, design and implementation needs.
Performs problem analysis, directs implementation of resolution and mitigation.
Acts as key resource or consultant to department and division management, customers, and client organization on specific project, functional, or strategic issues with moderate to broad impact.
Consult with project and program management on risks, issues, project tracking, changes and technical direction of deliverables.
Perform project maintenance activities like updating project plans.
Develop and map business processes

Required:
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a related field.
5+ years of business and technical experience in network areas, consulting with clients, and developing solutions to meet business needs.
Strong knowledge of analytical methods and the ability to gather data from various sources for reporting and analysis.
Experience with project management tools and techniques, including RAID management and project tracking.
Experience with Microsoft Visio for business process mapping.
Six Sigma certification.
Certified Scrum Master (CSM)
Hands-on experience with 4G LTE or 5G network infrastructure.
Telecom or wireless network knowledge, with experience working for companies such as Verizon, T-Mobile, or similar.
Experience with data analytics and reporting, with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.

Preferred
Experience with Site Tracker for managing telecom construction projects and deployments.

title: Quantitative Development & Data Science Internship
description:
About the job
2100935-2

Job Description

Quantitative Development & Data Science Internship

Our Mission

At Fidelity, we are focused on making our financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want‚Äî from the 23 million people investing their life savings, to the 20,000 businesses managing their employee benefits programs, to the 10,000 advisors and institutions needing innovative technology solutions to invest their clients‚Äô money. Certifications

Company Overview

Fidelity Investments is a privately held company with a mission to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients. We help people invest and plan for their future. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients‚Äô money.

Join Us

At Fidelity, you‚Äôll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoples‚Äô lives, including yours. You can take advantage of flexible benefits that support you through every stage of your career, empowering you to thrive at work and at home. Honored with a Glassdoor Employees‚Äô Choice Award, we have been recognized by our employees as a top 10 Best Place to Work in 2024. Fidelity‚Äôs hybrid working model blends the best of both onsite and offsite work experiences. Working onsite is important for our business strategy and our culture. We also value the benefits that working offsite offers associates. Most hybrid roles require associates to work onsite all business days of every other week in a Fidelity office.

At Fidelity, we value honesty, integrity, and the safety of our associates and customers within a heavily regulated industry. Certain roles may require candidates to go through a preliminary credit check during the screening process. Candidates who are presented with a Fidelity offer will need to go through a background investigation, detailed in this document, and may be asked to provide additional documentation as requested. This investigation includes but is not limited to a criminal, civil litigations and regulatory review, employment, education, and credit review (role dependent). These investigations will account for 7 years or more of history, depending on the role. Where permitted by federal or state law, Fidelity will also conduct a pre-employment drug screen, which will review for the following substances: Amphetamines, THC (marijuana), cocaine, opiates, phencyclidine.

We invite you to Find Your Fidelity at fidelitycareers.com.

Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that the most effective way to attract, develop and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging.

Fidelity will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities who need adjustments to participate in the application or interview process. To initiate a request for an accommodation, contact the HR Accommodation Team by sending an email to accommodations@fmr.com.

title: Sr. Data Analytics Auditor
description:
About the job
The Sr. Data Analytics Auditor is a highly analytical and skilled data specialist who helps Internal Audit effectively leverage the vast amount of AutoZone data by providing ad-hoc and project-based data analysis support and developing and maintaining analytics tools used for supporting Audit projects across all functional areas (Store Operations, Finance, Merchandising, Supply Chain, etc.). The position helps the team deliver valuable recommendations to mitigate risk, strengthen control structures, and improve operational efficiency. The Sr. Data Analytics Auditor will work with Internal Audit leadership to develop and execute a centralized process for supporting audit project teams and Company initiatives by providing services such as data mining, statistical analysis and dashboarding and reporting. This will require interaction with team members across Internal Audit and other critical functional areas to understand their requirements in order to develop data analysis solutions. In addition, this individual will be responsible for delivering training to the Internal Audit team members on the standard business intelligence and analytics tools used in the department.

Key Responsibilities

Provide services such as data mining, statistical analysis, dashboarding, and reporting to the Internal Audit team
Help audit project teams by providing analytical insights gleaned through research and data analysis 
Enhance data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytical tools for audit project teams and the business
Develop and maintain an in-depth understanding of AutoZone‚Äôs data tables available for analysis and guide and educate staff members
Extend and enhance AutoZone‚Äôs data with third-party data sources
Process, cleanse, and verify the integrity of data used for analysis
Perform ad-hoc analysis and present results in a clear and creative manner
Create automated fraud and risk detection tools to continuously audit and monitor activity
Maintain and enhance the audit department‚Äôs internal KPI reporting
Integrate data analytics into Enterprise Risk Management, annual risk assessment, and project planning
Deliver training to department associates on the standard BI and analytics tools used in the department

Education And/or Experience

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Analysis, Finance, Accounting, or other related business field. Master‚Äôs degree preferred
Minimum of 5 - 7 years of Audit experience
Minimum of 1 - 2 years data analysis experience
Experience and proficiency in analyzing structured and unstructured data
Strong data mining skills and familiarity with the BI tools and technology such as R, Python, Big Query, and Looker. PeopleSoft or SAP experience a plus.
Familiarity with data visualization tools to develop dashboards and reporting
Able to identify and address data imperfections such as missing values, inconsistent string and/or data formatting
Able to know the context of the business situation at hand with regards to data and able to predict questions and challenges to assumptions and conclusions
Able to describe findings or the way techniques work to audiences, both technical and non-technical

Benefits at AutoZone

AutoZone cares about people. That‚Äôs why AutoZone offers thoughtful benefits programs with one-on-one benefit guidance designed to improve AutoZoners‚Äô physical, mental and financial wellbeing.

Some Of These Benefits Include

 Competitive pay and paid time off
 Unrivaled company culture
 Medical, dental, vision, life, and short- and long-term disability insurance options 
 Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts with wellness rewards
 Exclusive Discounts and Perks, including AutoZone In-store discount
 401(k) with Company match and Stock Purchase Plan
 AutoZoners Living Well Program for mental and physical health
 Opportunities for career growth and tuition reimbursement 

Eligibility and waiting period requirements may apply; benefits for Autozoners in Puerto Rico, Hawaii or the U.S. Virgin Islands may differ. Learn more about all that AutoZone has to offer at‚ÄØcareers.autozone.com

title: Data Scientist
description:
About the job
Data Scientist at TRKKN

As a catalyst for innovative digital marketing ideas, what excites us at TRKKN is using a data-driven approach to take our clients‚Äô business to the next level. 

Working for TRKKN means that you'll be part of an inspiring, energetic, and international team in a fast-growing tech environment. We offer the ideal workplace for anyone who wants to grow, learn, and has a strong desire for solving complex business challenges. 

Being on the bleeding edge of marketing technology and innovation means you will have an unparalleled opportunity for learning, along with personal and professional growth: there's never a dull moment here.

Responsibilities
As a Data Scientist, reporting into the Head of Data & Strategy at TRKKN North America (NA), you‚Äôll focus on building scalable machine learning and AI products to help evaluate and optimize the business impact of our clients‚Äô marketing investment. 
Whether working with our existing repository of products or building TRKKN‚Äôs next-gen capabilities, you‚Äôll leverage your expertise in statistics and programming to develop and deploy scalable solutions within the cloud. 
Working as a leader within TRKKN globally, you will contribute directly to company growth goals by faithfully managing and executing robust and complex data science and engineering projects. As company headcount grows, you‚Äôll be expected to foster the development of junior employees, creating a roadmap for professional growth for a data science career at TRKKN NA. To be successful in this role, you‚Äôll: 
Act as Data Science Subject Matter Expert (SME) in the delivery and development of machine learning and AI products
Deploy data products from our existing proprietary codebase and translate outcomes/findings in a digestible format for clients and internal stakeholders
Design tech infrastructure and data pipelines (ETL, data automation, data querying, etc.) when necessary
Aid agency leadership New Business efforts by executing ad hoc and custom analyses when necessary

Requirements:
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field (advanced degree is preferred)
3+ years of experience, preferably in Data Science
Expertise with Google Cloud Platform‚Äôs distributed Machine Learning, Data Science and Data Engineering tools (e.g. BigQuery ML, VertexAI, AutoML, Docker, Kubernetes, Kubeflow, Dataproc)
Experience with Git, GitLab, CI/CD pipelines on Gitlab, and Terraform
Experience with Big Data frameworks (e.g. Hadoop MapReduce, Spark, Hive, Kafka)
Strong analytical mindset with expert knowledge of SQL and BigQuery, as well as BI tools such DataStudio and Looker (LookML) to implement business reports and BI solutions.
Deep understanding and experience with advanced analytics, Machine Learning (ML), Deep Learning (DL), Natural Language Processing (NLP) or Computer Vision (at least 3 of these areas)
Proficiency in Python and specialized ML libraries (e.g. TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, scikit-learn, SciPy, Pandas, NumPy)
Experience working on a data science team, participating in scrums, sprints, and retrospectives
Ability to clearly explain complex ideas to non-expert audiences 
Familiarity with media, media measurement, predictive modeling, and segmentation a plus

TRKKN is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age, or any other federally protected class. For this role, Benefits include: health insurance, vision insurance, dental insurance, 401(k), Healthcare Flexible Spending Account, Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account, vacation days, sick days, personal days, paid parental leave, paid medical leave, and STD/LTD insurance benefits.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
About the job
Impact

As a Senior Data Scientist on the Marketplace Product Data Science team, you will collaborate closely with diverse teams (including product managers, engineers, and fellow data scientists) to advance our understanding of the customer, make predictions to improve our products and experiences, and design and measure experiments. Our ideal candidate will be data-driven, intellectually curious, technically and statistically rigorous, and a clear communicator.

In this role you will bring strong technical expertise and develop a thorough understanding of our data to drive insights in the areas of customer acquisition, engagement, retention, and loyalty through causal inference and experimentation methods. You will contribute to organizational maturity in data storytelling and best-in-class ML and statistical approaches and design product experiments to test business hypotheses, apply rigorous statistical analyses, and interpret the results to draw impactful insights.

What You‚Äôll Need to Be Successful

Advanced degree preferred in a quantitative field, and a minimum of 4 years of industry experience.
Experience with exploratory data analysis, statistical analysis and testing, experiment design and model development, and knowledge of how to leverage these skills to solve complex business problems.
Expertise in causal inference.
Proficiency in programming languages (we use Python) and experience with data analysis and machine learning libraries (e.g. TensorFlow, PyTorch, Airflow, etc).
Strong SQL skills (we use Snowflake).
Experience with a data visualization tool (we use Tableau).
Demonstrated ability to learn and embrace new technologies, applications, and solutions.
Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to explain technical topics to data scientists, engineers, and business partners.
Ability to work collaboratively in a dynamic, team-based environment.
Experience as a technical lead and a passion for mentoring.

Work Arrangement

Shipt considers candidates located near a Shipt office or workspace in Birmingham, San Francisco, or Minneapolis to be hybrid, which means that they have the flexibility to work from home (with leader approval) or at a Shipt office in order to facilitate the ability to innovate, collaborate, and spark team connections. In-office expectations will vary by role and leader. Certain roles may require in-office presence on a full-time basis. Please work with your recruiter to learn more about the classification of this role.

About Shipt

Shipt is a retail tech company that connects people to reliable, high-quality delivery with a personal touch. Shipt connects customers to the things they want from the stores they love, retail businesses to more satisfied customers, and workers to new earning opportunities.

At Shipt, we aim to put our team first to boost a sense of belonging, spark opportunities for growth, provide unique benefits and commit to giving back to our communities in ways that make life better, both personally and professionally. We understand that our service, our culture, and our connection to our communities are only made better by every single person who shows up to work here every day. Learn More.

Shipt is an independently operated, wholly owned subsidiary of Target Corporation and available in more than 5,000 U.S. cities. Shipt was founded and is headquartered in Birmingham, Alabama. For more information, please visit Shipt‚Äôs company site at Shipt.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, ethnicity, religion or religious belief, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, military or veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Please inform your recruiting contact upon initial connection if you need any accommodations.

Employees (and eligible family members) are covered by medical, dental, vision and more. Employees may enroll in our company‚Äôs 401k plan. Employees will also be eligible to receive discretionary vacation for exempt team members, paid holidays throughout the calendar year and paid sick leave. Other compensation includes eligibility for an annual bonus and the potential for restricted stock units based on role.

Pay Range

Metro Areas of Boston, District of Columbia, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Seattle and New York City:

$121,487-$242,974

All other locations:

$101,239-$202,478

Please note that the salary range above is a guideline, and individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as qualifications, skill level, competencies, and work location.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
About the job
About Us 
Our people are our biggest asset. They support the core of our existence, and we take pride in their skills, proficiency, and achievements. This belief allows us to create the best working environment for our employees that provides a technically challenging and rewarding experience along with a healthy work-life balance. 

We look for professionals who are driven, motivated, passionate about their work and are willing to take initiatives to work towards achieving goals by team effort. We'll make sure you get valuable feedback, coaching, and knowledge from the people you work with and help you‚ÄØoffer the same to others. 

The Role 
As a Senior Data Engineer you will be working alongside others on the Software Design Partners team in developing effective and high-quality data solutions that meet customer business objectives. This role will be responsible for architecting data solutions, designing and creating data models, transforming data using ETL tools, developing integrations, as well as working with our development and business intelligence teams. This role will also have customer-facing responsibilities including defining current state and future state data architectures, gathering and validating requirements, handling requests, providing updates, and troubleshooting issues. 

An ideal candidate will have a strong technical background, natural technical curiosity, the ability to learn as technology changes, and a desire to contribute wherever needed. 

Responsibilities
Continue to learn and leverage the latest data management tools and practices. 
Architect, design, develop and implement solutions with databases, database systems, integration processes and analytics. 
Azure Fabric to design and implement data warehouse/business intelligence solutions. 
Azure Synapse working with pipelines, data lakes, SQL Serverless, SQL Dedicated Pools, etc. to design and implement data warehouse/business intelligence solutions. 
Design, develop and maintain semantic models using SQL Server, SQL Server Analysis Services, Microsoft Fabric and other database systems. 
Analyze data, identify relationships, and relate data to business processes. 
Utilize ETL tools to move and transform data between systems. 
Troubleshoot, diagnose, repair, and document solutions and problems with databases, database systems, or integration processes. 
Effectively communicate orally and in writing in a clear and straightforward manner. 
Evaluate business processes, identify areas for improvement, and document requirements. 
Collaborate with external clients to gather requirements, handle requests, provide updates and troubleshoot issues. 
Work closely with business analysts, application architects, QA test engineers, project managers, and other teams. 
Work independently or in a team-based environment depending upon the project needs. 
Handle multiple projects and tasks, make decisions, solve problems, prioritize and organize effectively, and show initiative in a fast-paced environment. 
Follow established best practices for database and data warehouse architecture. 

Background and Qualifications
Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent experience. 
5+ years related experience or more. 
Experience in building data lake houses in Azure Synapse or Azure Fabric 
Experience in designing data models and knowledge of different ETL design and development methodologies (e.g. SSIS, Apache Kafka, Apache Spark, Talend). 
Experience with extracting data from relational databases as well as 3rd party software. 
Knowledge and experience using business intelligence tools such as Power BI or Tableau. 
Configuring databases and services, setting up service accounts. 
Development experience with SQL (Preferably TSQL). 
Strong analytic and problem-solving skills. 
Broad business-related knowledge. 
Experience in gathering and documenting business and functional requirements. 
Must be authorized to work in the US for any employer. 

Preferred skills, but not required: 
Understanding of Business Intelligence/Data Warehouse architecture and concepts. 
DAX or MDX experience. 
Building solutions in Microsoft Fabric. 
Experience using Python. 
Reporting experience using SSRS, Power BI or other similar tools. 
Open source DB background (e.g. PostgreSQL, MySQL). 
Cloud database experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) or Google Cloud

title: Data Science / Gen AI - Sr Level
description:
About the job
Job Description: 
We are seeking a highly skilled and versatile Senior Data Scientist with deep expertise in both forecasting and generative AI technologies. 
The ideal candidate will bring a strong background in time series analysis, advanced machine learning, deep learning techniques, and a robust experience in building ML solutions on AWS. 
Additionally, proficiency in generative AI models and cutting-edge techniques like Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) and LangChain is highly desirable. 

Key Responsibilities: 
Forecasting & Data Science: 
Rapidly experiment, develop, and implement advanced forecasting models for demand or sales forecasting. 
Apply time series analysis, statistical methods, and machine learning algorithms to build accurate and scalable forecasting solutions. 
Design and develop global forecasting models incorporating economic, demographic, historical trends, and other relevant factors. 
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, analyze data, and deliver actionable insights. 
Partner with data engineers to deploy and integrate forecasting solutions into production systems. 
Conduct thorough evaluation and validation of forecasting models to ensure accuracy and reliability. 
Stay current on advancements in forecasting techniques, machine learning algorithms, and cloud technologies. 
Generative AI & Advanced Technologies: 
Design, implement, and maintain advanced generative AI models using Python and LlamaIndex, including techniques such as RAG to enhance model performance. 
Integrate LangChain for advanced language understanding and processing to deepen the integration of generative models with natural language processing tasks. 
Develop and manage sophisticated indexing systems and utilize vector databases for efficient handling of high-dimensional linguistic data. 
Collaborate with the development team to ensure seamless integration of generative AI technologies into products and services. 
Work with cloud AI services such as Amazon Bedrock and Azure OpenAI Studio to build, deploy, and scale AI solutions, ensuring they meet standards for robustness and efficiency. 
Remain at the forefront of AI advancements, particularly in generative models, language understanding, RAG, and vector databases, to enhance AI offerings and maintain a competitive edge. 

Candidate's Profile: 
Education: 
Master‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or a related field. 

Experience: 
Minimum of 5 years of experience in data science with a focus on forecasting. 
Strong proficiency in time series analysis, statistical modeling, and machine learning algorithms. 
Advanced experience with AWS services (e.g., SageMaker, S3, EC2, Lambda) and cloud-based AI services (e.g., Amazon Bedrock, Azure OpenAI Studio). 
Experience in designing and deploying generative AI models using Python and LlamaIndex, with familiarity in frameworks like LangChain. 
Demonstrated expertise in developing innovative AI solutions and working with vector databases. 

Skills: 
Excellent problem-solving abilities and the capability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

This role offers a unique opportunity to leverage your expertise in both traditional data science and cutting-edge AI technologies, driving innovation and contributing to impactful projects in a dynamic environment.

title: Business Analyst
description:
About the job
Description

Company

SDI Presence LLC is an IT systems integration and consultancy that leverages its strong team presence to advance our clients to a secure digital enterprise. With a 28-year corporate resume, SDI delivers strategic managed services, IT consulting, and hybrid infrastructure solutions to optimize our clients‚Äô technology environments. SDI is a certified Minority Business Enterprise (MBE), with a portfolio of clients that includes some of the nation‚Äôs largest utilities, airports, commercial real estate portfolios, and government agencies. SDI delivers a deep technical presence through a local delivery model to achieve customer confidence and success. Visit us at www.sdipresence.com and connect with us on X and Instagram.

Although we list out what we generally look for in this job description, we are very likely missing other attributes and skills that you have that could make you a great fit but are not currently listed. The point we‚Äôre getting at is it doesn‚Äôt hurt to take a chance and apply! 

Summary

The Business Analyst will work on a team to perform analysis to understand business requirements and work with other SMEs to develop and document solutions. This individual will also assist with ensuring that deliverables meet client standards and expectations. The successful candidate may work on multiple projects simultaneously and be a team player.

Responsibilities

Determine objectives by studying business functions, gathering information, conducting research, and evaluating output requirements

Take detailed meeting minutes and determine actionable next steps
Help track project progress and create status reports

General consulting experience at a large firm is a plus
Testing, Training, Change Management experience a plus

Demonstrated ability to develop insights from data analysis and management/stakeholder discussions
Demonstrated ability to perform discrete tasks and activities and/or execute on portions of projects
Ability to effectively present to and work with senior management
Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Other Duties

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
