Rust-Oleum is an equal opportunity employer. Employment selection and related decisions are made without regard to sex, race, age, disability, religion, national origin, color, or any other protected class.

title: Data Engineer
description:
About the job
**Must currently live near Denver or Boulder CO**

Role Title: Senior Data Engineer (Airflow Implementation)
Employment Type: Contract/Contract to Hire
Duration: 4 months, potential for extensions and conversion to a FTE
Preferred Location: Denver or Boulder, CO preferred for occasional onsite
Role Description:
This client is searching for a Sr. Data engineer who possess strong skills in developing, managing, and optimizing data workflows, handling complex data environments, and utilizing contemporary data platforms. This position requires expertise in Databricks, Airflow, Snowflake, PySpark, Python, and SQL, as well as the capability to design and maintain data ecosystems and operational data systems.
Data Workflow Development: Design and implement efficient, scalable, and reliable data workflows using Databricks, PySpark, and SQL to handle large datasets.
Lead Airflow Optimization and Implementation: Lead efforts to set up, maintain, and optimize Airflow, providing the engineering team with guidance on best practices.
Environment Setup: Work closely with the environment manager to set up and maintain various environments (development, testing, and production) optimized for both performance and cost.
Operational Data Systems: Collaborate on the design and development of operational data systems, ensuring they meet the needs of performance, scalability, and availability.
Optimization: Constantly monitor and adjust data processes to optimize resource utilization and minimize delays in data handling.
Best Practices: Develop and enforce best practices for coding, testing, documentation, and deployment within the data engineering team.
Requirements:
- 5+ years in data engineering, focusing on managing large-scale environments and building complex data workflows.

Technical Proficiencies:
Databricks: Extensive hands-on experience.
Airflow: Strong expertise in job scheduling and automation with Airflow.
Snowflake: Deep knowledge of Snowflake as a data warehousing tool.
PySpark: Advanced proficiency in PySpark for distributed data operations.
Python: Solid Python skills for scripting and building data workflows.
SQL: Expert-level SQL for managing and querying data.
Environment Management: Proven experience managing cloud-based environments.
Operational Data Stores: Experience in creating and managing operational data systems.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or an equivalent field of study, or equivalent work experience.
Preferred Skills:
Cloud Platforms: Experience with AWS, Azure, or GCP.
Serverless Technologies: Familiarity with designing and implementing serverless solutions.
Data Lakes: Hands-on experience with Data Lake/Delta Lake.
Event-Driven Pipelines: Experience in designing event-driven data workflows.
CI/CD: Knowledge of continuous integration and deployment in a data engineering context.
Big Data Tools: Experience with additional tools in the big data space is a plus.

title: Business Analyst / SME ‚Äì Clinical Operations Data Analytics Platform
description:
About the job
Company Description
Fipsar is a premier boutique data solutions provider on a mission to empower biopharmaceutical and healthcare organizations to harness the transformative power of their data. We design and implement robust data platforms that elevate decision-making through cutting-edge AI and machine learning technologies. Our innovative solutions not only optimize clinical and commercial operations but also deliver actionable insights that drive accelerate R&D and meaningful improvements in patient outcomes. 

Role Description
We are seeking a skilled Business Analyst / Subject Matter Expert (SME) to collaborate with our data engineering and analytics teams in the design and development of a cutting-edge Clinical Operations Data Analytics Platform. You will serve as the critical bridge between clinical operations stakeholders and technical teams, ensuring that data solutions meet the business needs of clinical trial management and operational efficiency. Your expertise in clinical operations and data management will drive the development of a platform that delivers valuable insights for optimizing clinical trials.

Key Responsibilities:
Serve as the primary liaison between clinical operations teams and data engineering/analytics teams.
Gather and translate business requirements from clinical operations teams into detailed functional specifications for the data platform.
Analyze clinical trial processes and workflows to identify key data points and performance metrics needed for the platform.
Collaborate with data engineers to define data models, schemas, and ETL processes that align with clinical operations requirements.
Provide insights on clinical data standards (e.g., CDISC, SDTM, ADaM) and ensure that data models and analytics adhere to regulatory and operational guidelines.
Develop and maintain documentation (e.g., business requirements, process flows, data dictionaries) that guides platform development.
Support the testing and validation of data pipelines and analytics features to ensure alignment with clinical operations goals.
Ensure that the platform enables data visualization and reporting that provides actionable insights into clinical trial performance (e.g., timelines, patient recruitment, data quality).
Work closely with stakeholders to define KPIs and metrics for clinical trial performance and operational efficiency.
Facilitate cross-functional collaboration between IT, clinical operations, and biostatistics teams to ensure seamless platform development.
Support the adoption and change management processes for end-users of the clinical data analytics platform.


Qualifications
Bachelor's/Master‚Äôs degree in life sciences, data science, information systems, or related field.
5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst, SME, or similar role in clinical operations or clinical data management within the biopharma industry.
Strong understanding of clinical trial processes, operational workflows, and regulatory requirements (FDA, EMA, ICH GCP).
Familiarity with clinical data standards, including CDISC, SDTM, and ADaM, and experience with clinical trial data management systems (e.g., EDC, CTMS).
Experience working with data engineering teams to define requirements for data models, ETL pipelines, and data integration.
Strong skills in business process analysis, requirements gathering, and documentation.
Experience with data analytics tools and platforms (e.g., Qlik Sense, Tableau, Power BI, SAS, R) is a plus.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex clinical operations needs to technical teams.
Proven ability to collaborate across functional teams, driving the successful delivery of data solutions that meet business objectives.

title: Business Intelligence Architect
description:
About the job
Business Intelligence Architect - Investments 
Technology ¬∑ Charlotte, North Carolina

Summary

As the Business Intelligence Architect, you will act as a bridge between IT and business units in Investments and Finance, driving data strategy and integrating cloud-centric data models. Your role is crucial for leveraging data to drive strategic decisions and enhance collaboration across actuarial, financial, and investment domains.

Responsibilities

- Align technology solutions with business strategies in actuarial, finance, and investment areas.
- Design and implement cloud-based data architectures to boost analytics and reporting.
- Develop and manage data integration processes for Investments and Finance Data Models.
- Deploy advanced analytics tools, expanding Power BI and integrating SAP semantic models.
- Implement Data Mesh architecture for a scalable, flexible data environment.
- Ensure compliance with data security standards.
- Provide data guidance and support to business users.
- Maintain and document data architectures and processes, and educate staff on best practices.
- Stay updated on technology advancements to improve data strategies.
- Lead and support special tech projects as directed.

Qualifications

- Required Experience: Minimum 5 years in business intelligence, data architecture, or similar, with large-scale project management. Expertise in IT for financial, actuarial, and investment sectors; proficiency in data platforms and analytical tools; familiarity with reinsurance structures and actuarial modeling.
 - Preferred Experience: Advanced qualifications in data science, IT, or related fields; experience with Data Mesh and modern data architectures.

- Skills: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, robust project management, professional integrity, and attention to detail.

Other Information

- Supervisory Responsibilities: None
- Travel Requirements: Periodic as needed
- Compensation and Location: Full-time in Charlotte, NC with competitive salary, bonus, and benefits. Relocation may be required.

Contact Information

For inquiries, please contact us at info@ascenteum.co.uk.

title: Data Engineer
description:
About the job
Data Engineer - member of the Financial Operations and IT Teams and will support the company with the collection and storage of essential information and data. Will collaborate closely across departments, including IT, Finance, Accounting, Legal, Operations, People & Culture, Payroll, Marketing, etc. 
 Specific Responsibilities:
Develop standards of operation when handling and archiving data.
Maintain data management plans and instructions for operating our network of business systems. 
Design, develop, and modify data infrastructure to improve processes of data analysis and reporting.
Coordinate with other team members to reach project milestones and deadlines.
Identify areas for improvement in current systems.
Develop standards of operation when handling and archiving data.
Maintain security protocol.
Oversee the integration of new technologies and initiatives into data standards and structures.
Evaluate the design, selection, and implementation of database changes by comparing them with business requirements and design documents.
Assess system performance and make recommendations for hardware, software, and data storage improvements.
Ensure data and information security by integrating and upholding digital security systems.
Assist in basic maintenance of custom software application built in-house, which serves as our hospitals‚Äô KPI dashboard 

Skills and Experience:
5+ years of relevant data engineering experience.
Data visualization platforms such as Power BI and Tableau
Experience with different database systems including Microsoft SQL, AWS, Oracle, etc.
Ability to analyze, interpret, and organize large amounts of data.

Excellent communication skills to translate complex problems into digestible terms.

title: Education Analyst
description:
About the job
About Parsec Education:
Parsec Education is an innovative Educational Technology and Consulting company that aims to improve and transform K-12 education and student outcomes. Our mission is to modernize, evaluate, improve, and standardize the way schools view, interpret, and respond to data. Our vision is to make the world a better place to learn. We hold ourselves to the highest standards and pride ourselves on our core values: partner success, innovation, integrity, student-centered, and humor.

Role Summary:
The Education Analyst is a key member of our data analytics team, responsible for performing detailed analysis of varied educational data sets and delivering insights that support the objectives of our educational partners. This role requires a deep understanding of K-12 education, a technical skill set in data analysis and a creative approach to problem-solving to provide continuous support and innovative solutions to our partners' data needs. The Education Analyst will work under the direction of the Director of Education Data Analytics and will contribute significantly to projects and strategic initiatives through expert data handling and analysis. This role will work closely with a cross-functional team including a Partner Engagement Manager and Learning Integration Specialist to ensure coherent meaningful support for our partners.
Responsibilities:
Data Analysis and Reporting: Conduct thorough and complex data analyses to extract meaningful insights that support partner goals. Prepare detailed reports and presentations that clearly communicate these insights to both internal and external stakeholders.
Partner Support: Work directly with educational partners to understand their data needs and challenges. Provide ongoing support and tailored solutions that enhance their decision-making processes and educational outcomes.
Solution Development: Assist in the development and refinement of data-driven tools and solutions, ensuring they are effectively tailored to meet the specific needs of our partners.
Project Collaboration: Collaborate with other members of the data team and cross-functional teams to contribute to larger projects and initiatives, ensuring the integration and alignment of data analysis with overall strategic goals.
Innovation and Improvement: Continuously explore new data sources, analytical techniques, and technological advancements to enhance the analytics capabilities of the team.
Knowledge Sharing: Maintain up-to-date knowledge of developments in education data analytics and share relevant findings and best practices with the team to foster a learning environment.
Qualifications:
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Education, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in data analysis, preferably in an educational or EdTech setting.
Proficiency with data analysis tools and software (e.g., SQL, R, Python, Tableau).
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, capable of working effectively with both technical and non-technical teams.
Ability to handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment and adapt to evolving project requirements.
Ability to work On-site at our Fresno, CA office. Relocation opportunities are not being offered at this time.

Preferred Qualifications:
Master‚Äôs degree in Data Analysis or related field.

Benefits:
Great medical, dental, and vision insurance options
In addition to 14 observed holidays, team members have unlimited paid time off
401(k) plan with employer match
Employer Paid Life Insurance
Current Hybrid Environment - In Office: Monday-Wednesday, Remote: Thursday-Friday
Competitive Bonus Structure
Awesome Collaborative Office Space located in Downtown Fresno

Salary ranges are dependent on a variety of factors, including qualifications and experience. Range is not inclusive of potential bonus or benefits. Our Hiring Manager can share more information about the salary range specific to your working location and other factors during the hiring process.

title: Senior Data Management and Quality Assurance Analyst (Technical) (Hybrid)
description:
About the job
We are seeking a Senior Data Governance and Quality Assurance Analyst who will play a key role in establishing, leading, and overseeing data governance and data quality initiatives across the organization. This individual will enhance the integrity, security, and proper utilization of data while being technically hands-on, developing and executing SQL queries for reporting, data validation, and analysis.

The ideal candidate is a blend of strategic leader and technical expert who can work closely with business stakeholders, IT teams, and external partners to drive data governance policies, adherence to quality standards, and support the organization‚Äôs data-driven goals.

Key Responsibilities:
Data Governance Leadership:
Develop and implement a comprehensive data governance strategy, including policies, standards, and procedures.
Establish and lead a data governance council or working group, working with business units to achieve alignment.
Monitor compliance with data governance policies and facilitate data integrity across various systems.

Quality Assurance & Compliance:
Implement quality assurance frameworks to ensure data accuracy, completeness, and consistency.
Define and monitor data quality metrics, and take action to resolve data quality issues.
Ensure compliance with data-related regulations, including GDPR, HIPAA, or other relevant standards.

Technical & Hands-On SQL Development:
Write and optimize complex SQL queries for data extraction, analysis, and reporting.
Perform data validation, reconciliation, and troubleshooting of data issues.
Collaborate with IT teams to design and maintain databases, tables, and data architecture to support data governance objectives.

Stakeholder Collaboration:
Act as the key point of contact for business units and IT teams for data governance and quality issues.
Provide training and guidance to staff on best practices for data management and quality assurance.
Work with data engineers, analysts, and other IT staff to ensure data is clean, well-documented, and compliant with governance standards.

Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Management, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in data governance, data management, or quality assurance roles.
Proficiency in SQL with the ability to write, analyze, and optimize queries for complex datasets.
Experience with data governance frameworks and data quality management tools.
Familiarity with data compliance regulations (GDPR, HIPAA, etc.).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to troubleshoot and resolve data issues.
Excellent communication and leadership skills, with the ability to engage and influence stakeholders at all levels.
Experience with data warehousing or ETL processes is a plus.
Knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) is preferred but not required.

If you are passionate about data governance and quality assurance, and enjoy a balance between strategy and hands-on technical work, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

title: Software Engineering Manager
description:
About the job
Position: Software Engineering Manager
Duration: Permanent
Salary: 150-170k
Location: Hybrid, at least 2 days onsite in Redwood City, CA, travel to testing site in Watsonville, CA at least 4-5x/month

 Must-Haves
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics, or related fields
Proven track record of shipping a software/hardware product from start to finish.
5 years of professional experience within software engineering, building embedded systems firmware and software applications
Proficiency in a systems programming language such as Rust, C++, C, or Go.
Strong understanding of software development practices, including version control, testing, and documentation.

Plusses
Familiarity with within the following tech stack: Rust, Python, TypeScript/React, NVIDIA Jetson.
Experience in robotics software development, computer vision, machine learning, or autonomous systems.
Knowledge of agricultural systems or farming practices.

Day to Day
Insight Global is searching for a Software Engineering Manager for its startup robotics clients that is innovating within the field of agricultural technology. This software manager would be leading a team of software engineers, delegating critical tasks, mentoring team members, directing the shipping of software deployment to hardware that reaches clients, and interfacing with those clients to receive and implement feedback. The ideal candidate would have technical expertise and willing to work alongside their team to ensure delivery of software and updates in a timely manner. This manager will have had experience driving a software product through the development lifecycle and have it successfully be implemented, monitored, and improved within client-facing hardware. Work will span multiple areas, from cloud infrastructure and distributed systems to application development and embedded systems, ensuring the robots operate safely, efficiently, and effectively. Overall, the ideal candidate will be motivated and eager to work within a start-up that is committed to bettering the lives of farmers who are committed to green technology, regenerative practices, and the advancement of a foundational industry into the technological era.

title: IT Data Intern
description:
About the job

Job Description:



Introduction 

At GAF, we cover more than just buildings. We cover each other. Under this roof, you will have the tools and resources you need to begin, grow, and develop in your career. Under this roof, you will experience our incredible culture and be empowered to support your teammates, your customers and especially your community through collaboration. Under this roof, we define the future while leading the present through our commitment to continuous improvement and never being satisfied with the status quo. We are GAF. And under this roof, we protect what matters most.



Summary: 

Put your classroom studies into practice in the real world and gain the experience to help determine your journey after graduation. At GAF, we‚Äôll make sure you get going on your very first day with a comprehensive orientation into our company. In our program, you will have the opportunity to own your own projects, participate in meetings, and work cross-functionally with other departments. 



GAF is looking for a Data - Intern. The ideal candidate for this role is majoring in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or Engineering. This intern will assist with the development of new subject areas into GAF's Google big query data platform using tools such as Google Cloud Platform and Tableau for visualization and user enablement. The intern will have a great deal of opportunity to learn, contribute, and develop leadership skills. 

 

Essential Duties:
Develop a solution for a business need using Google Cloud Platform/Tableau Desktop
Conduct analysis on functionality and features that are of interest to the team.
Analyze data and generate insights to support the development of new products and features.
Present at a monthly Data Analytics meeting to a cross-function group of analysts
Learn support processes and participate in support rotation to address user requests and incidents
Establish how new metrics will be defined and measured, and partner with business teams to operationalize reporting
Deliver analytics and insights that are clear and digestible to non-technical stakeholders
 

Under This Roof, We Require 
Pursue of Bachelor‚Äôs Degree from an accredited institution, with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0
 Minimum 2 years of experience in the field of data organization, validation, and visualization
Fluency in expressing analytics needs, capabilities, and outcomes
Experience working with BI and data visualization platforms
Ability to communicate complex information with clarity and precision


Under This Roof, We also value 
Excellent communication skills 
Conduct rigorous quality assurance to ensure the accuracy and integrity of data
 

How We Protect What Matters Most 
We offer a wide range of health insurance options that include medical, dental, and vision for you and your family. 
Our Family-Building benefits support the many different journeys to fertility and parenthood.
Our robust 401K plan includes an employer match contribution with your pre-tax and/or Roth contributions.
Other exciting programs and perks are available to help employees achieve work-life balance, including (but not limited to) a wellness program, free financial coaching, a referral program, and product rebates when purchased for an employee‚Äôs primary residence. 
Professional growth and development are very important to us! We offer internal training programs and courses, as well as a generous tuition reimbursement program. 
We put diversity and inclusion into action with our Employee Resource Groups, which unite employees based on common perspectives, identities, demographic factors, or out of a desire to be an ally.
 

GAF complies with federal, state, and local disability laws and makes reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with disabilities. If a reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact HR Services at 833-HR-XPERT.










We believe our employees are our greatest resource. We offer competitive salary, benefits, 401k, and vacation packages for all full time permanent positions. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and GAF, Standard Logistics, SGI, and Siplast are proud to be affirmative action employers. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know. If applying for positions in the U.S., must be eligible to work in the U.S. without need for employer sponsored visa (work permit).

title: Analytical Scientist
description:
About the job
Analytical Scientist II

Monday-Friday: 8:30am-5pm
Location: Lancaster SC
Salary: $90,000-$105,000/year

Position Summary:
The Analytical Scientist will independently develop and validate new analytical methods while providing technical support to various corporate groups, including Quality Control and Quality Assurance.

Key Responsibilities:
Report to Analytical Chemistry (AC) Management and perform Quality Control testing and data review to support timely product release.
Develop, optimize, and validate analytical methods for raw materials, finished products, and stability studies.
Utilize Empower Software and other laboratory tools for chromatographic, spectroscopic, and wet chemistry analyses.
Assess testing methodologies and evaluate results from contract laboratories to ensure compliance with agreed methods.
Stay updated on technological trends and mentor chemists in method execution and validation study interpretation.
Manage hazardous waste according to RCRA and SCDHEC regulations, ensuring proper handling and labeling.
Communicate effectively across departments and contribute to team objectives.

Minimum Requirements:
Proficient in developing methods for chromatographic, spectroscopic, and wet chemistry analyses.
Strong troubleshooting skills with laboratory instruments.
In-depth knowledge of analytical method development and specification setting.
Familiarity with various laboratory instruments (FTIR, HPLC, GC, LC-MS, etc.) and characterization of botanical compounds.
Experience with effective sample preparation techniques and knowledge of statistical methods for data analysis.
Thorough understanding of FDA and ICH regulations, with experience in GLP/GMP environments.

Education and Experience:
Bachelor‚Äôs degree with 10 years of experience in analytical method development for nutraceuticals or pharmaceuticals in a GMP setting; a Master‚Äôs degree with 5 years of experience is preferred.
Degree in analytical chemistry, biochemistry, or chemical engineering is strongly preferred.
Ability to work on the bench as part of the Analytical Chemistry team.

title: Machine Learning Research Co-op
description:
About the job
You know the moment. It‚Äôs the first notes of that song you love, the intro to your favorite movie, or simply the sound of someone you love saying ‚Äúhello.‚Äù It‚Äôs in these moments that sound matters most.

At Bose, we believe sound is the most powerful force on earth. We‚Äôve dedicated ourselves to improving it for nearly 60 years. And we‚Äôre passionate down to our bones about making whatever you‚Äôre listening to a little more magical.

The engineering team at Bose is a thriving, passionate, deeply skilled team of professionals from a broad range of disciplines and experiences, who share a common goal‚Äîto create products that provide transformative sound experiences.

Job Description

THE PROGRAM

We're looking for students to join our Co-op Program who are obsessively curious about 'what's next'. You'll get hands-on experience with our products and learn from the best of the best in the business. You will work as part of the team for an established research project, or have a dedicated topic of applied research.

Opportunities don't stop at your day-to-day work. While you're getting a targeted look at your area of expertise, we'll expose you to other areas of the company. Our interns and co-ops are given the opportunity to connect with senior leadership across the business to understand different perspectives at Bose. You'll network with other co-ops and colleagues to grow your network for the future!

Timeframe - January to June 2025

THE ROLE

We are looking for an audio machine learning research co-op to join our research lab this summer and fall! In this role you will help build our next generation of wearable and software products that are empowered by deep learning, enabling people to hear better, focus better and achieve more.

Responsibilities

Develop, train, and evaluate deep learning algorithms with a focus on building models to solve (audio) signal processing and control problems. Research, implement and evaluate a variety of published approaches and algorithms for problems in ML and signal processing.

Minimum Qualification 

Recent graduate or currently is in the process of obtaining a M.S. or PhD in computer science, electrical engineering, machine learning, music technology, or related field. 
Strong programming background with 2+ years of experience in Python. 
Strong experience in implementing deep neural networks with Tensorflow, Keras, PyTorch, etc. 
Familiar with latest research in deep learning for audio and signal processing, and ability to implement published algorithms 
Experience with cross-group and cross-culture collaboration. 
High levels of creativity and quick problem-solving capabilities 

Preferred Qualification

Demonstrated software engineer experience via an internship, work experience, coding competitions. 
Strong publication record demonstrating innovative research in venues such as DCASE, ISMIR, ICASSP, etc. 
Strong knowledge and experience working with audio and digital signal processing, deep learning with time-domain signal, and control systems.

title: Senior Statistical Data Scientist (Healthcare Data)
description:

title: Sr. Enterprise Data Analyst
description:
About the job
Job Description:
We are seeking a Senior Enterprise Data Analyst to play a key role in enhancing the corporation's analytical capabilities across various business functions. This role will work closely with a diverse team comprising data scientists, analytical sponsors, analytics translators, data engineers, and other stakeholders to drive strategic data-driven initiatives enterprise-wide. The Data Analyst will work under the general direction of the Delivery Manager within the Enterprise Analytics team.
 Required Experience (5+ years):
‚Ä¢ Enterprise-wide data analytics and business intelligence experience.
‚Ä¢ Experience in operations research, statistical analysis, and/or business analysis.
‚Ä¢ Experience demonstrating advanced skill in the use of Microsoft Office Suite, including Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Access.
‚Ä¢ Experience and proficiency in SQL.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
About the job
Lazard is one of the world‚Äôs leading financial advisory and asset management firms. Our people make the difference. With just over 3,000 employees, our tight-knit community allows for professionals eager to learn and willing to teach to connect and grow together. We believe that diversity, equity, inclusion, and allyship are not just business imperatives ‚Äî they are central pillars of our employee experience. Our entrepreneurial culture and flat structure allow creative ideas and original concepts to drive our business forward ‚Äî and for careers to take flight.

Lazard‚Äôs Corporate functions empower strategic decision-making and ensure continued success of our firm. From Finance & Tax to Information Technology and Human Resources, our colleagues around the globe support our financial advisory and asset management business lines in many ways. By utilizing the latest technology, these integral groups make sure our businesses are compliant, operationally efficient, and profitable. 

The Corporate Technology group is seeking a highly skilled SVP, Senior Data Engineer to lead a Corporate Data Service team. This is a hands-on position. The successful candidate will be responsible for leading the design, development and implementation of data services within the Corporate business lines. Initial implementation and designs will focus on database designs for use by PowerBI, ensuring optimal performance and data integrity.
 We‚Äôll trust you to:
Design, implement and maintain systems and processes required to store, process, secure and access corporate data.
Build and optimize data pipelines, including databases, data warehouses, and data lakes.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather business requirements and translate them into effective database designs, data models and data flows.
Optimize database performance through indexing, partitioning, and other best practices.
Work with the Corporate Solution Architect group to provide data services solutions, resolve data performance issues and provide technical support to end-users as needed.
Work within the framework and standards set by Lazard‚Äôs Data Service group.
Assess database implementation procedures to ensure they comply with internal policies and procedures.
Install and organize information systems to guarantee company functionality.
Prepare accurate database design and architecture reports for review.
Oversee the migration of data from legacy systems to new solutions.
Monitor the system performance by performing regular tests, troubleshooting, and integrating new features.
Stay current with industry trends and emerging technologies, recommend and implementing improvements to existing data services and processes.
Educate staff members through training and individual support.
 You‚Äôll need to have:
Proven expertise in Snowflake data modeling techniques, including dimensional modeling and normalization
In-depth understanding of data management (e.g. permissions, recovery, security and monitoring).
Strong experience in an Azure cloud environment,
Hands on experience with development languages such as Python.
Experience in ETL development. Alteryx experience a plus.
The ability to manage multiple projects and priorities in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.
An ability to understand front-end users' requirements and a problem-solving attitude.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills.
Certifications in Snowflake Cloud Data Platform, strong familiarity with PowerBI for analytics & visualizations.
A good understanding of infrastructure layers (networking, information security, database, etc.) and ability to work with respective infrastructure teams, DevOps and app development teams to help structure high performing, cost effective solutions.
 Does this sound like you?
Apply! We‚Äôll get in touch and let you know the next steps.
 We expect the base salary range for this role to be approximately 200,000 - 250,000 USD. Various factors contribute to determining the actual base compensation offered, including but not limited to the applicant‚Äôs years of relevant experience, career tenure, qualifications, level of education attained, certifications or other professional licenses held, relevant skills for the role. Base salary is one component of Lazard Asset Management‚Äôs compensation package, which also includes comprehensive benefits and may include incentive compensation.
 Inclusion at Lazard
Lazard is an intellectual capital business focused on delivering the best advice and solutions to clients. Achieving these objectives requires us to identify, develop and retain the best talent. A workforce comprised of people with varied backgrounds and experiences creates a rich diversity of thought that empowers us to challenge conventional wisdom, as diverse perspectives lead to better decisions.
 Our appreciation of diversity‚Äôs strength is ingrained in our multicultural heritage. As a global firm that has grown organically from local roots in different countries, we have a deep tradition of respect for individual differences, which has been core to our success for 175 years.
 The ongoing cultivation of an inclusive culture are essential to our continued growth. We are committed to sustaining an environment in which all employees ‚Äì regardless of socioeconomic status, race, ethnicity, nationality, religion, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, physical abilities, veteran or military status ‚Äì can maximize their individual potential, as well as our collective success.

title: Data Scientist
description:
About the job
Description

Hi, We‚Äôre AppFolio

We‚Äôre innovators, changemakers, and collaborators. We‚Äôre more than just a software company ‚Äì we‚Äôre pioneers in cloud and AI who deliver magical experiences that make our customers‚Äô lives easier. We‚Äôre revolutionizing how people do business in the real estate industry, and we want your ideas, enthusiasm, and passion to help us keep innovating.

We're looking for an experienced Data Scientist with a strong background in workforce optimization, machine learning, data analysis, and software engineering to improve the scale and efficiency of our sales and business development operations.

Your impact 

Optimize Sales and Business Development efforts and resource allocation:

Business Forecasting: Develop and implement data-driven Sales forecasting models and uplevel accuracy by incorporating in-depth workforce capacity inputs, prospect data signals, historical performance trends, and market dynamics. Modeling would include segment and product-level outputs with risk indicators.
Pipeline Creation: Develop a Sales and Business Development Representative (BDR) pipeline creation forecasting and conversion rate model(s) to assess productivity, progression, and contribution. Modeling would include segment and product-level outputs with risk indicators.
Account Targeting: Partner to help build and deploy a propensity to buy model per Account (New Business) and Customer (By Product) that can be leveraged across Appfolio for various efforts. These efforts span Account Tiering, Outreach prioritization (Sales, BDR, or Marketing), and Financial Target Planning
Capacity / Efficiency: Combine provided propensity-to-buy models with sales workforce efficiency metrics to optimize staffing of BDRs, sales reps, and account managers across tiers, regions, and segments. Leverage natural language processing techniques on Sales call transcripts and support case data to understand customer sentiment and drive Sales enablement strategy. Optimize the timing and content of follow-up communications by designing a next-best-action framework for current and potential customers.


Collaborate across teams to drive wider business value:

Partner with Prospect/Account DS and Marketing analysts to align Sales and Marketing strategies for cohesive customer acquisition.
Partner with Prospect/Account DS to ingest customer lifetime value prediction models to forecast future revenue and inform business decisions around pricing and packaging.
Partner with Product DSs/DAs and Product teams to identify opportunities for feature additions/improvements based on Sales data and customer feedback.
Partner with Product DSs/DAs to align prospect/growth efforts with new features and launches, targeted to focused audiences.
Assist in quantifying the impact of Sales strategies on key business metrics like revenue growth and customer retention.


Contribute to Data Science & Analytics infrastructure:

Develop reusable code libraries and modeling frameworks to support data applications across the organization.
Implement best practices for version control, documentation, and reproducibility in our data science workflows.
Collaborate on building scalable data assets that support both Sales Operations and broader analytics needs.
Participate in knowledge sharing sessions to elevate the team's collective capabilities in data science technologies.
Assist in the evaluation and implementation of new tools and technologies to enhance our data science capabilities


Qualifications

Technical skills ‚Äì should be able to research and implement various advanced analytical techniques needed to manage and scale our Sales Operations teams. Candidates should not only have the mathematical background to understand the pros and cons of various techniques, but also the engineering prowess to deploy and manage these models. 
Business acumen ‚Äì understands key challenges facing our business and partners with key stakeholders to find creative ways to apply data science to solve them; connects dots between data & business outcomes
Attention to detail ‚Äì appropriately checks all work for errors and does not let important details slip when it comes to data and its accuracy
Creative problem solving - able to use creativity and curiosity as tools to pick apart any problem, producing a solution which is relevant and realistic
Efficiency ‚Äì able to quickly iterate on data generation and refinement. Looks for ways to improve processes to maximize efficiency and remove redundancy
Curiosity - always striving to learn more, keeping up to date with the latest tools and techniques being applied in industry.


Must have

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in a STEM field and minimum 2-4 years experience in a related field
Strong programming background (Python, SQL, R, etc.)
Experience working with sales/CRM analytics
Experience developing, deploying, and monitoring machine learning models
Experience creating, managing, and scaling data pipelines for reporting purposes
Experience using cloud-based technologies and working in collaborative environments with version control 
Listening and interpersonal skills; ability to support, work, and communicate with cross functional partners in both technical and business terms
Highly self-motivated and directed
Proven analytical and creative problem-solving abilities
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment 


Nice to Have

Experience working with sales, CRM, or marketing data
Familiarity with real estate or property management industries
Experience using dbt (data build tool)
Experience using orchestration frameworks such as Airflow


Compensation & Benefits

The base salary that we reasonably expect to pay for this role is $108,000-$149,000

The actual base salary for this role will be determined by a variety of factors, including but not limited to the candidate‚Äôs skills, education, experience, etc.

Please note that base pay is one important aspect of a compelling Total Rewards package. The base pay range indicated here does not include any additional benefits or bonuses that you may be eligible for based on your role and/or employment type.

Regular full-time employees are eligible for benefits - see here.

Why AppFolio

Grow | We enable a culture of high performance, where delivering results is recognized by opportunities for growth and compelling total rewards. Our challenging and meaningful work drive the growth of our business, and ourselves.

Learn | We partner with you to realize your potential by investing in you from the start. We're cultivating a team of big thinkers through coaching and mentorship with our best-in-class leaders, and giving you the time and tools to develop your skills.

Impact | We are creating a world where living in, investing in, managing, and supporting communities feels magical and effortless, freeing people to thrive. We do this by innovating with purpose while cultivating a culture of impact. We learn as much from each other as we do our customers and our communities.

Connect | We excel at hybrid work by fostering an environment that feels flexible, personal and connected, no matter where we are. We create space to fuel innovation and collaboration, and we come together to celebrate, connect, and succeed.

Paddle as One.

Learn more at appfolio.com/company/careers

Statement of Equal Opportunity

At AppFolio, we value diversity in backgrounds and perspectives and depend on it to drive our innovative culture. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre a proud Equal Opportunity Employer, and we believe that our products, our teams, and our business are stronger because of it. This means that no matter what race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identification, national origin, age, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, or veteran status, you‚Äôre always welcome at AppFolio.

title: Data Scientist
description:
About the job
Data Scientist at TRKKN

As a catalyst for innovative digital marketing ideas, what excites us at TRKKN is using a data-driven approach to take our clients‚Äô business to the next level.

Working for TRKKN means that you'll be part of an inspiring, energetic, and international team in a fast-growing tech environment. We offer the ideal workplace for anyone who wants to grow, learn, and has a strong desire for solving complex business challenges.

Being on the bleeding edge of marketing technology and innovation means you will have an unparalleled opportunity for learning, along with personal and professional growth: there's never a dull moment here.

Responsibilities
As a Data Scientist, reporting into the Head of Data & Strategy at TRKKN North America (NA), you‚Äôll focus on building scalable machine learning and AI products to help evaluate and optimize the business impact of our clients‚Äô marketing investment.
Whether working with our existing repository of products or building TRKKN‚Äôs next-gen capabilities, you‚Äôll leverage your expertise in statistics and programming to develop and deploy scalable solutions within the cloud.
Working as a leader within TRKKN globally, you will contribute directly to company growth goals by faithfully managing and executing robust and complex data science and engineering projects. As company headcount grows, you‚Äôll be expected to foster the development of junior employees, creating a roadmap for professional growth for a data science career at TRKKN NA. To be successful in this role, you‚Äôll:
Act as Data Science Subject Matter Expert (SME) in the delivery and development of machine learning and AI products
Deploy data products from our existing proprietary codebase and translate outcomes/findings in a digestible format for clients and internal stakeholders
Design tech infrastructure and data pipelines (ETL, data automation, data querying, etc.) when necessary
Aid agency leadership New Business efforts by executing ad hoc and custom analyses when necessary

Requirements:
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field (advanced degree is preferred)
3+ years of experience, preferably in Data Science
Expertise with Google Cloud Platform‚Äôs distributed Machine Learning, Data Science and Data Engineering tools (e.g. BigQuery ML, VertexAI, AutoML, Docker, Kubernetes, Kubeflow, Dataproc)
Experience with Git, GitLab, CI/CD pipelines on Gitlab, and Terraform
Experience with Big Data frameworks (e.g. Hadoop MapReduce, Spark, Hive, Kafka)
Strong analytical mindset with expert knowledge of SQL and BigQuery, as well as BI tools such DataStudio and Looker (LookML) to implement business reports and BI solutions.
Deep understanding and experience with advanced analytics, Machine Learning (ML), Deep Learning (DL), Natural Language Processing (NLP) or Computer Vision (at least 3 of these areas)
Proficiency in Python and specialized ML libraries (e.g. TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, scikit-learn, SciPy, Pandas, NumPy)
Experience working on a data science team, participating in scrums, sprints, and retrospectives
Ability to clearly explain complex ideas to non-expert audiences
Familiarity with media, media measurement, predictive modeling, and segmentation a plus

TRKKN is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age, or any other federally protected class. For this role, Benefits include: health insurance, vision insurance, dental insurance, 401(k), Healthcare Flexible Spending Account, Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account, vacation days, sick days, personal days, paid parental leave, paid medical leave, and STD/LTD insurance benefits.

title: Senior Manager, Data Science
description:
About the job
About Research Team

Our team is dedicated to researching and developing cutting-edge science and technology within the beverage industry to drive business innovation and growth. We continuously incorporate newly developed external technologies into our research program. We aim to integrate data science into our research efforts to enhance efficiency and elevate innovation to the next level.

You will also work closely with research teams, produce developers, IT partners, project owners and business stakeholders to deliver impactful data insights and AI-driven solutions.

 AI & Machine Learning:

Data Analysis & Interpretation

Model Optimization

Qualifications

Strong project management skills. Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects across product categories. 
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

Skills

Influencing

$133,000 - $157,000

title: AI Research Scientist, AI Security
description:
About the job
AI Research Scientist, AI Security & Privacy

Data Science is all about breaking new ground to enable businesses to answer their most urgent questions. Pioneering massively parallel data-intensive analytic processing, our mission is to develop a whole new approach to generating meaning and value from petabyte-scale data sets and shape brand new methodologies, tools, statistical methods and models. What‚Äôs more, we are in collaboration with leading academics, industry experts and highly skilled engineers to equip our customers to generate sophisticated new insights from the biggest of big data.

Join us to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact as an AI Research Scientist, AI Security & Privacy on our AI Research Data Science Team in Austin, Texas.

What You‚Äôll Achieve

As an AI Research Scientist, AI Security & Privacy, you‚Äôll work on cutting-edge research to protect AI systems from threats while ensuring privacy and security. You will be responsible for contributing to business strategy and influence decision making based on information gained from deep dive analysis. You will produce actionable and compelling recommendations by interpreting insights from complex data sets. You will design processes to consolidate and examine unstructured data to generate actionable insights. You will also partner with business leaders, engineers and industry experts to construct predictive models, algorithms and probability engines.

You will:

Develop and implement novel methods to protect discriminative and generative AI models and systems from threats such as data extraction and model inversion attacks and collaborate with cross-functional teams to establish security best practices for model deployment
Integrate privacy-preserving techniques into AI model development while ensuring that ML models are built while safeguarding the privacy and security of data and data subjects
Apply your expertise in deep learning to address security and privacy challenges
Lead efforts to mitigate risks associated with data poisoning, prompt injection and other emerging threats and implement solutions that proactively enhance AI security and privacy in client and edge deployments.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to establish guidelines for secure and privacy-aware model deployment and communicate effectively to drive adoption of best practices

Take the first step towards your dream career

Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here‚Äôs what we are looking for with this role:

Essential Requirements

5 to 8 years of related experience
Strong AI/ML and security skills
Python programming
Solid applied research skills
Documentation, communication and problem-solving skills

Desirable Requirements

Bachelor‚Äôs degree / PhD is an asset
Ability to work in a team environment

Compensation

Dell is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The salary range for this position is $135,000 - $167,000.

Benefits And Perks Of Working At Dell Technologies

Your life. Your health. Supported by your benefits. You can explore the overall benefits experience that awaits you as a Dell Technologies team member ‚Äî right now at MyWellatDell.com

Who We Are

We believe that each of us has the power to make an impact. That‚Äôs why we put our team members at the center of everything we do. If you‚Äôre looking for an opportunity to grow your career with some of the best minds and most advanced tech in the industry, we‚Äôre looking for you.

Dell Technologies is a unique family of businesses that helps individuals and organizations transform how they work, live and play. Join us to build a future that works for everyone because Progress Takes All of Us.

Dell Technologies is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. Read the full Equal Employment Opportunity Policy here.

title: Regulatory Reporting Data Analyst
description:
About the job
As Senior Data Analyst, you will support the Data Owners, Data Consumers and Data Stewards in an Enterprise Data Remediation Process intended to remediate data concerns which arise from enterprise data not meeting quality requirements. 

Key Responsibilities
Analyze if a newly logged data concern is/related to an existing data concern/issue.
Conduct Root Cause Analysis which determines the Break Point for Remediation. Defects identified in this process will answer ‚ÄúWhat‚Äù is broken, ‚Äúwhere‚Äù the break occurred, and the underlying Root Cause, the "Why‚Äù of the occurrence.
Review and validate data provided and obtain new data where required to commence the Root Cause Analysis (RCA) Process.
Analyze Data Quality Rule results to recommend Data Quality Rule modifications or, the need to investigate a Data-Related issue.
Document the details of RCA by Recursive Data Transformation review and determine the Root causes of defects.
Identify potential preventive measures, tactical and/or strategic system for fixes.
Conduct detailed Impact Analysis
Confirm Remediation Ownership
Improve Data Quality rules including Data Construct, Critical Data Element, Rule registration in Collibra, scripting business rules, collaborating with Technology to implement Rules, Testing implementation of rules.
Present Updates to Data Owners and Leadership in the form of Overview Documents, RCA Templates and other Presentations as required.
Create Jira Stories and Close them with evidence at the end of each Sprint.

Minimum Qualifications
5-7 years plus experience in any of the following Data Management areas including, Data Cataloging, Data Lineage, Data Quality Rules, Score card Monitoring.
Knowledge of consumer Banking Business/Product (Deposits, Cards, Loans, Mortgages), Wealth Products (Lending, Deposits to Private Banking Clients) and Global Operations from a Risk, Finance, Compliance or, Operations perspective. 
Strong Data Analysis, Business Analysis and Problem-solving skills using excel
Thrives in a collaborative environment working with cross functional teams
Strong interpersonal skills, interacting with clients both on the business side as well as technical specialists
Has worked in an agile environment.

Strong Communication and Presentation Skills 
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in finance, Accounting, Economics, Engineering, Computer Science

Preferred Qualifications/ Skills
Familiarity with Basel II, III, CCAR, CECL, FR 2052A, FDIC and other similar Banking regulations
HPALM or similar tool in Issue Management
Data Analysis using SQL
Collibra
JIRA

‚ÄúThe approximate annual base compensation range for this position is $115k to $125k. The actual offer, reflecting the total compensation package plus benefits, will be determined by a number of factors which include but are not limited to the applicant‚Äôs experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities; geographic location; and internal equity.‚Äù

title: Solutions Architect
description:

Responsible for the architecture roadmap for applications and integrations

title: Data Governance Manager
description:
About the job
TITLE: Data Governance Manager
LOCATION: Remote
ANTICIPATED DURATION:Direct Hire

Data Governance Manager Responsibilities: 

- Establish and oversee an enterprise-wide Data Governance framework aligned with business objectives, including data management strategies, governance policies, and quality processes. 
- Advise data owners and leaders on Data Governance best practices and management techniques. 
- Act as a liaison between teams to ensure data-related requirements are clearly defined and incorporated into operational plans. 
- Develop and implement data quality and protection standards across the organization. 
- Lead cross-functional decision-making processes, document outcomes, and ensure smooth execution of governance projects. 
- Collaborate with teams to manage data collection, storage, and utilization in a compliant and consistent manner. 
- Maintain an inventory of enterprise information maps, including authoritative systems and owners.
- Monitor and improve data quality by conducting root cause analysis (RCA) and remediation efforts. 
- Represent Data Governance across all levels of the organization, providing best practices to data stewards and stakeholders. 

Data Governance Manager Requirements: 

- 5+ years of experience in data management, business intelligence, or analysis-based environments.
- 3+ years of hands-on experience in managing Data Governance programs, covering data standardization, modeling, inventorying, cataloging, and metadata standards. 
- Strong collaboration skills with experience working across teams and levels of the organization. 
- Expertise in driving data-driven decision-making and analytics processes. 
- Proficiency in SQL, Python, and data analysis, sufficient to lead governance processes and documentation.
- Ability to simplify complex business problems for a wide range of audiences. 
- Excellent oral and written communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical users. 
- Strong teamwork, work ethic, and deadline-oriented mindset. 
- Ability to work independently and think critically. 
- Experience with Atlan, Collibra, or similar tools preferred. 

Data Governance Manager Preferred Experience: 

- Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, MIS, or related field. 
- Familiarity with data governance frameworks (e.g., DAMA, DCAM) and methodologies. 
- Understanding of data privacy regulations and compliance. 
- Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Excel, and Tableau. 

Certifications (Preferred): 

- Certified Data Management Professional (CDMP) 
- Certified Information Privacy Professional (CIPP) 
- Data Governance and Stewardship Professional (DGSP) 

The annual salary for this position is $130,000 to 140,000 (dependent on factors including but not limited to client requirements, experience, statutory considerations, and location). title: 2025 Early Talent Internship: Digital & Client Experience
description:
About the job
Intern

The Intern gains experience and an overall feel for the company and the financial services industry by attending meetings, delivering presentations, exploring business-specific tasks, and working closely with cross-functional groups to better understand the organization. Over the 10-week summer internship program, this job participates in a robust training and onboarding program followed by an ongoing speaker series, lunch-and-learns, and cohort engagement activities. This job may have the opportunity to work in the follow business areas: Technology, Asset Management, Financial Analysis/Accounting, Audit, Risk and Compliance, Human Resources and Advice and Client Relationships.

Key Responsibilities And Duties

Performs clerical duties such as taking memos, organizing documents, maintaining files, photocopying, faxing, etc. as needed
Assists in preparing information and research materials, including Powerpoint presentations.
Takes notes during meetings and provides to team members.
Researches and gathers documentation as directed by colleagues.
Attends company functions, including trainings programs, speaker series, lunch-and-learns and social networking events that provide opportunities for career growth and personal development.
Shadows multiple office jobs and trains in a variety of tasks.
Gains experience and an overall feel for the company and the financial services industry
Minimum 3.0 GPA required 

Educational Requirements

High School Preferred

Work Experience

No Experience Required

Physical Requirements

Physical Requirements: Sedentary Work

Career Level

2IC

The 10-week summer internship program is designed to challenge students by providing opportunities for hand-on experiences, skills training, and valuable professional networking to assist students with identifying and building on their career interests. This role gains experience and an overall feel for the company and the financial services industry by attending meetings, delivering presentations, exploring business-specific tasks, and working closely with cross-functional groups to better understand the TIAA and Nuveen‚Äôs businesses.

The program includes an onboarding program followed by our ongoing speaker series, lunch-and-learns, and engagement activities, as well as direct access to executive and senior leadership, mentors, and previous interns.

The Digital & Client Experience (D&CX) team is a diverse area within TIAA that solves real business problems. D&CX‚Äôs purpose and objective is to delight clients by transforming TIAA‚Äôs culture and practices around client centricity, creating confidence and simplicity in our end-to-end experiences.

D&CX interns will have an opportunity to join one of the following teams:

 Design: focusing on end-to-end client experience design that unlocks innovation and delights our clients.
 Analytics: Focusing on business analytics, data visualization, data governance/controls and/or data science.

Key Responsibilities And Duties:

Summer Associates will work on an exciting mix of strategically aligned challenging assignments and projects that help drive the achievement of the organization's strategy and mission. Managers and colleagues will work side by side with summer interns to ensure development and learning. Candidates can expect to gain an understanding of TIAA and the Financial Services industry and will be involved in creating resolutions for complex problems and/or transactions where business expertise is required.

Additional Requirements:

 Currently enrolled in a degree-seeking program pursuing a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree
 Expected Graduation date between December 2025‚Äì June 2027
 Minimum GPA of 3.0

Preferred Skills:

 Overall GPA of 3.0 or better
 Interest in the fields of design, technology, client experience, customer research, product strategy / management, data analytics / enablement, reporting and business intelligence solutions.
 Passion for client experience and client insights.
 Experimentation and innovation mindset with a bias for action.
 Desire to continuously learn.
 Strong problem-solving/analytical skills/critical thinking.
 Ability to analyze data to identify trends.
 Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously to deliver on commitments.
 Willingness to embrace change and collaborate to foster team success.
 Strong verbal and written communication skills.
 Knowledge of Microsoft Office products (PowerPoint, Word, Excel and Outlook).

Related Skills

Accountability, Adaptability, Clean Energy Acumen, Commercial Mindset, Communication, Consultative Communication, Continuous Improvement Mindset, Executive Presence, Prioritizes Effectively, Stakeholder Engagement

Anticipated Posting End Date:

2024-10-07

Base Pay Range: $18.75/hr. - $27.40/hr.

Actual base salary may vary based upon, but not limited to, relevant experience, time in role, base salary of internal peers, prior performance, business sector, and geographic location. In addition to base salary, the competitive compensation package may include, depending on the role, participation in an incentive program linked to performance (for example, annual discretionary incentive programs, non-annual sales incentive plans, or other non-annual incentive plans).

_____________________________________________________________________________________________________

Company Overview

TIAA is the leading provider of financial services in the academic, research, medical, cultural and government fields. We offer a wide range of financial solutions, including investing, banking, advice and education, and retirement services.

Benefits And Total Rewards

The organization is committed to making financial well-being possible for its clients, and is equally committed to the well-being of our associates. That‚Äôs why we offer a comprehensive Total Rewards package designed to make a positive difference in the lives of our associates and their loved ones. title: HRIS Data Visualization Analyst
description:
About the job
Address: USA-NC-Salisbury-2085 Harrison Road

Store Code: HR Reporting & Analytics (5135606)

Ahold Delhaize USA, a division of global food retailer Ahold Delhaize, is part of the U.S. family of brands, which also includes five leading omnichannel grocery brands ‚Äì Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop & Shop. Ahold Delhaize USA associates support the brands with a wide range of services, including Finance, Legal, Sustainability, Commercial, Digital and E-commerce, Technology and more.

Primary Purpose

The role of an HR Data Visualization & Governance Analyst is essential to the HR Reporting and Analytics team. The responsibilities encompass creating sophisticated business intelligence solutions for analyzing and presenting HR, financial, and business data to diverse stakeholders and brands. This involves working with data from our Azure SQL data warehouse, ad-hoc data sources, and third-party environments. Key duties include developing Power BI reports that conform to best practices, meet delivery standards, and effectively address specific business requirements. Additionally, the role requires overseeing security administration, managing access to Power BI reports, and implementing security governance processes.

Our flexible/ hybrid work schedule includes 3 in-person days at one of our core locations and 2 remote days.

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.

Duties And Responsibilities

Designated expert in HR reporting, specializing in data security and creating visual representations to improve understanding and decision-making. 
Review all Power BI reporting and workspace setups to ensure compliance with company requirements. 
Conduct quarterly security assessments to ensure Power BI apps, reporting, and related datasets are only shared with the necessary audiences. 
Consult and assist other analysts in adhering to Power BI best practices and effectively communicating their data. 
Provide daily support to functional users within our HR Power BI ecosystem. 
Provide coaching and support for Power BI professionals across the organization to help them develop their skills. 
Support all regulatory HR reporting requests, such as EEO-1 reporting or DOL surveys. 
Conducted regression testing on the Azure SQL Data Warehouse and Power BI infrastructure every time significant changes were made to our data pipelines. 
Demonstrate a thorough understanding of the business processes and their relationship to HR data. 
Utilize HR data and analytics expertise to impact business decisions, establishing an HR competitive advantage for our diverse retail brands, supply chain, and shared services customers. 
Develop and manage the framework of policies and technologies to ensure appropriate access to technology resources by the right users. 
Lead the management, monitoring, and improvement of existing and new enterprise BI workspaces and support IT processes, including change, release, and incident management. 
Maintain high visibility within the organization by collaborating with senior leaders to drive cultural change across a broad spectrum of data disciplines. 
Create an organizational culture around data, empowering users and visualization creators. 
Craft and deliver insightful business intelligence recommendations to our senior leadership team using a mix of qualitative and quantitative insights. 
Transform data into compelling reports that captivate and inform, empowering better decision-making. 
Collaborate with leadership to provide meaningful and credible feedback on reporting capabilities and data availability. 
Develop innovative solutions and analytics frameworks to help the business understand HR patterns and connections across the ‚ÄòHire to Retire‚Äô lifecycle ‚Äì creating actionable decision-making frameworks for our customers. 
Lead optimization and use of the BI platform and processes on how data is/can be utilized in the organization. 
Proactively identify structural weaknesses in using Power BI applications and design changes to address these weaknesses. 
Manage and develop reporting and Power BI applications, implement processes, monitor enterprise BI workspaces, and support IT processes such as change/release/incident management. Test and validate software development and perform quality assurance checks for applications. 
Work with other non-HR teams to identify opportunities for innovation by implementing new platforms and processes that can streamline and automate their tasks. 
Work with HR user groups to define information needs and sources. Collaborate with central IT to develop proposed solutions, including budgets for development and maintenance. 
Partner with IT to continuously improve the HR User Experience for HR systems, applications, and technology. Evaluate the effectiveness of current HR Solutions while leveraging industry best practices. 
Accurately document information, scripts, issues, and anything relevant within the designated record system. 
Evaluate and work to improve the capabilities of Business Intelligence tools through new methodologies, technology, and data management; review existing reports to enhance accuracy, functionality, security, and consistency. 
Work with stakeholders to develop and modify reporting or processes to resolve simple business problems by leveraging data pipelines. This includes analyzing business and user needs, documenting business requirements, and translating business requirements into functional solutions. 
Able to estimate and evaluate efforts for potential projects related to data and PowerBI. 
Additional job duties may be assigned as needed to meet the needs of the business and support our Values. 

Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree or equivalent combination of education and related work experience. 
Power BI or Related Certification Required 
7+ years of HRIS or significant proven analytical experience. 
3+ years of Power BI Reporting or Equivalent Configuration Experience Required 
Critical Thinking and System Design 
Advanced MS Office ‚Äì Specifically Excel and Power BI 
Written and spoken communication ‚Äì Ability to write requirements and design documents 
Strong Analytical & Design skills 
Strong Attention to detail 
Basic understanding of statistical methods 
Power BI System & Configuration Knowledge; 
Moderate understanding of SQL scripting 
Ability to work independently and help with strategic planning. 
Strong Presentation skills - Ability to present to senior business leadership 
Aptitude for comprehending and leveraging both HR and technical concepts for continuous improvement and process re-design 
Ability to document and triage data quality and security issues. 
5-10% travel 

Preferred Qualifications

SuccessFactors Certification Preferred 
MBA preferred 
Power BI (Advanced to Expert) 
DAX Coding and M Query (Advanced) 
SQL Query Creation Experience (We use SSMS | T-SQL) (Intermediate +) 
Understanding of HR Data Models 
Experience in any of the following SuccessFactors Modules:
SuccessFactors Employee Central 
SuccessFactors Learning 
SuccessFactors Recruiting & Onboarding 
SuccessFactors Talent 
SuccessFactors Employe Central Payroll (ECP) 
Experience in any of the following programs or languages:
MuleSoft Integration Layer 
Data Bricks 
Kronos (Workforce Dimensions) 
PeopleSoft 
Ahold Delhaize USA, a division of global food retailer Ahold Delhaize, is part of the U.S. family of brands, which also includes five leading omnichannel grocery brands ‚Äì Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop & Shop. When considered together, the companies of Ahold Delhaize USA comprise the largest grocery retail group on the East Coast and the fourth largest grocery retail group in the nation, serving millions of omnichannel customers each week.

title: Developer
description:

DevOps
PowerApp
.NET

We specialize in the areas of IT solutions, application development, program management, systems integration, and cybersecurity services. We believe our core values are the keys to success by empowering people to do the right thing for our colleagues, customers, and community. Join Us!!

EEO (Equal Employment Opportunity) Commitment:

title: Data Solutions Architect
description:
About the job
Our client in the financial industry is seeking a Data Solution Architect for an 18 month contract. The position is hybrid to their Jersey City office.

The architect will be responsible for designing and/or providing inputs into the design of NAUDS. Provide framework for how data and data related technologies and methodologies are used across the company.

The Data Solution Architect will ensure that data assets are managed and flows appropriately through the enterprise and meets business needs. He/She will collaborate with Enterprise architecture group, Technical Lead, Functional teams, Upstream/Downstream applications to drive innovation, document and adopt standard data architecture design principles and artifacts. He/She will ensure data architectures are designed for security and align with the Bank Data governance, Risk Management and IT Security standards and protocols.

Responsibilities
Analyze business needs by facilitating business & IT discussions, reviewing requirements from business and technical stakeholders.
Facilitate the design of flexible and scalable data architecture with an understanding of both functional and technical requirements. Focus to maintain balance between technology and execution efficiency.
Collaborate with business partners in Finance, Risk, Liquidity and Regulatory reporting to develop and maintain conceptual and logical data models in harmony with FRESH business strategies
Design and architecture of ETL interfaces, Data Marts, and Data Warehouse methodologies, adhering to the designed technical architecture and technologies within the company
Work closely with the technical team to understand the existing technical and functional flows and deliver an end-to-end solution solving existing system deficits.
Design end to end solutions focusing on Data Lineage, Reconciliations, Controls, User Interface
Partner with Enterprise Architects, Transversal teams, clients, ETL developers, other key stakeholders to design and develop high performing database solutions and maintain consistent data element definitions
Create high-level design documents and detailed specifications, in accordance with architecture standards.
Supports decision making by performing tradeoff analysis and recommending optimal solutions.
Assist the Project Manager to:
-Execute the project plan and coordinate with the project stakeholders
-Manage issues and risks
-Report status, budget consumption and capacity planning

Preferred Experience ‚Äì Qualifications ‚Äì Soft Skills 
7+ years of experience in Data Architecture and Data Modeling, along with Solid experience in delivering multiple technical and data architecture for large projects.
7+ years of complete system development life cycle experience with complex data integration solutions using relational data platforms (Oracle, Teradata, etc‚Ä¶ ) and/or Big Data
Possess in depth technical development experience and a broad awareness of data management disciplines listed -but not limited to - below:
-Data Modeling.
-Data Integration (ETL/ELT).
-BI tools like OAS and Tableau
-Sensitive Data Management ‚Äì Data classification and handling.
-Metadata, Data Quality, Master Data Management.
-Programming including shell scripting.
Experience in Banking and Financial Services industry with domain knowledge of Ledger and Referential Data, banking products such as Deposits, Loans, Securities, Derivatives, etc.
Demonstrates a sense of ownership of desired outcomes. Has a 'driver' mindset to move forward the design process for an application.
Proven hands-on experience in solution driving and problem solving.
Ability to work independently under strict deadlines.
Strong engagement skills between, management, sponsors and stakeholders.
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Results driven, client focused
