title: Data Analyst
description:
About the job
Role: Data Analyst

Location: Jackson, MI (100% remote but need locals)

Rate: Market

Duration: Long term

Department Summary

The Sales Strategy & Performance team, part of Sales Operations, is driven to build and support a world-class sales team that executes on achieving the company‚Äôs clean energy goals. The support includes performance management, target establishment, forecasting, visual management development, and process improvements. This is a very dynamic team moving at a fast pace.

Job Description/Responsibilities

In this role, you will be shaping the company's future by working with the latest clean energy products, including demand response, energy waste reduction, renewable energy, and electrification. You will work closely with internal organizations such as product, marketing, sales, data analytics, and IT.

Specific Tasks Include

Build models, reports, and tools to analyze and report sales-related data, including sales pipeline and business productivity.
Manage datasets in Microsoft CRM and SQL environments, proactively detect data gaps, and ensure data accuracy.
Support the sales team to resolve technical issues and answer data requests; work as a liaison between the sales team and IT to request and implement system/data enhancements.
Provide sales segment analytics.
Maintain cadenced reporting, including PowerPoint presentations.
Execute sales go-to-market strategy, including prospect development and target setting.
Trigger and maintain sales compensation workflow.
Drive efficiency in processes.
Complete additional business tasks or projects as requested.
The candidate will be able to work remotely and attend meetings onsite as needed, though they can opt to work at one of our locations.

Skills And Experience

Required Skills:

3+ years of relevant business experience related to modeling or business/financial reporting utilizing relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, SAP HANA).
Work experience with MS Power BI or equivalent visual management software.
Work experience with MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word).
Strong problem-solving identification and resolution skills.
Able to work as a member of a strong, collaborative team that thrives on providing actionable input to decisions in a fast-paced environment.

Preferred Skills

Advanced degree in a related field.
Strong communication skills with strong attention to detail.
Self-starter and intellectually curious.
Utility or e-commerce experience a plus.
Working knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics, SAP.
Experience with R or Python.
Experience with Web API.

Education

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, IT, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field, or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Physical Demands

Meet the physical demands required to perform the essential functions of this job.
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Regularly required to drive, sit, stand, walk, stoop, kneel, crouch, crawl, and use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects.
Frequently required to talk and hear.
Must lift and move up to twenty pounds.
Recommended maximum weight for employees to lift without the aid of other employees or a lifting device is 35 pounds.
Specific vision abilities required include close vision, color vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.
The work environment characteristics described are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.
The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

title: Media Data Analyst
description:
About the job
Founded in 1994, the PlowShare Group (PlowShare) works exclusively with nonprofit organizations, government agencies, and their partners. Our mission is to harness the power of communications for social good. Our core expertise as a full-service communications agency and consultancy includes unique capabilities in Public Service Announcement (PSA) creative development, distribution services, and monitoring and reporting. 
Acquired in 2017 by Publicis Groupe, PlowShare now brings the full suite of marketing services to our clients and an array of career path options to our employees. Present in over 100 countries and employing nearly 80,000 professionals, Publicis Groupe is the third largest communications group in the world. Publicis Groupe is listed on the Euronext Paris [FR0000130577] and is part of the CAC 40 index. Active across the entire value chain, Publicis Groupe offers its major clients a transversal, unified and fluid model allowing them access to all the Groupe‚Äôs tools and expertise around the world through the mantra "The Power of One".


Job Description

At the PlowShare Group, Analytics is a mission-driven practice. Not only are we providing best-in-class solutions in data and measurement, but we are motivated to change the world for the better.
PlowShare‚Äôs clients are in government, public service and non-profits ‚Äì and every one of them has a specific aim. In Analytics, we share those aims, and we create insights that help make for stronger, more impactful organizations. While our core work includes media reporting, we also include business and brand intelligence reporting. Our goal is to deliver data-driven findings as a force in rebuilding trust between our core institutions and the people that they serve. 
Reporting to SVP of Data Innovations, PlowShare‚Äôs Media Data Analyst will be responsible for the ongoing updating of various reports, while assisting in measurement planning, data strategy and insight creation. At Plowshare, transparency is key to our success and in this role, you will have the opportunity to apply your data and analytics experience to develop automated live dashboards and influence media planning and operations for clients and internal teams.
Key Responsibilities:
Collect and analyze media data from various sources, including social media, traditional media, and digital platforms.
Assist in the preparation of detailed reports and presentations for internal and external stakeholders.
Support the development and implementation of media strategies based on data insights.
Collaborate with the media team to optimize media campaigns and measure their effectiveness.
Utilize media analytics tools and software to extract meaningful data and insights.
Participate in team meetings and contribute ideas for improving media analysis processes.

Qualifications

Required Skills:
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions and data visualization techniques.
Proficiency in Lookr Studio, Tableau, PowerBi or similar data visualization tools.
Basic understanding of media metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs).
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Detail-oriented with strong organizational and time management skills.
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
Familiarity with media monitoring and analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, social media analytics platforms) is a plus.
Preferred Qualifications:
Prior internship or work experience in media analysis, market research, or a related area.
Knowledge of digital marketing principles and practices.
Understanding of social media platforms and their analytics.
Experience with Google Ads, Campaign Manager 360, and other Google Marketing Platform tools.

Additional Information

The Power of One starts with our people! To do powerful things, we offer powerful resources. Our best-in-class wellness and benefits offerings include:
Paid Family Care for parents and caregivers for 12 weeks or more
Monetary assistance and support for Adoption, Surrogacy and Fertility
Monetary assistance and support for pet adoption
Employee Assistance Programs and Health/Wellness/Comfort reimbursements to help you invest in your future and work/life balance
Tuition Assistance
Paid time off that includes Flexible Time off Vacation, Annual Sick Days, Volunteer Days, Holiday and Identity days, and more
Matching Gifts programs
Flexible working arrangements
‚ÄòWork Your World‚Äô Program encouraging employees to work from anywhere Publicis Groupe has an office for up to 6 weeks a year (based upon eligibility)
Business Resource Groups that support multiple affinities and alliances
 
The benefits offerings listed are available to eligible U.S. Based employees, are reviewed on an annual basis, and are governed by the terms of the applicable plan documents.
Plowshare is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our employment decisions are made without regard to actual or perceived race, color, ethnicity, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, disability, medical condition as defined by applicable state law, genetic information, marital status, military service and veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws and ordinances.
If you require accommodation or assistance with the application or onboarding process specifically, please contact USMSTACompliance@publicis.com. 
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
Compensation Range: $52,500 - $69,500 annually. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off. The Company anticipates the application deadline for this job posting will be 10/15/2024.

title: Data Scientist
description:
About the job
Job Title: Data Scientist

Location: Dallas, TX

Duration: 12 months

Pay Range: $72.51--$ 89.31/hr on W2

Looking for only W2 resources

Job Description

We are looking for a Data Scientist to analyze large amounts of raw information to find patterns that will help improve. 
We will rely on you to build data products to extract valuable business insights. In this role, you should be highly analytical with a knack for analysis, math and statistics. 
Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are essential for interpreting data. We also want to see a passion for machine-learning and research. 
Your goal will be to help analyze trends to make better decisions. 

Responsibilities

Provide analytical support and recommendations regarding optimization of operational processes, capital allocation, and pricing. 
Provide insights into future growth and profitability strategy through historical business analysis and forecasting of industry and major customer trends (e.g. what markets to prioritize, opportunities to pursue, how to win, impact of 5G, etc.) Work with and analyze complex data from various sources. 
Manipulate large data sets and navigate a variety of servers, data types, and data structures to complete statistical and other analyses 
Develop predictive and descriptive models using advanced procedures like statistical modeling, linear regression and Bayesian analyses. 

Required Qualifications

Experience developing and implementing statistical models. 
Experience with a statistical analysis tool like Python. 
Experience performing data management, mining, and manipulation along with analytics. 
Experience using SQL in a RDBMS environment. 
Excellent communication skills, oral and written. 
Must have strong attention to detail and ability to work independently under general instructions and with a team. 
Some programming experience - This role will rely heavily on programming experience in Python, as well as SSMS 
Degree (Graduate / Ph.D. preferred) in an analytical or technical field (e.g. applied mathematics, physics, computer science, operations research).√¢‚Ç¨¬¢ Act as a liaison between consumer, network and finance stakeholders 
Develop and maintain training material. 
Represent modeling on teams and task groups for projects/initiatives across the organization and act as a source of effective challenge. 
Perform outreach activities to new business areas engaged in modeling √¢‚Ç¨¬¢ Develop and maintain business unit and enterprise-wide model risk metrics and reports √¢‚Ç¨¬¢Develop and maintain model repository, develop model scorecard, and communicate model impact to senior leaders. 
Lead building out action plans and milestones to drive remediation of any oversight issues. 
Lead Modeling team‚Äôs communication for regulatory exams 
Drive knowledge sharing on relevant industry standards, best practices, and business processes and technology used in model risk management and model development. √¢‚Ç¨¬¢Lead evaluation of model management technology tools.

description:

title: Data Scientist, ML OPS
description:
About the job
We are a technology-led healthcare solutions provider. We are driven by our purpose to enable healthcare organizations be future ready. We offer accelerated, global growth opportunities for talent that‚Äôs bold, industrious and nimble. With Indegene, you gain a unique career experience that celebrates entrepreneurship, and is guided by passion, innovation, collaboration and empathy. To explore exciting opportunities at the convergence of healthcare and technology, check out www.careers.indegene.com
What if we told you that you can move to an exciting role in an entrepreneurial organization without the usual risks associated with it? 
We understand that you are looking for growth in your career at this point and we would love for you to join us in our journey and grow with us. At Indegene, our roles come with the excitement you require at this stage of your career with the reliability you seek. We believe in creating leaders of tomorrow and mentor our leads to help them grow and nurture them as people managers and account managers. 
We are a rapidly growing global organization and are scouting for the best talent for this phase of growth. With us, you are at the intersection of two of the most exciting industries of healthcare and technology. We offer global opportunities with fast-track careers while you work with a team that is fueled by purpose. The combination of this will lead to a truly differentiated experience for you. 
If this excites you, then apply below. 

Data Scientist, MLOPS
 You will be responsible for: 
Your impact: 

We are seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist with expertise in various modelling algorithms and MLOps to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data science, machine learning, and operationalizing ML models and exposure to pharma commercial analytics. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to develop, deploy, and maintain machine learning models that drive business insights and innovation.

Key Responsibilities:

We are looking for experienced data science professional, who can handle commercial analytics projects with proficiency. Additionally, domains expertise on Sales Force analytics or Payer analytics or Patient or digital analytics or Brand Performance analytics will be a value add
Model Development: Design, develop, and implement machine learning models through EDA, feature engineering and using a variety of algorithms (e.g., regression, classification, clustering, neural networks, ensemble methods)
MLOps: Establish and maintain MLOps practices to ensure seamless deployment, monitoring, and maintenance of ML models in production environments.
Model Evaluation: Evaluate model performance using appropriate metrics and techniques, and iterate on models to improve accuracy and efficiency.
Collaboration: Work closely with data engineers and business stakeholders to integrate ML models into applications and workflows.
Documentation: Document model development processes, assumptions, and results to ensure reproducibility and transparency.
Continuous Learning: Stay updated with the latest advancements in AI/ML including LLMs, MLOps, to continuously improve skills and knowledge.


 About you: 
Education: Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Experience: 4+ years of experience in data science and machine learning, with a focus on model development and MLOps.
Domain Expertise: Experience in pharma commercial analytics for at least 2+ years preferably in sales force targeting, patient journey predictions
Technical Skills: Proficiency in programming languages such as Pyspark, Python or R, and experience with ML libraries/frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn)
MLOps Tools: Experience with MLOps tools and platforms (e.g., MLflow, Kubeflow, Docker, Kubernetes) for model deployment and monitoring.
Data Handling: Strong skills in SQL and experience in snowflake, Dataiku, Databricks is a plus
Problem-Solving: Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business problems into data science solutions.
Communication: Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complex concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY
Indegene is proud to be an Equal Employment Employer and is committed to the culture of Inclusion and Diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, sex, colour, age, national origin, pregnancy, sexual orientation, physical ability, or any other characteristics. All employment decisions, from hiring to separation, will be based on business requirements, candidate‚Äôs merit and qualification.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristics.

title: Grand Prairie Data Science Tutor
description:
About the job
Grand Prairie Data Science Tutor Jobs

The Varsity Tutors platform has thousands of students looking for online Data Science tutors nationally and in Grand Prairie. As a tutor who uses the Varsity Tutors platform, you can earn good money, choose your own hours, and truly make a difference in the lives of your students.

Enjoy competitive rates and get paid 2x per week.
Choose to tutor as much or as little as you want.
Set your own hours and schedule.

description:

Purpose

People, Technology and Processes, LLC is seeking contractors to provide support to the TRADOC Enterprise KM Program. The goal of the TRADOC Enterprise KM Program is to create and implement the TRADOC KM strategy and improve organizational performance by establishing an environment and culture that efficiently shares knowledge, leverages data/content, and continuously innovates and improves work and business processes. title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
About the job
Data Analyst - AWS Cloud Data Transformation

Pay Rate: $80.00 - $95.00 / HR w2

100% ONSITE: 

Greenwood Village, CO 

Duration: 6 month contract - likely to extend and/or C2H.

Location: Greenwood Village, CO - fully onsite

# openings: 1 opening - 3 sub slots

--------------------------------------------------------------

INTERVIEW/HIRING PROCESS
Webex ‚Äì multiple people, one round.


High level Role Description: 

We are looking for a detail-oriented Data Analyst with strong expertise in business process analysis and data modeling to join our AWS Cloud data transformation team. The ideal candidate will play a critical role in mapping business processes to data models, defining data transformation rules, and ensuring data quality throughout our data lakehouse development.

Key Responsibilities:

Business Process Understanding:
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with business stakeholders to gain a deep understanding of business processes, particularly within the financial domain.
‚Ä¢ Document and analyze business processes to identify key data requirements and dependencies.
‚Ä¢ Translate business needs into comprehensive data models that support data lakehouse architecture in AWS Cloud.


Data Modeling and Mapping:
‚Ä¢ Work closely with data architects and engineers to map business processes to logical and physical data models.
‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain mapping documents that clearly define the relationships between source systems, data models, and target AWS Cloud data structures.
‚Ä¢ Extract and analyze complex data relationships from existing data models in operational systems to ensure accurate representation in the AWS data lakehouse.
‚Ä¢ Ensure that data models align with business objectives and are optimized for performance and scalability.


Data Transformation Rules:
‚Ä¢ Define and document data transformation rules that govern how data is extracted, transformed, and loaded into the AWS data lakehouse.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with data engineers to implement these transformation rules using AWS tools and services, ensuring accuracy and efficiency.
‚Ä¢ Regularly review and update transformation rules to reflect changes in business processes or data requirements.


Data Quality Assurance:
‚Ä¢ Develop and implement data quality rules to ensure the accuracy, consistency, and completeness of data within the data lakehouse.
‚Ä¢ Monitor data quality metrics and work with relevant teams to address any data quality issues.
‚Ä¢ Establish data validation processes to verify that data transformation and integration efforts meet business standards.


Documentation and Communication:
‚Ä¢ Create clear, detailed documentation of business process mappings, data transformation rules, and data quality standards.
‚Ä¢ Communicate findings, insights, and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
‚Ä¢ Provide support and training to business users on data models, transformation processes, and data quality practices.


Required Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Information Systems, Business Analysis, or a related field.
‚Ä¢ 5+ years of experience in data analysis, with a strong focus on business process mapping and data modeling.
‚Ä¢ Proven experience in extracting and analyzing complex data relationships from existing operational system data models.
‚Ä¢ Experience in documenting data transformation rules and mapping documents.
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with AWS Cloud services and data lakehouse architecture.
‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of financial domain business processes and data requirements.
‚Ä¢ Experience in developing and implementing data quality rules and monitoring processes.
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in SQL and data modeling tools (e.g., ERwin, PowerDesigner).
‚Ä¢ Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.

title: Sr. Data Scientist
description:
About the job
ECS is seeking a Sr. Data Scientist to work remote.

 Job Description: 

ECS is seeking a passionate and driven Data Scientist to support DHS‚Äô Data Services Branch, under the Office of Chief Information Officer, that provides innovative and complex data analytics services and platforms to users.

As Data Scientist, you will be driven by an interest in solving complex business and immigration problems through data exploration and analysis. Candidates must be passionate about using rich and unique data sets to directly affect immigration policy and decisions at the highest level. You must be highly analytically minded, have a robust technical tool kit, and experience on designing data analytic and visual strategies including architecture of solution. Data Scientist will be responsible for designing strategy to consistently unify, curate, and secure data, as well as, test, implement, and evaluate code and strategy. They will work with immigration experts and data engineers to support the development of processes and technologies that solve immigration problems.

The Economics Policy Research Data Scientist should be an expert in statistics and mathematical methods to solve these problems. These models will drive innovative solutions that bring value and direction to DHS situations. Candidates will be able to thoroughly define and test a problem statement that ensures data and analytics quality, traceability, and ease to scale program.

 Salary Range: $175,000 - $200,000 

General Description Of Benefits

 Required Skills: 

 Master's Degree or 10+ years of related experience 
 7+ years of IT experience including experience in design, analysis, and implementation of large-scale, complex data architectures. 
 Quantitative analysis including experience with SQL or statistical/mathematical software (eg., R, SAS, Stata). 
 Experience with conceptualization and implementation of statistical and machine learning models (multivariate regression, classification, time series analysis, clustering, graph models, etc.). 
 Perform secondary data review and exploratory data analysis to clearly report findings regarding usability and quality of existing data resources to provide new insights. 
 Maker mindset, coachable, and have an urge to learn/master new technologies and fields. 
 Strong ability to communicate with multiple stakeholders to build relationship and provide guidance. 
 Ability to work with data engineers and other technical staff for the purpose of managing structured, unstructured, and semi-structured data and applying data cleaning, data imputation and feature engineering methods prior to developing models. 
 Ability to advise others on correct statistical design, analysis, model selection, and validation. 
 Demonstrated background in assisting in the preparation of documents (e.g., briefings and reports on the design, including graphs that clearly present findings from analyses). 
 Knowledgeable in a breadth of statistical computer languages (Python, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets. 

 Desired Skills: 

 Experience with DHS and knowledge of DHS standards a plus. 
 Demonstrated ability to adequately plan and meet delivery objectives and maintain adequate service levels in a highly dynamic, complex environments. 
 Experience doing rigorous research with lengthy, arduous requirements for completion and publication. 
 Experience using AWS cloud environment. 
 Experience working in Agile environment leveraging advanced design best practices. 

ECS is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, status as a crime victim, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. ECS promotes affirmative action for minorities, women, disabled persons, and veterans.

ECS is a leading mid-sized provider of technology services to the United States Federal Government. We are focused on people, values and purpose. Every day, our 3800+ employees focus on providing their technical talent to support the Federal Agencies and Departments of the US Government to serve, protect and defend the American People.

Your work will directly influence the scalability and efficiency of the company's products, which are designed to automate complex workflows for mid-market and enterprise service businesses.

Key Responsibilities:
Take on projects from zero to one (0-1).
Take ownership of the front end conversation interface and FE architecture.
Develop and extend core full-stack applications using TypeScript and React.js/Next.js.
Collaborate closely with backend, product and design teams to create user-friendly interfaces.

Essential Experience: Built and owned SaaS products using JavaScript/TypeScript, React.js and/or Next.js.
Highly Desirable: Large Language Models (LLM), AI Chatbots, TailwindCSS and Shadcn.

What We're Looking For:
Proven Experience: At least 5 years of experience in software engineering, with a strong background in frontend/user-interface engineering.
Similar Background: Ideally worked for one or multiple an early-stage SaaS start-ups with experience taking on projects from 0-1.
Customer Focused: Ability to work directly with customers to understand their needs and translate them into technical solutions.
Autonomous & Collaborative: Thrive in a dynamic environment where you balance independent work with collaboration across teams.
Problem Solver: Strong analytical skills with a focus on delivering efficient and scalable solutions.

Why Join?
The Senior Frontend Engineer role offers a unique opportunity to be a key player in an AI Automation start-up that is revolutionizing their industry with innovative solutions. You'll be part of a small, tight-knit team where your contributions will have a significant impact.

DISCLAIMER: Venturi is a staffing business dedicated to you, differentiating ourselves in the marketplace by quality of service and candidate delivery. Our highly skilled and experienced staff operate within dedicated markets to give you the best service possible. Venturi markets include Engineering (Software & Data), Analytics, Data Science and Cloud. Venturi operates as an employment agency and employment business. No terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of age, and we confirm that we are happy to accept applications from persons of any age for this role.

title: Lead Data Engineer
description:

THIS ROLE DOES NOT SPONSO

.

title: Senior Associate, Data Scientist - Servicing Intelligence
description:
About the job
Center 1 (19052), United States of America, McLean, VirginiaSenior Associate, Data Scientist - Servicing Intelligence

Data is at the center of everything we do. As a startup, we disrupted the credit card industry by individually personalizing every credit card offer using statistical modeling and the relational database, cutting edge technology in 1988! Fast-forward a few years, and this little innovation and our passion for data has skyrocketed us to a Fortune 200 company and a leader in the world of data-driven decision-making.

As a Data Scientist at Capital One, you‚Äôll be part of a team that‚Äôs leading the next wave of disruption at a whole new scale, using the latest in computing and machine learning technologies and operating across billions of customer records to unlock the big opportunities that help everyday people save money, time and agony in their financial lives.

Team Description:

The Servicing Intelligence data science team builds models to help our internal customers use unstructured, multi-modal data sources ‚Äî text, image, and audio data. We partner with product, engineering, and business teams to deliver solutions spanning from using generative AI to conduct information extraction on millions of documents to analyzing call transcripts to identify customer pain points. You will be the driving force to experiment, innovate, and create next generation experiences powered by the latest emerging generative AI technologies.

Role Description:

In this role, you will:

 Leverage Natural Language Processing (NLP), Computer Vision, Speech, large language models (LLMs), large multi-modal models (LMMs) and traditional modeling approaches like GBMs for advanced customer servicing applications. 
 Utilize a broad stack of technologies like Python, Pytorch, HuggingFace, LangChain, Spark, Kubernetes, Docker, AWS Cloud, Github etc., for model development and deployment. 
 Analyze and derive insights from both structured and unstructured data sources. 
 Collaborate on a team of data scientists and engineers to build machine learning models through all phases of development, from design through training, evaluation, validation, implementation, and maintenance 
 Flex your communication skills by interacting with a variety of internal business stakeholders to define innovative data science solutions 
 Grasp underlying business processes, getting into the details by guiding annotators to curate high quality, consistent training datasets 

The Ideal Candidate is:

 Creative. You thrive on bringing definition to big, undefined problems. You love asking questions and pushing hard to find answers. You‚Äôre not afraid to share a new idea. 
 Innovative. You continually research and evaluate emerging technologies. You stay current on published state-of-the-art methods, technologies, and applications and seek out opportunities to apply them. 
 Technical. You‚Äôre comfortable with open-source languages and are passionate about developing further. You have hands-on experience developing data science solutions using open-source tools and cloud computing platforms. 
 Statistically-minded. You‚Äôve built models, validated them, and backtested them. You know how to interpret a confusion matrix or a ROC curve. 

Basic Qualifications:

 Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining a Bachelor‚Äôs Degree plus 3 years of experience in data analytics, or currently has, or is in the process of obtaining Master‚Äôs Degree plus 1 year of experience in data analytics with an expectation that required degree will be obtained on or before the scheduled start date 
 At least 1 year of experience in open source programming languages for large scale data analysis 
 At least 1 year of experience with machine learning 
 At least 1 year of experience with relational databases 

Preferred Qualifications:

 At least 2 years of experience in Python with a blend of experiences in data science and software engineering 
 At least 2 years of experience with machine learning 
 At least 1 years of experience working with unstructured data for natural language processing, computer vision, or speech applications 
 At least 1 years of experience fine-tuning and deploying transformer based models 
 At least 1 years of experience working with deep learning libraries and tools, such as Pytorch and HuggingFace 
 At least 1 year of experience working with AWS 

The minimum and maximum full-time annual salaries for this role are listed below, by location. Please note that this salary information is solely for candidates hired to perform work within one of these locations, and refers to the amount Capital One is willing to pay at the time of this posting. Salaries for part-time roles will be prorated based upon the agreed upon number of hours to be regularly worked.

New York City (Hybrid On-Site): $138,500 - $158,100 for Sr Assoc, Data Science

Candidates hired to work in other locations will be subject to the pay range associated with that location, and the actual annualized salary amount offered to any candidate at the time of hire will be reflected solely in the candidate‚Äôs offer letter.

This role is also eligible to earn performance based incentive compensation, which may include cash bonus(es) and/or long term incentives (LTI). Incentives could be discretionary or non discretionary depending on the plan.

Capital One will consider sponsoring a new qualified applicant for employment authorization for this position.

Capital One offers a comprehensive, competitive, and inclusive set of health, financial and other benefits that support your total well-being. Learn more at the Capital One Careers website . Eligibility varies based on full or part-time status, exempt or non-exempt status, and management level.

This role is expected to accept applications for a minimum of 5 business days.No agencies please. Capital One is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions), race, color, age, national origin, religion, disability, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender reassignment, citizenship, immigration status, protected veteran status, or any other basis prohibited under applicable federal, state or local law. Capital One promotes a drug-free workplace. Capital One will consider for employment qualified applicants with a criminal history in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable laws regarding criminal background inquiries, including, to the extent applicable, Article 23-A of the New York Correction Law; San Francisco, California Police Code Article 49, Sections 4901-4920; New York City‚Äôs Fair Chance Act; Philadelphia‚Äôs Fair Criminal Records Screening Act; and other applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations regarding criminal background inquiries.

If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation, please contact Capital One Recruiting at 1-800-304-9102 or via email at RecruitingAccommodation@capitalone.com . All information you provide will be kept confidential and will be used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodations.

For technical support or questions about Capital One's recruiting process, please send an email to Careers@capitalone.com

Capital One does not provide, endorse nor guarantee and is not liable for third-party products, services, educational tools or other information available through this site.

Capital One Financial is made up of several different entities. Please note that any position posted in Canada is for Capital One Canada, any position posted in the United Kingdom is for Capital One Europe and any position posted in the Philippines is for Capital One Philippines Service Corp. (COPSSC).

description:

title: Sr Power BI Developer
description:
About the job
Detailed position description:

Act as liaison between technology teams and business areas by trouble shooting and translating technical problems related to reports and report data.

Assist business users on functional and data requirements to enhance reports and report data.

Supports business data experts on select data repositories and provides support for project implementations and modifications impacting data repositories.

Follows best practices and guidelines to support dashboards, metrics, scorecards, and reporting solutions providing a high level of customer service with an emphasis on partnership and collaboration.

Assists with investigating, reviewing and analyzing data from multiple internal and external sources to maintain quality and while understanding the source structures and business relevance of the data.

Performs analysis and design by translating business requirements and developing reporting and dashboard solutions that yield relevant business information in a user-friendly format by collecting, analyzing and leveraging data.

Monitors recurring processes and ensures output accuracy and timely distribution. Responsible for maintenance, documentation, and enhancements of recurring processes and procedures.

Follows best practices in data modeling and source-to-target mapping.

Performs planned maintenance (e.g., application upgrades, releases, enhancements, service packs, etc.) on BI solutions and underlying infrastructure.

Ensures that adequate security procedures are developed and followed.

Attention to detail to deliver a complete and correct solution within deadlines.

Contributes technical knowledge and understanding of applications to training programs, support processes, and operating procedures.

Ability to conduct report demonstrations and training sessions for business units and developers.

Ability to collaborate with BU development team to review data model & report specifications.

Position Requirements: 

BS in Computer Science, Accounting, Information Systems, Data Analytics or commensurate Power BI dev experience.


3-5 years of experience in complex development and scripting SQL
3-5 years of experience developing with advanced Power BI tools including DAX, M, & Power Query.
3-5 years of experience with advanced Power BI report development techniques including bookmarking, selection pane, using buttons for page navigation, dynamic measures, and drill-through.
3-5 years of experience developing reports, researching, analyzing and problem-solving using end-user tools such as Paginated Reports Builder, Power BI Desktop and Visual Studio.
3-5 years of experience developing dashboard solutions with data visualizations in Microsoft Power BI desktop.
3-5 years of experience using Visual Studio & SSMS to develop Analysis Services Tabular models.


Experience with Microsoft Azure platform and service (Power BI, Azure SQL Data Warehouse, Azure Synapse, Azure Data Factory) including the creation and maintenance of ADF data ingestion pipelines, data quality pipelines, notification pipelines, Azure Logic Apps to refresh data models, and Synapse tables & views

Experience working with large and complex datasets.

Strong understanding and working experience establishing and maintaining RLS (Row Level Security) in Azure Analysis Services / Power BI tabular models.

Expertise with database and data warehouse designs, data modeling, data performance tuning, data integration, including ETL processes.

Knowledge and applied documentation experience with a variety of industry concepts, methodologies, and frameworks within data warehouse and business intelligence field including requirements, source to target mapping, architecture, and design documentation.

Ability to manage the project lifecycle of report development from data identification, source data mapping, data staging, model development, report development, report publishing & report security.

Prefer familiarity with relational databases with the ability to create calculated members and key performance indicators (KPIs).

Experience With Tabular Editor And DAX Studio Preferred.

This is an on-site position in Oklahoma City, you have to reside in this area in order to be considered for this opening

title: Lead Data Engineer
description:

title: Adobe Analytics Lead Digital Data Analyst
description:
About the job
Position: Adobe Analytics Lead Digital Data Analyst
Location: Los Angeles, CA
Duration: 12 months 
Compensation: $68.00 - 75.00/hr. 
Work Authorization: US Citizen, GC Holders or Authorized to Work in the U.S.

Summary: 

The Adobe Analytics Lead Digital Data Analyst role is focused on planning, reporting, and developing insights to support Digital Products and Digital Experience Design groups. The lead data analyst will partner with the Digital Experience Design Manager to refine and execute upon the digital analytics strategy and collaborate with the MarTech team to establish Adobe Analytics as the primary source of truth for digital client behavior data. This role will lead implementation and development of a new reporting suite and collaborate to guide data collecting, tagging, and reporting requirements, supporting the full end-to-end reporting lifecycle. This is a key role in developing client's overall digital data storytelling practice.

Job Responsiiltiies: 
Identifies and frames problems to be solved, empathizing with digital product and design teams to understand how we can leverage digital data to improve business decision-making and improve teams' efficiency, performance, and outcomes

Provides traffic/usage insights (including journey analytics, flow and fall-out analyses) to better understand conversion rates through specific processes/journeys/campaigns, correlations between events, and improve overall client user experience

Mobile application, web, and mobile web analytics

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
About the job
Are you ready to join Connecticut Innovation‚Äôs vibrant community of innovators? Connecticut Innovations (‚ÄúCI‚Äù) is Connecticut‚Äôs strategic venture capital arm, and we are passionate about serving our portfolio of 220+ companies across various industries, with strengths in life sciences, technology, and climate tech.

Come join one of our quickly growing portfolio companies, NourishedRx, NourishedRx.

About NourishedRx
NourishedRx is on a mission to eradicate poor diet and nutrition insecurity as top drivers of death, disease and disparities. Founded in 2019, NourishedRx is a digital health and nutrition 
company that helps people live healthier lives. Leveraging the healing and connective power of food, NourishedRx partners with healthcare organizations to nourish their most vulnerable members, build healthy relationships, and support health equity.

Poor diet is the top driver of death, disease and disparities in the US, and the relationship between diet and health is worsening at an alarming rate. 90% of US adults don't get enough fruits and vegetables, 74% of Americans have overweight or obesity (more than triple the rate in 1960), 93% of US adults have poor cardiometabolic health, and 17 million US households are food insecure. These trends are heightened with racial and ethnic minority groups, contributing to health and economic disparities. Since 2019, NourishedRx has partnered with healthcare organizations to nourish their most vulnerable members, build healthy relationships, and support health equity.

Join us in revolutionizing healthcare through food. 

Senior Data Engineer
We are seeking an experienced and motivated Senior Data Engineer to join our dynamic data team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining scalable data pipelines, managing our data warehouse infrastructure, and supporting analytics initiatives across the organization. You will work closely with data scientists, analysts, and other stakeholders to ensure data quality, integrity, and accessibility, enabling the organization to make data-driven decisions. 

Key Responsibilities: 
Design and Develop Data Pipelines: Architect, develop, and maintain robust and scalable data pipelines for ingesting, processing, and transforming large volumes of data from multiple sources in real-time and batch modes. 
Data Warehouse Management: Manage, optimize, and maintain the data warehouse infrastructure, ensuring data integrity, security, and availability. Oversee the implementation of best practices for data storage, partitioning, indexing, and schema design. 
ETL Processes: Design and build efficient ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to move data across various systems while ensuring high performance, reliability, and scalability. 
Data Integration: Integrate diverse data sources (structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data) into a unified data model that supports analytics and reporting needs. 
Data Quality and Governance: Establish and enforce data quality standards, governance policies, and best practices. Implement monitoring and alerting to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and completeness. 
Support Analytics and BI: Collaborate with data analysts, data scientists, and business intelligence teams to understand data requirements and provide data sets, models, and solutions that support their analytics needs. 
Performance Optimization: Optimize data pipelines and warehouse infrastructure for performance and cost-effectiveness, identifying and resolving bottlenecks and inefficiencies. 
Tool and Technology Evaluation: Evaluate and recommend new tools, technologies, and best practices to enhance the efficiency and scalability of our data infrastructure. 
Documentation and Training: Create and maintain detailed documentation for data pipelines, ETL processes, data models, and data warehousing solutions. Mentor and train junior team members and other stakeholders on data engineering practices. 
Collaboration and Stakeholder Management: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, analytics, and product teams, to define and prioritize data initiatives and ensure alignment with business goals. 

Qualifications: 
Education: 
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience. 
Experience: 
5+ years of experience in data engineering or a similar role. 
Proven experience building and managing data pipelines, data warehouses, and ETL processes. 
Technical Skills: 
Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL, Oracle) and data warehousing solutions (e.g., Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery). 
Expertise in data pipeline tools and frameworks (e.g., AWS Glue, Google Dataflow, Apache Airflow, Apache NiFi, dbt). 
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms and their data services (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform). 
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala for data manipulation and automation. 
Knowledge of data modeling, schema design, and data governance principles. 
Familiarity with distributed data processing frameworks like Apache Spark, Hadoop, or similar. 
Experience with BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker)
Soft Skills: 
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills with a keen attention to detail. 
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders. 
Proactive mindset with the ability to work independently and handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment. 

Why Join the NourishedRX Team? 
Receive a competitive salary and benefits package, including medical, dental and vision. 
Work alongside a venture backed mission-driven team, making a real difference in the lives of people around the world. 
Partner with a leadership team with deep sector experience across healthcare, technology, food, and nutrition from Oxford, UnitedHealthcare, Solera, Optum and more.
Assist in building the ONLY platform that has been purpose-built to support socially vulnerable health plan members and patients, who have diet-related disease, obesity, and/or pregnancy.
Learn, grow, and contribute to the success of a dynamic and innovative startup company with opportunities for ownership and company growth.

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
NourishedRx is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Senior, Analytics Solutions
description:
About the job
Our Story
AKDM is a leader in delivering digital growth strategies guided by data, analytics, and business intelligence. We work with a range of clients ‚Äî spanning niche players to industry leaders across e-commerce, financial services, travel, entertainment, and consumer packaged goods.

Inclusivity for our teams is a priority. From DEI training to volunteering, we are on a journey to connect our business goals with values by promoting a culture of equity and access. We are actively seeking candidates that bring diverse perspectives to our team and work with us to build better, more inclusive approaches to work and collaboration.

About the Role
As a Senior in the Analytics Solutions role, designing and implementing measurement solutions doesn‚Äôt intimidate you. Key areas of experience (but not limited to) include interpreting business metrics into a tagging design, configuring, and debugging a tagging container, or helping non-technical clients understand their data capture environment. 

You thrive in this role when you can grow existing skills while learning new skills, collaborate with teams across disciplines, and help establish a data-driven culture of measurement. Your passion for connecting client needs with a technical solution that directly impacts ROI provides the basis for many crucial downstream processes; complex analysis, data products, and digital marketing performance measurement.

The salary range for the Senior, Solutions Analytics position is between $75,000 and $85,000. The actual annual salary is dependent upon many factors, such as the individual‚Äôs experience, knowledge, skills, and qualifications. AKDM does not offer relocation assistance or sponsorship. This is a hybrid role and we‚Äôre looking for someone to come into our Dumbo office 1 - 2 times a week.

Responsibilities
Collaborate with multiple business teams to assess their objectives and develop tracking and tagging strategies that enable individuals and teams to measure their success effectively.
Consult with clients and their agencies on projects involving web analytics platform selection, implementation, and remediation.
Install, configure, and troubleshoot tracking solutions across various channels, including web, mobile apps, and offline sources, using tools like Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Adobe Analytics, Dynamic Tag Manager, and others.
Work closely with client engineering teams to audit tracking implementations, resolve tracking issues, and define quality assurance tests to ensure accurate data capture and alignment with business requirements.
Lead a team in site tag implementation, custom rules development, and analysis using data layer elements on top-tier Tag Management Solutions such as Google Tag Manager, Adobe Launch, or Tealium.
Oversee the development of implementation documentation for client developers, detailing page code requirements and data layer specifics to support business analysis needs.
Provide oversight on quality assurance tests for tracking implementations, ensuring they meet expected standards.
Offer expert consulting services to clients, addressing web analytics platform strategies and technical challenges.
Collaborate with internal and external teams to ensure that key stakeholders are informed of best practices for metrics, exposing them to client management and decision makers.
Conduct training sessions and knowledge-sharing workshops on web analytics for clients and the project team.
Deploy and test analytics tools in iOS and Android mobile apps, especially through the Firebase SDK.
Report directly to the Manager of Analytics Solutions.
Collaborate closely with AKDM‚Äôs digital marketing teams to improve tracking capabilities, leveraging your expertise in tracking methodologies and best practices.
Maintain a repository of high-quality technical deliverables, methodologies, and business development documents.
Evaluate and recommend the technical feasibility of new tools for potential implementation.

Competencies
Bachelor's degree or equivalent.
4+ years of on-the-job analytics implementation experience for tools such as Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics with an understanding of the digital marketing or ad tech space.
2+ years experience with web development.
Experience with HTML, JavaScript, and web protocols.
Experience with tag auditing tools such as Fiddler, Charles, dataLayer Inspector+, and Analytics Debugger
4+ years experience with at least one tag management solution such as Google Tag Manager, Adobe Launch, Tealium iQ, or Ensighten
Experience with Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Facebook Events, Google Floodlights, and other popular analytics and marketing tracking platforms, including how to setup a new implementation, how they are similar, and how they are radically different.
Proven critical thinking, analytical problem-solving skills, and attention to detail.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills to bridge the gap between technology and business management.
Passionate about web technologies (data layers, HTTP protocol, DevTools, etc.) and big data.
Ready to be part of a tight-knit, growing team; ambitious, can work independently as well as collaboratively and possess interpersonal skills.

Bonus Skills
Experience with front-end development, including customizing templates, for popular content management platforms such as WordPress, Shopify, Magento, Drupal, and more.
Experience with one or more data visualization tools, including Tableau, PowerBI, or Data Studio.
You love to figure out ways to automate work processes and have some familiarity with SQL.

What We Provide:
100% Health, Dental, and Vision Coverage: We pay the monthly premium for all employees and cover 70% for spouses, partner, and dependents
3% Non-Elective 401k Match: We contribute to your retirement even if you choose not to
Unlimited Vacation. On average, AKDM employees take 20+ days of vacation and we encourage each other to take time off as needed
Unlimited Sick Days: We want our team to stay healthy and stay home when they need to
Holidays: We observe all major holidays and encourage our employees to celebrate their cultural and ethnic traditions without having to take PTO
Paid Parental Leave: We provide 12 weeks paid leave for primary and secondary caregivers plus flexibility in case more time is needed
Mentorship Program: Mentees receive one-on-one support from the leadership team to receive practical advice and guidance in developing future career goals
Flexible work from home policy

What We Value:
At AKDM we believe diversity is essential to crafting digital strategies. We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, ethnicity, citizenship, national origin of employees, religion, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected status.

description:

title: Associate Research Scientist
description:
About the job
The Associate Research Scientist position described here is part of the Pearson Psychometric and Research Services group, which is part of the US School Assessment group and larger Assessment and Qualifications team. Pearson research scientists provide the full range of psychometric support to state and national customers, develop innovative techniques and processes, and conduct cutting-edge research studies.

The education, experience, and responsibilities associated with this position include:

Education And Work Experience

Doctoral degree in educational measurement or a related field from a nationally recognized institution of higher education

Familiarity with Psychometric Techniques or Techniques Associated with Other Relevant Areas of Expertise

Familiarity with applied psychometric techniques‚Äîincluding classical test theory, item response theory, test equating, scaling, linking, and standard setting
OR familiarity with applied techniques associated with the scientist's specific area of expertise

Familiarity with Software Packages and Programming Languages

Has experience with software packages and programming languages commonly used in psychometric work or measurement research (e.g., SAS, R, SPSS, WINSTEPS, IRTPro, PARSCALE, C++, MPLUS, Java, Javascript, Python)
OR experience with software (Matlab, IDL, PERL, XML) associated with the scientist's specific area of expertise

Scaling and Equating

Conducts analyses for item calibration, linking, and equating under the guidance of more senior research scientists

Grants, Research, and External Funding

Understands grant and research proposal application/writing process
Designs scope of analysis work and anticipated limits for proposed research studies under the guidance of more senior research scientists

Test Construction/Field Testing

Works under guidance from more senior research scientists in the construction of test forms and the preparation of items for various testing purposes

Proposal Development

Contributes to assessment sections of proposals under guidance from more senior research scientists

Knowledge of Educational Trends

Gathers information about national and state trends in education and considers this information when conducting analysis work
Upholds the principles defined by the Standards for Educational and Psychological Testing

Communication Skills, Technical Presentations, And Client Contact

Demonstrates communication skills, (oral, written, and business), necessary to function effectively with internal project teams and external clients
May present technical information to different audiences, (e.g., client groups or technical advisory committees), with guidance from more senior research scientists
Makes presentations at national conferences
Serves as an internal Psychometric and Research Services (PRS) contact (e.g., represents PRS in meetings and other communications) for a testing program or research project

Project and Talent Management

Demonstrates project management skills necessary to complete assigned PRS tasks in a timely manner
Supports hiring process through applicant interviewing
Provides career plan information

Organizational Behavior

Aligns goals with published department goals
Follows existing processes

Working Location and Travel

Willingness to travel as necessary

Compensation at Pearson is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific location. As required by the Colorado, California, Washington State, New York State and New York City laws, the pay range for this position is as follows:

The minimum full-time salary range is between $100,000 - $108,000.

This position is eligible to participate in an annual incentive program, and information on benefits offered is here.

What To Expect From Pearson

Did you know Pearson is one of the 10 most innovative education companies of 2022?

At Pearson, we add life to a lifetime of learning so everyone can realize the life they imagine. We do this by creating vibrant and enriching learning experiences designed for real-life impact. We are on a journey to be 100 percent digital to meet the changing needs of the global population by developing a new strategy with ambitious targets. To deliver on our strategic vision, we have five business divisions that are the foundation for the long-term growth of the company: Assessment & Qualifications, Virtual Learning, English Language Learning, Workforce Skills and Higher Education. Alongside these, we have our corporate divisions: Digital & Technology, Finance, Global Corporate Marketing & Communications, Human Resources, Legal, Strategy and Direct to Consumer. Learn more at We are Pearson.

We value the power of an inclusive culture and also a strong sense of belonging. We promote a culture where differences are embraced, opportunities are accessible, consideration and respect are the norm and all individuals are supported in reaching their full potential. Through our talent, we believe that diversity, equity and inclusion make us a more innovative and vibrant place to work. People are at the center, and we are committed to building a workplace where talent can learn, grow and thrive.

Pearson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and a member of E-Verify. We want a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. All employment decisions are based on qualifications, merit and business need.‚ÄØAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status or any other group protected by law. We strive for a workforce that reflects the diversity of our communities.

To learn more about Pearson‚Äôs commitment to a diverse and inclusive workforce, navigate to: Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Pearson.

If you are an individual with a disability and are unable or limited in your ability to use or access our career site as a result of your disability, you may request reasonable accommodations by emailing TalentExperienceGlobalTeam@grp.pearson.com.

title: AML/BSA Data & Analytics (Remote)
description:
About the job
Job Summary

Provides data analytics and performance reporting that drive business decisions and priorities for the BSA/AML and OFAC department. Production teams' internal partner for forecasting, scorecards, dashboards and reports that offer visibility into our compliance work and the corresponding data trends. Develops and delivers analyses that answer critical business questions, validate assumptions and debunk myths. Works with production customer, account and transaction data to support and execute strategies to ensure compliance, improve team and customer experience, and reduce costs. Partners effectively with internal technology resources and third-party data and/or vendor providers.

Job Duties And Responsibilities

Performs data mining and customer analysis. Researches, compiles, and performs complex analysis on critical customer, household, account, transactional, geographical and or behavioral data
Maintains necessary processes, controls and procedures to ensure data accuracy and integrity. Leverages multiple internal or external information sources and ensures adherence to data management/data governance regulations and policies.
Liaison with Synovus Data Governance team to identify location, structure, and function of data related to department needs and projects.
Partners with department teams to define issues and information needs and translates them into specific data/technical requirements to support business initiatives and projects.
Responsible for designing and developing data visualization solutions according to business requirements to effectively communicate insights and provide performance measurement solutions to business decision makers.
Supports enterprise and department initiatives related to data and technology.
Manages multiple assignments simultaneously and completes assignments within established time frames.
Remains current on best practices of business analytics trends, techniques and tools. May identify emerging trends in technology and analysis as opportunities for future business growth and development.
Presents complex material to all levels of management in a digestible, consumable manner. Responsible for committee materials due on routine basis along with production metric tracking.
Builds effective business partnerships with all levels of team members.
Serves as a liaison between business units, technology teams, and other support teams.
Each team member is expected to be aware of risk within their functional area. This includes observing all policies, procedures, laws, regulations and risk limits specific to their role. 
Performs other related duties as required.

The information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

Synovus is an Equal Opportunity Employer supporting diversity in the workplace

Minimum Education:

Bachelor's degree in Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Finance, Computer Science or a related quantitative discipline and/or business or an equivalent combination of education and experience. 

Minimum Experience:

Four (4) or more years of data reporting, analytics, or technical experience in reporting, analytics, and database technology for financial services AND/OR four (4) or more years of relevant BSA Compliance experience required. 

Required Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:

Knowledge of the industry's standard business practices, products, and services both BSA and technology
Comfortable working with fluid priorities and tight deadlines
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and conceptual skills with high attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to interact and influence successfully at all levels of the organization
Exceptional verbal, written and presentation communication skills
Highly proficient in MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint
Demonstrated data management skills utilizing a large and complex database environment OR using statistical software to collect data and assimilate statistics Exceptional technical skills using tools such as SQL Assistant, SAS, R, Python, Tableau, SPSS, Informatica, DataBricks

Preferred Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:

Job related experience in the financial services industry 
Working knowledge of regression testing, and more complex data modeling principles

title: Data Analyst
description:
About the job
We are currently seeking a Data Analyst to help support our company's merchandising efforts by providing reliable data and building new systems. Our team works on a variety of initiatives, such as helping to prioritize merchandising opportunities based on existing product sales or analyzing and reporting on publishing workflows to minimize throughput time and rework.

What You'll Be Doing
Develop business solutions that align with strategy and represent customer needs understood through data analysis and research
Create reports and dashboards to monitor customer impact and operational progress
Write clean and well-documented queries
Conduct analyses of customer behavioral data to draw trends and identify opportunities
Evaluate solutions that enable teammates to solve problems not currently supported by existing tools or that influence how our business focuses efforts to maximize customer impact
Validate the impact of key metrics on long-term business objectives in a statistically rigorous manner

What We Look For
McMaster-Carr encourages you to apply and share your unique experience even if you don‚Äôt meet 100% of the qualifications below. We look forward to your application.
Strong analytical & critical thinking ability
Demonstrated ability and interest in using data to drive business decisions
Proficiency in SQL, Python, and Microsoft Office
Experience writing clean and well-documented code
1-2 years of professional experience in related fields such as analytics, data science, or other similar areas
Experience with 1-2 statistical methods used in data analysis, such as decision trees, clustering, A/B analysis, or regression
Preferred: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Quantitative Methods (Social Science) or related field
Preferred: HTML, Javascript, Neo4J, NumPy, pandas

About McMaster-Carr
For more than 100 years, McMaster-Carr has been supplying the equipment that keeps the wheels of industry turning. As an industry leader in distribution, operations, customer service, and publishing, we are a trusted partner of major and minor businesses, governments, and institutions across the continent. Our signature catalog contains over 580,000 of the highest-quality, highest-demand products, and our supply chain and logistics management allow us to deliver those products to our customers quickly and reliably.
 Be Rewarded
The starting pay range for this role is $144,500 - $166,500. Exact compensation may vary based on skills and experience. In addition to your base salary, you will also be eligible for Cash Profit Sharing and Retirement Fund (DPS) contributions. Zero-dollar premiums for medical, dental, pharmacy, and vision plans for employees, spouses, and dependents

title: IT Business Analyst IV
description:
About the job
Responsibilities

Kforce has a client that is seeking an IT Business Analyst IV in Atlanta, GA. Responsibilities:

 IT Business Analyst IV will collaborate across teams, geographies, and organizational levels to identify and translate business requirements into scalable automation solutions
 Lead sessions with process owners to step through the current state process in detail and ask thoughtful questions to gain a full and clear understanding of the process being automated
 Identify optimization and standardization opportunities based on these sessions and continually collaborate with the process owner to ensure any recommended process changes satisfy requirements and meet process owner expectations
 Document AS-IS and TO-BE processes using flowcharts and other forms of documentation
 Create Process Design Documents (PDDs) as inputs to RPA and/or APA development and ensure final solution design meets business needs and requirements
 As an IT Business Analyst IV, you will develop any APA components of the automation solution utilizing Alteryx
 Support testing and implementation of automated solutions by creating test cases

Requirements

 Bachelor's degree or equivalent applicable work experience required
 Experience translating business processes into technical requirements
 Experience processing and transforming large volumes of data
 Advanced Excel level, proficient with all other Office applications
 Solid time management skills, ability to prioritize assignments in a dynamic work environment
 Excellent interpersonal skills, positive attitude, flexibility, and a willingness to learn new things
 Ability to map out and document complicated processes and identify opportunities for optimization
 Ability to identify opportunities for innovation by thinking outside the box
 Ability to work in a fast-paced environment even during times of ambiguity
 Demonstrated ability to hold information confidential with excellent judgement
 Alteryx experience preferred
 HR process experience preferred
 Data visualization experience a plus
 Workday and ADP system experience a plus

The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.
