title: Director of AI
description:
About the job
Company Overview
At VoyceMe, we‚Äôre building the first English-originated platform for manga, webtoons and web-novels. We allow fans to interact with other fans, fans to connect with their favorite authors, and universes to be created from original series by authors. We help authors monetize their stories, build and engage their fan base, and share their Voyce. We are building the future of storytelling within the anime world.

Role Overview
Position: Data & AI Director
Focus: Drive AI and data science strategies to revolutionize storytelling and content monetization.

We are on the hunt for a Data & AI Director to spearhead our cutting-edge data science and AI initiatives, shaping the future of storytelling in the anime world! This is a pivotal role where you'll harness the power of AI to revolutionize how stories are created, experienced, and monetized on our innovative platform. If you‚Äôre a visionary leader with deep expertise in machine learning, AI technologies, and a passion for storytelling, this is your opportunity to drive groundbreaking advancements that will redefine fan engagement and creative expression on a global scale.

Tech Stack
Technologies: Python, Stable Diffusion, ComfyUI, Next.js, Tailwind, Flutter, AWS, SQL, PostgreSQL, GraphQL, Hasura.

Key Responsibilities
Leadership: Manage and mentor a team of 12 data scientists and machine learning engineers while being hands on in the code daily. 
Strategy: Develop and execute the company‚Äôs data science & AI strategy.
Development: Develop innovative and data-driven product features for content creation and user engagement through deep learning, diffusion models, and neural networks.
Modeling: Utilize predictive modeling, machine learning, and other statistical techniques to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities.
Analytics: Design and implement advanced data analytics techniques to extract meaningful insights from large, complex datasets and drive data-informed decision-making.
Data Management: Oversee data pipelines and ensure high-quality data processing.
Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams to integrate data insights into business strategies.
Ethics: Champion responsible AI practices and ensure ethical application of AI technologies.
Innovation: Stay updated on industry trends and apply new methodologies to maintain a competitive edge.
Scaling Growth: Play a crucial role in scaling the company through its continued rapid growth, optimizing AI and data science strategies to support and drive expansion. Ensure the infrastructure and systems are robust enough to handle increasing demands while maintaining high performance, reliability and scalability.

Qualifications
Experience: Proven senior leadership in data science, machine learning, or AI, preferably in tech or entertainment. The ideal candidate would have experience with image generation. 
Education: Master‚Äôs or Ph.D. and/or Research experience in relevant fields is nice to have.
Skills: Proficiency in programming (Python, R, Java), AI frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch), and managing large teams and projects.
Attributes: Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills; passion for storytelling and the creative arts.
Passion: for storytelling, anime, and the creative arts is ideal.

Please note: VoyceMe is based in NYC. This role can be fully remote and based in the United States, Canada or Philippines with the caveat that you're willing to work EST hours and handle critical tasks as needed in Philippine Standard Time.

title: Data Scientist
description:
About the job
As a Data Scientist at Smarsh, you will be analyzing a wide range of unstructured communications data to address problems for our customers through attentive listening, astute planning, and out of the box thinking to develop solutions and reporting results in an engaging manner.

The role will involve working with Senior Data Scientists and mentoring Associate Data Scientists in analyzing complex data, generating insights, and creating solutions as needed across a variety of tools and platforms. The ideal candidate for this position will possess the ability to perform both independent and team-based research and generate insights from large data sets with a hands-on/can do attitude of servicing/managing day to day data requests and analysis.

The role offers a unique opportunity to get exposure to many problems and solutions associated with taking machine learning and analytics research to production. On any given day, you will have the opportunity to interface with business leaders, machine learning researchers, data engineers, platform engineers, data scientists and many more, enabling you to level up in true end-to-end data science proficiency.

What will you do?

Development of machine learning models and other analytics following established workflows, while also looking for optimization and improvement opportunities
Data annotation and quality review 
Exploratory data analysis and model fail state analysis 
Methodology, results and insights reporting, including model Governance report drafting in collaboration with senior team members 
Client/prospect guidance in machine learning model and analytic fine-tuning/development processes
50% exploratory data analysis and annotation
20% interaction with stakeholders to understand modeling needs
30% data science experiments and model building

What will you bring?

Solid statistics knowledge (hypothesis testing, ANOVA, chi-square tests, etc‚Ä¶)
Command of data science and statistics principles (regression, Bayes, time series, clustering, P/R, AUROC, exploratory data analysis etc‚Ä¶)
Understanding and Experience of NLP Techniques in traditional pipelines, metrics, process and evaluation for supervised and unsupervised learning. 
Familiarity with Deep Learning techniques for NLP.
Familiarity with LLMs.
Excellent verbal and written skills
Proven collaborator, thriving on teamwork
Self-learner
Good relationship building skills

Required Education And Experience

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Applied Math, Statistics, or a scientific field
Approx. 2 to 5 years experience working with data & analytics (including school)
Experience working with Python
Familiarity with SQL and noSQL databases 
Knowledge of ‚ÄúBig Data‚Äù frameworks like Hadoop, spark and Kafka are a plus
Familiarity with one or more data science and machine/deep learning frameworks and tooling, including scikit-learn, H2O, keras, pytorch, tensorflow, pandas, numpy, carot, tidyverse
Experience using Git, Linux/Unix, an IDEs

Preferred Education And Experience

Master‚Äôs or Doctor of Philosophy degree in Computer Science, Applied Math, Statistics, or a scientific field
Have 1+ years experience working with NLP, text analytics/classification
Knowledge of NLP transfer learning, including word embedding models (gloVe, fastText, word2vec) and transformer models (Bert, SBert, HuggingFace, and GPT-x etc.)
Experience with natural language processing toolkits like NLTK, spaCy
Knowledge of microservices architecture and continuous delivery concepts in machine learning and related technologies such as helm, Docker and Kubernetes
Cloud computing (AWS, GCS, Azure)

$120,000 - $130,000 a year

The above salary range represents Smarsh's good faith and reasonable estimate of the range of possible base compensation at the time of posting.

Any applicable bonus programs will be discussed during the recruiting process.

The salary for this role will be set based on a variety of factors, including but not limited to, internal equity, experience, education, location, specialty and training. Local cost of living assessments are done for each new hire at the time of offer.

About Our Culture

Smarsh hires lifelong learners with a passion for innovating with purpose, humility and humor. Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. We work closely with the most popular communications platforms and the world‚Äôs leading cloud infrastructure platforms. We use the latest in AI/ML technology to help our customers break new ground at scale. We are a global organization that values diversity, and we believe that providing opportunities for everyone to be their authentic self is key to our success. Smarsh leadership, culture, and commitment to developing our people have all garnered Comparably.com Best Places to Work Awards. Come join us and find out what the best work of your career looks like.

title: Director, Laboratory Data Analytics
description:
About the job
Job Summary:  
The Director is a top-caliber Subject Matter Expert responsible for leading and supporting the implementation of projects and responding to complex client matters while mentoring and providing guidance to team members on complex issues relating to client projects. The Director serves as key member of the internal extended leadership team and plays a vital and important role on client engagements within the life sciences industry, including pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and medical devices. 

Team members in the role of Director possess a deep understanding of business and corporate strategy and have an excellent overall grasp of issues relating to the pharmaceutical industry The Director works closely with other team members and key stakeholders to deliver quality client services and achieve excellent client satisfaction. 

Essential Duties and Responsibilities: 
The Director is a broad-minded, strategically oriented professional who: 
Maintains current knowledge of practices and trends in the areas of drug development, manufacturing, compliance, regulation, laboratory, and related policies/procedures associated with FDA and other agency‚Äôs approvals for drugs and can convey this knowledge to colleagues. 
Interface with new or potential clients to develop project specific contracts. 
Direct small and large, complex projects, including selection and management of appropriate staffing, project management, budget oversight, timely delivery, customer service and high-quality deliverables based on contracted services. 
Contributes to projects as SME. 
Easily synthesizes solutions and recommend improvements/changes to clients successfully. 
Manages and develops Practice Area team members by fostering an environment that promotes successful and positive interaction. 
Participates in recruiting, training, coaching, and development of personnel; Supports and contributes to knowledge management and knowledge sharing. 
Works both collaboratively and independently to complete client projects; manages multiple assignments and tasks simultaneously. 
Successful development or responses and remediation of FDA 483s, Warning Letters, and Consent Decrees; Corrective action plans as related to laboratory compliance. 
Provides expert scientific guidance to understand and resolve significant issues related to adverse FDA 483 observations and Warning Letters. 
Performs due diligence activities, gap analysis, data integrity, application integrity, validation, and standard operating procedures. 
Develops specialized laboratory data integrity investigative techniques to audit and oversee the auditing of analytical raw data (including electronic source data) to ensure accuracy and validity. 
Develops specialized and effective auditing techniques in support of numerous "for cause" audits of GMP, GCP, GLP, and BE/BA bioanalytical laboratories. 
Delivers bioanalytical and analytical methods development, methods validation, process validation expertise. 
Supports the firm‚Äôs initiatives to build industry eminence and recognition and deliver quality work products. 
Successfully completes special projects as assigned. 

Required Education and Experience: 
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree from a four-year college or university in a designated discipline or relevant field of study. 
Masters or Doctorate preferred in life science. 
Experience working with/for U.S. and International Regulatory agencies / life sciences industry. 
Extensive experience in data governance strategies and control. 

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: 
Deep understanding of business and corporate strategy relating to laboratory design and compliance. 
Highly skilled and knowledgeable of FDA submissions; pre-approval inspections, validation of laboratory equipment and computer systems and standard operating procedures. 
Strong knowledge of regulations of US FDA and regulatory agencies other than US FDA, including EU MDR. 
Demonstrated leadership skills in project and process delivery involving teams and professional technical aspects. 
Technical skills must include demonstrated SME level experience in QC Chemistry Analytical Laboratory practices including the most recent test methods; equipment; LIMS; and regulatory compliance applications. 
Demonstrated SME level experience in laboratory data governance and data integrity principles. 
Must be able to both assess current state and make specific recommendations for remediation based on current regulatory compliance expectations, global standards, guidance, and industry best practice 
Exhibits flexible/accommodating communication style when interacting with clients across a global customer base. 
Demonstrates sophisticated capability at applying the methodology, data/information gathering, analysis, and synthesis of reports in areas relating to client issues on topics of laboratory compliance 
Proven success in quality customer services, both internal and external. 
Success in efficiently managing multiple projects simultaneously. 
Skilled at formulating appropriate client recommendations, interacting with client representatives. 
Successfully develops project deliverables and independently leads project teams. 
Exhibits superb organizational skills and demonstrated attention to detail. 
Skilled in reviewing, auditing, investigating, and report writing. 
Possesses strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite and project management software/tools. 

Required Supervisory Responsibilities: 
The Director is required to manage the company‚Äôs professionals in accordance with company‚Äôs policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; conducting individual performance appraisals; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and conflict resolution. 

Soft Skills and Behaviors: 
Displays excellent leadership and decision-making skills. 
Leads people by encouraging collaboration and communication, effectively managing conflict, leveraging diversity, and assisting in developing others. 
Demonstrates high level of interpersonal skills and constructively communicates with clients across a global customer base, team members, leadership and key stakeholders in the delivery of consulting services; can discuss difficult issues effectively and to the point. 
Practices active listening. 
Effectively collaborates with people in (and outside of) the team to successfully reach targets. 
Freely and effectively shares knowledge and provides support to team members. 
Brings positivity and enthusiasm to the organization and creates an inclusive culture. 
Demonstrates empathy, seeing multiple perspectives. 
Displays self-awareness and understanding. 

Travel: 
Travel is required via automobile, train, bus and/or airplane multiple days at a time, both domestically and internationally. Percentage of travel to be discussed based on specific role.

title: Data Scientist II
description:
About the job

Maintains detailed documentation of data analysis processes, model development methodologies, and findings for future reference and regulatory compliance.
Stays informed about industry trends, emerging technologies, and advancements in data science within the insurance sector.
Identifies opportunities for process improvement and automation to enhance

Education:

3+ years of experience in a data science role, with a focus on data analysis, predictive modeling, and machine learning.

Extensive experience in working with relational database management system such as Microsoft SQL Server and MySQL.
Advanced skills in writing complex SQL queries for data retrieval, transformation and

Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to explain complex data concepts to diverse stakeholders.

Protect the confidentiality, integrity and availability of information and technology assets against unauthorized disclosure, destruction and/or alteration, in accordance with Safety National policies, standards, and procedures.

Safety National is a leading specialty insurance and reinsurance provider. Our culture is built upon relationships, which allow us to demonstrate our expertise gained through our rich 80-year history. As a wholly-owned subsidiary of Tokio Marine, Inc., we appreciate the benefits and support provided by our affiliation with one of the top 10 insurance companies in the world.

A Benefits Structure That Puts Employees First

Safety National‚Äôs approach to benefits reaches far beyond competitive fixed compensation. Instead, we construct a total rewards benefits package for each valued member of our team. Highlights include incentive award bonuses, an annual holiday bonus, and profit-sharing contributions. Other exceptional benefits include generous healthcare coverage, a 401(k) match, enhanced paid caregiver leave, and family-forming benefits for adoption, surrogacy, and fertility. We also promote balance by offering a hybrid working environment and several employee appreciation events throughout the year. Apply today to learn more about our total rewards approach.

Safety National is committed to fair, transparent pay and we strive to provide competitive, market-based compensation. In our vision to be First with Co-Workers, compensation is only one piece of the comprehensive total rewards package we offer. The target salary range for this position is $84,000 to $135,000. title: Manager, Data Science, Analytics - Digital Ordering
description:
About the job
About The Team

DoorDash provides products and services to help restaurants grow. The Digital Ordering team builds products to help restaurants maximize the value of their first-party customers outside of the DoorDash app, via digital channels like websites, native apps, and CRM.

About The Role

As the manager and lead for the Digital Ordering analytics team, you‚Äôll be leading a team of data scientists who are working on building effective digital channels and surfaces to engage restaurant customers and facilitate an easy and delightful ordering experience. You will work closely with product and eng teams to build new products, and work with strategy and ops teams to bring these to market and validate ROI for restaurants. You will oversee our metrics and analytics strategy to understand how to bring together a set of independent digital products into a cohesive digital suite that will help restaurants grow and accelerate their sales.

You're Excited About This Opportunity Because You Will‚Ä¶

Lead and develop a team of Data Scientists in building software products and uncovering key drivers of our business, along with your own contributions as an Individual Contributor
Influence the Product and Operations roadmap by making actionable recommendations based on data
Interface frequently with senior leadership to showcase your team‚Äôs work and tackle complex business problems
Drive measurement strategy for the area under scope, defining success metrics and implementing best practices around experiment design and statistical analysis
Develop a strategic learning roadmap based on data observations, strategic questions, and hypotheses

We're Excited About You Because You Have‚Ä¶

2+ years of experience managing a team of data scientists in a formal or informal capacity, and a track record of delivering impactful analyses
6+ years of experience in Data Science and Product Analytics, primarily in related industries
Strength in leading through your technical chops, and ability to leverage it appropriately in the business context
Deep understanding of, and hands-on experience with A/B experimentation
Experience with data pipelines
Excellent communication and cross-functional working skills, including the ability to present complex findings to non-technical audiences and influence strategic decisions

Notice to Applicants for Jobs Located in NYC or Remote Jobs Associated With Office in NYC Only

We use Covey as part of our hiring and/or promotional process for jobs in NYC and certain features may qualify it as an AEDT in NYC. As part of the hiring and/or promotion process, we provide Covey with job requirements and candidate submitted applications. We began using Covey Scout for Inbound from August 21, 2023, through December 21, 2023, and resumed using Covey Scout for Inbound again on June 29, 2024.

The Covey tool has been reviewed by an independent auditor. Results of the audit may be viewed here: Covey

Compensation

The successful candidate's starting pay will fall within the pay range listed below and is determined based on job-related factors including, but not limited to, skills, experience, qualifications, work location, and market conditions. Base salary is localized according to an employee‚Äôs work location. Ranges are market-dependent and may be modified in the future.

In addition to base salary, the compensation for this role includes opportunities for equity grants. Talk to your recruiter for more information.

DoorDash cares about you and your overall well-being. That‚Äôs why we offer a comprehensive benefits package for all regular employees that includes a 401(k) plan with an employer match, paid time off, paid parental leave, wellness benefits, and several paid holidays.

Additionally, for full-time employees, DoorDash offers medical, dental, and vision benefits, disability and basic life insurance, family-forming assistance, a commuter benefit match, and a mental health program, among others.

To learn more about our benefits, visit our careers page here.

The base pay for this position ranges from our lowest geographical market up to our highest geographical market within California, Colorado, District of Columbia, Hawaii, New Jersey, New York and Washington.

$163,100‚Äî$239,800 USD

About DoorDash

At DoorDash, our mission to empower local economies shapes how our team members move quickly, learn, and reiterate in order to make impactful decisions that display empathy for our range of users‚Äîfrom Dashers to merchant partners to consumers. We are a technology and logistics company that started with door-to-door delivery, and we are looking for team members who can help us go from a company that is known for delivering food to a company that people turn to for any and all goods.

DoorDash is growing rapidly and changing constantly, which gives our team members the opportunity to share their unique perspectives, solve new challenges, and own their careers. We're committed to supporting employees‚Äô happiness, healthiness, and overall well-being by providing comprehensive benefits and perks including premium healthcare, wellness expense reimbursement, paid parental leave and more.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We‚Äôre committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That‚Äôs why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

Statement of Non-Discrimination: In keeping with our beliefs and goals, no employee or applicant will face discrimination or harassment based on: race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital/domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability status, or veteran status. Above and beyond discrimination and harassment based on ‚Äúprotected categories,‚Äù we also strive to prevent other subtler forms of inappropriate behavior (i.e., stereotyping) from ever gaining a foothold in our office. Whether blatant or hidden, barriers to success have no place at DoorDash. We value a diverse workforce ‚Äì people who identify as women, non-binary or gender non-conforming, LGBTQIA+, American Indian or Native Alaskan, Black or African American, Hispanic or Latinx, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander, differently-abled, caretakers and parents, and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. Thank you to the Level Playing Field Institute for this statement of non-discrimination.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, and any other state or local hiring regulations, we will consider for employment any qualified applicant, including those with arrest and conviction records, in a manner consistent with the applicable regulation.

If you need any accommodations, please inform your recruiting contact upon initial connection.

title: Senior Technical Program Manager
description:
About the job
About GitHub

As the global home for all developers, GitHub is the complete AI-powered developer platform to build, scale, and deliver secure software. Over 100 million people, including developers from 90 of the Fortune 100 companies, use GitHub to build amazing things together across 330+ million repositories. With all the collaborative features of GitHub, it has never been easier for individuals and teams to write faster, better code.

Locations

In this role you can work from Remote, United States

Overview

GitHub is the developer company and the home of open source. We make it easier for developers to be developers: to work together, to solve challenging problems, and to create the world‚Äôs most important technologies. We foster a collaborative community that can come together‚Äîas individuals and in teams‚Äîto create the future of software and make a difference in the world.

GitHub Engineering Operations ensures that each engineer has a great onboarding experience. We are expanding this to a organization-wide learning program for engineers across the breadth of professional experience. A candidate with experience in building a curriculum for engineers at all professional stages will bring a valued perspective, whether on their first day at GitHub or in their twentieth year of their engineering career.

Responsibilities

The Technical Program Manager partners with the product manager, engineering lead, and other internal stakeholders to develop and manage a comprehensive program plan including schedule, cross - functional dependencies, risk elements, and communicating status/progress and risks to all the program stakeholders, including the GitHub leadership team.

The TPM is technically adept and well versed in agile program management to engage with the GitHub engineering team while also has business breadth across go-to-market, marketing, sales, support, legal, finance and other functional areas to deliver an exceptional experience for GitHub‚Äôs customers.

The TPM has a passion for program management, exceptional leadership skills to be able to mobilize engagement across multiple functions and be able to align all these efforts to deliver a high impact business outcome. In this role, the TPM will be as comfortable offering recommendations across both technical and business domains. The TPM is comfortable making trade-off recommendations that optimize for the overall program success over individual functional success.

The TPM is adept at developing processes and tools to help scale the TPM function at GitHub and drive continuous improvements in the practice. This opportunity is well-suited for an experienced TPM who loves enabling teams to solve complex technical and business problems, has the attention to detail to deliver outstanding experiences for our customers and super fans, works collaboratively across a global organization, and thrives in a dynamic, fast-paced, completely distributed organization. The TPM should also be comfortable interacting with senior executives across the program partners articulating status, dependencies and navigating discussions towards impactful decisions.

Qualifications

Required Qualifications:

6+ years experience in engineering, product/technical program management, data analysis, or product development
OR Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, Math, Business, or related field AND 4+ years experience in engineering, product/technical program management, data analysis, or product development 
OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, Math, Business, or related field AND 2+ years experience in engineering, product/technical program management, data analysis, or product development
OR equivalent experience.
3+ years experience in managing cross-functional and/or cross-team projects.

Preferred Qualifications:

6+ years experience in managing cross-functional and/or cross-team projects.
2+ years experience designing, building, or supporting software systems.
Comfortable working in a 100% remote and globally distributed team and willing to travel as/when needed in support of program goals
Have a flair for software development projects, can quickly absorb new technologies and proven experience in creating clarity in the midst of complexity; experience in understanding the technical architecture and design of a product/ feature(s)
Expert level knowledge in agile as well as traditional project management methodologies, with the ability to combine and develop hybrid tools to drive program success
Ability to clearly identify and articulate program status, identify complex blockers, and work with a sense of urgency to mitigate unexpected issues, when they arise
Demonstrated success in working in a boundaryless manner and delivering results through cross functional, cross organizational collaboration
Intellectually curious with a passion for learning and development for yourself and others

Compensation Range

The base salary range for this job is USD $104,200.00 - USD $276,900.00 /Yr.

These pay ranges are intended to cover roles based across the United States. An individual's base pay depends on various factors including geographical location and review of experience, knowledge, skills, abilities of the applicant. At GitHub certain roles are eligible for benefits and additional rewards, including annual bonus and stock. These rewards are allocated based on individual impact in role. In addition, certain roles also have the opportunity to earn sales incentives based on revenue or utilization, depending on the terms of the plan and the employee's role.

GitHub values

Customer-obsessed
Ship to learn
Growth mindset
Own the outcome
Better together
Diverse and inclusive

Manager fundamentals

Model
Coach
Care

Leadership principles

Create clarity
Generate energy
Deliver success

Who We Are

GitHub is the world‚Äôs leading AI-powered developer platform with 100 million developers and counting. We‚Äôre also home to the biggest open-source community on earth (and 99% of the world‚Äôs software has open-source code in its DNA). Many of the apps and programs you use every day are built on GitHub.

Our teams are dreamers, doers, and pioneers, leading the way in AI, driving humanitarian efforts around the globe, and even sending open source to Mars (and beyond!). At GitHub, our goal is to create the space you need to do your best work. We‚Äôre remote-first and offer competitive pay, generous learning and growth opportunities, and excellent benefits to support you, wherever you are‚Äîbecause we know that people flourish when they can work on their own terms.

Join us, and let‚Äôs change the world, together.

EEO Statement

GitHub is made up of people from a wide variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. We embrace diversity and invite applications from people of all walks of life. We don't discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process better for you; we're happy to accommodate!

title: Data Specialist
description:
About the job
Dataiku Developer - Data Specialist
Location: Remote
Duration 3-5+ months

About the Role:
Our client, a leading bank, is looking for a highly skilled Dataiku Developer to help employ and optimize Dataiku as part of their data management and analytics strategy. This role will focus on integrating Dataiku into the bank‚Äôs existing infrastructure, ensuring that it supports key business initiatives like data governance, analytics, and regulatory reporting.

Key Responsibilities:
As a Dataiku Developer, you will:
Design and Implement Dataiku Workflows: Build and manage end-to-end data pipelines and workflows in Dataiku, ensuring optimal performance and scalability for large data sets.
Develop Data Solutions: Collaborate with data engineers, analysts, and stakeholders to develop, implement, and maintain data solutions for analytics, machine learning models, and regulatory reporting.
Data Integration & Automation: Utilize Dataiku to integrate data from multiple sources, ensuring seamless data flow for the bank‚Äôs analytics and reporting needs.
Governance and Compliance: Support the deployment of data governance and compliance frameworks using Dataiku, ensuring all workflows and processes adhere to financial regulatory standards.
Optimize Dataiku Platform Usage: Identify opportunities to enhance the use of Dataiku across teams by promoting best practices in data preparation, transformation, and analysis.
Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams: Work closely with business analysts, data scientists, and IT teams to deliver high-quality data solutions that meet the bank‚Äôs business objectives.
Support and Troubleshoot Dataiku Applications: Provide ongoing support, troubleshooting, and enhancements for the Dataiku platform to ensure smooth operation and user adoption.

Required Skills and Qualifications:
Dataiku Expertise: Proven hands-on experience with Dataiku, including developing and managing data pipelines, workflow automation, and deploying analytics solutions.
Data Integration: Strong experience in integrating data from multiple sources (e.g., databases, APIs, cloud storage) into Dataiku.
Banking/Financial Services Experience: Familiarity with the banking industry‚Äôs data needs, particularly around regulatory reporting, risk management, and compliance.
Programming & Scripting: Proficiency in Python or R within the Dataiku platform, with the ability to write custom scripts and build machine learning models.
Data Governance: Experience in deploying and managing data governance frameworks using Dataiku or other data management tools.
ETL/ELT Processes: Strong knowledge of ETL/ELT processes and how to leverage Dataiku for efficient data transformation and cleaning.
Team Collaboration: Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work across various teams to deliver solutions.

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with cloud-based data solutions (e.g., AWS, Azure) and integrating them with Dataiku.
Familiarity with SQL and other databases commonly used in banking environments.
Knowledge of machine learning and AI frameworks, especially as applied within Dataiku.

title: Data Scientist
description:
About the job
WHO WE ARE: At Fors Marsh, we take on issues that matter. We are a team of researchers, advisors, and communicators working together to shape the systems that shape our lives. We look at human behavior from all angles to design targeted solutions that influence decision-making and move people to action. We are committed to the problem, not just the project, and we are intentional about taking on work and forming partnerships that balance purpose, people, planet, and profit. We are a certified B Corporation, a Just employer, and a 2019-2024 Top Workplace. We hold ourselves accountable to the values that have always defined us. And those values drive us to be the best possible versions of ourselves-for each other, our communities, our clients, and the world.

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR: Fors Marsh is seeking an intelligent and motivated early career Data Scientist needed to join our Research Methodology Center‚Äîthe company‚Äôs go to resource for quantitative methodology. This individual‚Äôs primary responsibility will be executing and supporting the research efforts of our clients. This job is best suited for an individual who enjoys research, possesses excellent attention to detail, continuously strives to learn and develop, and prefers working in a cooperative environment.

Responsibilities include:

Working collaboratively with other members of the Research Methodology Center and client facing project teams to support client needs. 
Executing and contributing to analysis plans that outline data preparation, statistical and computational methodology, and planned goals for the interpretation of findings.
Managing and manipulating datasets from primary data collections and secondary data sources.
Preparing technical reports, presentations, and executive summaries.
Participating in project meetings and assisting project managers with development of research projects.
Ensuring quality control of quantitative research projects across research divisions.
Develop comprehensive analysis plans, including selecting appropriate methodologies and defining interpretation strategies to ensure accurate and actionable insights.
Contribute to business development efforts by assisting in the writing of a proposal‚Äôs methodology section.

Qualifications:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in data science, statistics or social science (i.e., mathematics, economics, business, public policy, or related disciplines). Graduate degree preferred.
3 years of applied research experience.
Experience with R or Stata is required; experience with other statistical software packages such as Python, and Tableau. 
Ability to standardize programming syntax and automate syntax where applicable.
Initiative to expand in a specialized skillset such as programming dashboards (in R, Python, or JavaScript), cloud computing, large-scale data processing in Spark, Natural Language Processing (NLP), or Generative AI.
Knowledge and experience with social science research methods including best practices for surveys, experimental design, and associated statistical analyses (i.e., descriptive statistics, traditional statistical modeling, machine learning).
Highly self-motivated with keen attention to detail.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Applicants may be subject to a low-level government security investigation and must meet eligibility criteria for access to sensitive information.
Must be a U.S. Citizen and consent to a full background check due to our federal contract requirements.

We Offer:

Our benefits typically meet or exceed our competitors‚Äô packages. Ways we are unique?

Ability to make an impact on people‚Äôs lives, both internal and external to the organization.
Top-tier health, dental, vision, and long and short-term disability coverage all covered at 100% for employee coverage.
Remote work.
Our company culture, which values balance and allows each employee to take leave as they require it to balance the responsibilities of both their work and home lives without worrying about depleting their available leave hours.
We provide a floating holiday bank so you can celebrate the days you value.
Generous matching retirement contributions and no vesting period starting the third month of employment.
Dedicated training and development budgets to expand your expertise and grow your skillset.
You can volunteer your way with paid time off.
You can participate in Fors Marsh staff-led affinity groups.
Our employees receive product and service discounts through the certified B Corp network.

Salary: $80,000 - $85,000

FM Career Map: Research Scientist I

Location: Remote, United States Residents only

EOE: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran

title: Business Intelligence Technical Lead
description:
About the job
Title: Business Intelligence Technical Lead 
Location: Philadelphia, PA *(Hybrid) 
Compensation: 130 to 145k + Bonus
Type: Direct

We are seeking a talented and motivated Business Intelligence (BI) Technical Lead with extensive experience in Oracle Analytics Cloud (OAC) to lead the technical design, development, and deployment of cutting-edge BI solutions. This is an individual contributor role, requiring hands-on expertise in building and optimizing business intelligence systems.

Responsibilities:
Lead the design, development, and implementation of Business Intelligence solutions using Oracle Analytics Cloud (OAC).
Create and maintain data visualizations, dashboards, and reports to support business decision-making.
Develop data models and optimize queries to enhance BI performance and deliver actionable insights to stakeholders.
Collaborate with business users and stakeholders to gather BI requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
Work with cross-functional teams (data engineering, data science, business teams) to ensure data integrity and alignment with business objectives.
Implement best practices for data management, governance, and security, ensuring compliance with organizational and industry standards.
Provide technical leadership in troubleshooting and resolving performance issues related to OAC, ensuring high system availability.
Stay current on BI trends, emerging tools, and Oracle cloud updates to recommend improvements and drive innovation in BI processes.
Train and mentor team members or business users on BI tools and self-service capabilities within OAC.
Act as a liaison between technical teams and business units, ensuring the seamless integration of BI solutions across departments.

Qualifications:
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree required. Related I.S. degree or equivalent experience in Business Intelligence / Data Warehousing preferred.
Minimum of five (5) years directly related experience.
Oracle Analytics Cloud or similar (Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, etc.)
Minimum of three (3) years of Cloud development experience, preferably Oracle
Comprehensive understanding of Business Intelligence and Data Warehousing processes and tools
Experience with data modeling within RDBMS, including the Kimball Design Methodology (star schemas, bridge tables, etc.)
Proficiency in designing interactive dashboards, reports, and data visualizations using OAC‚Äôs suite of tools.
Strong expertise in data modeling, SQL, and performance optimization for BI queries.
Solid understanding of ETL processes, data warehousing, and data integration techniques.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently, taking ownership of BI projects from end-to-end in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

Benefits:
Performance bonus for all team members
401(k) with company match
Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance Options
HSA
Life & Disability Insurance 
Paid Parental Leave & Adoption Assistance 
Hybrid work arrangements 
Tuition Reimbursement 
Paid Time Off, volunteer days, community partnerships, and Employee Assistance Program

Equal Opportunity Employer:
We are deeply committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. We believe that different backgrounds and life experiences make our team better. title: Data Scientist
description:
About the job
A position at White Cap isn‚Äôt your ordinary job. You‚Äôll work in an exciting and diverse environment, meet interesting people, and have a variety of career opportunities.

The White Cap family is committed to Building Trust on Every Job. We do this by being deeply knowledgeable, fully capable, and always dependable, and our associates are the driving force behind this commitment.

Job Summary

Responsible for leveraging data science expertise to derive actionable insights from complex data sets, aiding in driving growth and operational efficiency. Collaborate across departments, providing data-driven guidance and predictive analytics to inform critical business decisions.

Major Tasks, Responsibilities And Key Accountabilities

Support the development of robust experiments and models with high levels of rigor to ensure accuracy, reproducibility, and reliability of results.
Utilize modern techniques in machine learning and software development for complex data analysis and predictive modeling. Participate in the development of both stochastic and deterministic prediction models, including exploratory analysis, time series forecasting, and classification tasks with detailed instruction and supervision.
Work with open-source libraries, including LLMs, Transformers, ML, and forecasting packages. Apply these models to a variety of datasets to extract insights, make predictions, and inform decision-making processes.
Collaborate closely with senior team members while independently managing your own tasks, contributing to team efforts in addressing challenges.
Stay updated with the latest developments in data science, machine learning, and big data technologies. Explore new tools and techniques to improve existing processes and contribute to innovation within the team.
Leverage Azure Cloud services for data storage, processing, and analytics. Implement scalable solutions and manage large datasets effectively.

Nature and Scope

Demonstrates skill in data analysis techniques by resolving missing/incomplete information and inconsistencies/anomalies in more complex research/data.
Nature of work requires increasing independence; receives guidance only on unusual, complex problems or issues. Work review typically involves periodic review of output by a supervisor and/or direct customers of the process.
May provide general guidance/direction to or train junior level support or professional personnel.

Work Environment

Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.
Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles.
Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time.

Education And Experience

Typically requires BS/BA in a related discipline. Generally 2-5 years of experience in a related field OR MS/MA and generally 2-4 years of experience in a related field. Certification is required in some areas.

Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
5+ years of quantitative and analytics experience.
3 years of demonstrated Python and SQL experience
Demonstrate skills in experimental design.
Experience with Databricks, PySpark and MLflow is a plus.

\

\

If you‚Äôre looking to play a role in building America, consider one of our open opportunities. We can‚Äôt wait to meet you.

Functional Area Marketing and Communications

Recruiter Haynes, Steven

Req ID WCJR-020498

White Cap is an Equal Opportunity Minority/Female/Individuals with Disabilities/Protected Veteran and Affirmative Action Employer. White Cap considers for employment and hires qualified candidates without regard to age, race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, protected veteran or disability status or any factor prohibited by law.

title: Director of Evaluation, Impact, and Research
description:
About the job
WHO WE ARE
The Alliance for Decision Education (the Alliance) is a national nonprofit and field builder with the mission of improving lives by empowering students with essential skills and dispositions for making better decisions. Founded in 2014 and backed by experts in decision sciences, business, and education‚Äîincluding several Nobel laureates‚Äîthe Alliance believes that better decisions lead to better lives and a better society.

As a field builder, the Alliance partners with teachers, academic and business leaders, families, and community members to raise awareness and lead the growing call to have Decision Education taught in schools across the country.

The Alliance is committed to an inclusive, supportive, and collaborative culture. Our diverse team is made up of educators, researchers, subject matter experts, and other professionals who are dedicated to our mission. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

WHAT WE OFFER
The Alliance offers a comprehensive total rewards package inclusive of competitive compensation that is commensurate with experience, generous Paid Time Off (PTO), an Employee Assistance Program (EAP), and employer-paid medical, vision, dental, life, and disability insurance. Employees may also contribute to a Flexible Spending Account (FSA), as well as a 401(k) plan with a dollar-for-dollar match up to 5%.*

The Alliance operates on a hybrid work schedule in which local employees are expected to work from the office every Tuesday and Thursday during standard work hours. Local employees generally have the flexibility to work remotely or from the office on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays. All employees, both local and remote, receive equipment, supplies, and additional resources to help them do their best work.

JOB OVERVIEW
The Director of Evaluation, Impact, and Research will be responsible for leading and overseeing the execution of research strategies as outlined in our Strategic Plan and Research Agenda. This includes developing and implementing strategies to generate impact data and evidence (mostly from students and teachers), both internally and in collaboration with external partners. You will oversee the building and sustaining of a community of researchers, fostering collaboration and knowledge-sharing to advance our understanding of Decision Education.

The Director of Evaluation, Impact, and Research will also lead the Alliance‚Äôs recently launched Grants and Awards Program. Through the generous support of donors, the Alliance has $12.5M in restricted funding dedicated to supporting Decision Education research studies.

We are seeking someone who is passionate about fields related to decision science and Decision Education‚Äôs impact on students, excited by the chance to build a field of research, loves the idea of collaborating with leaders in this space, and wants to spearhead groundbreaking research.

The Director of Evaluation, Impact, and Research will report to the Interim Executive Director as part of the Research Department.

We expect this individual to adhere to the Alliance‚Äôs hybrid work schedule, working from the office in Bala Cynwyd, PA on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Department Leadership
Prioritize, execute, and update (when needed) Research Department initiatives in alignment with the Strategic Plan and the Research Agenda
Supervise the Research Department and manage department staff.
Collaborate closely with other departments.
Support team members with content expertise.

Alliance Impact 
Lead the Alliance‚Äôs efforts to evaluate effectiveness of our own in-school and out-of-school initiatives (in close collaboration with the Education Department). This will require expertise/experience collecting data from K-12 students and educators, analyzing it, and reporting findings.
Provide guidance and recommendations to the Education Department to support data-driven decision-making and continuous improvement in initiatives and programs to lead to better outcomes.
Ensure the reporting of the data is accessible to a general audience and is responsive to the needs of various internal and external stakeholders.

Grants and Awards Program
Oversee the 10-year Alliance Grants and Awards program ($12.5M in restricted funding) that supports researchers in building a body of credible evidence, including around K-12 Decision Education interventions. The first grants will be awarded in 2025.
Oversee the management a portfolio of research projects funded by the Alliance.

Research Community
Oversee the building and managing of a sustainable community of researchers, fostering collaboration and knowledge-sharing to advance the field of Decision Education.

Field data
Oversee the collection of organizational and field data, both quantitative and qualitative, and share it with other departments at the Alliance, our Board, and other stakeholders.

Digital Research Repository 
Oversee the management of building and maintaining an accessible repository of Decision Education research hosted on the Alliance website.

These duties may change or expand over time consistent with the organization‚Äôs needs and initiatives.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS
Experience
15+ years in research, data analysis, and evaluation of interventions/programs in K-12 education environments, including Includes: quantitative and qualitative analysis and experience with longitudinal studies is a bonus.
Experience managing a team and budget.
Experience overseeing a multi-year grant program, either as a grantmaker or grant recipient.
IRB approval for K-12 populations.
Working with external stakeholders.
Experience with grant application and execution is required.
PhD in decision science or related fields is preferred, but not required.
Skills, Characteristics, and Attributes
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to communicate complex concepts to general audiences and to engage in academic discussions with researchers.
Excellent organization, prioritization, strategic thinking, and attention to detail.
Emotional maturity, integrity, and interpersonal skills
Flexible and adaptable to changing conditions and focus.
Technologically proficient; ability to learn and understand different systems.
Reflects the Alliance‚Äôs core values and standards:
Humanism: valuing others as human beings.
Rationality: thinking and skills to help answer ‚Äúwhat is true?‚Äù and ‚Äúwhat to do?‚Äù
Education: growth mindset; dedication to developing knowledge and skills.
Conscientiousness: diligent work ethic; professionalism; high-quality work.
Initiative: owner‚Äôs and founder‚Äôs mentality; leadership skills.
Mission Alignment: dedication to the organization‚Äôs mission and goals.

PHYSICAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL DEMANDS
Sitting: most of the time is spent sitting at a desk or work station
Occasional walking or standing
Occasional lifting and carrying up to 10 lbs
Hand and Finger Dexterity: Constant use of hands for tasks such as typing, writing or handling small objects.
Visual and auditory requirements: Good vision and hearing are often necessary for tasks such as reading documents, working on a computer, or communicating with colleagues or external parties.

The position is based in the United States.

*Any posted salary range for this position reflects our good faith estimate of what ideal candidates for this position are likely to expect. We will tailor any offer based on the selected candidate‚Äôs relevant experience, knowledge, and skills as well as any other factors that may prove relevant. Salary and benefits mentioned may be revised at the discretion of the organization.

The Alliance for Decision Education is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

Employment at Alliance for Decision Education is on an at-will basis. This means that either the employee or the organization can terminate the employment relationship at any time, with or without cause or notice.

title: Chief Information Officer
description:
About the job
Mercer Group Associates has partnered with iHire to reach top talent for their opening below. Check it out and apply today!

amden County, Georgia is accepting applications for Chief Information Officer (CIO). Camden County is in the coastal area of Georgia and is rich in history, scenic beauty, and southern hospitality. One can enjoy the tranquility of a charming community while still having access to urban amenities. Less than an hour drive to Jacksonville, Florida metropolitan amenities and attractions are abundant. A half hour drive north is Georgia‚Äôs Golden Isles, Jekyll and St. Simons Islands, which provide beach adventures and more for the whole family. The cities of Kingsland, St. Mary‚Äôs, and Woodbine are the incorporated areas of Camden County. The 2022 Census lists Camden County‚Äôs total population as 57,013. The Camden County school system offers superior education to over 9,000 students in nine elementary schools, two middle schools and one high school. The Chief Information Officer reports to the County Administrator and oversees the daily operations of the department.

The Information Technology Department consists of a total of six positions including the Chief Information Officer supporting the Camden County IT infrastructure and needs of the various county departments. The new CIO will provide Visionary Leadership having the ability to envision the future of technology and align it with the county‚Äôs strategic goals; be a Strategic Thinker capable of developing long-term IT strategies that support the overall mission and objectives of the county.; be a Collaborator who works well with other departments, fostering partnerships to ensure that technology solutions meet county-wide needs. The ideal candidate will have an understanding of local government IT operations, including legal, regulatory, and financial constraints; must have familiarity with public sector IT governance frameworks, cybersecurity standards, and compliance requirements and will have in-depth knowledge of current and emerging technologies, including cloud computing, cybersecurity, data analytics, and digital transformation. The CIO position requires strong Leadership and Team Management with a proven ability to lead and develop IT teams, manage performance, and foster a positive work environment; Project Management proficiency in managing complex IT projects, including resource allocation, timelines, and stakeholder communication and Cybersecurity expertise including identifying, managing, and mitigating cybersecurity risks to protect government data and infrastructure.

Minimum Qualifications Include

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in public or information technology, information security, business administration, business management, or related field preferred, but not required.
Five years of experience in information technology of a similar size and complexity to Camden County or any equivalent combination of education, training, and experience which provide the requisite knowledge, skill, and ability to perform the essential functions of the job.
CISSP certification and either a CGCIO or LGCIO certification.
Possession of or ability to readily obtain a valid driver‚Äôs license issued by the State of Georgia.

Compensation & Benefits

The hiring range for this position is expected to be $100,000 - $110,000, dependent upon the qualifications of the chosen candidate. The package includes comprehensive benefits including health, dental, and vision insurance. The county extends additional perks such as an employee medical clinic and an EAP program. County-paid life and disability insurance are part of the benefits, along with 457 and 401a retirement plans featuring county matching contributions. Following the first year of employment, the county will match retirement contributions up to 9%. Furthermore, a generous annual and sick leave program is offered, and relocation expenses are subject to negotiation.

How To Apply

Interested candidates must submit by email a cover letter, resume, a list of at least five job related references (name, email and phone numbers), as well as salary history no later than close of business on October 9, 2024.

Employment Type: Full Time

Years Experience: 3 - 5 years

Salary: $100,000 - $110,000 Annual

Bonus/Commission: No

title: Data Specialist
description:
About the job
Our client is seeking a highly skilled Data Integration Specialist for a 6-month project focused on migrating from an on-premises Talend environment to Azure Data Factory (ADF). The ideal candidate will have strong experience with Talend, Azure Data Factory, and Snowflake to ensure a smooth transition and integration process. The role will involve designing, implementing, and optimizing data pipelines, and working closely with the data engineering and analytics teams.
Key Responsibilities:
Migration and Integration:
Lead the migration of ETL processes and workflows from Talend to Azure Data Factory.
Design, develop, and implement data pipelines and workflows in Azure Data Factory.
Ensure seamless integration between Azure Data Factory and Snowflake.
Data Management:
Develop and maintain data pipelines to ingest, transform, and load data into Snowflake.
Optimize data flows and ensure data quality and integrity throughout the migration process.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements and ensure they are met.
Technical Expertise:
Utilize Talend for legacy data integration tasks as needed during the transition period.
Leverage Snowflake's data warehousing capabilities for optimal performance and scalability.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to data pipelines, integration, and performance.
Collaboration and Reporting:
Work closely with project managers, data engineers, and other stakeholders to ensure project milestones and deliverables are met.
Provide regular updates and status reports on the migration progress.
Document processes, configurations, and best practices for future reference.
Required Qualifications:
Proven experience with Talend, Azure Data Factory, and Snowflake.
Strong understanding of ETL processes, data integration, and data warehousing concepts.
Experience designing and implementing data pipelines and workflows.
Proficiency in SQL and data modeling.
Ability to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to data integration.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with other data integration and ETL tools.
Familiarity with cloud-based data solutions and architectures.
Knowledge of data governance and data security best practices.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
About the job
PURPOSE: 
We are looking for a Business Analyst with an inquisitive mindset and a passion for business intelligence (BI), data structures, and analytics. 

Join our Information Systems team and support efforts to acquire and ingest client data, as well as analyze and refine existing data to improve its quality, consistency, organization, and utility to deliver business insights across all departments of the firm.

As a Business Analyst, you will play a role in most business intelligence projects, keeping data quality at the center of all initiatives. By staying engaged with the strategic vision of the firm and educating yourself on our current processes, you will identify gaps in our data processes and work to close them while staying aligned with the development pipeline. You have curiosity in spades and the proactiveness to act upon that curiosity.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
This is a varied business-facing role with the following responsibilities:
Support the Information Systems Manager in gathering project requirements from a business intelligence and overall systems process perspective.
Translate complex data sets into clear, actionable insights and compelling data-driven stories that inform decision-making across the firm.
Build ETLs, dashboards, cards, and reports on the Domo and Salesforce platforms. 
Manage weekly and daily imports from our third-party partners.
Advocate for high-quality, reportable data when collaborating internally with other members of the Information Systems team and across other departments.
Participate in user research and testing to better understand the user‚Äôs data needs and behaviors.
Create documentation and presentations to communicate clear and compelling ideas to a wide range of critical stakeholders.
Identify and gather requirements, translating into best practice scalable solutions with a focus on exceptional data quality.
Participate in design critiques, both as the evaluator and presenter.


QUALIFICATIONS AND BACKGROUND:
Required:
3 to 5 years of Business Analyst experience or equivalent
Strong knowledge and hands-on experience with the data analysis software, Domo, or equivalent
Salesforce product knowledge and hands-on experience with Salesforce Sales or Service Cloud Preferred:
Domo Administrator Experience
Domo Professional OR Domo Data Specialist OR MajorDomo Certification
Salesforce Administrator Certification
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business administration, computer science, applied mathematics, or equivalent


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:
Required:
Proactive attitude to data enhancements
Designing scalable, best-practice data solutions
Excellent relationship-building and communication skills
Ability to liaise with stakeholders at all levels
Translating requirements into technical solutions
Experience in change management and governance
Training end users and key stakeholders
Technical documentation
Available and responsive to questions

Preferred:
Domo‚Äôs Consumption-based Pricing Model
Salesforce Campaigns
Salesforce Data Loader
Salesforce Shield, specifically Event Monitoring
Implementing basic Salesforce configuration changes, including (but not limited to) fields, page layouts, dynamic forms, custom metadata types, dashboards, and reports
Experience creating mockups, prototypes, and visual aids
Demonstrates continued professional development


SALARY:
$80,000 - $100,000

WHO ARE WE: 
Barasch & McGarry is proud to be the leading law firm for the 9/11 community, a law firm dedicated to helping those affected by 9/11. Although the Environmental Protection Agency assured the public that "the air is safe," those living, working, volunteering, and going to or attending school near the 9/11 exposure zone breathed toxic air containing jet fuel, glass, fibers, and construction materials, and a host of known carcinogens. Tens of thousands of people have since been diagnosed with cancers and other illnesses, and thousands have had their deaths linked to the toxins.

Barasch & McGarry has successfully represented more 9/11 victims than any other law firm in the country. Since September 11th, thousands of our clients ‚Äî first responders, workers, students, residents, and volunteers ‚Äî have received more than $3 billion in funds from the 9/11 Victim Compensation Fund. Additionally, we've helped thousands of 9/11 victims register for the free lifetime healthcare the World Trade Center Health Program provides. Barasch & McGarry is one of New York's most prominent firms concentrating on personal injury, wrongful death, medical malpractice, and firefighter rights. 

Barasch & McGarry is an equal opportunity employer, where employment is based upon personal capabilities and qualifications, in compliance with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. The Firm strictly prohibits and does not tolerate discrimination against team members, applicants, interns, or any other covered persons because of age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, including pregnancy, gender, actual or perceived gender identity or expression, transgender status, actual or perceived sexual orientation, national origin, alienage or citizenship status, marital status, familial status, caregiver status, military status, including past, current, or prospective service in the uniformed services, genetic information, victim of domestic violence status, sexual or reproductive health decision making, actual or perceived physical or mental disability or any other protected characteristic as established by law.

title: Data Strategy, Senior Consultant
description:
About the job
Job Family

Data Science Consulting

Travel Required

Up to 25%

Clearance Required

Ability to Obtain Public Trust

About Our Data And Analytics Team

Our consultants on the ESI Solutions - Data and Analytics team help clients maximize the value of their data and automate business processes. This high performing team works with clients to implement the full spectrum of data analytics and data science, from data architecture and storage to data engineering and querying, to data visualization and dashboarding, to predictive analytics, machine learning, and artificial intelligence as well as intelligent automation. Our services enable our clients to define their information strategy, enable mission critical insights and data-driven decision making, reduce cost and complexity, increase trust, and improve operational effectiveness. We focus on client services, while also supporting business development, internal firm initiatives, and ongoing professional development.

About Our Project

Guidehouse will be supporting a statewide ERP implementation, including the development of a financial data strategy that spans a state‚Äôs executive agencies. This position will concentrate on supporting key data strategy and planning workstreams for this digital modernization effort.

What You Will Do

Support the design and develop a statewide financial data strategy and corresponding implementation roadmap
Develop resources to support stakeholder engagement, including the gathering of critical current state information, elicit organizational data needs, and support ongoing socialization and awareness of the project‚Äôs progress
Participate in data discovery and assessment activities to determine current data quality, data capabilities, and implications on organizational operations and data usage
Support data profiling activities and support the review and interpretation of results
Assist in the preparation and completion of workshops with business and technical leaders to inform the financial data strategy
Conduct analysis to determine organizational and change readiness factors and efforts required to successfully implement the developed strategy
Prepare critical documentation for the data strategy, roadmap, and downstream implementation activities (e.g., requirements documentation)

What You Will Need

Requires a University Degree and minimum of Three (3) prior experience; some roles may require graduate-level education Master‚Äôs or Doctorate degree (Relevant experience may be substituted for formal education or advanced degree)
Experience of data management experience that spans across the data lifecycle and critical functions (e.g., data profiling, data governance, data modelling, data consumption product and services)
Experience with financial data and understanding of key accounting and financial functions
Ability to obtain clearance
Excellent communications and demonstrated hands on experience developing data strategies or setting up critical data initiatives (e.g., data governance program establishment)
Ability to actively contribute to data strategy development initiatives and the definition of corresponding data use cases and implementation services
Proficiency in facilitating requirements gathering (including significant business stakeholder engagement) and translation to a data strategy and technical requirements
Knowledge of data governance concepts and practices, including establishing/enforcing controls to assure appropriate data privacy, security, and standard compliance

What Would Be Nice To Have

Hands on experience implementing data strategies
Certified Data Management Professional (CDMP) or another comparable data management certification
Experience implementing or managing large enterprise applications, including enterprise resource planning (ERP) software systems
Experience with financial data modelling, data migration, and/or data architecture development
Demonstrated work experience for financial services or public sector clients
Ability to support business development including RFP/RFQ/RFI responses involving data science / analytics

The annual salary range for this position is $109,100.00-$163,700.00. Compensation decisions depend on a wide range of factors, including but not limited to skill sets, experience and training, security clearances, licensure and certifications, and other business and organizational needs.

What We Offer

Guidehouse offers a comprehensive, total rewards package that includes competitive compensation and a flexible benefits package that reflects our commitment to creating a diverse and supportive workplace.

Benefits Include

Medical, Rx, Dental & Vision Insurance
Personal and Family Sick Time & Company Paid Holidays
Position may be eligible for a discretionary variable incentive bonus
Parental Leave and Adoption Assistance
401(k) Retirement Plan
Basic Life & Supplemental Life
Health Savings Account, Dental/Vision & Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts
Short-Term & Long-Term Disability
Student Loan PayDown
Tuition Reimbursement, Personal Development & Learning Opportunities
Skills Development & Certifications
Employee Referral Program
Corporate Sponsored Events & Community Outreach
Emergency Back-Up Childcare Program
Mobility Stipend

About Guidehouse

Guidehouse is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status, religion, creed, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law, ordinance, or regulation.

title: Sr. Financial Data Analyst
description:
About the job
Title: Sr. Financial Data Analyst

Synonymous job title: Sr. Financial Analyst

Location: Virtual anywhere in the US. Strong preference for you to be located in Dallas, Texas or Scottsdale, AZ.

Overview

This position will support the Portfolio-wide Product Development (PD) leadership and all interdependent initiatives between various business groups.

Analyzes financial information to identify financial trends and recommends changes, which will improve present and future financial performance.
Assists in the preparation of regular and special budgets and related reports to interpret budget directives and to establish policies for carrying out directives.
Conducts special studies to analyze corporate objectives and prepares recommendations for changes in policy and procedures.
Counsels with executive team and managers in planning and forecasting, and provides ongoing assistance within the Finance/Accounting Team.
Ensures a smooth budgeting process by supporting the management of the various revenue producing departments in completing the appropriate operating plan and forecasts. 
Establishes and administers databases of pertinent information for use in analyzing future plans, budgets, and forecasts.
Interprets and applies corporate financial policies, and accounting theory. 
Maintains broad contact with team leaders, executives, and managers at all levels. 
Makes recommendations to management regarding costs saving or profit generating opportunities and profitability improvement strategies.
Prepares comparative analyses of operating programs by analyzing costs in relation to services performed during previous fiscal years. Submits reports with recommendations for budget revisions. 
Updates and develops the budgeting tool to be used by management and Finance. Review existing tools for improvement.

Core Functions, Skills, And Responsibilities

This position will require but also allow the Sr. Financial Data Analyst to achieve fast-paced growth in the critical, next career-level areas of:

Business partnering with Product Development, Product Management Group, and other Finance groups.
Application of business and financial acumen to support various levels of Operational and Financial decision-makers with data, analysis, metrics, process creation/improvement, and operating model alignment.
Ability to dive deep into detail while maintaining a clear vision of the end goal with acute deadline awareness.

This Role Will Require Solid Foundational Skills In

Business Partnership: Collaborate closely with various leaders within the Product development group, providing financial insights and advice to support portfolio-wide decision-making.
Data Analysis: Extract, clean, and manipulate large quantities of disparate data; Develop and maintain data models and data documentation that support Product Development initiatives. Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and security across all Product Development Finance tools.
Scenario Modeling & Analysis: Heavy data analysis and dynamic scenario modeling with emphasis on researching and validating the modeling inputs and assumptions and ensuring their alignment with operational models and strategic goals. Full P&L business case development and presentation to senior leadership.
Business Acumen: Strong understanding of the supply chain industry, SaaS, and cloud architecture.
Process: Operational & Financial process understanding/mapping, efficiency improvements, and recommendations for adapting to changing functional and business requirements so that data output is streamlined and represents a true reflection of current performance.
Communication & Coordination: Skillful & timely communication and coordination with various levels of finance and operations.
Problem-solving: Ability to work under uncertainty, stringent deadlines, and limited supervision.
Responsibility & Ownership: Strong sense of ownership & responsibility, desire to improve and expand knowledge and to enjoy the learning journey.

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business
Minimum three (3) years of related experience supporting both financial and operational decision-makers. SaaS experience is a plus.
Excel Master Proficiency required.
Minimum 1 year experience in Power Query, Power Pivot, and/or Power BI.
Familiar with FinOps, DevOps, and/or Agile management.
Familiar with cloud providers such as Azure/AWS/GCP.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail, with high standards of accuracy.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to work in a diverse and multicultural environment.

The salary range for this position is: USD $91,111.54 - $114,888.45

The salary range information provided, reflects the anticipated base salary range for this position based on current national data. Minimums and maximums may vary based on location. Individual salary will be commensurate with skills, experience, certifications or licenses and other relevant factors. In addition, this role will be eligible to participate in either the annual performance bonus or commission program, determined by the nature of the position.

Our Values
