title: Creative / Content Strategist
description:
About the job
About Manor House Films

At Manor House Films, our mission is to craft compelling stories that ignite conversation and inspire change. We are dedicated to developing films with purpose‚Äîchallenging perspectives, fostering critical thinking, and shining a light on the world‚Äôs most pressing issues. Through the power of cinema, we aim to engage, educate, and empower audiences to see the world in new ways and take action for a better future.

Position Overview

We are looking for a dynamic, creative individual to join our team as a Content Strategist. This role is ideal for someone who excels at combining creativity with data-driven insights to develop compelling marketing strategies.

Key Responsibilities

Experience working with film studios and entertainment clients..
Familiarity with the latest trends in digital marketing and social media.
Knowledge of data analytics and its application in creative strategy.

title: VP, Engineering, Data & AI
description:
About the job
Job Description

Position: VP Technology, Data & AI

Location: New York, NY

Department: Technology

About The Role

Dow Jones is seeking an experienced VP of Technology, Data and AI with proven skills as a technical leader and architect to build, mentor, and guide our team of data, ML, and AI engineers. You will be responsible for shaping and executing our data and AI strategy, ensuring the development and implementation of new and innovative solutions that drive our business forward.

As a key member of the engineering leadership team, you will lead the strategic direction and implementation of cutting-edge data management, analytics, and AI solutions. You will be involved in every aspect of the product development process, from brainstorming and ideation to production launch and on-going development of our data products. You will play a pivotal role in shaping our data-driven decision-making processes and advancing our capabilities in AI and ML.

If you are a strategic thinker, innovative problem solver, and a leader passionate about leveraging data to drive business success, we invite you to apply for this challenging and rewarding role.

Responsibilities

Build, lead, and inspire a high-performing team of data engineers, data scientists, ML engineers, and AI specialists.
Foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning.
Oversee the design and implementation of scalable and robust data architectures aligned to deliver business outcomes and objectives.
Ensure effective data governance, quality, and security standards are maintained. 
Drive the development and deployment of ML models, AI algorithms, and other advanced analytics solutions.
Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in AI and data science. 
Evaluate and select technologies and tools for data processing, storage, ML, and AI development. 
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product, program, and business units, to understand data and AI requirements that meet business needs.
Ensure projects are delivered on time, within budget, and meet quality standards. 
Provide direction for prioritization and resource allocation.
Build and model a culture of excellence, inclusivity, and innovation.

Qualifications

Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
Proven experience in a leadership roles overseeing data engineering, machine learning, and AI initiatives.
Experience with enterprise financial data and research products.
Experience collaboratively transforming data and analytics to deliver business insights. 
Experience building products that serve millions of users daily.
Strong business acumen with the ability to align data and AI strategies with organizational goals. 
Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
Demonstrated success in building and leading high-performing teams.
Experience working in media is a plus.

Reasonable accommodation: Dow Jones, Making Careers Newsworthy - We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.EEO/AA/M/F/Disabled/Vets. Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application, due to a disability, email us at talentresourceteam@dowjones.com. Please put "Reasonable Accommodation" in the subject line and provide a brief description of the type of assistance you need. This inbox will not be monitored for application status updates.

Business Area: Dow Jones - Technology

Job Category: Software Product Engineering

Union Status

Non-Union role

Pay Range: $345000 - $410000

We recognize that attracting the best talent is key to our strategy and success as a company.As a result, we aim for flexibility in structuring competitive compensation offers to ensure we are able to attract the best candidates.The quoted salary range represents our good faith estimate as to what our ideal candidates are likely to expect, and we tailor our offers within the range based on the selected candidate's experience, industry knowledge, location, technical and communication skills, and other factors that may prove relevant during the interview process.

Pay-for-performance is a key element in our strategy to attract, engage, and motivate talented people to do their best work. Similarly to salary, for bonus eligible roles, targets are set based on a variety of factors including competitive market practice.

For benefits eligible roles, in addition to cash compensation, the company provides a comprehensive and highly competitive benefits package, with a variety of physical health, retirement and savings, caregiving, emotional wellbeing, transportation, and other benefits, including "elective" benefits employees may select to best fit the needs and personal situations of our diverse workforce..

Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world‚Äôs top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barron‚Äôs, MarketWatch and Financial News.

This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day.

If you are a current employee at Dow Jones, do not apply here. Please go to the Career section on your Workday homepage and view "Find Jobs - Dow Jones." Thank you.

title: Sr. Data Scientist
description:
About the job
NinjaHoldings was founded in 2017 by a team seeking to revolutionize the way everyday Americans interact with financial services. Through our CreditNinja and NinjaCard brands, we empower people overlooked by traditional financial institutions to take control of their finances via a full suite of digital banking and lending products, providing incentives and rewards along the way as we guide them on a path to financial improvement. Through our EDGE brand, we help companies better understand their customers by offering a package of bespoke underwriting, fraud detection, and analytics services. With offices in Chicago, Miami, and around the world through the power of remote work, we are a lean and innovative team always seeking like-minded talent to join us in our fight to disrupt consumer finance.

Key Responsibilities:
Build predictive models to optimize lending decisions by using advanced statistical modeling and simulation techniques
Use advanced data analytics to understand consumer risk behavior trends, their impact on the portfolio, and resulting business opportunities
Support the implementation of models by working closely with the software engineering team and performing post release checks and analysis
Assist with development of technical tools and platforms to standardize and streamline model development and monitoring processes
Establish key performance metrics and develop automated reporting dashboards using SQL and Python
Design A/B testing for models and underwriting strategies, evaluate impact, and provide recommendations
Work with cross-functional teams to explore new ways of finding insights from data and provide recommendations
Communicate concise and actionable business strategies to senior management

Requirements:
Bachelor's degree required
2+ years of experience with data analytics and statistical modeling
Experience with relational databases and SQL
Programming experience with Python
Strong quantitative and problem-solving skills with key attention to detail
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment

Additional Pluses, but Not Requirements:
Advanced degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., math, statistics, analytics, quantitative finance, engineering, or other quantitative fields)
Experience working with specialty finance or FinTech
Marketing analytical experience

Benefits:
Competitive salary and benefits package
Flexible, remote work
Fun, fast-paced work environment
Dynamic start-up culture
Ability to make an immediate impact in a growth stage company
Convenient downtown Chicago office located in the heart of the city
Equal opportunity employer

title: Solutions Architect, Data/AI
description:
About the job
This is a permanent, full-time role working directly for Insight Global within our Professional Services Division, Evergreen! This is primarily an on-site position in Atlanta (Tues-Thurs) and will also require some customer travel.

This is a client-facing, technical pre-sales role that requires deep technical expertise in Data Engineering, AI, and ML. 

About This Role:
Are you passionate about creating innovative and effective data solutions for diverse and complex business problems? Do you enjoy collaborating with clients, industry experts and IT professionals leveraging your deep domain experience in one or more domains as we create and refine best-of-breed data and AI/ML solutions enabling delivery of advanced analytics and AI/ML capabilities? If so, you might be the perfect fit for our Solution Architect role. 

As a Solution Architect in our Data and AI Practice, you will provide essential leadership within one or more industry COE verticals as you guide the development and packaging of best-of-breed data and AI/ML solutions to accelerate client proposals, pricing, and delivery. You will leverage your unique insights and expertise with Data and AI/ML implementations, collaborating with our technical architects to evaluate technology challenges and meet client goals. Employing our team dynamics and governance while leveraging our solutions, you will actively propose our solutions through compelling presentations. You will be a thought leader and mentor for your colleagues. Your expertise with technologies such as Databricks and Snowflake in a multi-cloud context effectively enables solution architecture. Join us in creating a dynamic, equitable, and innovative workspace that influences our growing practice and shapes the future of data and AI solutions.

What You'll Do:
‚Ä¢Lead technology assessments, architectural designs and solution asset development with thought leadership and industry expertise. 
‚Ä¢Provide client advisory services to understand client business goals, technology objectives and challenges.
‚Ä¢Provide technical advisory services to leverage, design and adapt Evergreen assets to define custom solutions, team structures, implementation roadmaps, and required technologies in collaboration with technical architects. 
‚Ä¢Construct comprehensive client proposals and convey our capabilities.
‚Ä¢Foster growth by educating sales teams and mentoring junior practice members.
‚Ä¢Excel in verbal communication and problem-solving, guiding collaborative environments.
‚Ä¢Advise practice leadership on technology trends and highlight opportunities for growth and evolution in our core solution offers. 
‚Ä¢All other job duties as assigned.

What You'll Need to Succeed:
‚Ä¢Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience. 
‚Ä¢Proven leadership qualities, with passion for rapid learning and forming expert opinions.
‚Ä¢Advanced understanding of technologies such as Databricks, Snowflake, SQL Server, etc. in one or more industry verticals.
‚Ä¢Track record of successful client advisory services and managing complex data projects in one or more industry verticals.
‚Ä¢Strong SQL skills, data governance, and metadata management expertise.
‚Ä¢Customer first mind-set, and a passion for successful solution creation, packaging and delivery.
‚Ä¢Deep experience working with leading Cloud Platforms such as Azure, AWS and Google Cloud. 
‚Ä¢In-depth knowledge of data integration, big data tools, and stream-processing systems.
‚Ä¢A track record of working with and producing value from large datasets.
‚Ä¢Project management acumen and collaborative prowess.
‚Ä¢Live our values of ‚ÄúEveryone Matters‚Äù, ‚ÄúWe Take Care of Each Other‚Äù, ‚ÄúLeadership Is Here To Serve‚Äù, ‚ÄúHigh Character And Hard Work Above All Else‚Äù, and ‚ÄúAlways Know Where You Stand‚Äù

description:

title: Intern-Data Science
description:
About the job
Why should you join our team?

American AgCredit offers a unique opportunity to be a part of a national financial system supporting those who feed, clothe and fuel the world. We are a growing organization embracing collaboration and innovation while delivering transformative solutions. American AgCredit provides a cultivating environment where you truly make a difference for our customers and teams.

Position will be posted until filled.

BASIC FUNCTION:

The Data Management team is seeking an intern that is currently pursuing a Masters or PhD in Data Science and/or Advanced Analytics. The Data Science intern may assist in the development of a predictive model(s) and/or surface descriptive / diagnostic analytics aimed at solving a business problem for American Ag Credit.

The Data Science intern is responsible for completing a project for a specific business unit or team. Projects will vary based on business need, and project plans can evolve through the selection process. Interns will spend the majority of their time on an individual project assignment. The summer intern is also responsible for developing skills relevant to their performance and professional development.

The summer internship program is 10 weeks beginning in late May and ending in early August. The internship program begins with a mandatory Orientation and ends with mandatory project presentations. Start dates may be flexible depending on individual circumstances, pending ability to attend Orientation.

TYPICAL EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

Pursuing a four-year degree or enrolled in a graduate program. Major emphasis in computer science, data analytics, mathematics, physics, computational, economics or related field.
Strong verbal, written, analytical, and interpersonal skills.
Proficient in Microsoft Office tools, including Word, Excel, and Outlook. Must be comfortable adapting quickly to new technology and software.
Proficient in R and or Python, and SQL Programming Languages.
Must have the ability to travel. 

ESSENTIAL REQUIREMENTS: 

Must have the ability to perform basic office tasks, work in an office or outdoor setting and be able to sit at a desk and work at a computer for an extended period of time. This job regularly requires the employee to visit job sites and must be able walk, sit, crouch, kneel, crawl, reach, and be able to lift up to 40 pounds. Ability to navigate around construction equipment and business materials is required. Must have the ability to walk for some distance, more than a mile, during or getting to an inspection. Must have strong written and verbal communication skills to adequately convey ideas and work well with a team. Ability to talk and hear, sit and use their hands and fingers, and reach in all directions is essential in performance of the job. Some travel required and projects requiring driving to local destinations require a clear driver history check. Work during established business hours and may require occasional weekend and/or evening work.

BENEFITS:

Practical experience with a major player in the Agriculture Finance space
Shadowing, mentoring, and training opportunities with successful banking professionals
Opportunity to participate in networking events and company-wide meetings
Flexible schedule for students
Competitive Intern Compensation

FULL-TIME REMOTE: These roles and job functions can be done remotely, while maintaining our strong commitment to customer service and our business goals. Employees are welcome to come to an office to work if needed, and some travel for team meetings will be required.

COMPENSATION:

$20 per Hour

All hiring is contingent on eligibility to work in the United States. We are unable to sponsor or transfer visas for applicants.

American AgCredit provides equal opportunity in employment to all employees and applicants. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, alienage or citizenship status, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, genetic information, medical condition, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical condition, military service or veteran status, victims of domestic violence, or any other characteristics protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. American AgCredit prohibits harassment of any individuals on any of the bases listed above.

If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at jobs@agloan.com.

title: Arity - Data Science Intern - Arity
description:
About the job
At Allstate, great things happen when our people work together to protect families and their belongings from life‚Äôs uncertainties. And for more than 90 years our innovative drive has kept us a step ahead of our customers‚Äô evolving needs. From advocating for seat belts, air bags and graduated driving laws, to being an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, and, more recently, device and identity protection.

Job Description

Founded by The Allstate Corporation in 2016, Arity is a data and analytics company focused on improving transportation. We collect and analyze enormous amounts of data, using predictive analytics to build solutions with a single goal in mind: to make transportation smarter, safer and more useful for everyone. At the heart of that mission are the people that work here‚Äîthe dreamers, doers and difference-makers that call this place home. As part of that team, your work will showcase both your intelligence and your creativity as you tackle real problems and put your talents towards transforming transportation. That‚Äôs because at Arity, we believe work and life shouldn‚Äôt be at odds with one another. After all, we know that your unique qualities give you a unique perspective. We don‚Äôt just want you to see yourself here. We want you to be yourself here.

 

The Analytics Team

At Arity, our Data Science team is at the core of helping us transform mobility. We not only know how to analyze and find meaning within billions of miles of driving data collected from smartphones, onboard devices and third parties; we are passionate about how it affects the end-users of our products. On our team people get the opportunity to build scalable distributed data pipelines, develop and deploy an array of machine learning algorithms, and create eye-opening data visualizations. We find top talent from various quantitative disciplines to collaborate with product owners, software engineers, and experience designers in development teams to create innovative products to make transportation smarter, safer, and more useful for everyone.

Where good people build rewarding careers.

This Summer 2025 internship is for students currently enrolled in a graduate degree program. This‚ÄØrole is responsible‚ÄØfor the use and development of data science/geospatial projects and proof of concept business solutions for users in Analytics and Data Science. This person partners with Data Scientists and Data‚ÄØEngineers to provide tactical‚ÄØsolutions in one of the several product segments including insurance, geospatial enrichment, core telematics, and advertising. This is a highly dynamic position that requires a great degree of flexibility, analytic‚ÄØagility and the ability to rapidly adapt to changing business requirements/needs, new technologies and data sources. This role requires close integration and partnership with the business and Data Science team and requires business acumen in order to output the best technical solutions. 

Job Description

Uses best practices, with limited coaching, to develop‚ÄØmachine learning and geospatial techniques to build models that address business needs 
Utilizes effective project planning techniques to break down basic and occasionally moderately complex projects into tasks and ensure deadlines are kept 
Uses and learns a wide variety of tools and languages to achieve results (e.g., Python, Spark, SQL) 
Collaborates with the team in order to improve the effectiveness of business decisions through the use of data and machine learning/predictive modeling 
Innovates on projects by using predictive modeling techniques, deep learning techniques or tools 
Executes on modeling/machine learning projects effectively 
Reviews and evaluates on appropriateness of techniques, given current modeling practices, to senior leadership 

Job Qualifications

Target Start date: May/June 2025 
Currently pursuing a master or PhD degree (strongly preferred) in a quantitative field (e.g. mathematics, statistics, computer or physical science) 
Ability to solve problems, think critically, and communicate clearly 
Knowledge of statistical modeling, machine learning, mathematical optimization, and/or data mining from graduate level course work 
Proven capability of executing end-to-end analytics projects from capstone projects, research projects, or past intern experience 
Demonstrated fluency with Python or R programming 
Experience with Spark or AWS computing services such as EMR, Glue, Sagemaker or data warehouse service like BigQuery is a plus 
Understanding of algorithmic scaling and complexity is a plus 
Compensation offered for this role is between $20 and $42 an hour and is based on experience and qualifications.

Skills

Customer Centricity, Digital Literacy, Inclusive Leadership, Learning Agility, Results-Oriented

Compensation

The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation.

Joining our team isn‚Äôt just a job ‚Äî it‚Äôs an opportunity. One that takes your skills and pushes them to the next level. One that encourages you to challenge the status quo. And one where you can impact the future for the greater good.

You‚Äôll do all this in a flexible environment that embraces connection and belonging. And with the recognition of several inclusivity and diversity awards, we‚Äôve proven that Allstate empowers everyone to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live.

Good Hands. Greater Together.

Allstate generally does not sponsor individuals for employment-based visas for this position.

title: Product Manager
description:
About the job
Role Overview:
Dune Security is seeking a passionate and driven Product Manager to join our dynamic and growing team. In this role, you will be responsible for leading the development and enhancement of key features and capabilities within our AI-powered cybersecurity solutions. You will work closely with our R&D, engineering, and customer success teams to deliver innovative products that meet the evolving needs of our customers and help secure the digital future. 

What You‚Äôll Do:

1. Product Ownership
Backlog Management: Own and maintain the product backlog, prioritizing features and enhancements based on strategic goals, user feedback, and business impact. Ensure clarity and alignment with the development team to drive seamless execution.

Feature Delivery: Oversee the end-to-end process of feature development, from ideation and scoping to release. Define clear user stories, acceptance criteria, and scope, ensuring that product features meet quality standards and are delivered on time.

Product Lifecycle Management: Manage the entire product lifecycle, including planning, design, development, testing, launch, and post-launch evaluation. Drive continuous improvement based on data, user feedback, and market trends.

2. Product Operations
User Research: Conduct comprehensive user research through surveys, interviews, and usability testing to identify user needs, pain points, and preferences. Develop user personas and map user journeys to guide feature development and product improvements.

Data Analysis & Performance Metrics: Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) such as user engagement, retention, feature usage, and conversion rates. Leverage data insights to make informed, evidence-based product decisions.

A/B Testing: Design and implement A/B tests to optimize feature performance and validate hypotheses. Use test results to guide product enhancements and drive data-driven decision-making.

Reporting: Prepare detailed reports and dashboards that provide insights into product usage, performance trends, and areas for improvement. Communicate findings to internal stakeholders to support strategic decision-making.

3. Cross-Functional Collaboration
Engineering & R&D Collaboration: Work closely with engineering and R&D teams to translate product vision into technical requirements, ensuring accurate and timely implementation.

Marketing & Sales Alignment: Collaborate with marketing and sales teams to align product features with market needs, develop compelling product narratives, and devise effective go-to-market strategies.

Customer Success & Support: Partner with customer success and support teams to gather insights into customer feedback, pain points, and feature requests, incorporating this feedback into the product roadmap.

What You‚Äôll Bring:
Experience: 2-4 years of experience as a Product Manager in a SaaS or technology-driven environment.

Technical Background: Prior experience in roles such as Backend Developer or DevOps engineer, with a solid understanding of cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP) and/or Kubernetes.

Customer-Centric Mindset: Proven ability to engage with customers, understand their needs, and translate feedback into actionable product improvements.

Analytical Skills: Strong data analysis and reporting capabilities, with experience in defining KPIs, conducting A/B testing, and making data-driven decisions.

Communication & Collaboration: Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and present complex ideas to diverse stakeholders.

Passion for Innovation: A proactive and creative mindset, with a passion for building impactful products that address real-world challenges.

Cybersecurity Knowledge: Experience or interest in cybersecurity is a plus, though not mandatory.

About Dune Security:
Dune Security is a pioneering cybersecurity SaaS company reducing the attack surface for enterprises by introducing the world‚Äôs first User Adaptive Risk Management solution for enterprises. By leveraging AI, we quantify individual risk through analyzing user behavior, context, learning patterns, and third-party data. This allows us to tailor cybersecurity measures to each individual, transforming vulnerabilities into strengths. Dune Security is poised to reshape cybersecurity, enabling organizations to proactively manage risks and empowering CISOs to safeguard their companies.

At Dune Security, you‚Äôll have the freedom to think creatively, dream big, and use your full range of skills to contribute to our rapid growth. We‚Äôre still in an exciting early stage where your work can have a significant impact on the company‚Äôs direction and success. We value world-class talent and foster a culture of innovation, inclusion, and growth.

Dune Security is proudly backed by world-class venture capital firms, including SignalFire, Craft Ventures, Ensemble VC, Firestreak, and Alumni Ventures.

Additional Details:
Location: NYC. Candidates must reside within a commutable distance of our Soho, Manhattan office.
Hours: Full time.

Apply Today:
Joining Dune Security means embracing a unique opportunity to shape the future of cybersecurity. If you're passionate about innovation and ready to take on significant responsibility, we encourage you to apply.

If your experience is close to what we‚Äôre looking for but doesn‚Äôt fulfill all the requirements, we encourage you to apply. We are on a mission to build a special company, and to achieve our goal, we are focused on hiring individuals with diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences.

Note: Dune Security is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

title: Data Scientist
description:
About the job
Data Scientist at TRKKN

As a catalyst for innovative digital marketing ideas, what excites us at TRKKN is using a data-driven approach to take our clients‚Äô business to the next level.

Working for TRKKN means that you'll be part of an inspiring, energetic, and international team in a fast-growing tech environment. We offer the ideal workplace for anyone who wants to grow, learn, and has a strong desire for solving complex business challenges.

Being on the bleeding edge of marketing technology and innovation means you will have an unparalleled opportunity for learning, along with personal and professional growth: there's never a dull moment here.

Responsibilities
As a Data Scientist, reporting into the Head of Data & Strategy at TRKKN North America (NA), you‚Äôll focus on building scalable machine learning and AI products to help evaluate and optimize the business impact of our clients‚Äô marketing investment.
Whether working with our existing repository of products or building TRKKN‚Äôs next-gen capabilities, you‚Äôll leverage your expertise in statistics and programming to develop and deploy scalable solutions within the cloud.
Working as a leader within TRKKN globally, you will contribute directly to company growth goals by faithfully managing and executing robust and complex data science and engineering projects. As company headcount grows, you‚Äôll be expected to foster the development of junior employees, creating a roadmap for professional growth for a data science career at TRKKN NA. To be successful in this role, you‚Äôll:
Act as Data Science Subject Matter Expert (SME) in the delivery and development of machine learning and AI products
Deploy data products from our existing proprietary codebase and translate outcomes/findings in a digestible format for clients and internal stakeholders
Design tech infrastructure and data pipelines (ETL, data automation, data querying, etc.) when necessary
Aid agency leadership New Business efforts by executing ad hoc and custom analyses when necessary

Requirements:
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field (advanced degree is preferred)
3+ years of experience, preferably in Data Science
Expertise with Google Cloud Platform‚Äôs distributed Machine Learning, Data Science and Data Engineering tools (e.g. BigQuery ML, VertexAI, AutoML, Docker, Kubernetes, Kubeflow, Dataproc)
Experience with Git, GitLab, CI/CD pipelines on Gitlab, and Terraform
Experience with Big Data frameworks (e.g. Hadoop MapReduce, Spark, Hive, Kafka)
Strong analytical mindset with expert knowledge of SQL and BigQuery, as well as BI tools such DataStudio and Looker (LookML) to implement business reports and BI solutions.
Deep understanding and experience with advanced analytics, Machine Learning (ML), Deep Learning (DL), Natural Language Processing (NLP) or Computer Vision (at least 3 of these areas)
Proficiency in Python and specialized ML libraries (e.g. TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, scikit-learn, SciPy, Pandas, NumPy)
Experience working on a data science team, participating in scrums, sprints, and retrospectives
Ability to clearly explain complex ideas to non-expert audiences
Familiarity with media, media measurement, predictive modeling, and segmentation a plus

TRKKN is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age, or any other federally protected class. For this role, Benefits include: health insurance, vision insurance, dental insurance, 401(k), Healthcare Flexible Spending Account, Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account, vacation days, sick days, personal days, paid parental leave, paid medical leave, and STD/LTD insurance benefits.

title: Director of Business Intelligence

title: Data Engineer- CosmosDB
description:
About the job
No C2C Allowed.

In this role on the Cloud Data Engineering team, you will be a part of a team responsible for migrating existing data platform solutions to the cloud. You will also collaborate with others to develop new data pipelines. As a data engineer in the Cloud Data Engineering team, you must work in a data first mindset. You will use Microsoft Azure Cloud PaaS technologies to engineer our data solutions in a way that allows for us to optimize our information, make better decisions, and meet our customer's needs. If you have a passion for engineering, working with massive amounts of data and empowering smart business decisions, this is the role for you.

Required:
‚Ä¢ Must be committed to incorporating security into all decisions and daily job responsibilities
‚Ä¢ 3+ of related experience in Cosmos DB
‚Ä¢ Experience with configuration management and building automation capabilities such as Git/Jenkins/Bitbucket
‚Ä¢ Experience with Microsoft Azure Cloud workflows
‚Ä¢ Experience in T-SQL and scripting skills.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge on Microsoft cloud managed DBs/Systems, e.g. Managed SQL Instance, Cosmos DB, Databricks Delta Lake
‚Ä¢ Experience with Big Data solutions such as Delta Lake by Databricks and SQL DBMSs
‚Ä¢ Independently analyze, solve, and correct issues in real time, providing problem resolution end-to-end
‚Ä¢ Identify new opportunities and help refine automation of regular processes, track issues, and document changes

‚Ä¢ Expert in troubleshooting performance issues
‚Ä¢ Experience rightsizing Database object workflow for cost management
‚Ä¢ Ability to multi-task and context-switch effectively between different activities and teams
‚Ä¢ Join the on-call rotation with other Engineers
‚Ä¢ Must be able to both collaborate in a team-oriented environment and work independently with direction

Preferred:
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree in computer science, Computer Information Systems, Management Information Systems, or related field preferred
‚Ä¢ Azure SQL DB etc. will be a big plus
‚Ä¢ Experience with Microsoft Azure platform technologies like Databricks applications, Event Hub, Data Factory, Azure SQL, Synapse Analytics, Delta
Lake, Cosmos DB, or DevOps
‚Ä¢ Prior experience with large-scale projects
‚Ä¢ Experience with API development
‚Ä¢ Knowledge and working experience with Agile methodologies
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with JDBC connections to data sources

Pay Range: $60-80/ HR W2

The specific compensation for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role as well as the cost of labor in the market; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. Our full-time consultants have access to benefits including medical, dental, vision and 401K contributions as well as any other PTO, sick leave, and other benefits mandated by appliable state or localities where you reside or work.

title: Data Engineer
description:
About the job
For more Job Opportunities follow FINTRUST CONNECT here: FinTrust Connect: Jobs | LinkedIn

**This job cannot sponsor H1B visas**

Fraud Intelligence Data Engineer - St. Petersburg, FL
FinTrust Connect is excited to announce that we have partnered with a prominent Broker Dealer firm in search of a Fraud Intelligence Data Engineer. This role is responsible for designing and implementing fraud detection solutions, performing complex data analysis, and collaborating with stakeholders to mitigate fraud risks effectively.

Why this Opportunity?
Culture: This firm values a strong team-oriented culture that prioritizes inclusivity and professional development. They believe in creating a supportive and collaborative work environment where all employees feel valued and empowered to reach their full potential.

Workplace (On-site, Hybrid, Remote): Hybrid in St. Petersburg, FL

Requirements:
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in statistics, mathematics, physics, economics, or other analytical or quantitative disciplines. Master‚Äôs Degree or PhD preferred.
5-8 years of experience in data analytics, modeling, and analytical project implementation.
Experience working with Big Data environments with hands-on coding experience in tools such as SAS, SQL, Python, Impala, Hive.
Proficiency with data visualization tools, such as Tableau, PowerBI, or Qlik.
Strong quantitative and analytic skills; ability to derive patterns, trends, and insights, and perform risk/reward tradeoff analysis.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to connect analytics to business impacts and present to peers and management.
Creative problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Description:

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
About the job
Senior Data Engineer | Data Science | Atlanta GA, US

Travelport is a place of opportunity. It‚Äôs our incredible team that makes our company great ‚Äì our people drive our winning culture.

What‚Äôs Travelport?
Travelport is a worldwide travel retail platform that provides easy ways for businesses like airlines, hotels, and car rental companies to connect through personalized content to agencies and travelers. The world is changing, and our industry must change with it. We‚Äôre leading the change; we are the change.
We are on a mission to power the future of travel.
Come and be part of an organization that is committed to building a culture of inclusivity built upon a diverse workforce that is reflective of the communities in which we operate.

What does a great Senior Big Data Engineer I do?
Travelport‚Äôs Data Engineers are tasked with developing infrastructure and systems that realize the business value of the Data Science AI/ML models. Travelport has sophisticated Data Platforms in the cloud and on premise. We have Big Data, processing Terabytes of data, processing billions of transactions per day, and applications which process 100k+ transactions per second on average. As a Senior Data Engineer, you will create and lead the creation of frameworks and architectures for system integration, data pipelines, model generation pipelines, and more. You will also develop streaming and batch data products. Travelport employees enjoy a collaborative environment and have many opportunities to learn from and share knowledge with other Travelport developers, architects, and business leaders.

Responsibilities include:
4+ years of software development experience with a successful record of developing and deploying quality software products.
2+ years of Scala or Java development.
Experience working with one or more AWS cloud services (EKS, EC2, RDS, Lambda, Elastic Beanstalk, QuickSight).
Experience working with Kubernetes-based deploys.
Experience developing applications, web applications, and web services.
Experience designing modern, responsive web-based user interfaces.
Knowledge of web services (Examples: Microservices, RESTful web services, XML, JSON).
Knowledge of SQL and relational databases (Examples: Oracle, MySQL, Amazon Aurora) and/or data warehouses (Examples: Redshift, Athena, Snowflake).
Practiced DevOps implementation (CI/CD, Azure DevOps, Automation, Telemetry).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Good communication and interpersonal skills with emphasis on the ability to collaborate while working remotely.

It would be advantageous if you have some experience with:
Apache Spark for large-scale data processing.
Terraform for creating infrastructure.
Understand Git (e.g. Github, Bitbucket, Azure DevOps), managing branches, pull request, and common workflows.
Familiarity with CI/CD strategies & technologies (e.g. Jenkins, GitHub Actions).
Experience with container and container management (e.g. Dockers, Kubernetes).
Good knowledge of Cloud Platforms.
Knowledge of Web Security.
JSON/REST Services.
Application containerization and container management.
CI/CD concepts and processes.
Linux Environments.

Who we are looking for in this role:
Design, develop, develop for reusability, and test Big Data solutions.
Aid in providing strategic direction for development practices and the team‚Äôs technologies.
Implement frameworks, problem solving, perform troubleshooting and provide guidance to accelerate that team and educate more junior developers.
Install, integrate, and configure Big Data technologies.
Collaborate with business and technical teams to deliver solutions.
Continuous learning, leverage training resources, self-learning, and knowledge sharing.
Passionate about technology.

Our ambition is to hire for potential not just experience, and you‚Äôre likely to succeed if you:
Have a desire to learn and master new subject areas (Cloud, High Performance Computing, Big Data Eco Systems Tools, Model Implementation).
Are excited to use your creativity and innovative to solve unique problems.
Take responsibility and own your work.
Are courageous and ambitious to challenge what‚Äôs been done before.

These are just a few of our employee‚Äôs favorite benefits/perks‚Ä¶
We believe all employees contribute to the success of the company and should be able to share in that success, which is why all jobs are eligible to participate in our bonus program with any payouts being subject to individual and company performance. We offer a comprehensive benefit program that includes medical, dental, vision, employer paid Disability and Basic Life Insurance, Voluntary life options, a competitive 401(k) match, as well as many other voluntary benefits to fit your specific needs. We make health and wellness a priority and offer a generous paid time off policy as well as contributing to our communities with an annual volunteer day off. We also offer a New Child leave policy, where the birthing parent receives 16 weeks of paid time off, and the non-birthing parent receives 8.

title: 2025 Digital Data & AI Summer Internship
description:
About the job
Job Description

2024 Data Analytics Summer Internship:

What will your next career challenge offer?‚ÄØ At CohnReznick, our people are talented, intellectually curious, and driven to make a difference for our clients, community, and our firm.‚ÄØ We are an organization bound together by a passion for excellence, respect for others, flexibility, integrity, and a strong desire to develop ourselves and others. We approach our engagements by combining technical resources with an entrepreneurial spirit that allows us to solve for client needs in today‚Äôs dynamic business environment. 

As one of the top professional services firms in the country, we understand our people are our most valuable assets. Clients turn to CohnReznick because of the people we hire, and as a CohnReznick employee, you will be equipped with top training and development opportunities and presented with new challenges to help you stretch and grow as a professional. Through formalized learning and on-the-job coaching and mentorship, CohnReznick is committed to your development. Let‚Äôs build something great together.

CohnReznick‚Äôs Digital Advisory Group works across all CohnReznick Advisory industries and service lines to empower our clients with forward-looking solutions that are resilient to change‚ÄØby leveraging innovative thinking to address their business questions and challenges. The Digital Team delivers value by assessing our client‚Äôs current positions, advising our clients on a path toward a mutually defined future state, and supporting our clients in adopting and implementing our recommendations. As part of this team, you will be exposed to various industry leaders and have the opportunity to deliver on a variety of Advisory services.

 Data Analytics Intern ‚Äì Data & Analytics Tech+ Team 

The work of our Data Analytics interns includes qualitative and quantitative approaches in pursuit of insightful, evidence based insights and models. Projects range from industry and subject matter research to data collection to the preparation of statistical, financial, and other forms of analysis. Our interns can progress rapidly as they assemble the requisite experience and demonstrate exceptional skill and judgment.

Responsibilities

New Data Analytics Interns should be able to assemble compelling evidence from data and research that supports client deliverables and outcomes tracking outcomes to refine evidence-based models and insights over time. Key skills include:

 Understand, capture in writing, and apply in planning with delivery teams key client needs and project or solution requirements. Develop an understanding of key client personas, or roles, and their use stories (needs, requirements, and context) to compile highly relevant business and technical requirements documents and assemble them into test & acceptance plans. 
 Research. Accumulate, and Synthesize qualitative and quantitative data from public, client, and firm resources related to client project needs and requirements. 
 Contribute to the development of robust data analytics models and their application in leading technologies such as Microsoft Fabric/Synapse, Snowflake, AWS & Google Big Query. 
 Support the development of data integration plans, blueprints, and engineering using data pipelines and Extract-Load-Transform (ELT) methods of data ingestion and integration services as part of broader data solutions. Ensure the design and development process includes efficient data integrity and quality controls to accurately reflect the source systems in the target models. 
 Understand and contribute to the disciplined, efficient application of our reference data architecture and standards in the design and development of data services and solutions. 
 Support the development of dashboards, analytic models, reports and other client data visualization models growing your skills with experience and training-based learning. 
 Introductory experience with MS SQL, MS Azure Cloud, MS Azure DataBricks, PowerBI, and other analytics development toolsets is important and a plus with a previous internship experience with any of these toolsets. 
 Interact with senior staff, leadership, and clients to communicate economic concepts in an understandable manner. 
 Demonstrate creativity and efficient use of relevant software tools, analytical methods, and computer models to develop solutions. 
 Apply critical thinking skills in quantitative and qualitative analysis. 
 Participate in a team environment and work hard to meet client deadlines and quality expectations. 

Requirements

 Introductory experience with MS SQL, MS Azure Cloud, MS Azure DataBricks, PowerBI, or other Analytics development toolsets is important and a plus with a previous internship experience with any of these toolsets. 
 Possesses an academic understanding of basic business processes and organization. 
 Possesses knowledge of cloud-based data warehousing solutions with leading technologies such as AWS or Azure 
 Progression towards a master‚Äôs or bachelor‚Äôs degree in data analytics, math or statistics or a minor in a related field. 
 3.5 GPA or higher 
 Exceptional verbal and written communication skills. 
 0-1 years of experience, including internships 
 This position requires a highly motivated problem solver with strong analytical ability and a desire to advance within an organization. 
 Proven capability with MS Excel and relational database program(s) (e.g., MS SQL Server, SSAS, Snowflake, Azure Synapse, Tableau, Alteryx, MS Access, MySQL, Oracle, or Teradata). ‚ÄØA desire to expand these capabilities is required. 
 Experience with statistical analysis programs (e.g., SAS, SPSS, Stata, R) is desirable but not required. 

 We offer: 

 Endless opportunities to contribute to one of the largest professional services firms in the U.S. 
 A unique culture that values collaboration in everything we do. 
 A team of professionals driven by a sense of excellence, integrity, commitment to lifelong learning, respect for one another, adaptability, and making a difference. 
 A network of 2,700 professionals committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace and giving back to the communities in which we live and work. 
 Varied career paths supported by strong professional development programs and resources. 
 A flexible work environment with competitive benefits. 

About Us

CohnReznick is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. title: Clinical Data Scientist, Manager
description:
About the job
Why Patients Need You

Pfizer Worldwide Medical and Safety colleagues play a key role in connecting evidenced based, medical decision support with colleagues and stakeholders to enable better health and treatment outcomes. Whether you are creating framework necessary to ensure our evidence is scientifically sound, providing unbiased, medically necessary expertise or investigating how to close gaps in data, our mission is simple. Empower healthcare decisions regarding the safe and appropriate use of medicines for patients.

What You Will Achieve

It is our mission to strengthen the oversight of our clinical data through stronger ownership, control, and visibility of our clinical data. You will play an important role in processing, reviewing, and receiving patient data and records. You will be organizing clinical data forms from therapeutic groups and outside investigators. You will ensure that accurate, timely, and consistent clinical data reaches the medical department and other groups. You will be relied on for data management plans including data preparation, data validation activities, etc.

As a Manager, you provide guidance to operational teams for managing projects. Your planning skills will help in preparing forecasts for resource requirements, and providing areas of improvement for products, processes or services. Through your comprehensive knowledge of principles, concepts and theories of the discipline, you will also work towards advancing new concepts and methodologies. You will be able to take a leadership role to facilitate agreements between different teams.

It is your dedication and focus that will help make Pfizer ready to achieve new milestones and help patients across the globe.

How You Will Achieve It

Provide guidance, lead/co-lead projects, manage own time to meet objectives, plan resource requirements for projects across the division. 
Ensure work carried out by providers is in accordance with applicable Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and working practices. 
Promote the use of consistent, efficient, and quality processes to meet timelines and deliverables. 
Serve as Clinical Data Scientist and Trial Lead for one or more clinical trials assuming responsibility for all Data Monitoring and Management (DMM) activities and interact with Clinical Data Scientist at study level for deliverables. 
Serve as a technical resource to the study teams for data visualization and reporting tools and provide technical expertise and business process support in technology systems. 
Ensure operational excellence in collaboration with partners for application of standards, data acquisition, proactive data review and data integrity and overall data management activities. 
Partner with Research/Business Units and any external DM service provider to deliver high quality data management for all studies as assigned. 
Perform central monitoring activities including review system outputs, propose suggestions for signal and action management, and follow up with study team for the action resolutions. 
Plan and execute communication plans and methods for engaging customer populations. 

Qualifications

Must-Have

Bachelor's Degree
5+ years‚Äô experience
Experience within the pharmaceutical industry or in a health information management role
Working knowledge of all phases of clinical trials and ability to assess and determine study requirement from protocol review
Working knowledge of clinical research, Food and Drug Administration & International Conference on Harmonization Good Clinical Practices (GCDMP), and related regulatory requirements
Strong Project and Risk Management
Strong verbal and written communication skills, demonstrated ability to handle multiple tasks and projects
Knowledge of Windows Environment and its applications. 

Nice-to-Have

Master's degree
Contract Research Organization {CRO} and vendor oversight experience
Proficient in using commercial clinical data management systems and/or EDC products

Work Location Assignment: On Premise

The annual base salary for this position ranges from $99,900.00 to $166,500.00. In addition, this position is eligible for participation in Pfizer‚Äôs Global Performance Plan with a bonus target of 15.0% of the base salary and eligibility to participate in our share based long term incentive program. We offer comprehensive and generous benefits and programs to help our colleagues lead healthy lives and to support each of life‚Äôs moments. Benefits offered include a 401(k) plan with Pfizer Matching Contributions and an additional Pfizer Retirement Savings Contribution, paid vacation, holiday and personal days, paid caregiver/parental and medical leave, and health benefits to include medical, prescription drug, dental and vision coverage. Learn more at Pfizer Candidate Site ‚Äì U.S. Benefits | (uscandidates.mypfizerbenefits.com). Pfizer compensation structures and benefit packages are aligned based on the location of hire. The United States salary range provided does not apply to Tampa, FL or any location outside of the United States.

Relocation assistance may be available based on business needs and/or eligibility.

Sunshine Act

Pfizer reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care provider‚Äôs name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. If you have questions regarding this matter, please do not hesitate to contact your Talent Acquisition representative.

EEO & Employment Eligibility

Pfizer is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Pfizer also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. Pfizer is an E-Verify employer. This position requires permanent work authorization in the United States.

title: Information Technology Co-op
description:
About the job
Work Schedule

Standard (Mon-Fri)

Environmental Conditions

Office

When you‚Äôre part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you‚Äôll do important work, like helping customers in finding cures for cancer, protecting the environment or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have real-world impact, and you‚Äôll be supported in achieving your career goals. Our staff members are committed to making a difference in our organization, for our client partners and the patients we serve. We seek individuals with proven competencies and strong character to help lead our organization now and into the future.

Our co-op participants receive professional mentorship and leadership development opportunities to support future career growth with us. Whether you're looking to come back for a repeat co-op, transition into one of our Leadership Development Programs, or pursue a full-time position post-graduation, our team is here to support your next step!

How will you make an impact?

Students will be matched to projects based on their abilities and current business needs. All projects will have significant strategic and/or operating importance to the business to which they are assigned.

Projects may include the following responsibilities:

Partner with leadership to identify and address areas to improve efficiency and benchmark with industry best practices.
Become a process owner; critically review specific processes with great attention to detail and proactively recommend opportunities for improvement. 
Develop tools and models to improve tracking and efficiency.
Learn continuous improvement methodologies (i.e., PPI, Six Sigma, and others) and help promote improvement initiatives.
Work collaboratively across the IT function to achieve business objectives related to: Global Information Security, Digital Technology & Delivery, Enterprise Application Systems, Business Intelligence, Global Infrastructure, Corporate Strategy & Integrations, E-Business, Digital Transformations, and Data Science.

Compensation & Relocation: Our undergraduate Information Technology co-ops offer an hourly rate between $21.50 - $28.75 dependent upon the location you are supporting (aligned to respective cost-of-living guidelines). Additionally, a relocation stipend is offered in the amount of $5,000 if necessary. Student must be located 50+ miles away from the physical location of co-op to be eligible for the relocation stipend.

How will you get here?

Undergraduate student completing an Information Technology-related degree between December 2025 and June 2026.
0 years of work experience required; previous related internships preferred.
Consistent track record of results demonstrating integrity, innovation, involvement, and intensity.
Energized through championing change, driven in getting results, and savvy in navigating ambiguity.
Excellent interpersonal communication skills with a high degree of emotional intelligence.

If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you!

To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States and should not require sponsorship (current or future) for employment visa status. Thermo Fisher does not offer employment in this position to holders of F-1, J-1, H-1, OPT, and CPT Visas for the purpose of obtaining practical experience.

Compensation And Benefits

The hourly pay range estimated for this position based in Washington is $21.00‚Äì$24.00.

This position may also be eligible to receive a variable annual bonus based on company, team, and/or individual performance results in accordance with company policy. We offer a comprehensive Total Rewards package that our U.S. colleagues and their families can count on, which includes:

A choice of national medical and dental plans, and a national vision plan, including health incentive programs
Employee assistance and family support programs, including commuter benefits and tuition reimbursement
At least 120 hours paid time off (PTO), 10 paid holidays annually, paid parental leave (3 weeks for bonding and 8 weeks for caregiver leave), accident and life insurance, and short- and long-term disability in accordance with company policy
Retirement and savings programs, such as our competitive 401(k) U.S. retirement savings plan
Employees‚Äô Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) offers eligible colleagues the opportunity to purchase company stock at a discount

For more information on our benefits, please visit: https://jobs.thermofisher.com/global/en/total-rewards

title: Manager, Data Engineering
description:
About the job
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated individual to join our organization as the Manager of Data Engineering. As the Manager of Data Engineering within our Enterprise Data Platform (EDP) Data Operations Team, you will be responsible for overseeing and leading a team of data engineers to develop and maintain our data pipelines, data infrastructure and systems. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, analysts, and software engineers, to ensure efficient and reliable data integration, storage, and processing. This is a crucial role that requires technical expertise, leadership abilities, and a strategic mindset.

Responsibilities

Team Leadership: Lead and manage a team of data engineers, providing guidance, mentorship, and technical expertise. Set clear goals, establish priorities, and ensure successful project execution. Foster a collaborative and innovative work environment.
Data Infrastructure Strategy: Develop and execute the data engineering strategy to support the organization's data needs, ensuring scalability, reliability, and performance. Continuously evaluate and recommend new technologies, tools, and methodologies to optimize data engineering processes.
Data Pipeline Development: Oversee the design, development, and maintenance of robust and scalable data pipelines for efficient data ingestion, processing, transformation, and storage. Ensure data quality and integrity throughout the pipeline.
Data Modeling and Integration: Collaborate with data scientists and analysts to design and implement data models that support business intelligence, analytics, and reporting needs. Integrate data from various sources, both internal and external, ensuring compatibility and seamless data flow.
Performance Optimization: Identify and address bottlenecks, inefficiencies, and data processing issues to optimize the performance and reliability of data systems. Monitor system performance, conduct regular capacity planning, and implement necessary optimizations.
Data Security and Governance: Establish and enforce data security and governance policies and best practices to ensure data privacy, confidentiality, and compliance with regulatory requirements. Implement and maintain appropriate access controls and data protection measures.
Collaboration and Communication: Foster effective collaboration and communication with stakeholders across the organization, including data science teams, business units, and executive leadership. Clearly communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Continuous Learning and Development: Stay updated with the latest trends, techniques, and advancements in data engineering, and facilitate knowledge sharing within the team. Encourage a culture of continuous learning and professional growth.

Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, data science, or a related field. Advanced certifications in data engineering or relevant domains are a plus.
Proven experience (X+ years) in data engineering, including hands-on experience with data integration, data modeling, and ETL processes.
Strong leadership skills with experience in managing and leading data engineering teams.
Proficiency in programming languages like Python, SQL, and Java/C#. Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, and NoSQL databases.
In-depth understanding of data warehousing concepts, data architecture, and cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
Knowledge of data governance, security, and compliance practices.
Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and troubleshooting skills.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects and priorities in a fast-paced environment.

title: Sr. Data Architect
description:
About the job
Job Title: Sr. Data Architect
Job Location: Marysville Ohio 43040 Hybrid
Onsite Requirements: 
7+ years of experience in data management working as a data architect with a good foundation of experience in data modeling/data structures (star schemas, OLAP cubes, etc.)
7+ years of experience in Data Analysis, Information Management and Business Intelligence
5+ years of advance knowledge of designing & working with multi-dimensional data modeling, i.e., entity relationships, star/snowflake schemas, hierarchies, attributes, measures, granularity/aggregation
Job Description: 
We're on the lookout for a visionary Senior Data Architect to join our Data Architecture team. In this position, you will lead play a vital role in defining/fine-tuning data architecture standards and best practices, including the vision, strategy, and principles for managing and interacting with governed data.
In this pivotal role, you'll be instrumental in crafting high-performance data pipelines, ensuring data integrity, and expanding data access and governance. 
You'll work cross-functionally with diverse teams, including data analysts, business analysts, and stakeholders, to understand data requirements and create scalable and efficient data models and reporting systems.
You'll define and achieve our strategic objectives with business teams and senior leader to ensure we're meeting strategic goals and establishing global benchmarks for data architecture. 
Your expertise will help Honda drive the development of high-performance data systems, uphold data integrity, and broaden the horizons of data utilization and governance. 
Qualifications, Experience, and Skills:
 Hybrid: At least 4 days at the local office
 Education:
An undergraduate or graduate level degree in computer science, applied mathematics / statistics, electronics / electrical engineering or similar field of study.
Technical qualifying skills:
7+ years of experience in data management working as a data architect with a good foundation of experience in data modeling/data structures (star schemas, OLAP cubes, etc.)
7+ years of experience in Data Analysis, Information Management and Business Intelligence
5+ years of advance knowledge of designing & working with multi-dimensional data modeling, i.e., entity relationships, star/snowflake schemas, hierarchies, attributes, measures, granularity/aggregation
Skills:
Proven experience in the design and implementation of modern data architectures and concepts such as cloud services (AWS, Azure, GCP), real-time data distribution (Kafka, Dataflow), and modern data warehouse tools (Redshift, Snowflake, Databricks)
Experience with various database platforms, including DB2, MS SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Couchbase, MongoDB, RDS, DynamoDB, etc.
Knowledge of master data management, data cataloging and organizing data using multi-dimensional analysis.
Experience with tools like Power BI, Tableau, BO, QuickSight, Synapse, Qlik.
Ability to learn and adopt new technologies, especially in advance data analytics and AI/ML
Familiar with applicable data privacy practices and laws
Dynamic, self-driven professional with a strong sense of ownership
Leader who demonstrates, inspires, and fosters team success and individual growth and a team player who has a proven ability to build trust and influence. 
Exceptional communication and presentation skills
